BEGIN NOW Dublin and, by the holy farmer, he never cried crack till he brought him END
BEGIN NOW home as drunk as a boiled owl and he said he did it to teach him the END
BEGIN NOW evils of alcohol and by herrings, if the three women didn't near roast END
BEGIN NOW him, it's a queer story, the old one, Bloom's wife and Mrs O'Dowd that END
BEGIN NOW kept the hotel. END
BEGIN NOW Jesus, I had to laugh at pisser Burke taking them off END
BEGIN NOW chewing the fat. END
BEGIN NOW And Bloom with his but don't you see? END
BEGIN NOW and but on the END
BEGIN NOW other hand. END
BEGIN NOW And sure, more be token, the lout I'm told was in Power's END
BEGIN NOW after, the blender's, round in Cope street going home footless in a cab END
BEGIN NOW five times in the week after drinking his way through all the samples in END
BEGIN NOW the bloody establishment. END
BEGIN NOW Phenomenon! END
BEGIN NOW —The memory of the dead, says the citizen taking up his pintglass and END
BEGIN NOW glaring at Bloom. END
BEGIN NOW —Ay, ay, says Joe. END
BEGIN NOW —You don't grasp my point, says Bloom. END
BEGIN NOW What I mean is... END
BEGIN NOW —Sinn Fein! END
BEGIN NOW says the citizen. END
BEGIN NOW Sinn Fein amhain! END
BEGIN NOW The friends we love are END
BEGIN NOW by our side and the foes we hate before us. END
BEGIN NOW The last farewell was affecting in the extreme. END
BEGIN NOW From the belfries far END
BEGIN NOW and near the funereal deathbell tolled unceasingly while all around the END
BEGIN NOW gloomy precincts rolled the ominous warning of a hundred muffled drums END
BEGIN NOW punctuated by the hollow booming of pieces of ordnance. END
BEGIN NOW The deafening END
BEGIN NOW claps of thunder and the dazzling flashes of lightning which lit up the END
BEGIN NOW ghastly scene testified that the artillery of heaven had lent its END
BEGIN NOW supernatural pomp to the already gruesome spectacle. END
BEGIN NOW A torrential rain END
BEGIN NOW poured down from the floodgates of the angry heavens upon the bared END
BEGIN NOW heads of the assembled multitude which numbered at the lowest END
BEGIN NOW computation five hundred thousand persons. END
BEGIN NOW A posse of Dublin END
BEGIN NOW Metropolitan police superintended by the Chief Commissioner in person END
BEGIN NOW maintained order in the vast throng for whom the York street brass and END
BEGIN NOW reed band whiled away the intervening time by admirably rendering on END
BEGIN NOW their blackdraped instruments the matchless melody endeared to us from END
BEGIN NOW the cradle by Speranza's plaintive muse. END
BEGIN NOW Special quick excursion trains END
BEGIN NOW and upholstered charabancs had been provided for the comfort of our END
BEGIN NOW country cousins of whom there were large contingents. END
BEGIN NOW Considerable END
BEGIN NOW amusement was caused by the favourite Dublin streetsingers L-n-h-n and END
BEGIN NOW M-ll-g-n who sang The Night before Larry was stretched in their usual END
BEGIN NOW mirth-provoking fashion. END
BEGIN NOW Our two inimitable drolls did a roaring trade END
BEGIN NOW with their broadsheets among lovers of the comedy element and nobody who END
BEGIN NOW has a corner in his heart for real Irish fun without vulgarity will END
BEGIN NOW grudge them their hardearned pennies. END
BEGIN NOW The children of the Male and END
BEGIN NOW Female Foundling Hospital who thronged the windows overlooking the scene END
BEGIN NOW were delighted with this unexpected addition to the day's entertainment END
BEGIN NOW and a word of praise is due to the Little Sisters of the Poor for their END
BEGIN NOW excellent idea of affording the poor fatherless and motherless children END
BEGIN NOW a genuinely instructive treat. END
BEGIN NOW The viceregal houseparty which included END
BEGIN NOW many wellknown ladies was chaperoned by Their Excellencies to the most END
BEGIN NOW favourable positions on the grandstand while the picturesque foreign END
BEGIN NOW delegation known as the Friends of the Emerald Isle was accommodated on END
BEGIN NOW a tribune directly opposite. END
BEGIN NOW The delegation, present in full force, END
BEGIN NOW consisted of Commendatore Bacibaci Beninobenone (the semiparalysed doyen END
BEGIN NOW of the party who had to be assisted to his seat by the aid of a powerful END
BEGIN NOW steam crane), Monsieur Pierrepaul PetitÃ©patant, the Grandjoker END
BEGIN NOW Vladinmire Pokethankertscheff, the Archjoker Leopold Rudolph von END
BEGIN NOW Schwanzenbad-Hodenthaler, Countess Marha VirÃ¡ga KisÃ¡szony END
BEGIN NOW PutrÃ¡pesthi, Hiram Y. END
BEGIN NOW Bomboost, Count Athanatos Karamelopulos, Ali Baba END
BEGIN NOW Backsheesh Rahat Lokum Effendi, Senor Hidalgo Caballero Don Pecadillo y END
BEGIN NOW Palabras y Paternoster de la Malora de la Malaria, Hokopoko Harakiri, Hi END
BEGIN NOW Hung Chang, Olaf Kobberkeddelsen, Mynheer Trik van Trumps, Pan Poleaxe END
BEGIN NOW Paddyrisky, Goosepond Prhklstr Kratchinabritchisitch, Borus Hupinkoff, END
BEGIN NOW Herr Hurhausdirektorpresident Hans Chuechli-Steuerli, END
BEGIN NOW Nationalgymnasiummuseumsanatoriumandsuspensoriumsordinaryprivatdocent - END
BEGIN NOW generalhistoryspecialprofessordoctor Kriegfried Ueberallgemein. END
BEGIN NOW All the END
BEGIN NOW delegates without exception expressed themselves in the strongest END
BEGIN NOW possible heterogeneous terms concerning the nameless barbarity which END
BEGIN NOW they had been called upon to witness. END
BEGIN NOW An animated altercation (in which END
BEGIN NOW all took part) ensued among the F. END
BEGIN NOW O. END
BEGIN NOW T. END
BEGIN NOW E. END
BEGIN NOW I. END
BEGIN NOW as to whether the eighth END
BEGIN NOW or the ninth of March was the correct date of the birth of Ireland's END
BEGIN NOW patron saint. END
BEGIN NOW In the course of the argument cannonballs, scimitars, END
BEGIN NOW boomerangs, blunderbusses, stinkpots, meatchoppers, umbrellas, END
BEGIN NOW catapults, knuckledusters, sandbags, lumps of pig iron were resorted to END
BEGIN NOW and blows were freely exchanged. END
BEGIN NOW The baby policeman, Constable END
BEGIN NOW MacFadden, summoned by special courier from Booterstown, quickly END
BEGIN NOW restored order and with lightning promptitude proposed the seventeenth END
BEGIN NOW of the month as a solution equally honourable for both contending END
BEGIN NOW parties. END
BEGIN NOW The readywitted ninefooter's suggestion at once appealed to all END
BEGIN NOW and was unanimously accepted. END
BEGIN NOW Constable MacFadden was heartily END
BEGIN NOW congratulated by all the F.O.T.E.I., several of whom were bleeding END
BEGIN NOW profusely. END
BEGIN NOW Commendatore Beninobenone having been extricated from END
BEGIN NOW underneath the presidential armchair, it was explained by his legal END
BEGIN NOW adviser Avvocato Pagamimi that the various articles secreted in his END
BEGIN NOW thirtytwo pockets had been abstracted by him during the affray from the END
BEGIN NOW pockets of his junior colleagues in the hope of bringing them to their END
BEGIN NOW senses. END
BEGIN NOW The objects (which included several hundred ladies' and END
BEGIN NOW gentlemen's gold and silver watches) were promptly restored to their END
BEGIN NOW rightful owners and general harmony reigned supreme. END
BEGIN NOW Quietly, unassumingly Rumbold stepped on to the scaffold in faultless END
BEGIN NOW morning dress and wearing his favourite flower, the Gladiolus Cruentus. END
BEGIN NOW He announced his presence by that gentle Rumboldian cough which so many END
BEGIN NOW have tried (unsuccessfully) to imitate—short, painstaking yet withal so END
BEGIN NOW characteristic of the man. END
BEGIN NOW The arrival of the worldrenowned headsman was END
BEGIN NOW greeted by a roar of acclamation from the huge concourse, the viceregal END
BEGIN NOW ladies waving their handkerchiefs in their excitement while the even END
BEGIN NOW more excitable foreign delegates cheered vociferously in a medley of END
BEGIN NOW cries, hoch, banzai, eljen, zivio, chinchin, polla kronia, hiphip, vive, END
BEGIN NOW Allah, amid which the ringing evviva of the delegate of the land of song END
BEGIN NOW (a high double F recalling those piercingly lovely notes with which the END
BEGIN NOW eunuch Catalani beglamoured our greatgreatgrandmothers) was easily END
BEGIN NOW distinguishable. END
BEGIN NOW It was exactly seventeen o'clock. END
BEGIN NOW The signal for prayer END
BEGIN NOW was then promptly given by megaphone and in an instant all heads were END
BEGIN NOW bared, the commendatore's patriarchal sombrero, which has been in the END
BEGIN NOW possession of his family since the revolution of Rienzi, being removed END
BEGIN NOW by his medical adviser in attendance, Dr Pippi. END
BEGIN NOW The learned prelate who END
BEGIN NOW administered the last comforts of holy religion to the hero martyr when END
BEGIN NOW about to pay the death penalty knelt in a most christian spirit in a END
BEGIN NOW pool of rainwater, his cassock above his hoary head, and offered up to END
BEGIN NOW the throne of grace fervent prayers of supplication. END
BEGIN NOW Hand by the block END
BEGIN NOW stood the grim figure of the executioner, his visage being concealed in END
BEGIN NOW a tengallon pot with two circular perforated apertures through which his END
BEGIN NOW eyes glowered furiously. END
BEGIN NOW As he awaited the fatal signal he tested the END
BEGIN NOW edge of his horrible weapon by honing it upon his brawny forearm or END
BEGIN NOW decapitated in rapid succession a flock of sheep which had been provided END
BEGIN NOW by the admirers of his fell but necessary office. END
BEGIN NOW On a handsome mahogany END
BEGIN NOW table near him were neatly arranged the quartering knife, the various END
BEGIN NOW finely tempered disembowelling appliances (specially supplied by the END
BEGIN NOW worldfamous firm of cutlers, Messrs John Round and Sons, Sheffield), a END
BEGIN NOW terra cotta saucepan for the reception of the duodenum, colon, blind END
BEGIN NOW intestine and appendix etc when successfully extracted and two END
BEGIN NOW commodious milkjugs destined to receive the most precious blood of the END
BEGIN NOW most precious victim. END
BEGIN NOW The housesteward of the amalgamated cats' and END
BEGIN NOW dogs' home was in attendance to convey these vessels when replenished to END
BEGIN NOW that beneficent institution. END
BEGIN NOW Quite an excellent repast consisting of END
BEGIN NOW rashers and eggs, fried steak and onions, done to a nicety, delicious END
BEGIN NOW hot breakfast rolls and invigorating tea had been considerately provided END
BEGIN NOW by the authorities for the consumption of the central figure of the END
BEGIN NOW tragedy who was in capital spirits when prepared for death and evinced END
BEGIN NOW the keenest interest in the proceedings from beginning to end but he, END
BEGIN NOW with an abnegation rare in these our times, rose nobly to the occasion END
BEGIN NOW and expressed the dying wish (immediately acceded to) that the meal END
BEGIN NOW should be divided in aliquot parts among the members of the sick and END
BEGIN NOW indigent roomkeepers' association as a token of his regard and esteem. END
BEGIN NOW The nec and non plus ultra of emotion were reached when the blushing END
BEGIN NOW bride elect burst her way through the serried ranks of the bystanders END
BEGIN NOW and flung herself upon the muscular bosom of him who was about to be END
BEGIN NOW launched into eternity for her sake. END
BEGIN NOW The hero folded her willowy form in END
BEGIN NOW a loving embrace murmuring fondly Sheila, my own. END
BEGIN NOW Encouraged by this use END
BEGIN NOW of her christian name she kissed passionately all the various suitable END
BEGIN NOW areas of his person which the decencies of prison garb permitted her END
BEGIN NOW ardour to reach. END
BEGIN NOW She swore to him as they mingled the salt streams of END
BEGIN NOW their tears that she would ever cherish his memory, that she would never END
BEGIN NOW forget her hero boy who went to his death with a song on his lips as if END
BEGIN NOW he were but going to a hurling match in Clonturk park. END
BEGIN NOW She brought back END
BEGIN NOW to his recollection the happy days of blissful childhood together on the END
BEGIN NOW banks of Anna Liffey when they had indulged in the innocent pastimes of END
BEGIN NOW the young and, oblivious of the dreadful present, they both laughed END
BEGIN NOW heartily, all the spectators, including the venerable pastor, joining in END
BEGIN NOW the general merriment. END
BEGIN NOW That monster audience simply rocked with delight. END
BEGIN NOW But anon they were overcome with grief and clasped their hands for the END
BEGIN NOW last time. END
BEGIN NOW A fresh torrent of tears burst from their lachrymal ducts and END
BEGIN NOW the vast concourse of people, touched to the inmost core, broke into END
BEGIN NOW heartrending sobs, not the least affected being the aged prebendary END
BEGIN NOW himself. END
BEGIN NOW Big strong men, officers of the peace and genial giants of the END
BEGIN NOW royal Irish constabulary, were making frank use of their handkerchiefs END
BEGIN NOW and it is safe to say that there was not a dry eye in that record END
BEGIN NOW assemblage. END
BEGIN NOW A most romantic incident occurred when a handsome young END
BEGIN NOW Oxford graduate, noted for his chivalry towards the fair sex, stepped END
BEGIN NOW forward and, presenting his visiting card, bankbook and genealogical END
BEGIN NOW tree, solicited the hand of the hapless young lady, requesting her to END
BEGIN NOW name the day, and was accepted on the spot. END
BEGIN NOW Every lady in the audience END
BEGIN NOW was presented with a tasteful souvenir of the occasion in the shape of a END
BEGIN NOW skull and crossbones brooch, a timely and generous act which evoked a END
BEGIN NOW fresh outburst of emotion: and when the gallant young Oxonian (the END
BEGIN NOW bearer, by the way, of one of the most timehonoured names in Albion's END
BEGIN NOW history) placed on the finger of his blushing fiancÃ©e an expensive END
BEGIN NOW engagement ring with emeralds set in the form of a fourleaved shamrock END
BEGIN NOW the excitement knew no bounds. END
BEGIN NOW Nay, even the ster provostmarshal, END
BEGIN NOW lieutenantcolonel Tomkin-Maxwell ffrenchmullan Tomlinson, who presided END
BEGIN NOW on the sad occasion, he who had blown a considerable number of sepoys END
BEGIN NOW from the cannonmouth without flinching, could not now restrain his END
BEGIN NOW natural emotion. END
BEGIN NOW With his mailed gauntlet he brushed away a furtive tear END
BEGIN NOW and was overheard, by those privileged burghers who happened to be in END
BEGIN NOW his immediate entourage, to murmur to himself in a faltering undertone: END
BEGIN NOW —God blimey if she aint a clinker, that there bleeding tart. END
BEGIN NOW Blimey it END
BEGIN NOW makes me kind of bleeding cry, straight, it does, when I sees her cause END
BEGIN NOW I thinks of my old mashtub what's waiting for me down Limehouse way. END
BEGIN NOW So then the citizen begins talking about the Irish language and the END
BEGIN NOW corporation meeting and all to that and the shoneens that can't speak END
BEGIN NOW their own language and Joe chipping in because he stuck someone for a END
BEGIN NOW quid and Bloom putting in his old goo with his twopenny stump that he END
BEGIN NOW cadged off of Joe and talking about the Gaelic league and the END
BEGIN NOW antitreating league and drink, the curse of Ireland. END
BEGIN NOW Antitreating is END
BEGIN NOW about the size of it. END
BEGIN NOW Gob, he'd let you pour all manner of drink down END
BEGIN NOW his throat till the Lord would call him before you'd ever see the froth END
BEGIN NOW of his pint. END
BEGIN NOW And one night I went in with a fellow into one of their END
BEGIN NOW musical evenings, song and dance about she could get up on a truss of END
BEGIN NOW hay she could my Maureen Lay and there was a fellow with a Ballyhooly END
BEGIN NOW blue ribbon badge spiffing out of him in Irish and a lot of colleen END
BEGIN NOW bawns going about with temperance beverages and selling medals and END

BEGIN NOW entertainment, don't be talking. END
BEGIN NOW Ireland sober is Ireland free. END
BEGIN NOW And then END
BEGIN NOW an old fellow starts blowing into his bagpipes and all the gougers END
BEGIN NOW shuffling their feet to the tune the old cow died of. END
BEGIN NOW And one or two sky END
BEGIN NOW pilots having an eye around that there was no goings on with the END
BEGIN NOW females, hitting below the belt. END
BEGIN NOW So howandever, as I was saying, the old dog seeing the tin was empty END
BEGIN NOW starts mousing around by Joe and me. END
BEGIN NOW I'd train him by kindness, so I END
BEGIN NOW would, if he was my dog. END
BEGIN NOW Give him a rousing fine kick now and again END
BEGIN NOW where it wouldn't blind him. END
BEGIN NOW —Afraid he'll bite you? END
BEGIN NOW says the citizen, jeering. END
BEGIN NOW —No, says I. END
BEGIN NOW But he might take my leg for a lamppost. END
BEGIN NOW So he calls the old dog over. END
BEGIN NOW —What's on you, Garry? END
BEGIN NOW says he. END
BEGIN NOW Then he starts hauling and mauling and talking to him in Irish and the END
BEGIN NOW old towser growling, letting on to answer, like a duet in the opera. END
BEGIN NOW Such growling you never heard as they let off between them. END
BEGIN NOW Someone that END
BEGIN NOW has nothing better to do ought to write a letter pro bono publico to the END
BEGIN NOW papers about the muzzling order for a dog the like of that. END
BEGIN NOW Growling and END
BEGIN NOW grousing and his eye all bloodshot from the drouth is in it and the END
BEGIN NOW hydrophobia dropping out of his jaws. END
BEGIN NOW All those who are interested in the spread of human culture among the END
BEGIN NOW lower animals (and their name is legion) should make a point of not END
BEGIN NOW missing the really marvellous exhibition of cynanthropy given by the END
BEGIN NOW famous old Irish red setter wolfdog formerly known by the sobriquet of END
BEGIN NOW Garryowen and recently rechristened by his large circle of friends and END
BEGIN NOW acquaintances Owen Garry. END
BEGIN NOW The exhibition, which is the result of years END
BEGIN NOW of training by kindness and a carefully thoughtout dietary system, END
BEGIN NOW comprises, among other achievements, the recitation of verse. END
BEGIN NOW Our END
BEGIN NOW greatest living phonetic expert (wild horses shall not drag it from us!) END
BEGIN NOW has left no stone unturned in his efforts to delucidate and compare the END
BEGIN NOW verse recited and has found it bears a striking resemblance (the italics END
BEGIN NOW are ours) to the ranns of ancient Celtic bards. END
BEGIN NOW We are not speaking so END
BEGIN NOW much of those delightful lovesongs with which the writer who conceals END
BEGIN NOW his identity under the graceful pseudonym of the Little Sweet Branch has END
BEGIN NOW familiarised the bookloving world but rather (as a contributor D. END
BEGIN NOW O. END
BEGIN NOW C. END
BEGIN NOW points out in an interesting communication published by an evening END
BEGIN NOW contemporary) of the harsher and more personal note which is found in END
BEGIN NOW the satirical effusions of the famous Raftery and of Donal MacConsidine END
BEGIN NOW to say nothing of a more modern lyrist at present very much in the END
BEGIN NOW public eye. END
BEGIN NOW We subjoin a specimen which has been rendered into English END
BEGIN NOW by an eminent scholar whose name for the moment we are not at liberty to END
BEGIN NOW disclose though we believe that our readers will find the topical END
BEGIN NOW allusion rather more than an indication. END
BEGIN NOW The metrical system of the END
BEGIN NOW canine original, which recalls the intricate alliterative and END
BEGIN NOW isosyllabic rules of the Welsh englyn, is infinitely more complicated END
BEGIN NOW but we believe our readers will agree that the spirit has been well END
BEGIN NOW caught. END
BEGIN NOW Perhaps it should be added that the effect is greatly increased END
BEGIN NOW if Owen's verse be spoken somewhat slowly and indistinctly in a tone END
BEGIN NOW suggestive of suppressed rancour. END
BEGIN NOW The curse of my curses Seven days every day And seven dry Thursdays On END
BEGIN NOW you, Barney Kiernan, Has no sup of water To cool my courage, And my guts END
BEGIN NOW red roaring After Lowry's lights. END
BEGIN NOW So he told Terry to bring some water for the dog and, gob, you could END
BEGIN NOW hear him lapping it up a mile off. END
BEGIN NOW And Joe asked him would he have END
BEGIN NOW another. END
BEGIN NOW —I will, says he, a chara, to show there's no ill feeling. END
BEGIN NOW Gob, he's not as green as he's cabbagelooking. END
BEGIN NOW Arsing around from one END
BEGIN NOW pub to another, leaving it to your own honour, with old Giltrap's dog END

BEGIN NOW Entertainment for END
BEGIN NOW man and beast. END
BEGIN NOW And says Joe: END
BEGIN NOW —Could you make a hole in another pint? END
BEGIN NOW —Could a swim duck? END
BEGIN NOW says I. END
BEGIN NOW —Same again, Terry, says Joe. END
BEGIN NOW Are you sure you won't have anything in END
BEGIN NOW the way of liquid refreshment? END
BEGIN NOW says he. END
BEGIN NOW —Thank you, no, says Bloom. END

BEGIN NOW Selling bazaar tickets or what do you call it royal END
BEGIN NOW Hungarian privileged lottery. END
BEGIN NOW True as you're there. END
BEGIN NOW O, commend me to an END
BEGIN NOW israelite! END
BEGIN NOW Royal and privileged Hungarian robbery. END
BEGIN NOW So Bob Doran comes lurching around asking Bloom to tell Mrs Dignam he END
BEGIN NOW was sorry for her trouble and he was very sorry about the funeral and to END
BEGIN NOW tell her that he said and everyone who knew him said that there was END
BEGIN NOW never a truer, a finer than poor little Willy that's dead to tell her. END
BEGIN NOW Choking with bloody foolery. END
BEGIN NOW And shaking Bloom's hand doing the tragic END
BEGIN NOW to tell her that. END
BEGIN NOW Shake hands, brother. END
BEGIN NOW You're a rogue and I'm another. END
BEGIN NOW —Let me, said he, so far presume upon our acquaintance which, however END
BEGIN NOW slight it may appear if judged by the standard of mere time, is founded, END
BEGIN NOW as I hope and believe, on a sentiment of mutual esteem as to request of END
BEGIN NOW you this favour. END
BEGIN NOW But, should I have overstepped the limits of reserve END
BEGIN NOW let the sincerity of my feelings be the excuse for my boldness. END
BEGIN NOW —No, rejoined the other, I appreciate to the full the motives which END
BEGIN NOW actuate your conduct and I shall discharge the office you entrust to me END
BEGIN NOW consoled by the reflection that, though the errand be one of sorrow, END
BEGIN NOW this proof of your confidence sweetens in some measure the bitterness of END
BEGIN NOW the cup. END
BEGIN NOW —Then suffer me to take your hand, said he. END
BEGIN NOW The goodness of your heart, END
BEGIN NOW I feel sure, will dictate to you better than my inadequate words the END
BEGIN NOW expressions which are most suitable to convey an emotion whose END
BEGIN NOW poignancy, were I to give vent to my feelings, would deprive me even of END
BEGIN NOW speech. END
BEGIN NOW And off with him and out trying to walk straight. END
BEGIN NOW Boosed at five END
BEGIN NOW o'clock. END
BEGIN NOW Night he was near being lagged only Paddy Leonard knew the END
BEGIN NOW bobby, 14A. END
BEGIN NOW Blind to the world up in a shebeen in Bride street after END
BEGIN NOW closing time, fornicating with two shawls and a bully on guard, drinking END
BEGIN NOW porter out of teacups. END
BEGIN NOW And calling himself a Frenchy for the shawls, END

BEGIN NOW the two shawls killed with the laughing, picking his pockets, the bloody END

BEGIN NOW screeching laughing at one another. END

BEGIN NOW an old testament? END

BEGIN NOW sister. END

BEGIN NOW I saw him up at that meeting now with William END
BEGIN NOW Field, M. END
BEGIN NOW P., the cattle traders. END

BEGIN NOW So Joe starts telling the citizen about the foot and mouth disease and END

BEGIN NOW sending them all to the rightabout and Bloom coming out with his END
BEGIN NOW sheepdip for the scab and a hoose drench for coughing calves and the END

BEGIN NOW Because he was up one time in a END
BEGIN NOW knacker's yard. END
BEGIN NOW Walking about with his book and pencil here's my head END
BEGIN NOW and my heels are coming till Joe Cuffe gave him the order of the boot END
BEGIN NOW for giving lip to a grazier. END
BEGIN NOW Mister Knowall. END
BEGIN NOW Teach your grandmother how END
BEGIN NOW to milk ducks. END
BEGIN NOW Pisser Burke was telling me in the hotel the wife used to END
BEGIN NOW be in rivers of tears some times with Mrs O'Dowd crying her eyes out END
BEGIN NOW with her eight inches of fat all over her. END
BEGIN NOW Couldn't loosen her farting END
BEGIN NOW strings but old cod's eye was waltzing around her showing her how to do END
BEGIN NOW it. END
BEGIN NOW What's your programme today? END
BEGIN NOW Ay. END
BEGIN NOW Humane methods. END
BEGIN NOW Because the poor END
BEGIN NOW animals suffer and experts say and the best known remedy that doesn't END
BEGIN NOW cause pain to the animal and on the sore spot administer gently. END
BEGIN NOW Gob, END
BEGIN NOW he'd have a soft hand under a hen. END
BEGIN NOW Ga Ga Gara. END
BEGIN NOW Klook Klook Klook. END
BEGIN NOW Black Liz is our hen. END

BEGIN NOW us. END

BEGIN NOW The Sluagh na h-Eireann. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Cowe Conacre (Multifarnham. END

BEGIN NOW A most interesting discussion took place in the ancient hall of Brian END
BEGIN NOW O'ciarnain's in Sraid na Bretaine Bheag, under the auspices of Sluagh na END
BEGIN NOW h-Eireann, on the revival of ancient Gaelic sports and the importance of END
BEGIN NOW physical culture, as understood in ancient Greece and ancient Rome and END
BEGIN NOW ancient Ireland, for the development of the race. END
BEGIN NOW The venerable END
BEGIN NOW president of the noble order was in the chair and the attendance was of END
BEGIN NOW large dimensions. END
BEGIN NOW After an instructive discourse by the chairman, a END
BEGIN NOW magnificent oration eloquently and forcibly expressed, a most END
BEGIN NOW interesting and instructive discussion of the usual high standard of END
BEGIN NOW excellence ensued as to the desirability of the revivability of the END
BEGIN NOW ancient games and sports of our ancient Panceltic forefathers. END
BEGIN NOW The END
BEGIN NOW wellknown and highly respected worker in the cause of our old tongue, Mr END
BEGIN NOW Joseph M'Carthy Hynes, made an eloquent appeal for the resuscitation of END
BEGIN NOW the ancient Gaelic sports and pastimes, practised morning and evening by END
BEGIN NOW Finn MacCool, as calculated to revive the best traditions of manly END
BEGIN NOW strength and prowess handed down to us from ancient ages. END
BEGIN NOW L. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom, who END
BEGIN NOW met with a mixed reception of applause and hisses, having espoused the END
BEGIN NOW negative the vocalist chairman brought the discussion to a close, in END
BEGIN NOW response to repeated requests and hearty plaudits from all parts of a END
BEGIN NOW bumper house, by a remarkably noteworthy rendering of the immortal END
BEGIN NOW Thomas Osborne Davis' evergreen verses (happily too familiar to need END
BEGIN NOW recalling here) A nation once again in the execution of which the END
BEGIN NOW veteran patriot champion may be said without fear of contradiction to END
BEGIN NOW have fairly excelled himself. END
BEGIN NOW The Irish Caruso-Garibaldi was in END
BEGIN NOW superlative form and his stentorian notes were heard to the greatest END
BEGIN NOW advantage in the timehonoured anthem sung as only our citizen can sing END
BEGIN NOW it. END
BEGIN NOW His superb highclass vocalism, which by its superquality greatly END
BEGIN NOW enhanced his already international reputation, was vociferously END
BEGIN NOW applauded by the large audience among which were to be noticed many END
BEGIN NOW prominent members of the clergy as well as representatives of the press END
BEGIN NOW and the bar and the other learned professions. END

BEGIN NOW It was a historic and a hefty battle when Myler and Percy were scheduled END
BEGIN NOW to don the gloves for the purse of fifty sovereigns. END
BEGIN NOW Handicapped as he END
BEGIN NOW was by lack of poundage, Dublin's pet lamb made up for it by superlative END
BEGIN NOW skill in ringcraft. END
BEGIN NOW The final bout of fireworks was a gruelling for both END
BEGIN NOW champions. END
BEGIN NOW The welterweight sergeantmajor had tapped some lively claret END
BEGIN NOW in the previous mixup during which Keogh had been receivergeneral of END
BEGIN NOW rights and lefts, the artilleryman putting in some neat work on the END
BEGIN NOW pet's nose, and Myler came on looking groggy. END
BEGIN NOW The soldier got to END
BEGIN NOW business, leading off with a powerful left jab to which the Irish END
BEGIN NOW gladiator retaliated by shooting out a stiff one flush to the point of END
BEGIN NOW Bennett's jaw. END
BEGIN NOW The redcoat ducked but the Dubliner lifted him with a END
BEGIN NOW left hook, the body punch being a fine one. END
BEGIN NOW The men came to handigrips. END
BEGIN NOW Myler quickly became busy and got his man under, the bout ending with END
BEGIN NOW the bulkier man on the ropes, Myler punishing him. END
BEGIN NOW The Englishman, whose END
BEGIN NOW right eye was nearly closed, took his corner where he was liberally END
BEGIN NOW drenched with water and when the bell went came on gamey and brimful of END
BEGIN NOW pluck, confident of knocking out the fistic Eblanite in jigtime. END
BEGIN NOW It was END
BEGIN NOW a fight to a finish and the best man for it. END
BEGIN NOW The two fought like tigers END
BEGIN NOW and excitement ran fever high. END
BEGIN NOW The referee twice cautioned Pucking Percy END
BEGIN NOW for holding but the pet was tricky and his footwork a treat to watch. END
BEGIN NOW After a brisk exchange of courtesies during which a smart upper cut of END
BEGIN NOW the military man brought blood freely from his opponent's mouth the lamb END
BEGIN NOW suddenly waded in all over his man and landed a terrific left to END
BEGIN NOW Battling Bennett's stomach, flooring him flat. END
BEGIN NOW It was a knockout clean END
BEGIN NOW and clever. END
BEGIN NOW Amid tense expectation the Portobello bruiser was being END
BEGIN NOW counted out when Bennett's second Ole Pfotts Wettstein threw in the END
BEGIN NOW towel and the Santry boy was declared victor to the frenzied cheers of END
BEGIN NOW the public who broke through the ringropes and fairly mobbed him with END
BEGIN NOW delight. END

BEGIN NOW And whereas on the sixteenth day of the month of the oxeyed goddess and END
BEGIN NOW in the third week after the feastday of the Holy and Undivided Trinity, END
BEGIN NOW the daughter of the skies, the virgin moon being then in her first END
BEGIN NOW quarter, it came to pass that those learned judges repaired them to the END
BEGIN NOW halls of law. END
BEGIN NOW There master Courtenay, sitting in his own chamber, gave END
BEGIN NOW his rede and master Justice Andrews, sitting without a jury in the END

BEGIN NOW late lamented Jacob Halliday, vintner, deceased, versus Livingstone, an END
BEGIN NOW infant, of unsound mind, and another. END

BEGIN NOW street there came sir Frederick the Falconer. END
BEGIN NOW And he sat him there about END
BEGIN NOW the hour of five o'clock to administer the law of the brehons at the END

BEGIN NOW county of the city of Dublin. END

BEGIN NOW of the twelve tribes of Iar, for every tribe one man, of the tribe of END
BEGIN NOW Patrick and of the tribe of Hugh and of the tribe of Owen and of the END

BEGIN NOW tribe of Ossian, there being in all twelve good men and true. END
BEGIN NOW And he END
BEGIN NOW conjured them by Him who died on rood that they should well and truly END
BEGIN NOW try and true deliverance make in the issue joined between their END
BEGIN NOW sovereign lord the king and the prisoner at the bar and true verdict END
BEGIN NOW give according to the evidence so help them God and kiss the book. END

BEGIN NOW they rose in their seats, those twelve of Iar, and they swore by the END

BEGIN NOW rightwiseness. END

BEGIN NOW their donjon keep one whom the sleuthhounds of justice had apprehended END
BEGIN NOW in consequence of information received. END

BEGIN NOW of Paris. END
BEGIN NOW You wouldn't see a trace of them or their language anywhere in END
BEGIN NOW Europe except in a cabinet d'aisance. END
BEGIN NOW And says John Wyse: END
BEGIN NOW —Full many a flower is born to blush unseen. END
BEGIN NOW And says Lenehan that knows a bit of the lingo: END
BEGIN NOW —Conspuez les Anglais! END
BEGIN NOW Perfide Albion! END
BEGIN NOW He said and then lifted he in his rude great brawny strengthy hands the END
BEGIN NOW medher of dark strong foamy ale and, uttering his tribal slogan Lamh END
BEGIN NOW Dearg Abu, he drank to the undoing of his foes, a race of mighty END
BEGIN NOW valorous heroes, rulers of the waves, who sit on thrones of alabaster END
BEGIN NOW silent as the deathless gods. END
BEGIN NOW —What's up with you, says I to Lenehan. END
BEGIN NOW You look like a fellow that had END
BEGIN NOW lost a bob and found a tanner. END
BEGIN NOW —Gold cup, says he. END
BEGIN NOW —Who won, Mr Lenehan? END
BEGIN NOW says Terry. END
BEGIN NOW —Throwaway, says he, at twenty to one. END
BEGIN NOW A rank outsider. END
BEGIN NOW And the rest END
BEGIN NOW nowhere. END
BEGIN NOW —And Bass's mare? END
BEGIN NOW says Terry. END
BEGIN NOW —Still running, says he. END
BEGIN NOW We're all in a cart. END
BEGIN NOW Boylan plunged two quid on END
BEGIN NOW my tip Sceptre for himself and a lady friend. END
BEGIN NOW —I had half a crown myself, says Terry, on Zinfandel that Mr Flynn gave END
BEGIN NOW me. END
BEGIN NOW Lord Howard de Walden's. END
BEGIN NOW —Twenty to one, says Lenehan. END
BEGIN NOW Such is life in an outhouse. END
BEGIN NOW Throwaway, END
BEGIN NOW says he. END
BEGIN NOW Takes the biscuit, and talking about bunions. END
BEGIN NOW Frailty, thy name END
BEGIN NOW is Sceptre. END
BEGIN NOW So he went over to the biscuit tin Bob Doran left to see if there was END
BEGIN NOW anything he could lift on the nod, the old cur after him backing his END
BEGIN NOW luck with his mangy snout up. END
BEGIN NOW Old Mother Hubbard went to the cupboard. END
BEGIN NOW —Not there, my child, says he. END
BEGIN NOW —Keep your pecker up, says Joe. END
BEGIN NOW She'd have won the money only for the END
BEGIN NOW other dog. END
BEGIN NOW And J. END
BEGIN NOW J. END
BEGIN NOW and the citizen arguing about law and history with Bloom END
BEGIN NOW sticking in an odd word. END
BEGIN NOW —Some people, says Bloom, can see the mote in others' eyes but they END
BEGIN NOW can't see the beam in their own. END
BEGIN NOW —Raimeis, says the citizen. END
BEGIN NOW There's no-one as blind as the fellow that END
BEGIN NOW won't see, if you know what that means. END
BEGIN NOW Where are our missing twenty END
BEGIN NOW millions of Irish should be here today instead of four, our lost tribes? END
BEGIN NOW And our potteries and textiles, the finest in the whole world! END
BEGIN NOW And our END
BEGIN NOW wool that was sold in Rome in the time of Juvenal and our flax and our END
BEGIN NOW damask from the looms of Antrim and our Limerick lace, our tanneries and END
BEGIN NOW our white flint glass down there by Ballybough and our Huguenot poplin END
BEGIN NOW that we have since Jacquard de Lyon and our woven silk and our Foxford END
BEGIN NOW tweeds and ivory raised point from the Carmelite convent in New Ross, END
BEGIN NOW nothing like it in the whole wide world. END
BEGIN NOW Where are the Greek merchants END
BEGIN NOW that came through the pillars of Hercules, the Gibraltar now grabbed by END
BEGIN NOW the foe of mankind, with gold and Tyrian purple to sell in Wexford at END
BEGIN NOW the fair of Carmen? END
BEGIN NOW Read Tacitus and Ptolemy, even Giraldus Cambrensis. END
BEGIN NOW Wine, peltries, Connemara marble, silver from Tipperary, second to none, END
BEGIN NOW our farfamed horses even today, the Irish hobbies, with king Philip of END
BEGIN NOW Spain offering to pay customs duties for the right to fish in our END
BEGIN NOW waters. END
BEGIN NOW What do the yellowjohns of Anglia owe us for our ruined trade END
BEGIN NOW and our ruined hearths? END
BEGIN NOW And the beds of the Barrow and Shannon they END
BEGIN NOW won't deepen with millions of acres of marsh and bog to make us all die END
BEGIN NOW of consumption? END
BEGIN NOW —As treeless as Portugal we'll be soon, says John Wyse, or Heligoland END
BEGIN NOW with its one tree if something is not done to reafforest the land. END
BEGIN NOW Larches, firs, all the trees of the conifer family are going fast. END
BEGIN NOW I was END
BEGIN NOW reading a report of lord Castletown's... END
BEGIN NOW —Save them, says the citizen, the giant ash of Galway and the chieftain END
BEGIN NOW elm of Kildare with a fortyfoot bole and an acre of foliage. END
BEGIN NOW Save the END
BEGIN NOW trees of Ireland for the future men of Ireland on the fair hills of END
BEGIN NOW Eire, O. END
BEGIN NOW —Europe has its eyes on you, says Lenehan. END
BEGIN NOW The fashionable international world attended EN MASSE this afternoon at END
BEGIN NOW the wedding of the chevalier Jean Wyse de Neaulan, grand high chief END
BEGIN NOW ranger of the Irish National Foresters, with Miss Fir Conifer of Pine END
BEGIN NOW Valley. END
BEGIN NOW Lady Sylvester Elmshade, Mrs Barbara Lovebirch, Mrs Poll Ash, END
BEGIN NOW Mrs Holly Hazeleyes, Miss Daphne Bays, Miss Dorothy Canebrake, Mrs Clyde END
BEGIN NOW Twelvetrees, Mrs Rowan Greene, Mrs Helen Vinegadding, Miss Virginia END
BEGIN NOW Creeper, Miss Gladys Beech, Miss Olive Garth, Miss Blanche Maple, Mrs END
BEGIN NOW Maud Mahogany, Miss Myra Myrtle, Miss Priscilla Elderflower, Miss Bee END
BEGIN NOW Honeysuckle, Miss Grace Poplar, Miss O Mimosa San, Miss Rachel END
BEGIN NOW Cedarfrond, the Misses Lilian and Viola Lilac, Miss Timidity Aspenall, END
BEGIN NOW Mrs Kitty Dewey-Mosse, Miss May Hawthorne, Mrs Gloriana Palme, Mrs Liana END
BEGIN NOW Forrest, Mrs Arabella Blackwood and Mrs Norma Holyoake of Oakholme Regis END
BEGIN NOW graced the ceremony by their presence. END
BEGIN NOW The bride who was given away by END
BEGIN NOW her father, the M'Conifer of the Glands, looked exquisitely charming in END
BEGIN NOW a creation carried out in green mercerised silk, moulded on an underslip END
BEGIN NOW of gloaming grey, sashed with a yoke of broad emerald and finished with END
BEGIN NOW a triple flounce of darkerhued fringe, the scheme being relieved by END
BEGIN NOW bretelles and hip insertions of acorn bronze. END
BEGIN NOW The maids of honour, Miss END
BEGIN NOW Larch Conifer and Miss Spruce Conifer, sisters of the bride, wore very END
BEGIN NOW becoming costumes in the same tone, a dainty motif of plume rose being END
BEGIN NOW worked into the pleats in a pinstripe and repeated capriciously in the END
BEGIN NOW jadegreen toques in the form of heron feathers of paletinted coral. END
BEGIN NOW Senhor Enrique Flor presided at the organ with his wellknown ability END
BEGIN NOW and, in addition to the prescribed numbers of the nuptial mass, played a END
BEGIN NOW new and striking arrangement of Woodman, spare that tree at the END
BEGIN NOW conclusion of the service. END
BEGIN NOW On leaving the church of Saint Fiacre in END
BEGIN NOW Horto after the papal blessing the happy pair were subjected to a END
BEGIN NOW playful crossfire of hazelnuts, beechmast, bayleaves, catkins of willow, END
BEGIN NOW ivytod, hollyberries, mistletoe sprigs and quicken shoots. END
BEGIN NOW Mr and Mrs END
BEGIN NOW Wyse Conifer Neaulan will spend a quiet honeymoon in the Black Forest. END
BEGIN NOW —And our eyes are on Europe, says the citizen. END
BEGIN NOW We had our trade with END
BEGIN NOW Spain and the French and with the Flemings before those mongrels were END
BEGIN NOW pupped, Spanish ale in Galway, the winebark on the winedark waterway. END
BEGIN NOW —And will again, says Joe. END
BEGIN NOW —And with the help of the holy mother of God we will again, says the END
BEGIN NOW citizen, clapping his thigh, our harbours that are empty will be full END
BEGIN NOW again, Queenstown, Kinsale, Galway, Blacksod Bay, Ventry in the kingdom END
BEGIN NOW of Kerry, Killybegs, the third largest harbour in the wide world with a END
BEGIN NOW fleet of masts of the Galway Lynches and the Cavan O'Reillys and the END
BEGIN NOW O'Kennedys of Dublin when the earl of Desmond could make a treaty with END
BEGIN NOW the emperor Charles the Fifth himself. END
BEGIN NOW And will again, says he, when the END
BEGIN NOW first Irish battleship is seen breasting the waves with our own flag to END
BEGIN NOW the fore, none of your Henry Tudor's harps, no, the oldest flag afloat, END
BEGIN NOW the flag of the province of Desmond and Thomond, three crowns on a blue END
BEGIN NOW field, the three sons of Milesius. END
BEGIN NOW And he took the last swig out of the pint. END
BEGIN NOW Moya. END
BEGIN NOW All wind and piss like END
BEGIN NOW a tanyard cat. END
BEGIN NOW Cows in Connacht have long horns. END
BEGIN NOW As much as his bloody END
BEGIN NOW life is worth to go down and address his tall talk to the assembled END
BEGIN NOW multitude in Shanagolden where he daren't show his nose with the Molly END
BEGIN NOW Maguires looking for him to let daylight through him for grabbing the END
BEGIN NOW holding of an evicted tenant. END
BEGIN NOW —Hear, hear to that, says John Wyse. END
BEGIN NOW What will you have? END
BEGIN NOW —An imperial yeomanry, says Lenehan, to celebrate the occasion. END
BEGIN NOW —Half one, Terry, says John Wyse, and a hands up. END
BEGIN NOW Terry! END
BEGIN NOW Are you asleep? END
BEGIN NOW —Yes, sir, says Terry. END
BEGIN NOW Small whisky and bottle of Allsop. END
BEGIN NOW Right, sir. END
BEGIN NOW Hanging over the bloody paper with Alf looking for spicy bits instead of END
BEGIN NOW attending to the general public. END
BEGIN NOW Picture of a butting match, trying to END
BEGIN NOW crack their bloody skulls, one chap going for the other with his head END
BEGIN NOW down like a bull at a gate. END
BEGIN NOW And another one: Black Beast Burned in END
BEGIN NOW Omaha, Ga. END
BEGIN NOW A lot of Deadwood Dicks in slouch hats and they firing at a END
BEGIN NOW Sambo strung up in a tree with his tongue out and a bonfire under him. END
BEGIN NOW Gob, they ought to drown him in the sea after and electrocute and END
BEGIN NOW crucify him to make sure of their job. END
BEGIN NOW —But what about the fighting navy, says Ned, that keeps our foes at bay? END
BEGIN NOW —I'll tell you what about it, says the citizen. END
BEGIN NOW Hell upon earth it is. END
BEGIN NOW Read the revelations that's going on in the papers about flogging on the END
BEGIN NOW training ships at Portsmouth. END
BEGIN NOW A fellow writes that calls himself END
BEGIN NOW Disgusted One. END
BEGIN NOW So he starts telling us about corporal punishment and about the crew of END
BEGIN NOW tars and officers and rearadmirals drawn up in cocked hats and the END
BEGIN NOW parson with his protestant bible to witness punishment and a young lad END
BEGIN NOW brought out, howling for his ma, and they tie him down on the buttend of END
BEGIN NOW a gun. END
BEGIN NOW —A rump and dozen, says the citizen, was what that old ruffian sir John END
BEGIN NOW Beresford called it but the modern God's Englishman calls it caning on END
BEGIN NOW the breech. END
BEGIN NOW And says John Wyse: END
BEGIN NOW —'Tis a custom more honoured in the breach than in the observance. END
BEGIN NOW Then he was telling us the master at arms comes along with a long cane END
BEGIN NOW and he draws out and he flogs the bloody backside off of the poor lad END
BEGIN NOW till he yells meila murder. END
BEGIN NOW —That's your glorious British navy, says the citizen, that bosses the END
BEGIN NOW earth. END
BEGIN NOW The fellows that never will be slaves, with the only hereditary chamber END
BEGIN NOW on the face of God's earth and their land in the hands of a dozen END
BEGIN NOW gamehogs and cottonball barons. END
BEGIN NOW That's the great empire they boast about END
BEGIN NOW of drudges and whipped serfs. END
BEGIN NOW —On which the sun never rises, says Joe. END
BEGIN NOW —And the tragedy of it is, says the citizen, they believe it. END
BEGIN NOW The END
BEGIN NOW unfortunate yahoos believe it. END
BEGIN NOW They believe in rod, the scourger almighty, creator of hell upon earth, END
BEGIN NOW and in Jacky Tar, the son of a gun, who was conceived of unholy boast, END
BEGIN NOW born of the fighting navy, suffered under rump and dozen, was scarified, END
BEGIN NOW flayed and curried, yelled like bloody hell, the third day he arose END
BEGIN NOW again from the bed, steered into haven, sitteth on his beamend till END
BEGIN NOW further orders whence he shall come to drudge for a living and be paid. END
BEGIN NOW —But, says Bloom, isn't discipline the same everywhere. END
BEGIN NOW I mean wouldn't END
BEGIN NOW it be the same here if you put force against force? END
BEGIN NOW Didn't I tell you? END
BEGIN NOW As true as I'm drinking this porter if he was at his END
BEGIN NOW last gasp he'd try to downface you that dying was living. END
BEGIN NOW —We'll put force against force, says the citizen. END
BEGIN NOW We have our greater END
BEGIN NOW Ireland beyond the sea. END
BEGIN NOW They were driven out of house and home in the END
BEGIN NOW black 47. END
BEGIN NOW Their mudcabins and their shielings by the roadside were laid END
BEGIN NOW low by the batteringram and the Times rubbed its hands and told the END
BEGIN NOW whitelivered Saxons there would soon be as few Irish in Ireland as END
BEGIN NOW redskins in America. END
BEGIN NOW Even the Grand Turk sent us his piastres. END
BEGIN NOW But the END
BEGIN NOW Sassenach tried to starve the nation at home while the land was full of END
BEGIN NOW crops that the British hyenas bought and sold in Rio de Janeiro. END
BEGIN NOW Ay, END
BEGIN NOW they drove out the peasants in hordes. END
BEGIN NOW Twenty thousand of them died in END
BEGIN NOW the coffinships. END
BEGIN NOW But those that came to the land of the free remember END
BEGIN NOW the land of bondage. END
BEGIN NOW And they will come again and with a vengeance, no END
BEGIN NOW cravens, the sons of Granuaile, the champions of Kathleen ni Houlihan. END
BEGIN NOW —Perfectly true, says Bloom. END
BEGIN NOW But my point was... END
BEGIN NOW —We are a long time waiting for that day, citizen, says Ned. END
BEGIN NOW Since the END
BEGIN NOW poor old woman told us that the French were on the sea and landed at END
BEGIN NOW Killala. END
BEGIN NOW —Ay, says John Wyse. END
BEGIN NOW We fought for the royal Stuarts that reneged us END

BEGIN NOW Remember Limerick and the END
BEGIN NOW broken treatystone. END
BEGIN NOW We gave our best blood to France and Spain, the wild END
BEGIN NOW geese. END
BEGIN NOW Fontenoy, eh? END
BEGIN NOW And Sarsfield and O'Donnell, duke of Tetuan in END
BEGIN NOW Spain, and Ulysses Browne of Camus that was fieldmarshal to Maria END
BEGIN NOW Teresa. END
BEGIN NOW But what did we ever get for it? END
BEGIN NOW —The French! END
BEGIN NOW says the citizen. END
BEGIN NOW Set of dancing masters! END
BEGIN NOW Do you know what END
BEGIN NOW it is? END
BEGIN NOW They were never worth a roasted fart to Ireland. END
BEGIN NOW Aren't they END
BEGIN NOW trying to make an Entente cordiale now at Tay Pay's dinnerparty with END
BEGIN NOW perfidious Albion? END
BEGIN NOW Firebrands of Europe and they always were. END
BEGIN NOW —Conspuez les FranÃ§ais, says Lenehan, nobbling his beer. END
BEGIN NOW —And as for the Prooshians and the Hanoverians, says Joe, haven't we had END

BEGIN NOW elector down to the German lad and the flatulent old bitch that's dead? END
BEGIN NOW Jesus, I had to laugh at the way he came out with that about the old one END
BEGIN NOW with the winkers on her, blind drunk in her royal palace every night of END
BEGIN NOW God, old Vic, with her jorum of mountain dew and her coachman carting END
BEGIN NOW her up body and bones to roll into bed and she pulling him by the END
BEGIN NOW whiskers and singing him old bits of songs about Ehren on the Rhine and END
BEGIN NOW come where the boose is cheaper. END
BEGIN NOW —Well, says J. END
BEGIN NOW J. END
BEGIN NOW We have Edward the peacemaker now. END

BEGIN NOW There's a bloody sight more pox END
BEGIN NOW than pax about that boyo. END
BEGIN NOW Edward Guelph-Wettin! END

BEGIN NOW —Considerations of space influenced their lordships' decision. END

BEGIN NOW says Joe. END

BEGIN NOW I will. END

BEGIN NOW says Joe. END
BEGIN NOW —Beholden to you, Joe, says I. END

BEGIN NOW —Repeat that dose, says Joe. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom was talking and talking with John Wyse and he quite excited with END
BEGIN NOW his dunducketymudcoloured mug on him and his old plumeyes rolling about. END

BEGIN NOW Perpetuating national hatred among nations. END

BEGIN NOW says John Wyse. END
BEGIN NOW —Yes, says Bloom. END
BEGIN NOW —What is it? END
BEGIN NOW says John Wyse. END
BEGIN NOW —A nation? END
BEGIN NOW says Bloom. END
BEGIN NOW A nation is the same people living in the same END
BEGIN NOW place. END
BEGIN NOW —By God, then, says Ned, laughing, if that's so I'm a nation for I'm END
BEGIN NOW living in the same place for the past five years. END
BEGIN NOW So of course everyone had the laugh at Bloom and says he, trying to muck END
BEGIN NOW out of it: END

BEGIN NOW —That covers my case, says Joe. END
BEGIN NOW —What is your nation if I may ask? END
BEGIN NOW says the citizen. END
BEGIN NOW —Ireland, says Bloom. END
BEGIN NOW I was born here. END
BEGIN NOW Ireland. END
BEGIN NOW The citizen said nothing only cleared the spit out of his gullet and, END
BEGIN NOW gob, he spat a Red bank oyster out of him right in the corner. END
BEGIN NOW —After you with the push, Joe, says he, taking out his handkerchief to END
BEGIN NOW swab himself dry. END
BEGIN NOW —Here you are, citizen, says Joe. END
BEGIN NOW Take that in your right hand and END
BEGIN NOW repeat after me the following words. END
BEGIN NOW The muchtreasured and intricately embroidered ancient Irish facecloth END
BEGIN NOW attributed to Solomon of Droma and Manus Tomaltach og MacDonogh, authors END
BEGIN NOW of the Book of Ballymote, was then carefully produced and called forth END
BEGIN NOW prolonged admiration. END
BEGIN NOW No need to dwell on the legendary beauty of the END
BEGIN NOW cornerpieces, the acme of art, wherein one can distinctly discern each END
BEGIN NOW of the four evangelists in turn presenting to each of the four masters END
BEGIN NOW his evangelical symbol, a bogoak sceptre, a North American puma (a far END
BEGIN NOW nobler king of beasts than the British article, be it said in passing), END
BEGIN NOW a Kerry calf and a golden eagle from Carrantuohill. END
BEGIN NOW The scenes depicted END
BEGIN NOW on the emunctory field, showing our ancient duns and raths and cromlechs END
BEGIN NOW and grianauns and seats of learning and maledictive stones, are as END
BEGIN NOW wonderfully beautiful and the pigments as delicate as when the Sligo END
BEGIN NOW illuminators gave free rein to their artistic fantasy long long ago in END
BEGIN NOW the time of the Barmecides. END
BEGIN NOW Glendalough, the lovely lakes of Killarney, END
BEGIN NOW the ruins of Clonmacnois, Cong Abbey, Glen Inagh and the Twelve Pins, END
BEGIN NOW Ireland's Eye, the Green Hills of Tallaght, Croagh Patrick, the brewery END
BEGIN NOW of Messrs Arthur Guinness, Son and Company (Limited), Lough Neagh's END
BEGIN NOW banks, the vale of Ovoca, Isolde's tower, the Mapas obelisk, Sir Patrick END
BEGIN NOW Dun's hospital, Cape Clear, the glen of Aherlow, Lynch's castle, the END
BEGIN NOW Scotch house, Rathdown Union Workhouse at Loughlinstown, Tullamore jail, END
BEGIN NOW Castleconnel rapids, Kilballymacshonakill, the cross at Monasterboice, END
BEGIN NOW Jury's Hotel, S. END
BEGIN NOW Patrick's Purgatory, the Salmon Leap, Maynooth college END
BEGIN NOW refectory, Curley's hole, the three birthplaces of the first duke of END
BEGIN NOW Wellington, the rock of Cashel, the bog of Allen, the Henry Street END
BEGIN NOW Warehouse, Fingal's Cave—all these moving scenes are still there for us END
BEGIN NOW today rendered more beautiful still by the waters of sorrow which have END
BEGIN NOW passed over them and by the rich incrustations of time. END
BEGIN NOW —Show us over the drink, says I. END
BEGIN NOW Which is which? END
BEGIN NOW —That's mine, says Joe, as the devil said to the dead policeman. END
BEGIN NOW —And I belong to a race too, says Bloom, that is hated and persecuted. END
BEGIN NOW Also now. END
BEGIN NOW This very moment. END
BEGIN NOW This very instant. END
BEGIN NOW Gob, he near burnt his fingers with the butt of his old cigar. END
BEGIN NOW —Robbed, says he. END
BEGIN NOW Plundered. END
BEGIN NOW Insulted. END
BEGIN NOW Persecuted. END
BEGIN NOW Taking what belongs END
BEGIN NOW to us by right. END
BEGIN NOW At this very moment, says he, putting up his fist, sold END
BEGIN NOW by auction in Morocco like slaves or cattle. END
BEGIN NOW —Are you talking about the new Jerusalem? END
BEGIN NOW says the citizen. END
BEGIN NOW —I'm talking about injustice, says Bloom. END
BEGIN NOW —Right, says John Wyse. END
BEGIN NOW Stand up to it then with force like men. END
BEGIN NOW That's an almanac picture for you. END
BEGIN NOW Mark for a softnosed bullet. END
BEGIN NOW Old END
BEGIN NOW lardyface standing up to the business end of a gun. END
BEGIN NOW Gob, he'd adorn a END
BEGIN NOW sweepingbrush, so he would, if he only had a nurse's apron on him. END
BEGIN NOW And END
BEGIN NOW then he collapses all of a sudden, twisting around all the opposite, as END
BEGIN NOW limp as a wet rag. END
BEGIN NOW —But it's no use, says he. END
BEGIN NOW Force, hatred, history, all that. END
BEGIN NOW That's not END
BEGIN NOW life for men and women, insult and hatred. END
BEGIN NOW And everybody knows that it's END
BEGIN NOW the very opposite of that that is really life. END
BEGIN NOW —What? END
BEGIN NOW says Alf. END
BEGIN NOW —Love, says Bloom. END
BEGIN NOW I mean the opposite of hatred. END
BEGIN NOW I must go now, says he END
BEGIN NOW to John Wyse. END
BEGIN NOW Just round to the court a moment to see if Martin is END
BEGIN NOW there. END
BEGIN NOW If he comes just say I'll be back in a second. END
BEGIN NOW Just a moment. END
BEGIN NOW Who's hindering you? END
BEGIN NOW And off he pops like greased lightning. END
BEGIN NOW —A new apostle to the gentiles, says the citizen. END
BEGIN NOW Universal love. END
BEGIN NOW —Well, says John Wyse. END
BEGIN NOW Isn't that what we're told. END
BEGIN NOW Love your neighbour. END

BEGIN NOW says the citizen. END
BEGIN NOW Beggar my neighbour is his motto. END
BEGIN NOW Love, END
BEGIN NOW moya! END
BEGIN NOW He's a nice pattern of a Romeo and Juliet. END
BEGIN NOW Love loves to love love. END

BEGIN NOW Constable 14A END
BEGIN NOW loves Mary Kelly. END

BEGIN NOW B. END

BEGIN NOW certain person. END

BEGIN NOW —Well, Joe, says I, your very good health and song. END
BEGIN NOW More power, citizen. END
BEGIN NOW —Hurrah, there, says Joe. END
BEGIN NOW —The blessing of God and Mary and Patrick on you, says the citizen. END
BEGIN NOW And he ups with his pint to wet his whistle. END

BEGIN NOW What END
BEGIN NOW about sanctimonious Cromwell and his ironsides that put the women and END
BEGIN NOW children of Drogheda to the sword with the bible text God is love pasted END
BEGIN NOW round the mouth of his cannon? END
BEGIN NOW The bible! END
BEGIN NOW Did you read that skit in the END
BEGIN NOW United Irishman today about that Zulu chief that's visiting England? END
BEGIN NOW —What's that? END
BEGIN NOW says Joe. END
BEGIN NOW So the citizen takes up one of his paraphernalia papers and he starts END
BEGIN NOW reading out: END
BEGIN NOW —A delegation of the chief cotton magnates of Manchester was presented END
BEGIN NOW yesterday to His Majesty the Alaki of Abeakuta by Gold Stick in Waiting, END
BEGIN NOW Lord Walkup of Walkup on Eggs, to tender to His Majesty the heartfelt END
BEGIN NOW thanks of British traders for the facilities afforded them in his END
BEGIN NOW dominions. END
BEGIN NOW The delegation partook of luncheon at the conclusion of which END
BEGIN NOW the dusky potentate, in the course of a happy speech, freely translated END
BEGIN NOW by the British chaplain, the reverend Ananias Praisegod Barebones, END
BEGIN NOW tendered his best thanks to Massa Walkup and emphasised the cordial END
BEGIN NOW relations existing between Abeakuta and the British empire, stating that END
BEGIN NOW he treasured as one of his dearest possessions an illuminated bible, the END
BEGIN NOW volume of the word of God and the secret of England's greatness, END
BEGIN NOW graciously presented to him by the white chief woman, the great squaw END
BEGIN NOW Victoria, with a personal dedication from the august hand of the Royal END
BEGIN NOW Donor. END
BEGIN NOW The Alaki then drank a lovingcup of firstshot usquebaugh to the END
BEGIN NOW toast Black and White from the skull of his immediate predecessor in the END
BEGIN NOW dynasty Kakachakachak, surnamed Forty Warts, after which he visited the END
BEGIN NOW chief factory of Cottonopolis and signed his mark in the visitors' book, END
BEGIN NOW subsequently executing a charming old Abeakutic wardance, in the course END
BEGIN NOW of which he swallowed several knives and forks, amid hilarious applause END
BEGIN NOW from the girl hands. END
BEGIN NOW —Widow woman, says Ned. END
BEGIN NOW I wouldn't doubt her. END
BEGIN NOW Wonder did he put that END
BEGIN NOW bible to the same use as I would. END
BEGIN NOW —Same only more so, says Lenehan. END
BEGIN NOW And thereafter in that fruitful land END
BEGIN NOW the broadleaved mango flourished exceedingly. END
BEGIN NOW —Is that by Griffith? END
BEGIN NOW says John Wyse. END
BEGIN NOW —No, says the citizen. END
BEGIN NOW It's not signed Shanganagh. END
BEGIN NOW It's only initialled: END
BEGIN NOW P. END
BEGIN NOW —And a very good initial too, says Joe. END
BEGIN NOW —That's how it's worked, says the citizen. END
BEGIN NOW Trade follows the flag. END
BEGIN NOW —Well, says J. END
BEGIN NOW J., if they're any worse than those Belgians in the Congo END
BEGIN NOW Free State they must be bad. END

BEGIN NOW this his name is? END

BEGIN NOW He's an Irishman. END
BEGIN NOW —Yes, that's the man, says J. END
BEGIN NOW J. END
BEGIN NOW Raping the women and girls and flogging END
BEGIN NOW the natives on the belly to squeeze all the red rubber they can out of END
BEGIN NOW them. END
BEGIN NOW —I know where he's gone, says Lenehan, cracking his fingers. END
BEGIN NOW —Who? END
BEGIN NOW says I. END
BEGIN NOW —Bloom, says he. END
BEGIN NOW The courthouse is a blind. END
BEGIN NOW He had a few bob on END
BEGIN NOW Throwaway and he's gone to gather in the shekels. END
BEGIN NOW —Is it that whiteeyed kaffir? END
BEGIN NOW says the citizen, that never backed a END
BEGIN NOW horse in anger in his life? END
BEGIN NOW —That's where he's gone, says Lenehan. END
BEGIN NOW I met Bantam Lyons going to back END
BEGIN NOW that horse only I put him off it and he told me Bloom gave him the tip. END
BEGIN NOW Bet you what you like he has a hundred shillings to five on. END

BEGIN NOW only man in Dublin has it. END
BEGIN NOW A dark horse. END

BEGIN NOW So anyhow when I got back they were at it dingdong, John Wyse saying it END

BEGIN NOW of the government and appointing consuls all over the world to walk END
BEGIN NOW about selling Irish industries. END
BEGIN NOW Robbing Peter to pay Paul. END
BEGIN NOW Gob, that END
BEGIN NOW puts the bloody kybosh on it if old sloppy eyes is mucking up the show. END

BEGIN NOW mouseabout. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Bloom with his argol bargol. END
BEGIN NOW And his old fellow before END
BEGIN NOW him perpetrating frauds, old Methusalem Bloom, the robbing bagman, that END

BEGIN NOW with his baubles and his penny diamonds. END
BEGIN NOW Loans by post on easy terms. END
BEGIN NOW Any amount of money advanced on note of hand. END
BEGIN NOW Distance no object. END

BEGIN NOW security. END
BEGIN NOW Gob, he's like Lanty MacHale's goat that'd go a piece of the END
BEGIN NOW road with every one. END
BEGIN NOW —Well, it's a fact, says John Wyse. END
BEGIN NOW And there's the man now that'll tell END
BEGIN NOW you all about it, Martin Cunningham. END
BEGIN NOW Sure enough the castle car drove up with Martin on it and Jack Power END
BEGIN NOW with him and a fellow named Crofter or Crofton, pensioner out of the END
BEGIN NOW collector general's, an orangeman Blackburn does have on the END
BEGIN NOW registration and he drawing his pay or Crawford gallivanting around the END
BEGIN NOW country at the king's expense. END
BEGIN NOW Our travellers reached the rustic hostelry and alighted from their END
BEGIN NOW palfreys. END
BEGIN NOW —Ho, varlet! END
BEGIN NOW cried he, who by his mien seemed the leader of the party. END
BEGIN NOW Saucy knave! END
BEGIN NOW To us! END
BEGIN NOW So saying he knocked loudly with his swordhilt upon the open lattice. END
BEGIN NOW Mine host came forth at the summons, girding him with his tabard. END
BEGIN NOW —Give you good den, my masters, said he with an obsequious bow. END
BEGIN NOW —Bestir thyself, sirrah! END
BEGIN NOW cried he who had knocked. END
BEGIN NOW Look to our steeds. END
BEGIN NOW And for ourselves give us of your best for ifaith we need it. END
BEGIN NOW —Lackaday, good masters, said the host, my poor house has but a bare END
BEGIN NOW larder. END
BEGIN NOW I know not what to offer your lordships. END
BEGIN NOW —How now, fellow? END
BEGIN NOW cried the second of the party, a man of pleasant END
BEGIN NOW countenance, So servest thou the king's messengers, master Taptun? END
BEGIN NOW An instantaneous change overspread the landlord's visage. END
BEGIN NOW —Cry you mercy, gentlemen, he said humbly. END
BEGIN NOW An you be the king's END
BEGIN NOW messengers (God shield His Majesty!) you shall not want for aught. END
BEGIN NOW The END
BEGIN NOW king's friends (God bless His Majesty!) shall not go afasting in my END

BEGIN NOW cried the traveller who had not spoken, a lusty trencherman END
BEGIN NOW by his aspect. END

BEGIN NOW Mine host bowed again as he made answer: END

BEGIN NOW cried the last speaker. END

BEGIN NOW Pistachios! END
BEGIN NOW —Aha! END
BEGIN NOW cried he of the pleasant countenance. END

BEGIN NOW larder, quotha! END
BEGIN NOW 'Tis a merry rogue. END

BEGIN NOW The milkwhite dolphin tossed his mane and, rising in the golden poop the END

BEGIN NOW with all sail set, the spinnaker to larboard. END
BEGIN NOW A many comely nymphs drew END
BEGIN NOW nigh to starboard and to larboard and, clinging to the sides of the END
BEGIN NOW noble bark, they linked their shining forms as doth the cunning END
BEGIN NOW wheelwright when he fashions about the heart of his wheel the END
BEGIN NOW equidistant rays whereof each one is sister to another and he binds them END
BEGIN NOW all with an outer ring and giveth speed to the feet of men whenas they END

BEGIN NOW they come and set them, those willing nymphs, the undying sisters. END

BEGIN NOW waves. END
BEGIN NOW But begob I was just lowering the heel of the pint when I saw the END

BEGIN NOW metropolis and greater Dublin assembled in their thousands to bid END

BEGIN NOW The ceremony which went off with great Ã©clat was END
BEGIN NOW characterised by the most affecting cordiality. END
BEGIN NOW An illuminated scroll of END
BEGIN NOW ancient Irish vellum, the work of Irish artists, was presented to the END
BEGIN NOW distinguished phenomenologist on behalf of a large section of the END
BEGIN NOW community and was accompanied by the gift of a silver casket, tastefully END
BEGIN NOW executed in the style of ancient Celtic ornament, a work which reflects END
BEGIN NOW every credit on the makers, Messrs Jacob agus Jacob. END

BEGIN NOW the wellknown strains of Come back to Erin, followed immediately by END

BEGIN NOW Tarbarrels and bonfires were lighted along the END

BEGIN NOW Rock Mountain, Sugarloaf, Bray Head, the mountains of Mourne, the END

BEGIN NOW Slieve Bernagh and Slieve Bloom. END
BEGIN NOW Amid cheers that rent the welkin, END

BEGIN NOW distant Cambrian and Caledonian hills, the mastodontic pleasureship END
BEGIN NOW slowly moved away saluted by a final floral tribute from the END

BEGIN NOW But as luck would have it the jarvey got the nag's head round the other END
BEGIN NOW way and off with him. END
BEGIN NOW —Hold on, citizen, says Joe. END
BEGIN NOW Stop! END
BEGIN NOW Begob he drew his hand and made a swipe and let fly. END
BEGIN NOW Mercy of God the END
BEGIN NOW sun was in his eyes or he'd have left him for dead. END
BEGIN NOW Gob, he near sent it END
BEGIN NOW into the county Longford. END
BEGIN NOW The bloody nag took fright and the old mongrel END
BEGIN NOW after the car like bloody hell and all the populace shouting and END
BEGIN NOW laughing and the old tinbox clattering along the street. END
BEGIN NOW The catastrophe was terrific and instantaneous in its effect. END
BEGIN NOW The END
BEGIN NOW observatory of Dunsink registered in all eleven shocks, all of the fifth END
BEGIN NOW grade of Mercalli's scale, and there is no record extant of a similar END
BEGIN NOW seismic disturbance in our island since the earthquake of 1534, the year END
BEGIN NOW of the rebellion of Silken Thomas. END
BEGIN NOW The epicentre appears to have been END
BEGIN NOW that part of the metropolis which constitutes the Inn's Quay ward and END
BEGIN NOW parish of Saint Michan covering a surface of fortyone acres, two roods END
BEGIN NOW and one square pole or perch. END
BEGIN NOW All the lordly residences in the vicinity END
BEGIN NOW of the palace of justice were demolished and that noble edifice itself, END
BEGIN NOW in which at the time of the catastrophe important legal debates were in END
BEGIN NOW progress, is literally a mass of ruins beneath which it is to be feared END
BEGIN NOW all the occupants have been buried alive. END
BEGIN NOW From the reports of END
BEGIN NOW eyewitnesses it transpires that the seismic waves were accompanied by a END
BEGIN NOW violent atmospheric perturbation of cyclonic character. END
BEGIN NOW An article of END
BEGIN NOW headgear since ascertained to belong to the much respected clerk of the END
BEGIN NOW crown and peace Mr George Fottrell and a silk umbrella with gold handle END
BEGIN NOW with the engraved initials, crest, coat of arms and house number of the END
BEGIN NOW erudite and worshipful chairman of quarter sessions sir Frederick END
BEGIN NOW Falkiner, recorder of Dublin, have been discovered by search parties in END
BEGIN NOW remote parts of the island respectively, the former on the third END
BEGIN NOW basaltic ridge of the giant's causeway, the latter embedded to the END
BEGIN NOW extent of one foot three inches in the sandy beach of Holeopen bay near END
BEGIN NOW the old head of Kinsale. END
BEGIN NOW Other eyewitnesses depose that they observed an END
BEGIN NOW incandescent object of enormous proportions hurtling through the END
BEGIN NOW atmosphere at a terrifying velocity in a trajectory directed southwest END
BEGIN NOW by west. END
BEGIN NOW Messages of condolence and sympathy are being hourly received END
BEGIN NOW from all parts of the different continents and the sovereign pontiff has END
BEGIN NOW been graciously pleased to decree that a special missa pro defunctis END
BEGIN NOW shall be celebrated simultaneously by the ordinaries of each and every END
BEGIN NOW cathedral church of all the episcopal dioceses subject to the spiritual END
BEGIN NOW authority of the Holy See in suffrage of the souls of those faithful END
BEGIN NOW departed who have been so unexpectedly called away from our midst. END
BEGIN NOW The END
BEGIN NOW work of salvage, removal of dÃ©bris, human remains etc has been END
BEGIN NOW entrusted to Messrs Michael Meade and Son, 159 Great Brunswick street, END
BEGIN NOW and Messrs T. END
BEGIN NOW and C. END
BEGIN NOW Martin, 77, 78, 79 and 80 North Wall, assisted by END
BEGIN NOW the men and officers of the Duke of Cornwall's light infantry under the END
BEGIN NOW general supervision of H. END
