BEGIN NOW I. END
BEGIN NOW You never saw the like of it in all your born puff. END
BEGIN NOW Gob, if he got that END
BEGIN NOW lottery ticket on the side of his poll he'd remember the gold cup, he END
BEGIN NOW would so, but begob the citizen would have been lagged for assault and END
BEGIN NOW battery and Joe for aiding and abetting. END
BEGIN NOW The jarvey saved his life by END
BEGIN NOW furious driving as sure as God made Moses. END
BEGIN NOW What? END
BEGIN NOW O, Jesus, he did. END
BEGIN NOW And END
BEGIN NOW he let a volley of oaths after him. END
BEGIN NOW —Did I kill him, says he, or what? END
BEGIN NOW And he shouting to the bloody dog: END
BEGIN NOW —After him, Garry! END
BEGIN NOW After him, boy! END
BEGIN NOW And the last we saw was the bloody car rounding the corner and old END
BEGIN NOW sheepsface on it gesticulating and the bloody mongrel after it with his END
BEGIN NOW lugs back for all he was bloody well worth to tear him limb from limb. END
BEGIN NOW Hundred to five! END
BEGIN NOW Jesus, he took the value of it out of him, I promise END
BEGIN NOW you. END
BEGIN NOW When, lo, there came about them all a great brightness and they beheld END
BEGIN NOW the chariot wherein He stood ascend to heaven. END
BEGIN NOW And they beheld Him in END
BEGIN NOW the chariot, clothed upon in the glory of the brightness, having raiment END
BEGIN NOW as of the sun, fair as the moon and terrible that for awe they durst not END
BEGIN NOW look upon Him. END
BEGIN NOW And there came a voice out of heaven, calling: Elijah! END
BEGIN NOW Elijah! END
BEGIN NOW And He answered with a main cry: Abba! END
BEGIN NOW Adonai! END
BEGIN NOW And they beheld END
BEGIN NOW Him even Him, ben Bloom Elijah, amid clouds of angels ascend to the END
BEGIN NOW glory of the brightness at an angle of fortyfive degrees over Donohoe's END
BEGIN NOW in Little Green street like a shot off a shovel. END
BEGIN NOW [ 13 ] END
BEGIN NOW The summer evening had begun to fold the world in its mysterious END
BEGIN NOW embrace. END
BEGIN NOW Far away in the west the sun was setting and the last glow of END
BEGIN NOW all too fleeting day lingered lovingly on sea and strand, on the proud END
BEGIN NOW promontory of dear old Howth guarding as ever the waters of the bay, on END
BEGIN NOW the weedgrown rocks along Sandymount shore and, last but not least, on END
BEGIN NOW the quiet church whence there streamed forth at times upon the stillness END
BEGIN NOW the voice of prayer to her who is in her pure radiance a beacon ever to END
BEGIN NOW the stormtossed heart of man, Mary, star of the sea. END
BEGIN NOW The three girl friends were seated on the rocks, enjoying the evening END
BEGIN NOW scene and the air which was fresh but not too chilly. END
BEGIN NOW Many a time and END
BEGIN NOW oft were they wont to come there to that favourite nook to have a cosy END
BEGIN NOW chat beside the sparkling waves and discuss matters feminine, Cissy END
BEGIN NOW Caffrey and Edy Boardman with the baby in the pushcar and Tommy and END
BEGIN NOW Jacky Caffrey, two little curlyheaded boys, dressed in sailor suits with END
BEGIN NOW caps to match and the name H.M.S. END
BEGIN NOW Belleisle printed on both. END
BEGIN NOW For Tommy END
BEGIN NOW and Jacky Caffrey were twins, scarce four years old and very noisy and END
BEGIN NOW spoiled twins sometimes but for all that darling little fellows with END
BEGIN NOW bright merry faces and endearing ways about them. END
BEGIN NOW They were dabbling in END
BEGIN NOW the sand with their spades and buckets, building castles as children do, END
BEGIN NOW or playing with their big coloured ball, happy as the day was long. END
BEGIN NOW And END
BEGIN NOW Edy Boardman was rocking the chubby baby to and fro in the pushcar while END
BEGIN NOW that young gentleman fairly chuckled with delight. END
BEGIN NOW He was but eleven END
BEGIN NOW months and nine days old and, though still a tiny toddler, was just END
BEGIN NOW beginning to lisp his first babyish words. END
BEGIN NOW Cissy Caffrey bent over to END
BEGIN NOW him to tease his fat little plucks and the dainty dimple in his chin. END
BEGIN NOW —Now, baby, Cissy Caffrey said. END
BEGIN NOW Say out big, big. END
BEGIN NOW I want a drink of END
BEGIN NOW water. END
BEGIN NOW And baby prattled after her: END
BEGIN NOW —A jink a jink a jawbo. END
BEGIN NOW Cissy Caffrey cuddled the wee chap for she was awfully fond of children, END
BEGIN NOW so patient with little sufferers and Tommy Caffrey could never be got to END
BEGIN NOW take his castor oil unless it was Cissy Caffrey that held his nose and END
BEGIN NOW promised him the scatty heel of the loaf or brown bread with golden END
BEGIN NOW syrup on. END
BEGIN NOW What a persuasive power that girl had! END
BEGIN NOW But to be sure baby END
BEGIN NOW Boardman was as good as gold, a perfect little dote in his new fancy END
BEGIN NOW bib. END
BEGIN NOW None of your spoilt beauties, Flora MacFlimsy sort, was Cissy END
BEGIN NOW Caffrey. END
BEGIN NOW A truerhearted lass never drew the breath of life, always with END
BEGIN NOW a laugh in her gipsylike eyes and a frolicsome word on her cherryripe END
BEGIN NOW red lips, a girl lovable in the extreme. END
BEGIN NOW And Edy Boardman laughed too at END
BEGIN NOW the quaint language of little brother. END
BEGIN NOW But just then there was a slight altercation between Master Tommy and END
BEGIN NOW Master Jacky. END
BEGIN NOW Boys will be boys and our two twins were no exception to END
BEGIN NOW this golden rule. END
BEGIN NOW The apple of discord was a certain castle of sand END
BEGIN NOW which Master Jacky had built and Master Tommy would have it right go END
BEGIN NOW wrong that it was to be architecturally improved by a frontdoor like the END
BEGIN NOW Martello tower had. END
BEGIN NOW But if Master Tommy was headstrong Master Jacky was END
BEGIN NOW selfwilled too and, true to the maxim that every little Irishman's house END
BEGIN NOW is his castle, he fell upon his hated rival and to such purpose that the END
BEGIN NOW wouldbe assailant came to grief and (alas to relate!) the coveted castle END
BEGIN NOW too. END
BEGIN NOW Needless to say the cries of discomfited Master Tommy drew the END
BEGIN NOW attention of the girl friends. END
BEGIN NOW —Come here, Tommy, his sister called imperatively. END
BEGIN NOW At once! END
BEGIN NOW And you, END
BEGIN NOW Jacky, for shame to throw poor Tommy in the dirty sand. END
BEGIN NOW Wait till I END
BEGIN NOW catch you for that. END
BEGIN NOW His eyes misty with unshed tears Master Tommy came at her call for their END
BEGIN NOW big sister's word was law with the twins. END
BEGIN NOW And in a sad plight he was too END
BEGIN NOW after his misadventure. END
BEGIN NOW His little man-o'-war top and unmentionables END
BEGIN NOW were full of sand but Cissy was a past mistress in the art of smoothing END
BEGIN NOW over life's tiny troubles and very quickly not one speck of sand was to END
BEGIN NOW be seen on his smart little suit. END
BEGIN NOW Still the blue eyes were glistening END
BEGIN NOW with hot tears that would well up so she kissed away the hurtness and END
BEGIN NOW shook her hand at Master Jacky the culprit and said if she was near him END
BEGIN NOW she wouldn't be far from him, her eyes dancing in admonition. END
BEGIN NOW —Nasty bold Jacky! END
BEGIN NOW she cried. END
BEGIN NOW She put an arm round the little mariner and coaxed winningly: END
BEGIN NOW —What's your name? END
BEGIN NOW Butter and cream? END
BEGIN NOW —Tell us who is your sweetheart, spoke Edy Boardman. END
BEGIN NOW Is Cissy your END
BEGIN NOW sweetheart? END
BEGIN NOW —Nao, tearful Tommy said. END
BEGIN NOW —Is Edy Boardman your sweetheart? END
BEGIN NOW Cissy queried. END
BEGIN NOW —Nao, Tommy said. END
BEGIN NOW —I know, Edy Boardman said none too amiably with an arch glance from her END
BEGIN NOW shortsighted eyes. END
BEGIN NOW I know who is Tommy's sweetheart. END
BEGIN NOW Gerty is Tommy's END
BEGIN NOW sweetheart. END
BEGIN NOW —Nao, Tommy said on the verge of tears. END
BEGIN NOW Cissy's quick motherwit guessed what was amiss and she whispered to Edy END
BEGIN NOW Boardman to take him there behind the pushcar where the gentleman END
BEGIN NOW couldn't see and to mind he didn't wet his new tan shoes. END
BEGIN NOW But who was Gerty? END
BEGIN NOW Gerty MacDowell who was seated near her companions, lost in thought, END
BEGIN NOW gazing far away into the distance was, in very truth, as fair a specimen END
BEGIN NOW of winsome Irish girlhood as one could wish to see. END
BEGIN NOW She was pronounced END
BEGIN NOW beautiful by all who knew her though, as folks often said, she was more END
BEGIN NOW a Giltrap than a MacDowell. END
BEGIN NOW Her figure was slight and graceful, END
BEGIN NOW inclining even to fragility but those iron jelloids she had been taking END
BEGIN NOW of late had done her a world of good much better than the Widow Welch's END
BEGIN NOW female pills and she was much better of those discharges she used to get END
BEGIN NOW and that tired feeling. END
BEGIN NOW The waxen pallor of her face was almost END
BEGIN NOW spiritual in its ivorylike purity though her rosebud mouth was a genuine END
BEGIN NOW Cupid's bow, Greekly perfect. END
BEGIN NOW Her hands were of finely veined alabaster END
BEGIN NOW with tapering fingers and as white as lemonjuice and queen of ointments END
BEGIN NOW could make them though it was not true that she used to wear kid gloves END
BEGIN NOW in bed or take a milk footbath either. END
BEGIN NOW Bertha Supple told that once to END
BEGIN NOW Edy Boardman, a deliberate lie, when she was black out at daggers drawn END
BEGIN NOW with Gerty (the girl chums had of course their little tiffs from time to END
BEGIN NOW time like the rest of mortals) and she told her not to let on whatever END
BEGIN NOW she did that it was her that told her or she'd never speak to her again. END
BEGIN NOW No. END
BEGIN NOW Honour where honour is due. END
BEGIN NOW There was an innate refinement, a END
BEGIN NOW languid queenly hauteur about Gerty which was unmistakably evidenced in END
BEGIN NOW her delicate hands and higharched instep. END
BEGIN NOW Had kind fate but willed her END
BEGIN NOW to be born a gentlewoman of high degree in her own right and had she END
BEGIN NOW only received the benefit of a good education Gerty MacDowell might END
BEGIN NOW easily have held her own beside any lady in the land and have seen END
BEGIN NOW herself exquisitely gowned with jewels on her brow and patrician suitors END
BEGIN NOW at her feet vying with one another to pay their devoirs to her. END
BEGIN NOW Mayhap END
BEGIN NOW it was this, the love that might have been, that lent to her END
BEGIN NOW softlyfeatured face at whiles a look, tense with suppressed meaning, END
BEGIN NOW that imparted a strange yearning tendency to the beautiful eyes, a charm END
BEGIN NOW few could resist. END
BEGIN NOW Why have women such eyes of witchery? END
BEGIN NOW Gerty's were of END
BEGIN NOW the bluest Irish blue, set off by lustrous lashes and dark expressive END
BEGIN NOW brows. END
BEGIN NOW Time was when those brows were not so silkily seductive. END
BEGIN NOW It was END
BEGIN NOW Madame Vera Verity, directress of the Woman Beautiful page of the END
BEGIN NOW Princess Novelette, who had first advised her to try eyebrowleine which END
BEGIN NOW gave that haunting expression to the eyes, so becoming in leaders of END
BEGIN NOW fashion, and she had never regretted it. END
BEGIN NOW Then there was blushing END
BEGIN NOW scientifically cured and how to be tall increase your height and you END
BEGIN NOW have a beautiful face but your nose? END
BEGIN NOW That would suit Mrs Dignam because END
BEGIN NOW she had a button one. END
BEGIN NOW But Gerty's crowning glory was her wealth of END
BEGIN NOW wonderful hair. END
BEGIN NOW It was dark brown with a natural wave in it. END
BEGIN NOW She had cut END
BEGIN NOW it that very morning on account of the new moon and it nestled about her END
BEGIN NOW pretty head in a profusion of luxuriant clusters and pared her nails END
BEGIN NOW too, Thursday for wealth. END
BEGIN NOW And just now at Edy's words as a telltale END
BEGIN NOW flush, delicate as the faintest rosebloom, crept into her cheeks she END
BEGIN NOW looked so lovely in her sweet girlish shyness that of a surety God's END
BEGIN NOW fair land of Ireland did not hold her equal. END
BEGIN NOW For an instant she was silent with rather sad downcast eyes. END
BEGIN NOW She was END
BEGIN NOW about to retort but something checked the words on her tongue. END
BEGIN NOW Inclination prompted her to speak out: dignity told her to be silent. END
BEGIN NOW The pretty lips pouted awhile but then she glanced up and broke out into END
BEGIN NOW a joyous little laugh which had in it all the freshness of a young May END
BEGIN NOW morning. END
BEGIN NOW She knew right well, no-one better, what made squinty Edy say END
BEGIN NOW that because of him cooling in his attentions when it was simply a END
BEGIN NOW lovers' quarrel. END
BEGIN NOW As per usual somebody's nose was out of joint about the END
BEGIN NOW boy that had the bicycle off the London bridge road always riding up and END
BEGIN NOW down in front of her window. END
BEGIN NOW Only now his father kept him in in the END
BEGIN NOW evenings studying hard to get an exhibition in the intermediate that was END
BEGIN NOW on and he was going to go to Trinity college to study for a doctor when END
BEGIN NOW he left the high school like his brother W. END
BEGIN NOW E. END
BEGIN NOW Wylie who was racing in END
BEGIN NOW the bicycle races in Trinity college university. END
BEGIN NOW Little recked he END
BEGIN NOW perhaps for what she felt, that dull aching void in her heart sometimes, END
BEGIN NOW piercing to the core. END
BEGIN NOW Yet he was young and perchance he might learn to END
BEGIN NOW love her in time. END
BEGIN NOW They were protestants in his family and of course END
BEGIN NOW Gerty knew Who came first and after Him the Blessed Virgin and then END
BEGIN NOW Saint Joseph. END
BEGIN NOW But he was undeniably handsome with an exquisite nose and END
BEGIN NOW he was what he looked, every inch a gentleman, the shape of his head too END
BEGIN NOW at the back without his cap on that she would know anywhere something END
BEGIN NOW off the common and the way he turned the bicycle at the lamp with his END
BEGIN NOW hands off the bars and also the nice perfume of those good cigarettes END
BEGIN NOW and besides they were both of a size too he and she and that was why Edy END
BEGIN NOW Boardman thought she was so frightfully clever because he didn't go and END
BEGIN NOW ride up and down in front of her bit of a garden. END
BEGIN NOW Gerty was dressed simply but with the instinctive taste of a votary of END
BEGIN NOW Dame Fashion for she felt that there was just a might that he might be END
BEGIN NOW out. END
BEGIN NOW A neat blouse of electric blue selftinted by dolly dyes (because it END
BEGIN NOW was expected in the Lady's Pictorial that electric blue would be worn) END
BEGIN NOW with a smart vee opening down to the division and kerchief pocket (in END
BEGIN NOW which she always kept a piece of cottonwool scented with her favourite END
BEGIN NOW perfume because the handkerchief spoiled the sit) and a navy END
BEGIN NOW threequarter skirt cut to the stride showed off her slim graceful figure END
BEGIN NOW to perfection. END
BEGIN NOW She wore a coquettish little love of a hat of wideleaved END
BEGIN NOW nigger straw contrast trimmed with an underbrim of eggblue chenille and END
BEGIN NOW at the side a butterfly bow of silk to tone. END
BEGIN NOW All Tuesday week afternoon END
BEGIN NOW she was hunting to match that chenille but at last she found what she END
BEGIN NOW wanted at Clery's summer sales, the very it, slightly shopsoiled but you END
BEGIN NOW would never notice, seven fingers two and a penny. END
BEGIN NOW She did it up all by END
BEGIN NOW herself and what joy was hers when she tried it on then, smiling at the END
BEGIN NOW lovely reflection which the mirror gave back to her! END
BEGIN NOW And when she put it END
BEGIN NOW on the waterjug to keep the shape she knew that that would take the END
BEGIN NOW shine out of some people she knew. END
BEGIN NOW Her shoes were the newest thing in END
BEGIN NOW footwear (Edy Boardman prided herself that she was very petite but she END
BEGIN NOW never had a foot like Gerty MacDowell, a five, and never would ash, oak END
BEGIN NOW or elm) with patent toecaps and just one smart buckle over her END
BEGIN NOW higharched instep. END
BEGIN NOW Her wellturned ankle displayed its perfect END
BEGIN NOW proportions beneath her skirt and just the proper amount and no more of END
BEGIN NOW her shapely limbs encased in finespun hose with highspliced heels and END
BEGIN NOW wide garter tops. END
BEGIN NOW As for undies they were Gerty's chief care and who END
BEGIN NOW that knows the fluttering hopes and fears of sweet seventeen (though END
BEGIN NOW Gerty would never see seventeen again) can find it in his heart to blame END
BEGIN NOW her? END
BEGIN NOW She had four dinky sets with awfully pretty stitchery, three END
BEGIN NOW garments and nighties extra, and each set slotted with different END
BEGIN NOW coloured ribbons, rosepink, pale blue, mauve and peagreen, and she aired END
BEGIN NOW them herself and blued them when they came home from the wash and ironed END
BEGIN NOW them and she had a brickbat to keep the iron on because she wouldn't END
BEGIN NOW trust those washerwomen as far as she'd see them scorching the things. END
BEGIN NOW She was wearing the blue for luck, hoping against hope, her own colour END
BEGIN NOW and lucky too for a bride to have a bit of blue somewhere on her because END
BEGIN NOW the green she wore that day week brought grief because his father END
BEGIN NOW brought him in to study for the intermediate exhibition and because she END
BEGIN NOW thought perhaps he might be out because when she was dressing that END
BEGIN NOW morning she nearly slipped up the old pair on her inside out and that END
BEGIN NOW was for luck and lovers' meeting if you put those things on inside out END
BEGIN NOW or if they got untied that he was thinking about you so long as it END
BEGIN NOW wasn't of a Friday. END
BEGIN NOW And yet and yet! END
BEGIN NOW That strained look on her face! END
BEGIN NOW A gnawing sorrow is END
BEGIN NOW there all the time. END
BEGIN NOW Her very soul is in her eyes and she would give END
BEGIN NOW worlds to be in the privacy of her own familiar chamber where, giving END
BEGIN NOW way to tears, she could have a good cry and relieve her pentup END
BEGIN NOW feelingsthough not too much because she knew how to cry nicely before END
BEGIN NOW the mirror. END
BEGIN NOW You are lovely, Gerty, it said. END
BEGIN NOW The paly light of evening END
BEGIN NOW falls upon a face infinitely sad and wistful. END
BEGIN NOW Gerty MacDowell yearns in END
BEGIN NOW vain. END
BEGIN NOW Yes, she had known from the very first that her daydream of a END
BEGIN NOW marriage has been arranged and the weddingbells ringing for Mrs Reggy END
BEGIN NOW Wylie T. END
BEGIN NOW C. END
BEGIN NOW D. END
BEGIN NOW (because the one who married the elder brother would be END
BEGIN NOW Mrs Wylie) and in the fashionable intelligence Mrs Gertrude Wylie was END
BEGIN NOW wearing a sumptuous confection of grey trimmed with expensive blue fox END
BEGIN NOW was not to be. END
BEGIN NOW He was too young to understand. END
BEGIN NOW He would not believe in END
BEGIN NOW love, a woman's birthright. END
BEGIN NOW The night of the party long ago in Stoer's END
BEGIN NOW (he was still in short trousers) when they were alone and he stole an END
BEGIN NOW arm round her waist she went white to the very lips. END
BEGIN NOW He called her END
BEGIN NOW little one in a strangely husky voice and snatched a half kiss (the END
BEGIN NOW first!) but it was only the end of her nose and then he hastened from END
BEGIN NOW the room with a remark about refreshments. END
BEGIN NOW Impetuous fellow! END
BEGIN NOW Strength of END
BEGIN NOW character had never been Reggy Wylie's strong point and he who would woo END
BEGIN NOW and win Gerty MacDowell must be a man among men. END
BEGIN NOW But waiting, always END
BEGIN NOW waiting to be asked and it was leap year too and would soon be over. END
BEGIN NOW No END
BEGIN NOW prince charming is her beau ideal to lay a rare and wondrous love at her END
BEGIN NOW feet but rather a manly man with a strong quiet face who had not found END
BEGIN NOW his ideal, perhaps his hair slightly flecked with grey, and who would END
BEGIN NOW understand, take her in his sheltering arms, strain her to him in all END
BEGIN NOW the strength of his deep passionate nature and comfort her with a long END
BEGIN NOW long kiss. END
BEGIN NOW It would be like heaven. END
BEGIN NOW For such a one she yearns this balmy END
BEGIN NOW summer eve. END
BEGIN NOW With all the heart of her she longs to be his only, his END
BEGIN NOW affianced bride for riches for poor, in sickness in health, till death END
BEGIN NOW us two part, from this to this day forward. END
BEGIN NOW And while Edy Boardman was with little Tommy behind the pushcar she was END
BEGIN NOW just thinking would the day ever come when she could call herself his END
BEGIN NOW little wife to be. END
BEGIN NOW Then they could talk about her till they went blue in END
BEGIN NOW the face, Bertha Supple too, and Edy, little spitfire, because she would END
BEGIN NOW be twentytwo in November. END
BEGIN NOW She would care for him with creature comforts END
BEGIN NOW too for Gerty was womanly wise and knew that a mere man liked that END
BEGIN NOW feeling of hominess. END
BEGIN NOW Her griddlecakes done to a goldenbrown hue and END
BEGIN NOW queen Ann's pudding of delightful creaminess had won golden opinions END
BEGIN NOW from all because she had a lucky hand also for lighting a fire, dredge END
BEGIN NOW in the fine selfraising flour and always stir in the same direction, END
BEGIN NOW then cream the milk and sugar and whisk well the white of eggs though END
BEGIN NOW she didn't like the eating part when there were any people that made her END
BEGIN NOW shy and often she wondered why you couldn't eat something poetical like END
BEGIN NOW violets or roses and they would have a beautifully appointed drawingroom END
BEGIN NOW with pictures and engravings and the photograph of grandpapa Giltrap's END
BEGIN NOW lovely dog Garryowen that almost talked it was so human and chintz END
BEGIN NOW covers for the chairs and that silver toastrack in Clery's summer jumble END
BEGIN NOW sales like they have in rich houses. END
BEGIN NOW He would be tall with broad END
BEGIN NOW shoulders (she had always admired tall men for a husband) with END
BEGIN NOW glistening white teeth under his carefully trimmed sweeping moustache END
BEGIN NOW and they would go on the continent for their honeymoon (three wonderful END
BEGIN NOW weeks!) and then, when they settled down in a nice snug and cosy little END
BEGIN NOW homely house, every morning they would both have brekky, simple but END
BEGIN NOW perfectly served, for their own two selves and before he went out to END
BEGIN NOW business he would give his dear little wifey a good hearty hug and gaze END
BEGIN NOW for a moment deep down into her eyes. END
BEGIN NOW Edy Boardman asked Tommy Caffrey was he done and he said yes so then she END
BEGIN NOW buttoned up his little knickerbockers for him and told him to run off END
BEGIN NOW and play with Jacky and to be good now and not to fight. END
BEGIN NOW But Tommy said END
BEGIN NOW he wanted the ball and Edy told him no that baby was playing with the END
BEGIN NOW ball and if he took it there'd be wigs on the green but Tommy said it END
BEGIN NOW was his ball and he wanted his ball and he pranced on the ground, if you END
BEGIN NOW please. END
BEGIN NOW The temper of him! END
BEGIN NOW O, he was a man already was little Tommy END
BEGIN NOW Caffrey since he was out of pinnies. END
BEGIN NOW Edy told him no, no and to be off END
BEGIN NOW now with him and she told Cissy Caffrey not to give in to him. END
BEGIN NOW —You're not my sister, naughty Tommy said. END
BEGIN NOW It's my ball. END
BEGIN NOW But Cissy Caffrey told baby Boardman to look up, look up high at her END
BEGIN NOW finger and she snatched the ball quickly and threw it along the sand and END
BEGIN NOW Tommy after it in full career, having won the day. END
BEGIN NOW —Anything for a quiet life, laughed Ciss. END
BEGIN NOW And she tickled tiny tot's two cheeks to make him forget and played END
BEGIN NOW here's the lord mayor, here's his two horses, here's his gingerbread END
BEGIN NOW carriage and here he walks in, chinchopper, chinchopper, chinchopper END
BEGIN NOW chin. END
BEGIN NOW But Edy got as cross as two sticks about him getting his own way END
BEGIN NOW like that from everyone always petting him. END
BEGIN NOW —I'd like to give him something, she said, so I would, where I won't END
BEGIN NOW say. END
BEGIN NOW —On the beeoteetom, laughed Cissy merrily. END
BEGIN NOW Gerty MacDowell bent down her head and crimsoned at the idea of Cissy END
BEGIN NOW saying an unladylike thing like that out loud she'd be ashamed of her END
BEGIN NOW life to say, flushing a deep rosy red, and Edy Boardman said she was END
BEGIN NOW sure the gentleman opposite heard what she said. END
BEGIN NOW But not a pin cared END
BEGIN NOW Ciss. END
BEGIN NOW —Let him! END
BEGIN NOW she said with a pert toss of her head and a piquant tilt of END
BEGIN NOW her nose. END
BEGIN NOW Give it to him too on the same place as quick as I'd look at END
BEGIN NOW him. END
BEGIN NOW Madcap Ciss with her golliwog curls. END
BEGIN NOW You had to laugh at her sometimes. END
BEGIN NOW For instance when she asked you would you have some more Chinese tea and END
BEGIN NOW jaspberry ram and when she drew the jugs too and the men's faces on her END
BEGIN NOW nails with red ink make you split your sides or when she wanted to go END
BEGIN NOW where you know she said she wanted to run and pay a visit to the Miss END
BEGIN NOW White. END
BEGIN NOW That was just like Cissycums. END
BEGIN NOW O, and will you ever forget her the END
BEGIN NOW evening she dressed up in her father's suit and hat and the burned cork END
BEGIN NOW moustache and walked down Tritonville road, smoking a cigarette. END
BEGIN NOW There END
BEGIN NOW was none to come up to her for fun. END
BEGIN NOW But she was sincerity itself, one of END
BEGIN NOW the bravest and truest hearts heaven ever made, not one of your twofaced END
BEGIN NOW things, too sweet to be wholesome. END
BEGIN NOW And then there came out upon the air the sound of voices and the pealing END
BEGIN NOW anthem of the organ. END
BEGIN NOW It was the men's temperance retreat conducted by END
BEGIN NOW the missioner, the reverend John Hughes S. END
BEGIN NOW J., rosary, sermon and END
BEGIN NOW benediction of the Most Blessed Sacrament. END
BEGIN NOW They were there gathered END
BEGIN NOW together without distinction of social class (and a most edifying END
BEGIN NOW spectacle it was to see) in that simple fane beside the waves, after the END
BEGIN NOW storms of this weary world, kneeling before the feet of the immaculate, END
BEGIN NOW reciting the litany of Our Lady of Loreto, beseeching her to intercede END
BEGIN NOW for them, the old familiar words, holy Mary, holy virgin of virgins. END
BEGIN NOW How END
BEGIN NOW sad to poor Gerty's ears! END
BEGIN NOW Had her father only avoided the clutches of END
BEGIN NOW the demon drink, by taking the pledge or those powders the drink habit END
BEGIN NOW cured in Pearson's Weekly, she might now be rolling in her carriage, END
BEGIN NOW second to none. END
BEGIN NOW Over and over had she told herself that as she mused by END
BEGIN NOW the dying embers in a brown study without the lamp because she hated two END
BEGIN NOW lights or oftentimes gazing out of the window dreamily by the hour at END
BEGIN NOW the rain falling on the rusty bucket, thinking. END
BEGIN NOW But that vile decoction END
BEGIN NOW which has ruined so many hearths and homes had cist its shadow over her END
BEGIN NOW childhood days. END
BEGIN NOW Nay, she had even witnessed in the home circle deeds of END
BEGIN NOW violence caused by intemperance and had seen her own father, a prey to END
BEGIN NOW the fumes of intoxication, forget himself completely for if there was END
BEGIN NOW one thing of all things that Gerty knew it was that the man who lifts END
BEGIN NOW his hand to a woman save in the way of kindness, deserves to be branded END
BEGIN NOW as the lowest of the low. END
BEGIN NOW And still the voices sang in supplication to the Virgin most powerful, END
BEGIN NOW Virgin most merciful. END
BEGIN NOW And Gerty, rapt in thought, scarce saw or heard END
BEGIN NOW her companions or the twins at their boyish gambols or the gentleman off END
BEGIN NOW Sandymount green that Cissy Caffrey called the man that was so like END
BEGIN NOW himself passing along the strand taking a short walk. END
BEGIN NOW You never saw him END
BEGIN NOW any way screwed but still and for all that she would not like him for a END
BEGIN NOW father because he was too old or something or on account of his face (it END
BEGIN NOW was a palpable case of Doctor Fell) or his carbuncly nose with the END
BEGIN NOW pimples on it and his sandy moustache a bit white under his nose. END
BEGIN NOW Poor END
BEGIN NOW father! END
BEGIN NOW With all his faults she loved him still when he sang Tell me, END
BEGIN NOW Mary, how to woo thee or My love and cottage near Rochelle and they had END
BEGIN NOW stewed cockles and lettuce with Lazenby's salad dressing for supper and END
BEGIN NOW when he sang The moon hath raised with Mr Dignam that died suddenly and END
BEGIN NOW was buried, God have mercy on him, from a stroke. END
BEGIN NOW Her mother's birthday END
BEGIN NOW that was and Charley was home on his holidays and Tom and Mr Dignam and END
BEGIN NOW Mrs and Patsy and Freddy Dignam and they were to have had a group taken. END
BEGIN NOW No-one would have thought the end was so near. END
BEGIN NOW Now he was laid to rest. END
BEGIN NOW And her mother said to him to let that be a warning to him for the rest END
BEGIN NOW of his days and he couldn't even go to the funeral on account of the END
BEGIN NOW gout and she had to go into town to bring him the letters and samples END
BEGIN NOW from his office about Catesby's cork lino, artistic, standard designs, END
BEGIN NOW fit for a palace, gives tiptop wear and always bright and cheery in the END
BEGIN NOW home. END
BEGIN NOW A sterling good daughter was Gerty just like a second mother in the END
BEGIN NOW house, a ministering angel too with a little heart worth its weight in END
BEGIN NOW gold. END
BEGIN NOW And when her mother had those raging splitting headaches who was END
BEGIN NOW it rubbed the menthol cone on her forehead but Gerty though she didn't END
BEGIN NOW like her mother's taking pinches of snuff and that was the only single END
BEGIN NOW thing they ever had words about, taking snuff. END
BEGIN NOW Everyone thought the END
BEGIN NOW world of her for her gentle ways. END
BEGIN NOW It was Gerty who turned off the gas at END
BEGIN NOW the main every night and it was Gerty who tacked up on the wall of that END
BEGIN NOW place where she never forgot every fortnight the chlorate of lime Mr END
BEGIN NOW Tunney the grocer's christmas almanac, the picture of halcyon days where END
BEGIN NOW a young gentleman in the costume they used to wear then with a END
BEGIN NOW threecornered hat was offering a bunch of flowers to his ladylove with END
BEGIN NOW oldtime chivalry through her lattice window. END
BEGIN NOW You could see there was a END
BEGIN NOW story behind it. END
BEGIN NOW The colours were done something lovely. END
BEGIN NOW She was in a END
BEGIN NOW soft clinging white in a studied attitude and the gentleman was in END
BEGIN NOW chocolate and he looked a thorough aristocrat. END
BEGIN NOW She often looked at them END
BEGIN NOW dreamily when she went there for a certain purpose and felt her own arms END
BEGIN NOW that were white and soft just like hers with the sleeves back and END
BEGIN NOW thought about those times because she had found out in Walker's END
BEGIN NOW pronouncing dictionary that belonged to grandpapa Giltrap about the END
BEGIN NOW halcyon days what they meant. END
BEGIN NOW The twins were now playing in the most approved brotherly fashion till END
BEGIN NOW at last Master Jacky who was really as bold as brass there was no END
BEGIN NOW getting behind that deliberately kicked the ball as hard as ever he END
BEGIN NOW could down towards the seaweedy rocks. END
BEGIN NOW Needless to say poor Tommy was END
BEGIN NOW not slow to voice his dismay but luckily the gentleman in black who was END
BEGIN NOW sitting there by himself came gallantly to the rescue and intercepted END
BEGIN NOW the ball. END
BEGIN NOW Our two champions claimed their plaything with lusty cries and END
BEGIN NOW to avoid trouble Cissy Caffrey called to the gentleman to throw it to END
BEGIN NOW her please. END
BEGIN NOW The gentleman aimed the ball once or twice and then threw it END
BEGIN NOW up the strand towards Cissy Caffrey but it rolled down the slope and END
BEGIN NOW stopped right under Gerty's skirt near the little pool by the rock. END
BEGIN NOW The END
BEGIN NOW twins clamoured again for it and Cissy told her to kick it away and let END
BEGIN NOW them fight for it so Gerty drew back her foot but she wished their END
BEGIN NOW stupid ball hadn't come rolling down to her and she gave a kick but she END
BEGIN NOW missed and Edy and Cissy laughed. END
BEGIN NOW —If you fail try again, Edy Boardman said. END
BEGIN NOW Gerty smiled assent and bit her lip. END
BEGIN NOW A delicate pink crept into her END
BEGIN NOW pretty cheek but she was determined to let them see so she just lifted END
BEGIN NOW her skirt a little but just enough and took good aim and gave the ball a END
BEGIN NOW jolly good kick and it went ever so far and the two twins after it down END
BEGIN NOW towards the shingle. END
BEGIN NOW Pure jealousy of course it was nothing else to draw END
BEGIN NOW attention on account of the gentleman opposite looking. END
BEGIN NOW She felt the END
BEGIN NOW warm flush, a danger signal always with Gerty MacDowell, surging and END
BEGIN NOW flaming into her cheeks. END
BEGIN NOW Till then they had only exchanged glances of END
BEGIN NOW the most casual but now under the brim of her new hat she ventured a END
BEGIN NOW look at him and the face that met her gaze there in the twilight, wan END
BEGIN NOW and strangely drawn, seemed to her the saddest she had ever seen. END
BEGIN NOW Through the open window of the church the fragrant incense was wafted END
BEGIN NOW and with it the fragrant names of her who was conceived without stain of END
BEGIN NOW original sin, spiritual vessel, pray for us, honourable vessel, pray for END
BEGIN NOW us, vessel of singular devotion, pray for us, mystical rose. END
BEGIN NOW And END
BEGIN NOW careworn hearts were there and toilers for their daily bread and many END
BEGIN NOW who had erred and wandered, their eyes wet with contrition but for all END
BEGIN NOW that bright with hope for the reverend father Father Hughes had told END
BEGIN NOW them what the great saint Bernard said in his famous prayer of Mary, the END
BEGIN NOW most pious Virgin's intercessory power that it was not recorded in any END
BEGIN NOW age that those who implored her powerful protection were ever abandoned END
BEGIN NOW by her. END
BEGIN NOW The twins were now playing again right merrily for the troubles of END
BEGIN NOW childhood are but as fleeting summer showers. END
BEGIN NOW Cissy Caffrey played with END
BEGIN NOW baby Boardman till he crowed with glee, clapping baby hands in air. END
BEGIN NOW Peep END
BEGIN NOW she cried behind the hood of the pushcar and Edy asked where was Cissy END
BEGIN NOW gone and then Cissy popped up her head and cried ah! END
BEGIN NOW and, my word, END
BEGIN NOW didn't the little chap enjoy that! END
BEGIN NOW And then she told him to say papa. END
BEGIN NOW —Say papa, baby. END
BEGIN NOW Say pa pa pa pa pa pa pa. END
BEGIN NOW And baby did his level best to say it for he was very intelligent for END
BEGIN NOW eleven months everyone said and big for his age and the picture of END
BEGIN NOW health, a perfect little bunch of love, and he would certainly turn out END
BEGIN NOW to be something great, they said. END
BEGIN NOW —Haja ja ja haja. END
BEGIN NOW Cissy wiped his little mouth with the dribbling bib and wanted him to END
BEGIN NOW sit up properly and say pa pa pa but when she undid the strap she cried END
BEGIN NOW out, holy saint Denis, that he was possing wet and to double the half END
BEGIN NOW blanket the other way under him. END
BEGIN NOW Of course his infant majesty was most END
BEGIN NOW obstreperous at such toilet formalities and he let everyone know it: END
BEGIN NOW —Habaa baaaahabaaa baaaa. END
BEGIN NOW And two great big lovely big tears coursing down his cheeks. END
BEGIN NOW It was all END
BEGIN NOW no use soothering him with no, nono, baby, no and telling him about the END
BEGIN NOW geegee and where was the puffpuff but Ciss, always readywitted, gave him END
BEGIN NOW in his mouth the teat of the suckingbottle and the young heathen was END
BEGIN NOW quickly appeased. END
BEGIN NOW Gerty wished to goodness they would take their squalling baby home out END
BEGIN NOW of that and not get on her nerves, no hour to be out, and the little END
BEGIN NOW brats of twins. END
BEGIN NOW She gazed out towards the distant sea. END
BEGIN NOW It was like the END
BEGIN NOW paintings that man used to do on the pavement with all the coloured END
BEGIN NOW chalks and such a pity too leaving them there to be all blotted out, the END
BEGIN NOW evening and the clouds coming out and the Bailey light on Howth and to END
BEGIN NOW hear the music like that and the perfume of those incense they burned in END
BEGIN NOW the church like a kind of waft. END
BEGIN NOW And while she gazed her heart went END
BEGIN NOW pitapat. END
BEGIN NOW Yes, it was her he was looking at, and there was meaning in his END
BEGIN NOW look. END
BEGIN NOW His eyes burned into her as though they would search her through END
BEGIN NOW and through, read her very soul. END
BEGIN NOW Wonderful eyes they were, superbly END
BEGIN NOW expressive, but could you trust them? END
BEGIN NOW People were so queer. END
BEGIN NOW She could END
BEGIN NOW see at once by his dark eyes and his pale intellectual face that he was END
BEGIN NOW a foreigner, the image of the photo she had of Martin Harvey, the END
BEGIN NOW matinee idol, only for the moustache which she preferred because she END
BEGIN NOW wasn't stagestruck like Winny Rippingham that wanted they two to always END
BEGIN NOW dress the same on account of a play but she could not see whether he had END
BEGIN NOW an aquiline nose or a slightly retroussÃ© from where he was sitting. END
BEGIN NOW He END
BEGIN NOW was in deep mourning, she could see that, and the story of a haunting END
BEGIN NOW sorrow was written on his face. END
BEGIN NOW She would have given worlds to know what END
BEGIN NOW it was. END
BEGIN NOW He was looking up so intently, so still, and he saw her kick the END
BEGIN NOW ball and perhaps he could see the bright steel buckles of her shoes if END
BEGIN NOW she swung them like that thoughtfully with the toes down. END
BEGIN NOW She was glad END
BEGIN NOW that something told her to put on the transparent stockings thinking END
BEGIN NOW Reggy Wylie might be out but that was far away. END
BEGIN NOW Here was that of which END
BEGIN NOW she had so often dreamed. END
BEGIN NOW It was he who mattered and there was joy on END
BEGIN NOW her face because she wanted him because she felt instinctively that he END
BEGIN NOW was like no-one else. END
BEGIN NOW The very heart of the girlwoman went out to him, END
BEGIN NOW her dreamhusband, because she knew on the instant it was him. END
BEGIN NOW If he had END
BEGIN NOW suffered, more sinned against than sinning, or even, even, if he had END
BEGIN NOW been himself a sinner, a wicked man, she cared not. END
BEGIN NOW Even if he was a END
BEGIN NOW protestant or methodist she could convert him easily if he truly loved END
BEGIN NOW her. END
BEGIN NOW There were wounds that wanted healing with heartbalm. END
BEGIN NOW She was a END
BEGIN NOW womanly woman not like other flighty girls unfeminine he had known, END
BEGIN NOW those cyclists showing off what they hadn't got and she just yearned to END
BEGIN NOW know all, to forgive all if she could make him fall in love with her, END
BEGIN NOW make him forget the memory of the past. END
BEGIN NOW Then mayhap he would embrace her END
BEGIN NOW gently, like a real man, crushing her soft body to him, and love her, END
BEGIN NOW his ownest girlie, for herself alone. END
BEGIN NOW Refuge of sinners. END
BEGIN NOW Comfortress of the afflicted. END
BEGIN NOW Ora pro nobis. END
BEGIN NOW Well has END
BEGIN NOW it been said that whosoever prays to her with faith and constancy can END
BEGIN NOW never be lost or cast away: and fitly is she too a haven of refuge for END
BEGIN NOW the afflicted because of the seven dolours which transpierced her own END
BEGIN NOW heart. END
BEGIN NOW Gerty could picture the whole scene in the church, the stained END
BEGIN NOW glass windows lighted up, the candles, the flowers and the blue banners END
BEGIN NOW of the blessed Virgin's sodality and Father Conroy was helping Canon END
BEGIN NOW O'Hanlon at the altar, carrying things in and out with his eyes cast END
BEGIN NOW down. END
BEGIN NOW He looked almost a saint and his confessionbox was so quiet and END
BEGIN NOW clean and dark and his hands were just like white wax and if ever she END
BEGIN NOW became a Dominican nun in their white habit perhaps he might come to the END
BEGIN NOW convent for the novena of Saint Dominic. END
BEGIN NOW He told her that time when she END
BEGIN NOW told him about that in confession, crimsoning up to the roots of her END
BEGIN NOW hair for fear he could see, not to be troubled because that was only the END
BEGIN NOW voice of nature and we were all subject to nature's laws, he said, in END
BEGIN NOW this life and that that was no sin because that came from the nature of END
BEGIN NOW woman instituted by God, he said, and that Our Blessed Lady herself said END
BEGIN NOW to the archangel Gabriel be it done unto me according to Thy Word. END
BEGIN NOW He END
BEGIN NOW was so kind and holy and often and often she thought and thought could END
BEGIN NOW she work a ruched teacosy with embroidered floral design for him as a END
BEGIN NOW present or a clock but they had a clock she noticed on the mantelpiece END
BEGIN NOW white and gold with a canarybird that came out of a little house to tell END
BEGIN NOW the time the day she went there about the flowers for the forty hours' END
BEGIN NOW adoration because it was hard to know what sort of a present to give or END
BEGIN NOW perhaps an album of illuminated views of Dublin or some place. END
BEGIN NOW The exasperating little brats of twins began to quarrel again and Jacky END
BEGIN NOW threw the ball out towards the sea and they both ran after it. END
BEGIN NOW Little END
BEGIN NOW monkeys common as ditchwater. END
BEGIN NOW Someone ought to take them and give them a END
BEGIN NOW good hiding for themselves to keep them in their places, the both of END
BEGIN NOW them. END
BEGIN NOW And Cissy and Edy shouted after them to come back because they END
BEGIN NOW were afraid the tide might come in on them and be drowned. END
BEGIN NOW —Jacky! END
BEGIN NOW Tommy! END
BEGIN NOW Not they! END
BEGIN NOW What a great notion they had! END
BEGIN NOW So Cissy said it was the very END
BEGIN NOW last time she'd ever bring them out. END
BEGIN NOW She jumped up and called them and END
BEGIN NOW she ran down the slope past him, tossing her hair behind her which had a END
BEGIN NOW good enough colour if there had been more of it but with all the END
BEGIN NOW thingamerry she was always rubbing into it she couldn't get it to grow END
BEGIN NOW long because it wasn't natural so she could just go and throw her hat at END
BEGIN NOW it. END
BEGIN NOW She ran with long gandery strides it was a wonder she didn't rip up END
BEGIN NOW her skirt at the side that was too tight on her because there was a lot END
BEGIN NOW of the tomboy about Cissy Caffrey and she was a forward piece whenever END
BEGIN NOW she thought she had a good opportunity to show and just because she was END
BEGIN NOW a good runner she ran like that so that he could see all the end of her END
BEGIN NOW petticoat running and her skinny shanks up as far as possible. END
BEGIN NOW It would END
BEGIN NOW have served her just right if she had tripped up over something END
BEGIN NOW accidentally on purpose with her high crooked French heels on her to END
BEGIN NOW make her look tall and got a fine tumble. END
BEGIN NOW Tableau! END
BEGIN NOW That would have been END
BEGIN NOW a very charming expose for a gentleman like that to witness. END
BEGIN NOW Queen of angels, queen of patriarchs, queen of prophets, of all saints, END
BEGIN NOW they prayed, queen of the most holy rosary and then Father Conroy handed END

BEGIN NOW Blessed Sacrament and Cissy Caffrey caught the two twins and she was END
BEGIN NOW itching to give them a ringing good clip on the ear but she didn't END
BEGIN NOW because she thought he might be watching but she never made a bigger END

BEGIN NOW gosa cramen tum. END
BEGIN NOW Three and eleven she paid for those stockings in END
BEGIN NOW Sparrow's of George's street on the Tuesday, no the Monday before Easter END
BEGIN NOW and there wasn't a brack on them and that was what he was looking at, END
BEGIN NOW transparent, and not at her insignificant ones that had neither shape END
BEGIN NOW nor form (the cheek of her!) because he had eyes in his head to see the END

BEGIN NOW Cissy came up along the strand with the two twins and their ball with END

BEGIN NOW settle her hair and a prettier, a daintier head of nutbrown tresses was END

BEGIN NOW almost maddening in its sweetness. END
BEGIN NOW You would have to travel many a long END
BEGIN NOW mile before you found a head of hair the like of that. END

BEGIN NOW see the swift answering flash of admiration in his eyes that set her END

BEGIN NOW She put on her hat so that she could see from END
BEGIN NOW underneath the brim and swung her buckled shoe faster for her breath END

BEGIN NOW He was eying her as a END
BEGIN NOW snake eyes its prey. END
BEGIN NOW Her woman's instinct told her that she had raised END
BEGIN NOW the devil in him and at the thought a burning scarlet swept from throat END

BEGIN NOW Edy Boardman was noticing it too because she was squinting at Gerty, END

BEGIN NOW baby. END
BEGIN NOW Irritable little gnat she was and always would be and that was why END
BEGIN NOW no-one could get on with her poking her nose into what was no concern of END

BEGIN NOW And she said to Gerty: END
BEGIN NOW —A penny for your thoughts. END
BEGIN NOW —What? END
BEGIN NOW replied Gerty with a smile reinforced by the whitest of teeth. END
BEGIN NOW I END
BEGIN NOW was only wondering was it late. END
BEGIN NOW Because she wished to goodness they'd take the snottynosed twins and END
BEGIN NOW their babby home to the mischief out of that so that was why she just END
BEGIN NOW gave a gentle hint about its being late. END
BEGIN NOW And when Cissy came up Edy END
BEGIN NOW asked her the time and Miss Cissy, as glib as you like, said it was half END
BEGIN NOW past kissing time, time to kiss again. END
BEGIN NOW But Edy wanted to know because END
BEGIN NOW they were told to be in early. END
BEGIN NOW —Wait, said Cissy, I'll run ask my uncle Peter over there what's the END
BEGIN NOW time by his conundrum. END
BEGIN NOW So over she went and when he saw her coming she could see him take his END
BEGIN NOW hand out of his pocket, getting nervous, and beginning to play with his END
BEGIN NOW watchchain, looking up at the church. END
BEGIN NOW Passionate nature though he was END
BEGIN NOW Gerty could see that he had enormous control over himself. END
BEGIN NOW One moment he END
BEGIN NOW had been there, fascinated by a loveliness that made him gaze, and the END

BEGIN NOW in every line of his distinguishedlooking figure. END

BEGIN NOW watch was stopped but he thought it must be after eight because the sun END
BEGIN NOW was set. END
BEGIN NOW His voice had a cultured ring in it and though he spoke in END
BEGIN NOW measured accents there was a suspicion of a quiver in the mellow tones. END
BEGIN NOW Cissy said thanks and came back with her tongue out and said uncle said END
BEGIN NOW his waterworks were out of order. END

BEGIN NOW flowers and Father Conroy got up and settled it all right and she could END
BEGIN NOW see the gentleman winding his watch and listening to the works and she END
BEGIN NOW swung her leg more in and out in time. END
BEGIN NOW It was getting darker but he END
BEGIN NOW could see and he was looking all the time that he was winding the watch END
BEGIN NOW or whatever he was doing to it and then he put it back and put his hands END
BEGIN NOW back into his pockets. END
BEGIN NOW She felt a kind of a sensation rushing all over END
BEGIN NOW her and she knew by the feel of her scalp and that irritation against END
BEGIN NOW her stays that that thing must be coming on because the last time too END
BEGIN NOW was when she clipped her hair on account of the moon. END
BEGIN NOW His dark eyes END
BEGIN NOW fixed themselves on her again drinking in her every contour, literally END
BEGIN NOW worshipping at her shrine. END
BEGIN NOW If ever there was undisguised admiration in a END
BEGIN NOW man's passionate gaze it was there plain to be seen on that man's face. END
BEGIN NOW It is for you, Gertrude MacDowell, and you know it. END
BEGIN NOW Edy began to get ready to go and it was high time for her and Gerty END
BEGIN NOW noticed that that little hint she gave had had the desired effect END
BEGIN NOW because it was a long way along the strand to where there was the place END

BEGIN NOW Gerty could pay them back in their own coin and she just answered with END
BEGIN NOW scathing politeness when Edy asked her was she heartbroken about her END
BEGIN NOW best boy throwing her over. END
BEGIN NOW Gerty winced sharply. END
BEGIN NOW A brief cold blaze END
BEGIN NOW shone from her eyes that spoke volumes of scorn immeasurable. END
BEGIN NOW It hurt—O END
BEGIN NOW yes, it cut deep because Edy had her own quiet way of saying things like END
BEGIN NOW that she knew would wound like the confounded little cat she was. END
BEGIN NOW Gerty's lips parted swiftly to frame the word but she fought back the END
BEGIN NOW sob that rose to her throat, so slim, so flawless, so beautifully END
BEGIN NOW moulded it seemed one an artist might have dreamed of. END
BEGIN NOW She had loved him END
BEGIN NOW better than he knew. END
BEGIN NOW Lighthearted deceiver and fickle like all his sex END
BEGIN NOW he would never understand what he had meant to her and for an instant END
BEGIN NOW there was in the blue eyes a quick stinging of tears. END
BEGIN NOW Their eyes were END
BEGIN NOW probing her mercilessly but with a brave effort she sparkled back in END
BEGIN NOW sympathy as she glanced at her new conquest for them to see. END
BEGIN NOW —O, responded Gerty, quick as lightning, laughing, and the proud head END
BEGIN NOW flashed up. END
BEGIN NOW I can throw my cap at who I like because it's leap year. END
BEGIN NOW Her words rang out crystalclear, more musical than the cooing of the END
BEGIN NOW ringdove, but they cut the silence icily. END
BEGIN NOW There was that in her young END
BEGIN NOW voice that told that she was not a one to be lightly trifled with. END
BEGIN NOW As END
BEGIN NOW for Mr Reggy with his swank and his bit of money she could just chuck END
BEGIN NOW him aside as if he was so much filth and never again would she cast as END
BEGIN NOW much as a second thought on him and tear his silly postcard into a dozen END
BEGIN NOW pieces. END
BEGIN NOW And if ever after he dared to presume she could give him one END
BEGIN NOW look of measured scorn that would make him shrivel up on the spot. END
BEGIN NOW Miss END
BEGIN NOW puny little Edy's countenance fell to no slight extent and Gerty could END
BEGIN NOW see by her looking as black as thunder that she was simply in a towering END
BEGIN NOW rage though she hid it, the little kinnatt, because that shaft had END
BEGIN NOW struck home for her petty jealousy and they both knew that she was END
BEGIN NOW something aloof, apart, in another sphere, that she was not of them and END
BEGIN NOW never would be and there was somebody else too that knew it and saw it END
BEGIN NOW so they could put that in their pipe and smoke it. END
BEGIN NOW Edy straightened up baby Boardman to get ready to go and Cissy tucked in END
BEGIN NOW the ball and the spades and buckets and it was high time too because the END
BEGIN NOW sandman was on his way for Master Boardman junior. END
BEGIN NOW And Cissy told him END
BEGIN NOW too that billy winks was coming and that baby was to go deedaw and baby END
BEGIN NOW looked just too ducky, laughing up out of his gleeful eyes, and Cissy END
BEGIN NOW poked him like that out of fun in his wee fat tummy and baby, without as END
BEGIN NOW much as by your leave, sent up his compliments to all and sundry on to END
BEGIN NOW his brandnew dribbling bib. END
BEGIN NOW —O my! END
BEGIN NOW Puddeny pie! END
BEGIN NOW protested Ciss. END
BEGIN NOW He has his bib destroyed. END
BEGIN NOW The slight contretemps claimed her attention but in two twos she set END
BEGIN NOW that little matter to rights. END
BEGIN NOW Gerty stifled a smothered exclamation and gave a nervous cough and Edy END
BEGIN NOW asked what and she was just going to tell her to catch it while it was END
BEGIN NOW flying but she was ever ladylike in her deportment so she simply passed END
BEGIN NOW it off with consummate tact by saying that that was the benediction END
BEGIN NOW because just then the bell rang out from the steeple over the quiet END
BEGIN NOW seashore because Canon O'Hanlon was up on the altar with the veil that END
BEGIN NOW Father Conroy put round his shoulders giving the benediction with the END
BEGIN NOW Blessed Sacrament in his hands. END
BEGIN NOW How moving the scene there in the gathering twilight, the last glimpse END
BEGIN NOW of Erin, the touching chime of those evening bells and at the same time END
BEGIN NOW a bat flew forth from the ivied belfry through the dusk, hither, END
BEGIN NOW thither, with a tiny lost cry. END
BEGIN NOW And she could see far away the lights of END
BEGIN NOW the lighthouses so picturesque she would have loved to do with a box of END
BEGIN NOW paints because it was easier than to make a man and soon the lamplighter END
BEGIN NOW would be going his rounds past the presbyterian church grounds and along END
BEGIN NOW by shady Tritonville avenue where the couples walked and lighting the END
BEGIN NOW lamp near her window where Reggy Wylie used to turn his freewheel like END
BEGIN NOW she read in that book The Lamplighter by Miss Cummins, author of Mabel END
BEGIN NOW Vaughan and other tales. END
BEGIN NOW For Gerty had her dreams that no-one knew of. END
BEGIN NOW She loved to read poetry and when she got a keepsake from Bertha Supple END
BEGIN NOW of that lovely confession album with the coralpink cover to write her END
BEGIN NOW thoughts in she laid it in the drawer of her toilettable which, though END
BEGIN NOW it did not err on the side of luxury, was scrupulously neat and clean. END
BEGIN NOW It was there she kept her girlish treasure trove, the tortoiseshell END
BEGIN NOW combs, her child of Mary badge, the whiterose scent, the eyebrowleine, END
BEGIN NOW her alabaster pouncetbox and the ribbons to change when her things came END
BEGIN NOW home from the wash and there were some beautiful thoughts written in it END
BEGIN NOW in violet ink that she bought in Hely's of Dame Street for she felt that END
BEGIN NOW she too could write poetry if she could only express herself like that END
BEGIN NOW poem that appealed to her so deeply that she had copied out of the END
BEGIN NOW newspaper she found one evening round the potherbs. END
BEGIN NOW Art thou real, my END
BEGIN NOW ideal? END
BEGIN NOW it was called by Louis J Walsh, Magherafelt, and after there was END
BEGIN NOW something about twilight, wilt thou ever? END
BEGIN NOW and ofttimes the beauty of END
BEGIN NOW poetry, so sad in its transient loveliness, had misted her eyes with END
BEGIN NOW silent tears for she felt that the years were slipping by for her, one END
BEGIN NOW by one, and but for that one shortcoming she knew she need fear no END
BEGIN NOW competition and that was an accident coming down Dalkey hill and she END
BEGIN NOW always tried to conceal it. END
BEGIN NOW But it must end, she felt. END
BEGIN NOW If she saw that END
BEGIN NOW magic lure in his eyes there would be no holding back for her. END
BEGIN NOW Love END
BEGIN NOW laughs at locksmiths. END
BEGIN NOW She would make the great sacrifice. END
BEGIN NOW Her every END
BEGIN NOW effort would be to share his thoughts. END
BEGIN NOW Dearer than the whole world would END
BEGIN NOW she be to him and gild his days with happiness. END
BEGIN NOW There was the END
BEGIN NOW allimportant question and she was dying to know was he a married man or END
BEGIN NOW a widower who had lost his wife or some tragedy like the nobleman with END
BEGIN NOW the foreign name from the land of song had to have her put into a END
BEGIN NOW madhouse, cruel only to be kind. END
BEGIN NOW But even if—what then? END
BEGIN NOW Would it make a END
BEGIN NOW very great difference? END
BEGIN NOW From everything in the least indelicate her END
BEGIN NOW finebred nature instinctively recoiled. END
BEGIN NOW She loathed that sort of person, END
BEGIN NOW the fallen women off the accommodation walk beside the Dodder that went END
BEGIN NOW with the soldiers and coarse men with no respect for a girl's honour, END
BEGIN NOW degrading the sex and being taken up to the police station. END
BEGIN NOW No, no: not END
BEGIN NOW that. END
BEGIN NOW They would be just good friends like a big brother and sister END
BEGIN NOW without all that other in spite of the conventions of Society with a big END
BEGIN NOW ess. END
BEGIN NOW Perhaps it was an old flame he was in mourning for from the days END
BEGIN NOW beyond recall. END
BEGIN NOW She thought she understood. END
BEGIN NOW She would try to understand END

BEGIN NOW Universally that person's acumen is esteemed very little perceptive END
BEGIN NOW concerning whatsoever matters are being held as most profitably by END
BEGIN NOW mortals with sapience endowed to be studied who is ignorant of that END
BEGIN NOW which the most in doctrine erudite and certainly by reason of that in END
BEGIN NOW them high mind's ornament deserving of veneration constantly maintain END
BEGIN NOW when by general consent they affirm that other circumstances being equal END
BEGIN NOW by no exterior splendour is the prosperity of a nation more END
BEGIN NOW efficaciously asserted than by the measure of how far forward may have END
BEGIN NOW progressed the tribute of its solicitude for that proliferent END
BEGIN NOW continuance which of evils the original if it be absent when fortunately END
BEGIN NOW present constitutes the certain sign of omnipotent nature's incorrupted END
BEGIN NOW benefaction. END
BEGIN NOW For who is there who anything of some significance has END
BEGIN NOW apprehended but is conscious that that exterior splendour may be the END
BEGIN NOW surface of a downwardtending lutulent reality or on the contrary anyone END
BEGIN NOW so is there unilluminated as not to perceive that as no nature's boon END
BEGIN NOW can contend against the bounty of increase so it behoves every most just END
BEGIN NOW citizen to become the exhortator and admonisher of his semblables and to END
BEGIN NOW tremble lest what had in the past been by the nation excellently END
BEGIN NOW commenced might be in the future not with similar excellence END
BEGIN NOW accomplished if an inverecund habit shall have gradually traduced the END
BEGIN NOW honourable by ancestors transmitted customs to that thither of END
BEGIN NOW profundity that that one was audacious excessively who would have the END
BEGIN NOW hardihood to rise affirming that no more odious offence can for anyone END
BEGIN NOW be than to oblivious neglect to consign that evangel simultaneously END
BEGIN NOW command and promise which on all mortals with prophecy of abundance or END
BEGIN NOW with diminution's menace that exalted of reiteratedly procreating END
BEGIN NOW function ever irrevocably enjoined? END
BEGIN NOW It is not why therefore we shall wonder if, as the best historians END
BEGIN NOW relate, among the Celts, who nothing that was not in its nature END
BEGIN NOW admirable admired, the art of medicine shall have been highly honoured. END
BEGIN NOW Not to speak of hostels, leperyards, sweating chambers, plaguegraves, END
BEGIN NOW their greatest doctors, the O'Shiels, the O'Hickeys, the O'Lees, have END
BEGIN NOW sedulously set down the divers methods by which the sick and the END
BEGIN NOW relapsed found again health whether the malady had been the trembling END
BEGIN NOW withering or loose boyconnell flux. END
BEGIN NOW Certainly in every public work which END
BEGIN NOW in it anything of gravity contains preparation should be with importance END
BEGIN NOW commensurate and therefore a plan was by them adopted (whether by having END
BEGIN NOW preconsidered or as the maturation of experience it is difficult in END
BEGIN NOW being said which the discrepant opinions of subsequent inquirers are not END
BEGIN NOW up to the present congrued to render manifest) whereby maternity was so END
BEGIN NOW far from all accident possibility removed that whatever care the patient END
BEGIN NOW in that all hardest of woman hour chiefly required and not solely for END
BEGIN NOW the copiously opulent but also for her who not being sufficiently END
BEGIN NOW moneyed scarcely and often not even scarcely could subsist valiantly and END
BEGIN NOW for an inconsiderable emolument was provided. END
BEGIN NOW To her nothing already then and thenceforward was anyway able to be END
BEGIN NOW molestful for this chiefly felt all citizens except with proliferent END
BEGIN NOW mothers prosperity at all not to can be and as they had received END
BEGIN NOW eternity gods mortals generation to befit them her beholding, when the END
BEGIN NOW case was so hoving itself, parturient in vehicle thereward carrying END
BEGIN NOW desire immense among all one another was impelling on of her to be END
BEGIN NOW received into that domicile. END
BEGIN NOW O thing of prudent nation not merely in END
BEGIN NOW being seen but also even in being related worthy of being praised that END
BEGIN NOW they her by anticipation went seeing mother, that she by them suddenly END
BEGIN NOW to be about to be cherished had been begun she felt! END

BEGIN NOW Within womb won he worship. END
BEGIN NOW Whatever in that END
BEGIN NOW one case done commodiously done was. END
BEGIN NOW A couch by midwives attended with END
BEGIN NOW wholesome food reposeful, cleanest swaddles as though forthbringing were END

BEGIN NOW Israel's folk was that man that on earth wandering far had fared. END
BEGIN NOW Stark END
BEGIN NOW ruth of man his errand that him lone led till that house. END

BEGIN NOW Horne is lord. END
BEGIN NOW Seventy beds keeps he there teeming END
BEGIN NOW mothers are wont that they lie for to thole and bring forth bairns hale END
BEGIN NOW so God's angel to Mary quoth. END
BEGIN NOW Watchers tway there walk, white sisters in END
BEGIN NOW ward sleepless. END
BEGIN NOW Smarts they still, sickness soothing: in twelve moons END
BEGIN NOW thrice an hundred. END

BEGIN NOW wariest ward. END

BEGIN NOW nursingwoman answered him and said that that woman was in throes now END

BEGIN NOW that now in a little it would be. END

BEGIN NOW motherhood and he wondered to look on her face that was a fair face for END

BEGIN NOW And whiles they spake the door of the castle was opened and there nighed END

BEGIN NOW horrible and dreadful dragon was smitten him for which he did do make a END
BEGIN NOW salve of volatile salt and chrism as much as he might suffice. END
BEGIN NOW And he END
BEGIN NOW said now that he should go in to that castle for to make merry with them END

BEGIN NOW otherwhither for he was a man of cautels and a subtile. END
BEGIN NOW Also the lady END
BEGIN NOW was of his avis and repreved the learningknight though she trowed well END

BEGIN NOW But END
BEGIN NOW the learningknight would not hear say nay nor do her mandement ne have END

BEGIN NOW castle. END
BEGIN NOW And the traveller Leopold went into the castle for to rest him END
BEGIN NOW for a space being sore of limb after many marches environing in divers END
BEGIN NOW lands and sometime venery. END
BEGIN NOW And in the castle was set a board that was of the birchwood of Finlandy END
BEGIN NOW and it was upheld by four dwarfmen of that country but they durst not END
BEGIN NOW move more for enchantment. END
BEGIN NOW And on this board were frightful swords and END
BEGIN NOW knives that are made in a great cavern by swinking demons out of white END
BEGIN NOW flames that they fix then in the horns of buffalos and stags that there END
BEGIN NOW abound marvellously. END
BEGIN NOW And there were vessels that are wrought by magic of END
BEGIN NOW Mahound out of seasand and the air by a warlock with his breath that he END
BEGIN NOW blases in to them like to bubbles. END
BEGIN NOW And full fair cheer and rich was on END
BEGIN NOW the board that no wight could devise a fuller ne richer. END
BEGIN NOW And there was a END
BEGIN NOW vat of silver that was moved by craft to open in the which lay strange END
BEGIN NOW fishes withouten heads though misbelieving men nie that this be possible END
BEGIN NOW thing without they see it natheless they are so. END
BEGIN NOW And these fishes lie in END
BEGIN NOW an oily water brought there from Portugal land because of the fatness END
BEGIN NOW that therein is like to the juices of the olivepress. END
BEGIN NOW And also it was a END
BEGIN NOW marvel to see in that castle how by magic they make a compost out of END
BEGIN NOW fecund wheatkidneys out of Chaldee that by aid of certain angry spirits END
BEGIN NOW that they do in to it swells up wondrously like to a vast mountain. END
BEGIN NOW And END
BEGIN NOW they teach the serpents there to entwine themselves up on long sticks END
BEGIN NOW out of the ground and of the scales of these serpents they brew out a END
BEGIN NOW brewage like to mead. END
BEGIN NOW And the learning knight let pour for childe Leopold a draught and halp END
BEGIN NOW thereto the while all they that were there drank every each. END
BEGIN NOW And childe END
BEGIN NOW Leopold did up his beaver for to pleasure him and took apertly somewhat END
BEGIN NOW in amity for he never drank no manner of mead which he then put by and END
BEGIN NOW anon full privily he voided the more part in his neighbour glass and his END
BEGIN NOW neighbour nist not of this wile. END

BEGIN NOW them for to rest him there awhile. END

BEGIN NOW This meanwhile this good sister stood by the door and begged them at the END

BEGIN NOW fast. END
BEGIN NOW Sir Leopold heard on the upfloor cry on high and he wondered what END
BEGIN NOW cry that it was whether of child or woman and I marvel, said he, that it END
BEGIN NOW be not come or now. END
BEGIN NOW Meseems it dureth overlong. END
BEGIN NOW And he was ware and saw END

BEGIN NOW gently. END

BEGIN NOW And the franklin that had drunken said, Expecting each moment to be her END
BEGIN NOW next. END

BEGIN NOW he was a passing good man of his lustiness. END
BEGIN NOW And sir Leopold that was the END
BEGIN NOW goodliest guest that ever sat in scholars' hall and that was the meekest END

BEGIN NOW pondering. END

BEGIN NOW drunken an they might. END

BEGIN NOW Leopold. END

BEGIN NOW come and such as intended to no goodness said how he had broke his avow. END

BEGIN NOW time in the honourablest manner. END

BEGIN NOW wander, loth to leave. END
BEGIN NOW For they were right witty scholars. END
BEGIN NOW And he heard their aresouns each gen END
BEGIN NOW other as touching birth and righteousness, young Madden maintaining that END
BEGIN NOW put such case it were hard the wife to die (for so it had fallen out a END
BEGIN NOW matter of some year agone with a woman of Eblana in Horne's house that END
BEGIN NOW now was trespassed out of this world and the self night next before her END
BEGIN NOW death all leeches and pothecaries had taken counsel of her case). END
BEGIN NOW And END
BEGIN NOW they said farther she should live because in the beginning, they said, END
BEGIN NOW the woman should bring forth in pain and wherefore they that were of END
BEGIN NOW this imagination affirmed how young Madden had said truth for he had END
BEGIN NOW conscience to let her die. END
BEGIN NOW And not few and of these was young Lynch were END
BEGIN NOW in doubt that the world was now right evil governed as it was never END
BEGIN NOW other howbeit the mean people believed it otherwise but the law nor his END
BEGIN NOW judges did provide no remedy. END
BEGIN NOW A redress God grant. END
BEGIN NOW This was scant said END
BEGIN NOW but all cried with one acclaim nay, by our Virgin Mother, the wife END
BEGIN NOW should live and the babe to die. END
BEGIN NOW In colour whereof they waxed hot upon END
BEGIN NOW that head what with argument and what for their drinking but the END
BEGIN NOW franklin Lenehan was prompt each when to pour them ale so that at the END
BEGIN NOW least way mirth might not lack. END
BEGIN NOW Then young Madden showed all the whole END
BEGIN NOW affair and said how that she was dead and how for holy religion sake by END
BEGIN NOW rede of palmer and bedesman and for a vow he had made to Saint Ultan of END
BEGIN NOW Arbraccan her goodman husband would not let her death whereby they were END
BEGIN NOW all wondrous grieved. END
BEGIN NOW To whom young Stephen had these words following: END
BEGIN NOW Murmur, sirs, is eke oft among lay folk. END
BEGIN NOW Both babe and parent now END
BEGIN NOW glorify their Maker, the one in limbo gloom, the other in purgefire. END
BEGIN NOW But, gramercy, what of those Godpossibled souls that we nightly END
BEGIN NOW impossibilise, which is the sin against the Holy Ghost, Very God, Lord END
BEGIN NOW and Giver of Life? END
BEGIN NOW For, sirs, he said, our lust is brief. END
BEGIN NOW We are means END
BEGIN NOW to those small creatures within us and nature has other ends than we. END
BEGIN NOW Then said Dixon junior to Punch Costello wist he what ends. END
BEGIN NOW But he had END
BEGIN NOW overmuch drunken and the best word he could have of him was that he END
BEGIN NOW would ever dishonest a woman whoso she were or wife or maid or leman if END
BEGIN NOW it so fortuned him to be delivered of his spleen of lustihead. END
BEGIN NOW Whereat END
BEGIN NOW Crotthers of Alba Longa sang young Malachi's praise of that beast the END
BEGIN NOW unicorn how once in the millennium he cometh by his horn, the other all END
BEGIN NOW this while, pricked forward with their jibes wherewith they did malice END
BEGIN NOW him, witnessing all and several by saint Foutinus his engines that he END
BEGIN NOW was able to do any manner of thing that lay in man to do. END
BEGIN NOW Thereat END
BEGIN NOW laughed they all right jocundly only young Stephen and sir Leopold which END
BEGIN NOW never durst laugh too open by reason of a strange humour which he would END
BEGIN NOW not bewray and also for that he rued for her that bare whoso she might END
BEGIN NOW be or wheresoever. END
BEGIN NOW Then spake young Stephen orgulous of mother Church END
BEGIN NOW that would cast him out of her bosom, of law of canons, of Lilith, END
BEGIN NOW patron of abortions, of bigness wrought by wind of seeds of brightness END
BEGIN NOW or by potency of vampires mouth to mouth or, as Virgilius saith, by the END
BEGIN NOW influence of the occident or by the reek of moonflower or an she lie END
BEGIN NOW with a woman which her man has but lain with, effectu secuto, or END
BEGIN NOW peradventure in her bath according to the opinions of Averroes and Moses END
BEGIN NOW Maimonides. END
BEGIN NOW He said also how at the end of the second month a human soul END
BEGIN NOW was infused and how in all our holy mother foldeth ever souls for God's END
BEGIN NOW greater glory whereas that earthly mother which was but a dam to bear END
BEGIN NOW beastly should die by canon for so saith he that holdeth the fisherman's END
BEGIN NOW seal, even that blessed Peter on which rock was holy church for all ages END
BEGIN NOW founded. END
BEGIN NOW All they bachelors then asked of sir Leopold would he in like END
BEGIN NOW case so jeopard her person as risk life to save life. END
BEGIN NOW A wariness of mind END
BEGIN NOW he would answer as fitted all and, laying hand to jaw, he said END
BEGIN NOW dissembling, as his wont was, that as it was informed him, who had ever END
BEGIN NOW loved the art of physic as might a layman, and agreeing also with his END
BEGIN NOW experience of so seldomseen an accident it was good for that mother END
BEGIN NOW Church belike at one blow had birth and death pence and in such sort END
BEGIN NOW deliverly he scaped their questions. END
BEGIN NOW That is truth, pardy, said Dixon, END
BEGIN NOW and, or I err, a pregnant word. END
BEGIN NOW Which hearing young Stephen was a END
BEGIN NOW marvellous glad man and he averred that he who stealeth from the poor END
BEGIN NOW lendeth to the Lord for he was of a wild manner when he was drunken and END
BEGIN NOW that he was now in that taking it appeared eftsoons. END
BEGIN NOW But sir Leopold was passing grave maugre his word by cause he still had END
BEGIN NOW pity of the terrorcausing shrieking of shrill women in their labour and END
BEGIN NOW as he was minded of his good lady Marion that had borne him an only END
BEGIN NOW manchild which on his eleventh day on live had died and no man of art END
BEGIN NOW could save so dark is destiny. END
BEGIN NOW And she was wondrous stricken of heart END
BEGIN NOW for that evil hap and for his burial did him on a fair corselet of END
BEGIN NOW lamb's wool, the flower of the flock, lest he might perish utterly and END
BEGIN NOW lie akeled (for it was then about the midst of the winter) and now Sir END
BEGIN NOW Leopold that had of his body no manchild for an heir looked upon him his END
BEGIN NOW friend's son and was shut up in sorrow for his forepassed happiness and END
BEGIN NOW as sad as he was that him failed a son of such gentle courage (for all END
BEGIN NOW accounted him of real parts) so grieved he also in no less measure for END
BEGIN NOW young Stephen for that he lived riotously with those wastrels and END
BEGIN NOW murdered his goods with whores. END
BEGIN NOW About that present time young Stephen filled all cups that stood empty END
BEGIN NOW so as there remained but little mo if the prudenter had not shadowed END
BEGIN NOW their approach from him that still plied it very busily who, praying for END
BEGIN NOW the intentions of the sovereign pontiff, he gave them for a pledge the END
BEGIN NOW vicar of Christ which also as he said is vicar of Bray. END
BEGIN NOW Now drink we, END
BEGIN NOW quod he, of this mazer and quaff ye this mead which is not indeed parcel END
BEGIN NOW of my body but my soul's bodiment. END
BEGIN NOW Leave ye fraction of bread to them END
BEGIN NOW that live by bread alone. END
BEGIN NOW Be not afeard neither for any want for this END
BEGIN NOW will comfort more than the other will dismay. END
BEGIN NOW See ye here. END
BEGIN NOW And he showed END
BEGIN NOW them glistering coins of the tribute and goldsmith notes the worth of END
BEGIN NOW two pound nineteen shilling that he had, he said, for a song which he END
BEGIN NOW writ. END
BEGIN NOW They all admired to see the foresaid riches in such dearth of END
BEGIN NOW money as was herebefore. END
BEGIN NOW His words were then these as followeth: Know END
BEGIN NOW all men, he said, time's ruins build eternity's mansions. END
BEGIN NOW What means END
BEGIN NOW this? END
BEGIN NOW Desire's wind blasts the thorntree but after it becomes from a END
BEGIN NOW bramblebush to be a rose upon the rood of time. END
BEGIN NOW Mark me now. END
BEGIN NOW In woman's END
BEGIN NOW womb word is made flesh but in the spirit of the maker all flesh that END
BEGIN NOW passes becomes the word that shall not pass away. END
BEGIN NOW This is the END
BEGIN NOW postcreation. END
BEGIN NOW Omnis caro ad te veniet. END
BEGIN NOW No question but her name is END
BEGIN NOW puissant who aventried the dear corse of our Agenbuyer, Healer and Herd, END
BEGIN NOW our mighty mother and mother most venerable and Bernardus saith aptly END
BEGIN NOW that She hath an omnipotentiam deiparae supplicem, that is to wit, an END
BEGIN NOW almightiness of petition because she is the second Eve and she won us, END
BEGIN NOW saith Augustine too, whereas that other, our grandam, which we are END
BEGIN NOW linked up with by successive anastomosis of navelcords sold us all, END
BEGIN NOW seed, breed and generation, for a penny pippin. END
BEGIN NOW But here is the matter END
BEGIN NOW now. END
BEGIN NOW Or she knew him, that second I say, and was but creature of her END
BEGIN NOW creature, vergine madre, figlia di tuo figlio, or she knew him not and END
BEGIN NOW then stands she in the one denial or ignorancy with Peter Piscator who END
BEGIN NOW lives in the house that Jack built and with Joseph the joiner patron of END
BEGIN NOW the happy demise of all unhappy marriages, parceque M. END
BEGIN NOW LÃ©o Taxil nous a END
BEGIN NOW dit que qui l'avait mise dans cette fichue position c'Ã©tait le sacre END
BEGIN NOW pigeon, ventre de Dieu! END
BEGIN NOW Entweder transubstantiality ODER END
BEGIN NOW consubstantiality but in no case subsubstantiality. END
BEGIN NOW And all cried out END
BEGIN NOW upon it for a very scurvy word. END
BEGIN NOW A pregnancy without joy, he said, a END
BEGIN NOW birth without pangs, a body without blemish, a belly without bigness. END
BEGIN NOW Let the lewd with faith and fervour worship. END
BEGIN NOW With will will we END
BEGIN NOW withstand, withsay. END
BEGIN NOW Hereupon Punch Costello dinged with his fist upon the board and would END
BEGIN NOW sing a bawdy catch Staboo Stabella about a wench that was put in pod of END
BEGIN NOW a jolly swashbuckler in Almany which he did straightways now attack: The END
BEGIN NOW first three months she was not well, Staboo, when here nurse Quigley END
BEGIN NOW from the door angerly bid them hist ye should shame you nor was it not END
BEGIN NOW meet as she remembered them being her mind was to have all orderly END
BEGIN NOW against lord Andrew came for because she was jealous that no gasteful END
BEGIN NOW turmoil might shorten the honour of her guard. END
BEGIN NOW It was an ancient and a END
BEGIN NOW sad matron of a sedate look and christian walking, in habit dun END
BEGIN NOW beseeming her megrims and wrinkled visage, nor did her hortative want of END
BEGIN NOW it effect for incontinently Punch Costello was of them all embraided and END
BEGIN NOW they reclaimed the churl with civil rudeness some and shaked him with END
