BEGIN NOW menace of blandishments others whiles they all chode with him, a murrain END
BEGIN NOW seize the dolt, what a devil he would be at, thou chuff, thou puny, thou END
BEGIN NOW got in peasestraw, thou losel, thou chitterling, thou spawn of a rebel, END
BEGIN NOW thou dykedropt, thou abortion thou, to shut up his drunken drool out of END
BEGIN NOW that like a curse of God ape, the good sir Leopold that had for his END
BEGIN NOW cognisance the flower of quiet, margerain gentle, advising also the END
BEGIN NOW time's occasion as most sacred and most worthy to be most sacred. END
BEGIN NOW In END
BEGIN NOW Horne's house rest should reign. END
BEGIN NOW To be short this passage was scarce by when Master Dixon of Mary in END
BEGIN NOW Eccles, goodly grinning, asked young Stephen what was the reason why he END
BEGIN NOW had not cided to take friar's vows and he answered him obedience in the END
BEGIN NOW womb, chastity in the tomb but involuntary poverty all his days. END
BEGIN NOW Master END
BEGIN NOW Lenehan at this made return that he had heard of those nefarious deeds END
BEGIN NOW and how, as he heard hereof counted, he had besmirched the lily virtue END
BEGIN NOW of a confiding female which was corruption of minors and they all END
BEGIN NOW intershowed it too, waxing merry and toasting to his fathership. END
BEGIN NOW But he END
BEGIN NOW said very entirely it was clean contrary to their suppose for he was the END
BEGIN NOW eternal son and ever virgin. END
BEGIN NOW Thereat mirth grew in them the more and END
BEGIN NOW they rehearsed to him his curious rite of wedlock for the disrobing and END
BEGIN NOW deflowering of spouses, as the priests use in Madagascar island, she to END
BEGIN NOW be in guise of white and saffron, her groom in white and grain, with END
BEGIN NOW burning of nard and tapers, on a bridebed while clerks sung kyries and END
BEGIN NOW the anthem Ut novetur sexus omnis corporis mysterium till she was there END
BEGIN NOW unmaided. END
BEGIN NOW He gave them then a much admirable hymen minim by those END
BEGIN NOW delicate poets Master John Fletcher and Master Francis Beaumont that is END
BEGIN NOW in their Maid's Tragedy that was writ for a like twining of lovers: To END
BEGIN NOW bed, to bed was the burden of it to be played with accompanable concent END
BEGIN NOW upon the virginals. END
BEGIN NOW An exquisite dulcet epithalame of most mollificative END
BEGIN NOW suadency for juveniles amatory whom the odoriferous flambeaus of the END
BEGIN NOW paranymphs have escorted to the quadrupedal proscenium of connubial END
BEGIN NOW communion. END
BEGIN NOW Well met they were, said Master Dixon, joyed, but, harkee, END
BEGIN NOW young sir, better were they named Beau Mount and Lecher for, by my END
BEGIN NOW troth, of such a mingling much might come. END
BEGIN NOW Young Stephen said indeed to END
BEGIN NOW his best remembrance they had but the one doxy between them and she of END
BEGIN NOW the stews to make shift with in delights amorous for life ran very high END
BEGIN NOW in those days and the custom of the country approved with it. END
BEGIN NOW Greater END
BEGIN NOW love than this, he said, no man hath that a man lay down his wife for END
BEGIN NOW his friend. END
BEGIN NOW Go thou and do likewise. END
BEGIN NOW Thus, or words to that effect, END
BEGIN NOW saith Zarathustra, sometime regius professor of French letters to the END
BEGIN NOW university of Oxtail nor breathed there ever that man to whom mankind END
BEGIN NOW was more beholden. END
BEGIN NOW Bring a stranger within thy tower it will go hard but END
BEGIN NOW thou wilt have the secondbest bed. END
BEGIN NOW Orate, fratres, pro memetipso. END
BEGIN NOW And END
BEGIN NOW all the people shall say, Amen. END
BEGIN NOW Remember, Erin, thy generations and thy END
BEGIN NOW days of old, how thou settedst little by me and by my word and END
BEGIN NOW broughtedst in a stranger to my gates to commit fornication in my sight END
BEGIN NOW and to wax fat and kick like Jeshurum. END
BEGIN NOW Therefore hast thou sinned END
BEGIN NOW against my light and hast made me, thy lord, to be the slave of END
BEGIN NOW servants. END
BEGIN NOW Return, return, Clan Milly: forget me not, O Milesian. END
BEGIN NOW Why END
BEGIN NOW hast thou done this abomination before me that thou didst spurn me for a END
BEGIN NOW merchant of jalaps and didst deny me to the Roman and to the Indian of END
BEGIN NOW dark speech with whom thy daughters did lie luxuriously? END
BEGIN NOW Look forth now, END
BEGIN NOW my people, upon the land of behest, even from Horeb and from Nebo and END
BEGIN NOW from Pisgah and from the Horns of Hatten unto a land flowing with milk END
BEGIN NOW and money. END
BEGIN NOW But thou hast suckled me with a bitter milk: my moon and my END
BEGIN NOW sun thou hast quenched for ever. END
BEGIN NOW And thou hast left me alone for ever in END
BEGIN NOW the dark ways of my bitterness: and with a kiss of ashes hast thou END
BEGIN NOW kissed my mouth. END
BEGIN NOW This tenebrosity of the interior, he proceeded to say, END
BEGIN NOW hath not been illumined by the wit of the septuagint nor so much as END
BEGIN NOW mentioned for the Orient from on high Which brake hell's gates visited a END
BEGIN NOW darkness that was foraneous. END
BEGIN NOW Assuefaction minorates atrocities (as Tully END
BEGIN NOW saith of his darling Stoics) and Hamlet his father showeth the prince no END
BEGIN NOW blister of combustion. END
BEGIN NOW The adiaphane in the noon of life is an Egypt's END
BEGIN NOW plague which in the nights of prenativity and postmortemity is their END
BEGIN NOW most proper ubi and quomodo. END
BEGIN NOW And as the ends and ultimates of all things END
BEGIN NOW accord in some mean and measure with their inceptions and originals, END
BEGIN NOW that same multiplicit concordance which leads forth growth from birth END
BEGIN NOW accomplishing by a retrogressive metamorphosis that minishing and END
BEGIN NOW ablation towards the final which is agreeable unto nature so is it with END
BEGIN NOW our subsolar being. END
BEGIN NOW The aged sisters draw us into life: we wail, batten, END
BEGIN NOW sport, clip, clasp, sunder, dwindle, die: over us dead they bend. END
BEGIN NOW First, END
BEGIN NOW saved from waters of old Nile, among bulrushes, a bed of fasciated END
BEGIN NOW wattles: at last the cavity of a mountain, an occulted sepulchre amid END
BEGIN NOW the conclamation of the hillcat and the ossifrage. END
BEGIN NOW And as no man knows END
BEGIN NOW the ubicity of his tumulus nor to what processes we shall thereby be END
BEGIN NOW ushered nor whether to Tophet or to Edenville in the like way is all END
BEGIN NOW hidden when we would backward see from what region of remoteness the END
BEGIN NOW whatness of our whoness hath fetched his whenceness. END
BEGIN NOW Thereto Punch Costello roared out mainly Etienne chanson but he loudly END
BEGIN NOW bid them, lo, wisdom hath built herself a house, this vast majestic END
BEGIN NOW longstablished vault, the crystal palace of the Creator, all in applepie END
BEGIN NOW order, a penny for him who finds the pea. END
BEGIN NOW Behold the mansion reared by dedal Jack See the malt stored in many a END
BEGIN NOW refluent sack, In the proud cirque of Jackjohn's bivouac. END
BEGIN NOW A black crack of noise in the street here, alack, bawled back. END
BEGIN NOW Loud on END
BEGIN NOW left Thor thundered: in anger awful the hammerhurler. END
BEGIN NOW Came now the storm END
BEGIN NOW that hist his heart. END
BEGIN NOW And Master Lynch bade him have a care to flout and END
BEGIN NOW witwanton as the god self was angered for his hellprate and paganry. END
BEGIN NOW And END
BEGIN NOW he that had erst challenged to be so doughty waxed wan as they might all END
BEGIN NOW mark and shrank together and his pitch that was before so haught uplift END
BEGIN NOW was now of a sudden quite plucked down and his heart shook within the END
BEGIN NOW cage of his breast as he tasted the rumour of that storm. END
BEGIN NOW Then did some END
BEGIN NOW mock and some jeer and Punch Costello fell hard again to his yale which END
BEGIN NOW Master Lenehan vowed he would do after and he was indeed but a word and END
BEGIN NOW a blow on any the least colour. END
BEGIN NOW But the braggart boaster cried that an END
BEGIN NOW old Nobodaddy was in his cups it was muchwhat indifferent and he would END
BEGIN NOW not lag behind his lead. END
BEGIN NOW But this was only to dye his desperation as END
BEGIN NOW cowed he crouched in Horne's hall. END
BEGIN NOW He drank indeed at one draught to END
BEGIN NOW pluck up a heart of any grace for it thundered long rumblingly over all END
BEGIN NOW the heavens so that Master Madden, being godly certain whiles, knocked END
BEGIN NOW him on his ribs upon that crack of doom and Master Bloom, at the END
BEGIN NOW braggart's side, spoke to him calming words to slumber his great fear, END
BEGIN NOW advertising how it was no other thing but a hubbub noise that he heard, END
BEGIN NOW the discharge of fluid from the thunderhead, look you, having taken END
BEGIN NOW place, and all of the order of a natural phenomenon. END
BEGIN NOW But was young Boasthard's fear vanquished by Calmer's words? END
BEGIN NOW No, for he END
BEGIN NOW had in his bosom a spike named Bitterness which could not by words be END
BEGIN NOW done away. END
BEGIN NOW And was he then neither calm like the one nor godly like the END
BEGIN NOW other? END
BEGIN NOW He was neither as much as he would have liked to be either. END
BEGIN NOW But END
BEGIN NOW could he not have endeavoured to have found again as in his youth the END
BEGIN NOW bottle Holiness that then he lived withal? END
BEGIN NOW Indeed no for Grace was not END
BEGIN NOW there to find that bottle. END
BEGIN NOW Heard he then in that clap the voice of the END
BEGIN NOW god Bringforth or, what Calmer said, a hubbub of Phenomenon? END
BEGIN NOW Heard? END
BEGIN NOW Why, END
BEGIN NOW he could not but hear unless he had plugged him up the tube END
BEGIN NOW Understanding (which he had not done). END
BEGIN NOW For through that tube he saw that END
BEGIN NOW he was in the land of Phenomenon where he must for a certain one day die END
BEGIN NOW as he was like the rest too a passing show. END
BEGIN NOW And would he not accept to END
BEGIN NOW die like the rest and pass away? END
BEGIN NOW By no means would he though he must nor END
BEGIN NOW would he make more shows according as men do with wives which Phenomenon END
BEGIN NOW has commanded them to do by the book Law. END
BEGIN NOW Then wotted he nought of that END
BEGIN NOW other land which is called Believe-on-Me, that is the land of promise END
BEGIN NOW which behoves to the king Delightful and shall be for ever where there END
BEGIN NOW is no death and no birth neither wiving nor mothering at which all shall END
BEGIN NOW come as many as believe on it? END
BEGIN NOW Yes, Pious had told him of that land and END
BEGIN NOW Chaste had pointed him to the way but the reason was that in the way he END
BEGIN NOW fell in with a certain whore of an eyepleasing exterior whose name, she END
BEGIN NOW said, is Bird-in-the-Hand and she beguiled him wrongways from the true END
BEGIN NOW path by her flatteries that she said to him as, Ho, you pretty man, turn END
BEGIN NOW aside hither and I will show you a brave place, and she lay at him so END
BEGIN NOW flatteringly that she had him in her grot which is named Two-in-the-Bush END
BEGIN NOW or, by some learned, Carnal Concupiscence. END
BEGIN NOW This was it what all that company that sat there at commons in Manse of END
BEGIN NOW Mothers the most lusted after and if they met with this whore Bird-in- END
BEGIN NOW the-Hand (which was within all foul plagues, monsters and a wicked END
BEGIN NOW devil) they would strain the last but they would make at her and know END
BEGIN NOW her. END
BEGIN NOW For regarding Believe-on-Me they said it was nought else but notion END
BEGIN NOW and they could conceive no thought of it for, first, Two-in-the-Bush END
BEGIN NOW whither she ticed them was the very goodliest grot and in it were four END
BEGIN NOW pillows on which were four tickets with these words printed on them, END
BEGIN NOW Pickaback and Topsyturvy and Shameface and Cheek by Jowl and, second, END
BEGIN NOW for that foul plague Allpox and the monsters they cared not for them for END
BEGIN NOW Preservative had given them a stout shield of oxengut and, third, that END
BEGIN NOW they might take no hurt neither from Offspring that was that wicked END
BEGIN NOW devil by virtue of this same shield which was named Killchild. END
BEGIN NOW So were END
BEGIN NOW they all in their blind fancy, Mr Cavil and Mr Sometimes Godly, Mr Ape END
BEGIN NOW Swillale, Mr False Franklin, Mr Dainty Dixon, Young Boasthard and Mr END
BEGIN NOW Cautious Calmer. END
BEGIN NOW Wherein, O wretched company, were ye all deceived for END
BEGIN NOW that was the voice of the god that was in a very grievous rage that he END
BEGIN NOW would presently lift his arm up and spill their souls for their abuses END
BEGIN NOW and their spillings done by them contrariwise to his word which forth to END
BEGIN NOW bring brenningly biddeth. END
BEGIN NOW So Thursday sixteenth June Patk. END
BEGIN NOW Dignam laid in clay of an apoplexy and END
BEGIN NOW after hard drought, please God, rained, a bargeman coming in by water a END
BEGIN NOW fifty mile or thereabout with turf saying the seed won't sprout, fields END
BEGIN NOW athirst, very sadcoloured and stunk mightily, the quags and tofts too. END
BEGIN NOW Hard to breathe and all the young quicks clean consumed without sprinkle END
BEGIN NOW this long while back as no man remembered to be without. END
BEGIN NOW The rosy buds END
BEGIN NOW all gone brown and spread out blobs and on the hills nought but dry flag END
BEGIN NOW and faggots that would catch at first fire. END
BEGIN NOW All the world saying, for END
BEGIN NOW aught they knew, the big wind of last February a year that did havoc the END
BEGIN NOW land so pitifully a small thing beside this barrenness. END
BEGIN NOW But by and by, END
BEGIN NOW as said, this evening after sundown, the wind sitting in the west, END
BEGIN NOW biggish swollen clouds to be seen as the night increased and the END
BEGIN NOW weatherwise poring up at them and some sheet lightnings at first and END
BEGIN NOW after, past ten of the clock, one great stroke with a long thunder and END
BEGIN NOW in a brace of shakes all scamper pellmell within door for the smoking END
BEGIN NOW shower, the men making shelter for their straws with a clout or END
BEGIN NOW kerchief, womenfolk skipping off with kirtles catched up soon as the END
BEGIN NOW pour came. END
BEGIN NOW In Ely place, Baggot street, Duke's lawn, thence through END
BEGIN NOW Merrion green up to Holles street a swash of water flowing that was END
BEGIN NOW before bonedry and not one chair or coach or fiacre seen about but no END
BEGIN NOW more crack after that first. END
BEGIN NOW Over against the Rt. END
BEGIN NOW Hon. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Justice END
BEGIN NOW Fitzgibbon's door (that is to sit with Mr Healy the lawyer upon the END
BEGIN NOW college lands) Mal. END
BEGIN NOW Mulligan a gentleman's gentleman that had but come END
BEGIN NOW from Mr Moore's the writer's (that was a papish but is now, folk say, a END
BEGIN NOW good Williamite) chanced against Alec. END
BEGIN NOW Bannon in a cut bob (which are END
BEGIN NOW now in with dance cloaks of Kendal green) that was new got to town from END
BEGIN NOW Mullingar with the stage where his coz and Mal M's brother will stay a END
BEGIN NOW month yet till Saint Swithin and asks what in the earth he does there, END
BEGIN NOW he bound home and he to Andrew Horne's being stayed for to crush a cup END
BEGIN NOW of wine, so he said, but would tell him of a skittish heifer, big of her END
BEGIN NOW age and beef to the heel, and all this while poured with rain and so END
BEGIN NOW both together on to Horne's. END
BEGIN NOW There Leop. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom of Crawford's journal END
BEGIN NOW sitting snug with a covey of wags, likely brangling fellows, Dixon jun., END
BEGIN NOW scholar of my lady of Mercy's, Vin. END
BEGIN NOW Lynch, a Scots fellow, Will. END
BEGIN NOW Madden, END
BEGIN NOW T. END
BEGIN NOW Lenehan, very sad about a racer he fancied and Stephen D. END
BEGIN NOW Leop. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom END
BEGIN NOW there for a languor he had but was now better, be having dreamed tonight END
BEGIN NOW a strange fancy of his dame Mrs Moll with red slippers on in a pair of END
BEGIN NOW Turkey trunks which is thought by those in ken to be for a change and END
BEGIN NOW Mistress Purefoy there, that got in through pleading her belly, and now END
BEGIN NOW on the stools, poor body, two days past her term, the midwives sore put END
BEGIN NOW to it and can't deliver, she queasy for a bowl of riceslop that is a END
BEGIN NOW shrewd drier up of the insides and her breath very heavy more than good END
BEGIN NOW and should be a bullyboy from the knocks, they say, but God give her END
BEGIN NOW soon issue. END
BEGIN NOW 'Tis her ninth chick to live, I hear, and Lady day bit off END
BEGIN NOW her last chick's nails that was then a twelvemonth and with other three END
BEGIN NOW all breastfed that died written out in a fair hand in the king's bible. END
BEGIN NOW Her hub fifty odd and a methodist but takes the sacrament and is to be END
BEGIN NOW seen any fair sabbath with a pair of his boys off Bullock harbour END
BEGIN NOW dapping on the sound with a heavybraked reel or in a punt he has END
BEGIN NOW trailing for flounder and pollock and catches a fine bag, I hear. END
BEGIN NOW In sum END
BEGIN NOW an infinite great fall of rain and all refreshed and will much increase END
BEGIN NOW the harvest yet those in ken say after wind and water fire shall come END
BEGIN NOW for a prognostication of Malachi's almanac (and I hear that Mr Russell END
BEGIN NOW has done a prophetical charm of the same gist out of the Hindustanish END
BEGIN NOW for his farmer's gazette) to have three things in all but this a mere END
BEGIN NOW fetch without bottom of reason for old crones and bairns yet sometimes END
BEGIN NOW they are found in the right guess with their queerities no telling how. END
BEGIN NOW With this came up Lenehan to the feet of the table to say how the letter END
BEGIN NOW was in that night's gazette and he made a show to find it about him (for END
BEGIN NOW he swore with an oath that he had been at pains about it) but on END
BEGIN NOW Stephen's persuasion he gave over the search and was bidden to sit near END
BEGIN NOW by which he did mighty brisk. END
BEGIN NOW He was a kind of sport gentleman that went END
BEGIN NOW for a merryandrew or honest pickle and what belonged of women, END
BEGIN NOW horseflesh or hot scandal he had it pat. END
BEGIN NOW To tell the truth he was mean END
BEGIN NOW in fortunes and for the most part hankered about the coffeehouses and END
BEGIN NOW low taverns with crimps, ostlers, bookies, Paul's men, runners, END
BEGIN NOW flatcaps, waistcoateers, ladies of the bagnio and other rogues of the END
BEGIN NOW game or with a chanceable catchpole or a tipstaff often at nights till END
BEGIN NOW broad day of whom he picked up between his sackpossets much loose END
BEGIN NOW gossip. END
BEGIN NOW He took his ordinary at a boilingcook's and if he had but gotten END
BEGIN NOW into him a mess of broken victuals or a platter of tripes with a bare END
BEGIN NOW tester in his purse he could always bring himself off with his tongue, END
BEGIN NOW some randy quip he had from a punk or whatnot that every mother's son of END
BEGIN NOW them would burst their sides. END
BEGIN NOW The other, Costello that is, hearing this END
BEGIN NOW talk asked was it poetry or a tale. END
BEGIN NOW Faith, no, he says, Frank (that was END
BEGIN NOW his name), 'tis all about Kerry cows that are to be butchered along of END
BEGIN NOW the plague. END
BEGIN NOW But they can go hang, says he with a wink, for me with their END
BEGIN NOW bully beef, a pox on it. END
BEGIN NOW There's as good fish in this tin as ever came END
BEGIN NOW out of it and very friendly he offered to take of some salty sprats that END
BEGIN NOW stood by which he had eyed wishly in the meantime and found the place END
BEGIN NOW which was indeed the chief design of his embassy as he was sharpset. END
BEGIN NOW Mort aux vaches, says Frank then in the French language that had been END
BEGIN NOW indentured to a brandyshipper that has a winelodge in Bordeaux and he END
BEGIN NOW spoke French like a gentleman too. END
BEGIN NOW From a child this Frank had been a END
BEGIN NOW donought that his father, a headborough, who could ill keep him to END
BEGIN NOW school to learn his letters and the use of the globes, matriculated at END
BEGIN NOW the university to study the mechanics but he took the bit between his END
BEGIN NOW teeth like a raw colt and was more familiar with the justiciary and the END
BEGIN NOW parish beadle than with his volumes. END
BEGIN NOW One time he would be a playactor, END
BEGIN NOW then a sutler or a welsher, then nought would keep him from the bearpit END
BEGIN NOW and the cocking main, then he was for the ocean sea or to hoof it on the END
BEGIN NOW roads with the romany folk, kidnapping a squire's heir by favour of END
BEGIN NOW moonlight or fecking maids' linen or choking chicken behind a hedge. END
BEGIN NOW He END
BEGIN NOW had been off as many times as a cat has lives and back again with naked END
BEGIN NOW pockets as many more to his father the headborough who shed a pint of END
BEGIN NOW tears as often as he saw him. END
BEGIN NOW What, says Mr Leopold with his hands END
BEGIN NOW across, that was earnest to know the drift of it, will they slaughter END
BEGIN NOW all? END
BEGIN NOW I protest I saw them but this day morning going to the Liverpool END
BEGIN NOW boats, says he. END
BEGIN NOW I can scarce believe 'tis so bad, says he. END
BEGIN NOW And he had END
BEGIN NOW experience of the like brood beasts and of springers, greasy hoggets and END
BEGIN NOW wether wool, having been some years before actuary for Mr Joseph Cuffe, END
BEGIN NOW a worthy salesmaster that drove his trade for live stock and meadow END
BEGIN NOW auctions hard by Mr Gavin Low's yard in Prussia street. END
BEGIN NOW I question with END
BEGIN NOW you there, says he. END
BEGIN NOW More like 'tis the hoose or the timber tongue. END
BEGIN NOW Mr END
BEGIN NOW Stephen, a little moved but very handsomely told him no such matter and END
BEGIN NOW that he had dispatches from the emperor's chief tailtickler thanking him END
BEGIN NOW for the hospitality, that was sending over Doctor Rinderpest, the END
BEGIN NOW bestquoted cowcatcher in all Muscovy, with a bolus or two of physic to END
BEGIN NOW take the bull by the horns. END
BEGIN NOW Come, come, says Mr Vincent, plain dealing. END
BEGIN NOW He'll find himself on the horns of a dilemma if he meddles with a bull END
BEGIN NOW that's Irish, says he. END
BEGIN NOW Irish by name and irish by nature, says Mr END
BEGIN NOW Stephen, and he sent the ale purling about, an Irish bull in an English END
BEGIN NOW chinashop. END
BEGIN NOW I conceive you, says Mr Dixon. END
BEGIN NOW It is that same bull that was END
BEGIN NOW sent to our island by farmer Nicholas, the bravest cattlebreeder of them END
BEGIN NOW all, with an emerald ring in his nose. END
BEGIN NOW True for you, says Mr Vincent END
BEGIN NOW cross the table, and a bullseye into the bargain, says he, and a plumper END
BEGIN NOW and a portlier bull, says he, never shit on shamrock. END
BEGIN NOW He had horns END
BEGIN NOW galore, a coat of cloth of gold and a sweet smoky breath coming out of END
BEGIN NOW his nostrils so that the women of our island, leaving doughballs and END
BEGIN NOW rollingpins, followed after him hanging his bulliness in daisychains. END
BEGIN NOW What for that, says Mr Dixon, but before he came over farmer Nicholas END
BEGIN NOW that was a eunuch had him properly gelded by a college of doctors who END
BEGIN NOW were no better off than himself. END
BEGIN NOW So be off now, says he, and do all my END
BEGIN NOW cousin german the lord Harry tells you and take a farmer's blessing, and END
BEGIN NOW with that he slapped his posteriors very soundly. END
BEGIN NOW But the slap and the END
BEGIN NOW blessing stood him friend, says Mr Vincent, for to make up he taught him END
BEGIN NOW a trick worth two of the other so that maid, wife, abbess and widow to END
BEGIN NOW this day affirm that they would rather any time of the month whisper in END
BEGIN NOW his ear in the dark of a cowhouse or get a lick on the nape from his END
BEGIN NOW long holy tongue than lie with the finest strapping young ravisher in END
BEGIN NOW the four fields of all Ireland. END
BEGIN NOW Another then put in his word: And they END
BEGIN NOW dressed him, says he, in a point shift and petticoat with a tippet and END
BEGIN NOW girdle and ruffles on his wrists and clipped his forelock and rubbed him END
BEGIN NOW all over with spermacetic oil and built stables for him at every turn of END
BEGIN NOW the road with a gold manger in each full of the best hay in the market END
BEGIN NOW so that he could doss and dung to his heart's content. END
BEGIN NOW By this time the END
BEGIN NOW father of the faithful (for so they called him) was grown so heavy that END
BEGIN NOW he could scarce walk to pasture. END
BEGIN NOW To remedy which our cozening dames and END
BEGIN NOW damsels brought him his fodder in their apronlaps and as soon as his END
BEGIN NOW belly was full he would rear up on his hind uarters to show their END
BEGIN NOW ladyships a mystery and roar and bellow out of him in bulls' language END
BEGIN NOW and they all after him. END
BEGIN NOW Ay, says another, and so pampered was he that he END
BEGIN NOW would suffer nought to grow in all the land but green grass for himself END
BEGIN NOW (for that was the only colour to his mind) and there was a board put up END
BEGIN NOW on a hillock in the middle of the island with a printed notice, saying: END
BEGIN NOW By the Lord Harry, Green is the grass that grows on the ground. END
BEGIN NOW And, END
BEGIN NOW says Mr Dixon, if ever he got scent of a cattleraider in Roscommon or END
BEGIN NOW the wilds of Connemara or a husbandman in Sligo that was sowing as much END
BEGIN NOW as a handful of mustard or a bag of rapeseed out he'd run amok over half END
BEGIN NOW the countryside rooting up with his horns whatever was planted and all END
BEGIN NOW by lord Harry's orders. END
BEGIN NOW There was bad blood between them at first, says END
BEGIN NOW Mr Vincent, and the lord Harry called farmer Nicholas all the old Nicks END
BEGIN NOW in the world and an old whoremaster that kept seven trulls in his house END
BEGIN NOW and I'll meddle in his matters, says he. END
BEGIN NOW I'll make that animal smell END
BEGIN NOW hell, says he, with the help of that good pizzle my father left me. END
BEGIN NOW But END
BEGIN NOW one evening, says Mr Dixon, when the lord Harry was cleaning his royal END
BEGIN NOW pelt to go to dinner after winning a boatrace (he had spade oars for END
BEGIN NOW himself but the first rule of the course was that the others were to row END
BEGIN NOW with pitchforks) he discovered in himself a wonderful likeness to a bull END
BEGIN NOW and on picking up a blackthumbed chapbook that he kept in the pantry he END
BEGIN NOW found sure enough that he was a lefthanded descendant of the famous END
BEGIN NOW champion bull of the Romans, Bos Bovum, which is good bog Latin for boss END
BEGIN NOW of the show. END
BEGIN NOW After that, says Mr Vincent, the lord Harry put his head END
BEGIN NOW into a cow's drinkingtrough in the presence of all his courtiers and END
BEGIN NOW pulling it out again told them all his new name. END
BEGIN NOW Then, with the water END
BEGIN NOW running off him, he got into an old smock and skirt that had belonged to END
BEGIN NOW his grandmother and bought a grammar of the bulls' language to study but END
BEGIN NOW he could never learn a word of it except the first personal pronoun END
BEGIN NOW which he copied out big and got off by heart and if ever he went out for END
BEGIN NOW a walk he filled his pockets with chalk to write it upon what took his END
BEGIN NOW fancy, the side of a rock or a teahouse table or a bale of cotton or a END
BEGIN NOW corkfloat. END
BEGIN NOW In short, he and the bull of Ireland were soon as fast END
BEGIN NOW friends as an arse and a shirt. END
BEGIN NOW They were, says Mr Stephen, and the end END
BEGIN NOW was that the men of the island seeing no help was toward, as the ungrate END
BEGIN NOW women were all of one mind, made a wherry raft, loaded themselves and END
BEGIN NOW their bundles of chattels on shipboard, set all masts erect, manned the END
BEGIN NOW yards, sprang their luff, heaved to, spread three sheets in the wind, END
BEGIN NOW put her head between wind and water, weighed anchor, ported her helm, END
BEGIN NOW ran up the jolly Roger, gave three times three, let the bullgine run, END
BEGIN NOW pushed off in their bumboat and put to sea to recover the main of END
BEGIN NOW America. END
BEGIN NOW Which was the occasion, says Mr Vincent, of the composing by a END
BEGIN NOW boatswain of that rollicking chanty: END
BEGIN NOW —Pope Peter's but a pissabed. END
BEGIN NOW A man's a man for a' that. END
BEGIN NOW Our worthy acquaintance Mr Malachi Mulligan now appeared in the doorway END
BEGIN NOW as the students were finishing their apologue accompanied with a friend END
BEGIN NOW whom he had just rencountered, a young gentleman, his name Alec Bannon, END
BEGIN NOW who had late come to town, it being his intention to buy a colour or a END
BEGIN NOW cornetcy in the fencibles and list for the wars. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Mulligan was civil END
BEGIN NOW enough to express some relish of it all the more as it jumped with a END
BEGIN NOW project of his own for the cure of the very evil that had been touched END
BEGIN NOW on. END
BEGIN NOW Whereat he handed round to the company a set of pasteboard cards END
BEGIN NOW which he had had printed that day at Mr Quinnell's bearing a legend END
BEGIN NOW printed in fair italics: Mr Malachi Mulligan. END
BEGIN NOW Fertiliser and Incubator. END
BEGIN NOW Lambay Island. END
BEGIN NOW His project, as he went on to expound, was to withdraw END
BEGIN NOW from the round of idle pleasures such as form the chief business of sir END
BEGIN NOW Fopling Popinjay and sir Milksop Quidnunc in town and to devote himself END
BEGIN NOW to the noblest task for which our bodily organism has been framed. END
BEGIN NOW Well, END
BEGIN NOW let us hear of it, good my friend, said Mr Dixon. END
BEGIN NOW I make no doubt it END
BEGIN NOW smacks of wenching. END
BEGIN NOW Come, be seated, both. END
BEGIN NOW 'Tis as cheap sitting as END
BEGIN NOW standing. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Mulligan accepted of the invitation and, expatiating upon END
BEGIN NOW his design, told his hearers that he had been led into this thought by a END
BEGIN NOW consideration of the causes of sterility, both the inhibitory and the END
BEGIN NOW prohibitory, whether the inhibition in its turn were due to conjugal END
BEGIN NOW vexations or to a parsimony of the balance as well as whether the END
BEGIN NOW prohibition proceeded from defects congenital or from proclivities END
BEGIN NOW acquired. END
BEGIN NOW It grieved him plaguily, he said, to see the nuptial couch END
BEGIN NOW defrauded of its dearest pledges: and to reflect upon so many agreeable END
BEGIN NOW females with rich jointures, a prey to the vilest bonzes, who hide their END
BEGIN NOW flambeau under a bushel in an uncongenial cloister or lose their womanly END
BEGIN NOW bloom in the embraces of some unaccountable muskin when they might END
BEGIN NOW multiply the inlets of happiness, sacrificing the inestimable jewel of END
BEGIN NOW their sex when a hundred pretty fellows were at hand to caress, this, he END
BEGIN NOW assured them, made his heart weep. END
BEGIN NOW To curb this inconvenient (which he END
BEGIN NOW concluded due to a suppression of latent heat), having advised with END
BEGIN NOW certain counsellors of worth and inspected into this matter, he had END
BEGIN NOW resolved to purchase in fee simple for ever the freehold of Lambay END
BEGIN NOW island from its holder, lord Talbot de Malahide, a Tory gentleman of END
BEGIN NOW note much in favour with our ascendancy party. END
BEGIN NOW He proposed to set up END
BEGIN NOW there a national fertilising farm to be named Omphalos with an obelisk END
BEGIN NOW hewn and erected after the fashion of Egypt and to offer his dutiful END
BEGIN NOW yeoman services for the fecundation of any female of what grade of life END
BEGIN NOW soever who should there direct to him with the desire of fulfilling the END
BEGIN NOW functions of her natural. END
BEGIN NOW Money was no object, he said, nor would he END
BEGIN NOW take a penny for his pains. END
BEGIN NOW The poorest kitchenwench no less than the END
BEGIN NOW opulent lady of fashion, if so be their constructions and their tempers END
BEGIN NOW were warm persuaders for their petitions, would find in him their man. END
BEGIN NOW For his nutriment he shewed how he would feed himself exclusively upon a END
BEGIN NOW diet of savoury tubercles and fish and coneys there, the flesh of these END
BEGIN NOW latter prolific rodents being highly recommended for his purpose, both END
BEGIN NOW broiled and stewed with a blade of mace and a pod or two of capsicum END
BEGIN NOW chillies. END
BEGIN NOW After this homily which he delivered with much warmth of END
BEGIN NOW asseveration Mr Mulligan in a trice put off from his hat a kerchief with END
BEGIN NOW which he had shielded it. END
BEGIN NOW They both, it seems, had been overtaken by the END
BEGIN NOW rain and for all their mending their pace had taken water, as might be END
BEGIN NOW observed by Mr Mulligan's smallclothes of a hodden grey which was now END
BEGIN NOW somewhat piebald. END
BEGIN NOW His project meanwhile was very favourably entertained END
BEGIN NOW by his auditors and won hearty eulogies from all though Mr Dixon of END
BEGIN NOW Mary's excepted to it, asking with a finicking air did he purpose also END
BEGIN NOW to carry coals to Newcastle. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Mulligan however made court to the END
BEGIN NOW scholarly by an apt quotation from the classics which, as it dwelt upon END
BEGIN NOW his memory, seemed to him a sound and tasteful support of his END
BEGIN NOW contention: Talis ac tanta depravatio hujus seculi, O quirites, ut END
BEGIN NOW matresfamiliarum nostrae lascivas cujuslibet semiviri libici END
BEGIN NOW titillationes testibus ponderosis atque excelsis erectionibus END
BEGIN NOW centurionum Romanorum magnopere anteponunt, while for those of ruder wit END
BEGIN NOW he drove home his point by analogies of the animal kingdom more suitable END
BEGIN NOW to their stomach, the buck and doe of the forest glade, the farmyard END
BEGIN NOW drake and duck. END
BEGIN NOW Valuing himself not a little upon his elegance, being indeed a proper END
BEGIN NOW man of person, this talkative now applied himself to his dress with END
BEGIN NOW animadversions of some heat upon the sudden whimsy of the atmospherics END
BEGIN NOW while the company lavished their encomiums upon the project he had END
BEGIN NOW advanced. END
BEGIN NOW The young gentleman, his friend, overjoyed as he was at a END
BEGIN NOW passage that had late befallen him, could not forbear to tell it his END
BEGIN NOW nearest neighbour. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Mulligan, now perceiving the table, asked for whom END
BEGIN NOW were those loaves and fishes and, seeing the stranger, he made him a END
BEGIN NOW civil bow and said, Pray, sir, was you in need of any professional END
BEGIN NOW assistance we could give? END
BEGIN NOW Who, upon his offer, thanked him very END
BEGIN NOW heartily, though preserving his proper distance, and replied that he was END
BEGIN NOW come there about a lady, now an inmate of Horne's house, that was in an END
BEGIN NOW interesting condition, poor body, from woman's woe (and here he fetched END
BEGIN NOW a deep sigh) to know if her happiness had yet taken place. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Dixon, to END
BEGIN NOW turn the table, took on to ask of Mr Mulligan himself whether his END
BEGIN NOW incipient ventripotence, upon which he rallied him, betokened an END
BEGIN NOW ovoblastic gestation in the prostatic utricle or male womb or was due, END
BEGIN NOW as with the noted physician, Mr Austin Meldon, to a wolf in the stomach. END
BEGIN NOW For answer Mr Mulligan, in a gale of laughter at his smalls, smote END
BEGIN NOW himself bravely below the diaphragm, exclaiming with an admirable droll END
BEGIN NOW mimic of Mother Grogan (the most excellent creature of her sex though END
BEGIN NOW 'tis pity she's a trollop): There's a belly that never bore a bastard. END
BEGIN NOW This was so happy a conceit that it renewed the storm of mirth and threw END
BEGIN NOW the whole room into the most violent agitations of delight. END
BEGIN NOW The spry END
BEGIN NOW rattle had run on in the same vein of mimicry but for some larum in the END
BEGIN NOW antechamber. END
BEGIN NOW Here the listener who was none other than the Scotch student, a little END
BEGIN NOW fume of a fellow, blond as tow, congratulated in the liveliest fashion END
BEGIN NOW with the young gentleman and, interrupting the narrative at a salient END
BEGIN NOW point, having desired his visavis with a polite beck to have the END
BEGIN NOW obligingness to pass him a flagon of cordial waters at the same time by END
BEGIN NOW a questioning poise of the head (a whole century of polite breeding had END
BEGIN NOW not achieved so nice a gesture) to which was united an equivalent but END
BEGIN NOW contrary balance of the bottle asked the narrator as plainly as was ever END
BEGIN NOW done in words if he might treat him with a cup of it. END
BEGIN NOW Mais bien sÃ»r, END
BEGIN NOW noble stranger, said he cheerily, et mille compliments. END
BEGIN NOW That you may and END
BEGIN NOW very opportunely. END
BEGIN NOW There wanted nothing but this cup to crown my END
BEGIN NOW felicity. END
BEGIN NOW But, gracious heaven, was I left with but a crust in my wallet END
BEGIN NOW and a cupful of water from the well, my God, I would accept of them and END
BEGIN NOW find it in my heart to kneel down upon the ground and give thanks to the END
BEGIN NOW powers above for the happiness vouchsafed me by the Giver of good END
BEGIN NOW things. END
BEGIN NOW With these words he approached the goblet to his lips, took a END
BEGIN NOW complacent draught of the cordial, slicked his hair and, opening his END
BEGIN NOW bosom, out popped a locket that hung from a silk riband, that very END
BEGIN NOW picture which he had cherished ever since her hand had wrote therein. END
BEGIN NOW Gazing upon those features with a world of tenderness, Ah, Monsieur, he END
BEGIN NOW said, had you but beheld her as I did with these eyes at that affecting END
BEGIN NOW instant with her dainty tucker and her new coquette cap (a gift for her END
BEGIN NOW feastday as she told me prettily) in such an artless disorder, of so END
BEGIN NOW melting a tenderness, 'pon my conscience, even you, Monsieur, had been END
BEGIN NOW impelled by generous nature to deliver yourself wholly into the hands of END
BEGIN NOW such an enemy or to quit the field for ever. END
BEGIN NOW I declare, I was never so END
BEGIN NOW touched in all my life. END
BEGIN NOW God, I thank thee, as the Author of my days! END
BEGIN NOW Thrice happy will he be whom so amiable a creature will bless with her END
BEGIN NOW favours. END
BEGIN NOW A sigh of affection gave eloquence to these words and, having END
BEGIN NOW replaced the locket in his bosom, he wiped his eye and sighed again. END
BEGIN NOW Beneficent Disseminator of blessings to all Thy creatures, how great and END
BEGIN NOW universal must be that sweetest of Thy tyrannies which can hold in END
BEGIN NOW thrall the free and the bond, the simple swain and the polished coxcomb, END
BEGIN NOW the lover in the heyday of reckless passion and the husband of maturer END
BEGIN NOW years. END
BEGIN NOW But indeed, sir, I wander from the point. END
BEGIN NOW How mingled and END
BEGIN NOW imperfect are all our sublunary joys. END
BEGIN NOW Maledicity! END
BEGIN NOW he exclaimed in END
BEGIN NOW anguish. END
BEGIN NOW Would to God that foresight had but remembered me to take my END
BEGIN NOW cloak along! END
BEGIN NOW I could weep to think of it. END
BEGIN NOW Then, though it had poured END
BEGIN NOW seven showers, we were neither of us a penny the worse. END
BEGIN NOW But beshrew me, END
BEGIN NOW he cried, clapping hand to his forehead, tomorrow will be a new day and, END
BEGIN NOW thousand thunders, I know of a marchand de capotes, Monsieur Poyntz, END
BEGIN NOW from whom I can have for a livre as snug a cloak of the French fashion END
BEGIN NOW as ever kept a lady from wetting. END
BEGIN NOW Tut, tut! END
BEGIN NOW cries Le FÃ©condateur, END
BEGIN NOW tripping in, my friend Monsieur Moore, that most accomplished traveller END
BEGIN NOW (I have just cracked a half bottle AVEC LUI in a circle of the best wits END
BEGIN NOW of the town), is my authority that in Cape Horn, ventre biche, they have END
BEGIN NOW a rain that will wet through any, even the stoutest cloak. END
BEGIN NOW A drenching END
BEGIN NOW of that violence, he tells me, sans blague, has sent more than one END
BEGIN NOW luckless fellow in good earnest posthaste to another world. END
BEGIN NOW Pooh! END
BEGIN NOW A END
BEGIN NOW livre! END
BEGIN NOW cries Monsieur Lynch. END
BEGIN NOW The clumsy things are dear at a sou. END
BEGIN NOW One END
BEGIN NOW umbrella, were it no bigger than a fairy mushroom, is worth ten such END
BEGIN NOW stopgaps. END
BEGIN NOW No woman of any wit would wear one. END
BEGIN NOW My dear Kitty told me END
BEGIN NOW today that she would dance in a deluge before ever she would starve in END
BEGIN NOW such an ark of salvation for, as she reminded me (blushing piquantly and END
BEGIN NOW whispering in my ear though there was none to snap her words but giddy END
BEGIN NOW butterflies), dame Nature, by the divine blessing, has implanted it in END
BEGIN NOW our hearts and it has become a household word that il y a deux choses END
BEGIN NOW for which the innocence of our original garb, in other circumstances a END
BEGIN NOW breach of the proprieties, is the fittest, nay, the only garment. END
BEGIN NOW The END
BEGIN NOW first, said she (and here my pretty philosopher, as I handed her to her END
BEGIN NOW tilbury, to fix my attention, gently tipped with her tongue the outer END
BEGIN NOW chamber of my ear), the first is a bath... END
BEGIN NOW But at this point a bell END
BEGIN NOW tinkling in the hall cut short a discourse which promised so bravely for END
BEGIN NOW the enrichment of our store of knowledge. END
BEGIN NOW Amid the general vacant hilarity of the assembly a bell rang and, while END
BEGIN NOW all were conjecturing what might be the cause, Miss Callan entered and, END
BEGIN NOW having spoken a few words in a low tone to young Mr Dixon, retired with END
BEGIN NOW a profound bow to the company. END
BEGIN NOW The presence even for a moment among a END
BEGIN NOW party of debauchees of a woman endued with every quality of modesty and END
BEGIN NOW not less severe than beautiful refrained the humourous sallies even of END
BEGIN NOW the most licentious but her departure was the signal for an outbreak of END
BEGIN NOW ribaldry. END
BEGIN NOW Strike me silly, said Costello, a low fellow who was fuddled. END
BEGIN NOW A monstrous fine bit of cowflesh! END
BEGIN NOW I'll be sworn she has rendezvoused END
BEGIN NOW you. END
BEGIN NOW What, you dog? END
BEGIN NOW Have you a way with them? END
BEGIN NOW Gad's bud, immensely so, END
BEGIN NOW said Mr Lynch. END
BEGIN NOW The bedside manner it is that they use in the Mater END
BEGIN NOW hospice. END
BEGIN NOW Demme, does not Doctor O'Gargle chuck the nuns there under the END
BEGIN NOW chin. END
BEGIN NOW As I look to be saved I had it from my Kitty who has been wardmaid END
BEGIN NOW there any time these seven months. END
BEGIN NOW Lawksamercy, doctor, cried the young END
BEGIN NOW blood in the primrose vest, feigning a womanish simper and with immodest END
BEGIN NOW squirmings of his body, how you do tease a body! END
BEGIN NOW Drat the man! END
BEGIN NOW Bless me, END
BEGIN NOW I'm all of a wibbly wobbly. END
BEGIN NOW Why, you're as bad as dear little Father END
BEGIN NOW Cantekissem, that you are! END
BEGIN NOW May this pot of four half choke me, cried END
BEGIN NOW Costello, if she aint in the family way. END
BEGIN NOW I knows a lady what's got a END
BEGIN NOW white swelling quick as I claps eyes on her. END
BEGIN NOW The young surgeon, however, END
BEGIN NOW rose and begged the company to excuse his retreat as the nurse had just END
BEGIN NOW then informed him that he was needed in the ward. END
BEGIN NOW Merciful providence END
BEGIN NOW had been pleased to put a period to the sufferings of the lady who was END
BEGIN NOW enceinte which she had borne with a laudable fortitude and she had given END
BEGIN NOW birth to a bouncing boy. END
BEGIN NOW I want patience, said he, with those who, END
BEGIN NOW without wit to enliven or learning to instruct, revile an ennobling END
BEGIN NOW profession which, saving the reverence due to the Deity, is the greatest END
BEGIN NOW power for happiness upon the earth. END
BEGIN NOW I am positive when I say that if END
BEGIN NOW need were I could produce a cloud of witnesses to the excellence of her END
BEGIN NOW noble exercitations which, so far from being a byword, should be a END
BEGIN NOW glorious incentive in the human breast. END
BEGIN NOW I cannot away with them. END
BEGIN NOW What? END
BEGIN NOW Malign such an one, the amiable Miss Callan, who is the lustre of her END
BEGIN NOW own sex and the astonishment of ours? END
BEGIN NOW And at an instant the most END
BEGIN NOW momentous that can befall a puny child of clay? END
BEGIN NOW Perish the thought! END
BEGIN NOW I END
BEGIN NOW shudder to think of the future of a race where the seeds of such malice END
BEGIN NOW have been sown and where no right reverence is rendered to mother and END
BEGIN NOW maid in house of Horne. END
BEGIN NOW Having delivered himself of this rebuke he END
BEGIN NOW saluted those present on the by and repaired to the door. END
BEGIN NOW A murmur of END
BEGIN NOW approval arose from all and some were for ejecting the low soaker END
BEGIN NOW without more ado, a design which would have been effected nor would he END
BEGIN NOW have received more than his bare deserts had he not abridged his END
BEGIN NOW transgression by affirming with a horrid imprecation (for he swore a END
BEGIN NOW round hand) that he was as good a son of the true fold as ever drew END
BEGIN NOW breath. END
BEGIN NOW Stap my vitals, said he, them was always the sentiments of END
BEGIN NOW honest Frank Costello which I was bred up most particular to honour thy END
BEGIN NOW father and thy mother that had the best hand to a rolypoly or a hasty END
BEGIN NOW pudding as you ever see what I always looks back on with a loving heart. END
BEGIN NOW To revert to Mr Bloom who, after his first entry, had been conscious of END
BEGIN NOW some impudent mocks which he however had borne with as being the fruits END
BEGIN NOW of that age upon which it is commonly charged that it knows not pity. END
BEGIN NOW The young sparks, it is true, were as full of extravagancies as END
BEGIN NOW overgrown children: the words of their tumultuary discussions were END
BEGIN NOW difficultly understood and not often nice: their testiness and END
BEGIN NOW outrageous mots were such that his intellects resiled from: nor were END
BEGIN NOW they scrupulously sensible of the proprieties though their fund of END
BEGIN NOW strong animal spirits spoke in their behalf. END
BEGIN NOW But the word of Mr Costello END
BEGIN NOW was an unwelcome language for him for he nauseated the wretch that END
BEGIN NOW seemed to him a cropeared creature of a misshapen gibbosity, born out of END
BEGIN NOW wedlock and thrust like a crookback toothed and feet first into the END
BEGIN NOW world, which the dint of the surgeon's pliers in his skull lent indeed a END
BEGIN NOW colour to, so as to put him in thought of that missing link of END
BEGIN NOW creation's chain desiderated by the late ingenious Mr Darwin. END
BEGIN NOW It was now END
BEGIN NOW for more than the middle span of our allotted years that he had passed END
BEGIN NOW through the thousand vicissitudes of existence and, being of a wary END
BEGIN NOW ascendancy and self a man of rare forecast, he had enjoined his heart to END
BEGIN NOW repress all motions of a rising choler and, by intercepting them with END
BEGIN NOW the readiest precaution, foster within his breast that plenitude of END
BEGIN NOW sufferance which base minds jeer at, rash judgers scorn and all find END
BEGIN NOW tolerable and but tolerable. END
BEGIN NOW To those who create themselves wits at the END
BEGIN NOW cost of feminine delicacy (a habit of mind which he never did hold with) END
BEGIN NOW to them he would concede neither to bear the name nor to herit the END
BEGIN NOW tradition of a proper breeding: while for such that, having lost all END
BEGIN NOW forbearance, can lose no more, there remained the sharp antidote of END
BEGIN NOW experience to cause their insolency to beat a precipitate and inglorious END
BEGIN NOW retreat. END
BEGIN NOW Not but what he could feel with mettlesome youth which, caring END
BEGIN NOW nought for the mows of dotards or the gruntlings of the severe, is ever END
BEGIN NOW (as the chaste fancy of the Holy Writer expresses it) for eating of the END
BEGIN NOW tree forbid it yet not so far forth as to pretermit humanity upon any END
BEGIN NOW condition soever towards a gentlewoman when she was about her lawful END
BEGIN NOW occasions. END
BEGIN NOW To conclude, while from the sister's words he had reckoned END
BEGIN NOW upon a speedy delivery he was, however, it must be owned, not a little END
BEGIN NOW alleviated by the intelligence that the issue so auspicated after an END
BEGIN NOW ordeal of such duress now testified once more to the mercy as well as to END
BEGIN NOW the bounty of the Supreme Being. END
BEGIN NOW Accordingly he broke his mind to his neighbour, saying that, to express END
BEGIN NOW his notion of the thing, his opinion (who ought not perchance to express END
BEGIN NOW one) was that one must have a cold constitution and a frigid genius not END
BEGIN NOW to be rejoiced by this freshest news of the fruition of her confinement END
BEGIN NOW since she had been in such pain through no fault of hers. END
BEGIN NOW The dressy END
BEGIN NOW young blade said it was her husband's that put her in that expectation END
BEGIN NOW or at least it ought to be unless she were another Ephesian matron. END
BEGIN NOW I END
BEGIN NOW must acquaint you, said Mr Crotthers, clapping on the table so as to END
BEGIN NOW evoke a resonant comment of emphasis, old Glory Allelujurum was round END
BEGIN NOW again today, an elderly man with dundrearies, preferring through his END
BEGIN NOW nose a request to have word of Wilhelmina, my life, as he calls her. END
BEGIN NOW I END
BEGIN NOW bade him hold himself in readiness for that the event would burst anon. END
BEGIN NOW 'Slife, I'll be round with you. END
BEGIN NOW I cannot but extol the virile potency of END
BEGIN NOW the old bucko that could still knock another child out of her. END
BEGIN NOW All fell END
BEGIN NOW to praising of it, each after his own fashion, though the same young END
BEGIN NOW blade held with his former view that another than her conjugial had been END
BEGIN NOW the man in the gap, a clerk in orders, a linkboy (virtuous) or an END
BEGIN NOW itinerant vendor of articles needed in every household. END
BEGIN NOW Singular, END
BEGIN NOW communed the guest with himself, the wonderfully unequal faculty of END
BEGIN NOW metempsychosis possessed by them, that the puerperal dormitory and the END
BEGIN NOW dissecting theatre should be the seminaries of such frivolity, that the END
BEGIN NOW mere acquisition of academic titles should suffice to transform in a END
BEGIN NOW pinch of time these votaries of levity into exemplary practitioners of END
BEGIN NOW an art which most men anywise eminent have esteemed the noblest. END
BEGIN NOW But, he END
BEGIN NOW further added, it is mayhap to relieve the pentup feelings that in END
BEGIN NOW common oppress them for I have more than once observed that birds of a END
BEGIN NOW feather laugh together. END
BEGIN NOW But with what fitness, let it be asked of the noble lord, his patron, END
BEGIN NOW has this alien, whom the concession of a gracious prince has admitted to END
BEGIN NOW civic rights, constituted himself the lord paramount of our internal END
BEGIN NOW polity? END
BEGIN NOW Where is now that gratitude which loyalty should have END
BEGIN NOW counselled? END
BEGIN NOW During the recent war whenever the enemy had a temporary END
BEGIN NOW advantage with his granados did this traitor to his kind not seize that END
BEGIN NOW moment to discharge his piece against the empire of which he is a tenant END
BEGIN NOW at will while he trembled for the security of his four per cents? END
BEGIN NOW Has he END
BEGIN NOW forgotten this as he forgets all benefits received? END
BEGIN NOW Or is it that from END
BEGIN NOW being a deluder of others he has become at last his own dupe as he is, END
BEGIN NOW if report belie him not, his own and his only enjoyer? END
BEGIN NOW Far be it from END
BEGIN NOW candour to violate the bedchamber of a respectable lady, the daughter of END
BEGIN NOW a gallant major, or to cast the most distant reflections upon her virtue END
BEGIN NOW but if he challenges attention there (as it was indeed highly his END
BEGIN NOW interest not to have done) then be it so. END
BEGIN NOW Unhappy woman, she has been END
BEGIN NOW too long and too persistently denied her legitimate prerogative to END
BEGIN NOW listen to his objurgations with any other feeling than the derision of END
BEGIN NOW the desperate. END
BEGIN NOW He says this, a censor of morals, a very pelican in his END
BEGIN NOW piety, who did not scruple, oblivious of the ties of nature, to attempt END
BEGIN NOW illicit intercourse with a female domestic drawn from the lowest strata END
BEGIN NOW of society! END
BEGIN NOW Nay, had the hussy's scouringbrush not been her tutelary END
BEGIN NOW angel, it had gone with her as hard as with Hagar, the Egyptian! END
BEGIN NOW In the END
BEGIN NOW question of the grazing lands his peevish asperity is notorious and in END
BEGIN NOW Mr Cuffe's hearing brought upon him from an indignant rancher a scathing END
BEGIN NOW retort couched in terms as straightforward as they were bucolic. END
BEGIN NOW It ill END
BEGIN NOW becomes him to preach that gospel. END
BEGIN NOW Has he not nearer home a seedfield END
BEGIN NOW that lies fallow for the want of the ploughshare? END
BEGIN NOW A habit reprehensible END
BEGIN NOW at puberty is second nature and an opprobrium in middle life. END
BEGIN NOW If he must END
BEGIN NOW dispense his balm of Gilead in nostrums and apothegms of dubious taste END
BEGIN NOW to restore to health a generation of unfledged profligates let his END
BEGIN NOW practice consist better with the doctrines that now engross him. END
BEGIN NOW His END
BEGIN NOW marital breast is the repository of secrets which decorum is reluctant END
BEGIN NOW to adduce. END
BEGIN NOW The lewd suggestions of some faded beauty may console him for END
BEGIN NOW a consort neglected and debauched but this new exponent of morals and END
BEGIN NOW healer of ills is at his best an exotic tree which, when rooted in its END
BEGIN NOW native orient, throve and flourished and was abundant in balm but, END
BEGIN NOW transplanted to a clime more temperate, its roots have lost their END
BEGIN NOW quondam vigour while the stuff that comes away from it is stagnant, acid END
BEGIN NOW and inoperative. END
BEGIN NOW The news was imparted with a circumspection recalling the ceremonial END
BEGIN NOW usage of the Sublime Porte by the second female infirmarian to the END
BEGIN NOW junior medical officer in residence, who in his turn announced to the END
BEGIN NOW delegation that an heir had been born, When he had betaken himself to END
BEGIN NOW the women's apartment to assist at the prescribed ceremony of the END
BEGIN NOW afterbirth in the presence of the secretary of state for domestic END
BEGIN NOW affairs and the members of the privy council, silent in unanimous END
BEGIN NOW exhaustion and approbation the delegates, chafing under the length and END
BEGIN NOW solemnity of their vigil and hoping that the joyful occurrence would END
BEGIN NOW palliate a licence which the simultaneous absence of abigail and END
BEGIN NOW obstetrician rendered the easier, broke out at once into a strife of END
BEGIN NOW tongues. END
BEGIN NOW In vain the voice of Mr Canvasser Bloom was heard endeavouring END
BEGIN NOW to urge, to mollify, to refrain. END
BEGIN NOW The moment was too propitious for the END
BEGIN NOW display of that discursiveness which seemed the only bond of union among END
BEGIN NOW tempers so divergent. END
BEGIN NOW Every phase of the situation was successively END
BEGIN NOW eviscerated: the prenatal repugnance of uterine brothers, the Caesarean END
BEGIN NOW section, posthumity with respect to the father and, that rarer form, END
BEGIN NOW with respect to the mother, the fratricidal case known as the Childs END
BEGIN NOW Murder and rendered memorable by the impassioned plea of Mr Advocate END
BEGIN NOW Bushe which secured the acquittal of the wrongfully accused, the rights END
BEGIN NOW of primogeniture and king's bounty touching twins and triplets, END
BEGIN NOW miscarriages and infanticides, simulated or dissimulated, the acardiac END
BEGIN NOW foetus in foetu and aprosopia due to a congestion, the agnathia of END
BEGIN NOW certain chinless Chinamen (cited by Mr Candidate Mulligan) in END
BEGIN NOW consequence of defective reunion of the maxillary knobs along the medial END
BEGIN NOW line so that (as he said) one ear could hear what the other spoke, the END
BEGIN NOW benefits of anesthesia or twilight sleep, the prolongation of labour END
BEGIN NOW pains in advanced gravidancy by reason of pressure on the vein, the END
BEGIN NOW premature relentment of the amniotic fluid (as exemplified in the actual END
BEGIN NOW case) with consequent peril of sepsis to the matrix, artificial END
BEGIN NOW insemination by means of syringes, involution of the womb consequent END
BEGIN NOW upon the menopause, the problem of the perpetration of the species in END
BEGIN NOW the case of females impregnated by delinquent rape, that distressing END
BEGIN NOW manner of delivery called by the Brandenburghers Sturzgeburt, the END
BEGIN NOW recorded instances of multiseminal, twikindled and monstrous births END
BEGIN NOW conceived during the catamenic period or of consanguineous parents—in a END
BEGIN NOW word all the cases of human nativity which Aristotle has classified in END
BEGIN NOW his masterpiece with chromolithographic illustrations. END
BEGIN NOW The gravest END
BEGIN NOW problems of obstetrics and forensic medicine were examined with as much END
BEGIN NOW animation as the most popular beliefs on the state of pregnancy such as END
BEGIN NOW the forbidding to a gravid woman to step over a countrystile lest, by END
BEGIN NOW her movement, the navelcord should strangle her creature and the END
BEGIN NOW injunction upon her in the event of a yearning, ardently and END
BEGIN NOW ineffectually entertained, to place her hand against that part of her END
BEGIN NOW person which long usage has consecrated as the seat of castigation. END
BEGIN NOW The END
BEGIN NOW abnormalities of harelip, breastmole, supernumerary digits, negro's END
BEGIN NOW inkle, strawberry mark and portwine stain were alleged by one as a prima END
BEGIN NOW facie and natural hypothetical explanation of those swineheaded (the END
BEGIN NOW case of Madame Grissel Steevens was not forgotten) or doghaired infants END
BEGIN NOW occasionally born. END
BEGIN NOW The hypothesis of a plasmic memory, advanced by the END
BEGIN NOW Caledonian envoy and worthy of the metaphysical traditions of the land END
BEGIN NOW he stood for, envisaged in such cases an arrest of embryonic development END
BEGIN NOW at some stage antecedent to the human. END
BEGIN NOW An outlandish delegate sustained END
BEGIN NOW against both these views, with such heat as almost carried conviction, END
BEGIN NOW the theory of copulation between women and the males of brutes, his END
BEGIN NOW authority being his own avouchment in support of fables such as that of END
BEGIN NOW the Minotaur which the genius of the elegant Latin poet has handed down END
BEGIN NOW to us in the pages of his Metamorphoses. END
BEGIN NOW The impression made by his END
BEGIN NOW words was immediate but shortlived. END
BEGIN NOW It was effaced as easily as it had END
BEGIN NOW been evoked by an allocution from Mr Candidate Mulligan in that vein of END
BEGIN NOW pleasantry which none better than he knew how to affect, postulating as END
BEGIN NOW the supremest object of desire a nice clean old man. END
BEGIN NOW Contemporaneously, END
BEGIN NOW a heated argument having arisen between Mr Delegate Madden and Mr END
BEGIN NOW Candidate Lynch regarding the juridical and theological dilemma created END
BEGIN NOW in the event of one Siamese twin predeceasing the other, the difficulty END
BEGIN NOW by mutual consent was referred to Mr Canvasser Bloom for instant END
BEGIN NOW submittal to Mr Coadjutor Deacon Dedalus. END
BEGIN NOW Hitherto silent, whether the END
BEGIN NOW better to show by preternatural gravity that curious dignity of the garb END
BEGIN NOW with which he was invested or in obedience to an inward voice, he END
BEGIN NOW delivered briefly and, as some thought, perfunctorily the ecclesiastical END
BEGIN NOW ordinance forbidding man to put asunder what God has joined. END
BEGIN NOW But Malachias' tale began to freeze them with horror. END
BEGIN NOW He conjured up the END
BEGIN NOW scene before them. END
BEGIN NOW The secret panel beside the chimney slid back and in END
BEGIN NOW the recess appeared... END
BEGIN NOW Haines! END
BEGIN NOW Which of us did not feel his flesh creep! END
BEGIN NOW He had a portfolio full of Celtic literature in one hand, in the other a END
BEGIN NOW phial marked Poison. END
BEGIN NOW Surprise, horror, loathing were depicted on all END
BEGIN NOW faces while he eyed them with a ghostly grin. END
BEGIN NOW I anticipated some such END
BEGIN NOW reception, he began with an eldritch laugh, for which, it seems, history END
BEGIN NOW is to blame. END
BEGIN NOW Yes, it is true. END
BEGIN NOW I am the murderer of Samuel Childs. END
BEGIN NOW And END
BEGIN NOW how I am punished! END
BEGIN NOW The inferno has no terrors for me. END
BEGIN NOW This is the END
BEGIN NOW appearance is on me. END
BEGIN NOW Tare and ages, what way would I be resting at all, END
BEGIN NOW he muttered thickly, and I tramping Dublin this while back with my share END
BEGIN NOW of songs and himself after me the like of a soulth or a bullawurrus? END
BEGIN NOW My END
BEGIN NOW hell, and Ireland's, is in this life. END
BEGIN NOW It is what I tried to obliterate END
BEGIN NOW my crime. END
BEGIN NOW Distractions, rookshooting, the Erse language (he recited END
BEGIN NOW some), laudanum (he raised the phial to his lips), camping out. END
BEGIN NOW In vain! END
BEGIN NOW His spectre stalks me. END
BEGIN NOW Dope is my only hope... END
BEGIN NOW Ah! END
BEGIN NOW Destruction! END
BEGIN NOW The END
BEGIN NOW black panther! END
BEGIN NOW With a cry he suddenly vanished and the panel slid back. END
BEGIN NOW An instant later his head appeared in the door opposite and said: Meet END
BEGIN NOW me at Westland Row station at ten past eleven. END
BEGIN NOW He was gone. END
BEGIN NOW Tears gushed END
BEGIN NOW from the eyes of the dissipated host. END
BEGIN NOW The seer raised his hand to END
BEGIN NOW heaven, murmuring: The vendetta of Mananaun! END
BEGIN NOW The sage repeated: Lex END
BEGIN NOW talionis. END
BEGIN NOW The sentimentalist is he who would enjoy without incurring the END
BEGIN NOW immense debtorship for a thing done. END
BEGIN NOW Malachias, overcome by emotion, END
BEGIN NOW ceased. END
BEGIN NOW The mystery was unveiled. END
BEGIN NOW Haines was the third brother. END
BEGIN NOW His real END
BEGIN NOW name was Childs. END
BEGIN NOW The black panther was himself the ghost of his own END
BEGIN NOW father. END
BEGIN NOW He drank drugs to obliterate. END
BEGIN NOW For this relief much thanks. END
BEGIN NOW The END
BEGIN NOW lonely house by the graveyard is uninhabited. END
BEGIN NOW No soul will live there. END
BEGIN NOW The spider pitches her web in the solitude. END
BEGIN NOW The nocturnal rat peers from END
BEGIN NOW his hole. END
BEGIN NOW A curse is on it. END
BEGIN NOW It is haunted. END
BEGIN NOW Murderer's ground. END
BEGIN NOW What is the age of the soul of man? END
BEGIN NOW As she hath the virtue of the END
BEGIN NOW chameleon to change her hue at every new approach, to be gay with the END
BEGIN NOW merry and mournful with the downcast, so too is her age changeable as END
BEGIN NOW her mood. END
BEGIN NOW No longer is Leopold, as he sits there, ruminating, chewing END
BEGIN NOW the cud of reminiscence, that staid agent of publicity and holder of a END
BEGIN NOW modest substance in the funds. END
BEGIN NOW A score of years are blown away. END
BEGIN NOW He is END
BEGIN NOW young Leopold. END
BEGIN NOW There, as in a retrospective arrangement, a mirror within END
BEGIN NOW a mirror (hey, presto!), he beholdeth himself. END
BEGIN NOW That young figure of then END
BEGIN NOW is seen, precociously manly, walking on a nipping morning from the old END
BEGIN NOW house in Clanbrassil street to the high school, his booksatchel on him END
BEGIN NOW bandolierwise, and in it a goodly hunk of wheaten loaf, a mother's END
BEGIN NOW thought. END
BEGIN NOW Or it is the same figure, a year or so gone over, in his first END
BEGIN NOW hard hat (ah, that was a day!), already on the road, a fullfledged END
BEGIN NOW traveller for the family firm, equipped with an orderbook, a scented END
BEGIN NOW handkerchief (not for show only), his case of bright trinketware (alas! END
BEGIN NOW a thing now of the past!) and a quiverful of compliant smiles for this END
BEGIN NOW or that halfwon housewife reckoning it out upon her fingertips or for a END
BEGIN NOW budding virgin, shyly acknowledging (but the heart? END
BEGIN NOW tell me!) his END
BEGIN NOW studied baisemoins. END
BEGIN NOW The scent, the smile, but, more than these, the dark END
BEGIN NOW eyes and oleaginous address, brought home at duskfall many a commission END
BEGIN NOW to the head of the firm, seated with Jacob's pipe after like labours in END
BEGIN NOW the paternal ingle (a meal of noodles, you may be sure, is aheating), END
BEGIN NOW reading through round horned spectacles some paper from the Europe of a END
BEGIN NOW month before. END
BEGIN NOW But hey, presto, the mirror is breathed on and the young END
BEGIN NOW knighterrant recedes, shrivels, dwindles to a tiny speck within the END
BEGIN NOW mist. END
BEGIN NOW Now he is himself paternal and these about him might be his sons. END
BEGIN NOW Who can say? END
BEGIN NOW The wise father knows his own child. END
BEGIN NOW He thinks of a END
BEGIN NOW drizzling night in Hatch street, hard by the bonded stores there, the END
BEGIN NOW first. END
BEGIN NOW Together (she is a poor waif, a child of shame, yours and mine END
BEGIN NOW and of all for a bare shilling and her luckpenny), together they hear END
BEGIN NOW the heavy tread of the watch as two raincaped shadows pass the new royal END
BEGIN NOW university. END
BEGIN NOW Bridie! END
BEGIN NOW Bridie Kelly! END
BEGIN NOW He will never forget the name, ever END
BEGIN NOW remember the night: first night, the bridenight. END
BEGIN NOW They are entwined in END
BEGIN NOW nethermost darkness, the willer with the willed, and in an instant END
BEGIN NOW (fiat!) light shall flood the world. END
BEGIN NOW Did heart leap to heart? END
BEGIN NOW Nay, fair END
BEGIN NOW reader. END
BEGIN NOW In a breath 'twas done but—hold! END
BEGIN NOW Back! END
BEGIN NOW It must not be! END
BEGIN NOW In terror END
BEGIN NOW the poor girl flees away through the murk. END
BEGIN NOW She is the bride of darkness, END
BEGIN NOW a daughter of night. END
BEGIN NOW She dare not bear the sunnygolden babe of day. END
BEGIN NOW No, END
BEGIN NOW Leopold. END
BEGIN NOW Name and memory solace thee not. END
BEGIN NOW That youthful illusion of thy END
BEGIN NOW strength was taken from thee—and in vain. END
BEGIN NOW No son of thy loins is by END
BEGIN NOW thee. END
BEGIN NOW There is none now to be for Leopold, what Leopold was for Rudolph. END
BEGIN NOW The voices blend and fuse in clouded silence: silence that is the END
BEGIN NOW infinite of space: and swiftly, silently the soul is wafted over regions END
BEGIN NOW of cycles of generations that have lived. END
BEGIN NOW A region where grey twilight END
BEGIN NOW ever descends, never falls on wide sagegreen pasturefields, shedding her END
BEGIN NOW dusk, scattering a perennial dew of stars. END
BEGIN NOW She follows her mother with END
BEGIN NOW ungainly steps, a mare leading her fillyfoal. END
BEGIN NOW Twilight phantoms are END
BEGIN NOW they, yet moulded in prophetic grace of structure, slim shapely END
BEGIN NOW haunches, a supple tendonous neck, the meek apprehensive skull. END
BEGIN NOW They END
BEGIN NOW fade, sad phantoms: all is gone. END
BEGIN NOW Agendath is a waste land, a home of END
BEGIN NOW screechowls and the sandblind upupa. END
BEGIN NOW Netaim, the golden, is no more. END
BEGIN NOW And END
BEGIN NOW on the highway of the clouds they come, muttering thunder of rebellion, END
BEGIN NOW the ghosts of beasts. END
BEGIN NOW Huuh! END
BEGIN NOW Hark! END
BEGIN NOW Huuh! END
BEGIN NOW Parallax stalks behind and goads END
BEGIN NOW them, the lancinating lightnings of whose brow are scorpions. END
BEGIN NOW Elk and END
BEGIN NOW yak, the bulls of Bashan and of Babylon, mammoth and mastodon, they come END
BEGIN NOW trooping to the sunken sea, Lacus Mortis. END
BEGIN NOW Ominous revengeful zodiacal END
BEGIN NOW host! END
BEGIN NOW They moan, passing upon the clouds, horned and capricorned, the END
BEGIN NOW trumpeted with the tusked, the lionmaned, the giantantlered, snouter and END
BEGIN NOW crawler, rodent, ruminant and pachyderm, all their moving moaning END
BEGIN NOW multitude, murderers of the sun. END
BEGIN NOW Onward to the dead sea they tramp to drink, unslaked and with horrible END
BEGIN NOW gulpings, the salt somnolent inexhaustible flood. END
BEGIN NOW And the equine portent END
BEGIN NOW grows again, magnified in the deserted heavens, nay to heaven's own END
BEGIN NOW magnitude, till it looms, vast, over the house of Virgo. END
BEGIN NOW And lo, wonder END
BEGIN NOW of metempsychosis, it is she, the everlasting bride, harbinger of the END
BEGIN NOW daystar, the bride, ever virgin. END
BEGIN NOW It is she, Martha, thou lost one, END
BEGIN NOW Millicent, the young, the dear, the radiant. END
BEGIN NOW How serene does she now END
BEGIN NOW arise, a queen among the Pleiades, in the penultimate antelucan hour, END
BEGIN NOW shod in sandals of bright gold, coifed with a veil of what do you call END
BEGIN NOW it gossamer. END
BEGIN NOW It floats, it flows about her starborn flesh and loose it END
BEGIN NOW streams, emerald, sapphire, mauve and heliotrope, sustained on currents END
BEGIN NOW of the cold interstellar wind, winding, coiling, simply swirling, END
BEGIN NOW writhing in the skies a mysterious writing till, after a myriad END
BEGIN NOW metamorphoses of symbol, it blazes, Alpha, a ruby and triangled sign END
BEGIN NOW upon the forehead of Taurus. END
BEGIN NOW Francis was reminding Stephen of years before when they had been at END
BEGIN NOW school together in Conmee's time. END
BEGIN NOW He asked about Glaucon, Alcibiades, END
BEGIN NOW Pisistratus. END
BEGIN NOW Where were they now? END
BEGIN NOW Neither knew. END
BEGIN NOW You have spoken of the END
BEGIN NOW past and its phantoms, Stephen said. END
BEGIN NOW Why think of them? END
BEGIN NOW If I call them END
BEGIN NOW into life across the waters of Lethe will not the poor ghosts troop to END
BEGIN NOW my call? END
BEGIN NOW Who supposes it? END
BEGIN NOW I, Bous Stephanoumenos, bullockbefriending END
BEGIN NOW bard, am lord and giver of their life. END
BEGIN NOW He encircled his gadding hair END
BEGIN NOW with a coronal of vineleaves, smiling at Vincent. END
BEGIN NOW That answer and those END
BEGIN NOW leaves, Vincent said to him, will adorn you more fitly when something END
BEGIN NOW more, and greatly more, than a capful of light odes can call your genius END
BEGIN NOW father. END
BEGIN NOW All who wish you well hope this for you. END
BEGIN NOW All desire to see you END
BEGIN NOW bring forth the work you meditate, to acclaim you Stephaneforos. END
BEGIN NOW I END
BEGIN NOW heartily wish you may not fail them. END
BEGIN NOW O no, Vincent Lenehan said, laying END
BEGIN NOW a hand on the shoulder near him. END
BEGIN NOW Have no fear. END
BEGIN NOW He could not leave his END
BEGIN NOW mother an orphan. END
BEGIN NOW The young man's face grew dark. END
BEGIN NOW All could see how hard END
BEGIN NOW it was for him to be reminded of his promise and of his recent loss. END
BEGIN NOW He END
BEGIN NOW would have withdrawn from the feast had not the noise of voices allayed END
BEGIN NOW the smart. END
BEGIN NOW Madden had lost five drachmas on Sceptre for a whim of the END
BEGIN NOW rider's name: Lenehan as much more. END
BEGIN NOW He told them of the race. END
BEGIN NOW The flag END
BEGIN NOW fell and, huuh! END
BEGIN NOW off, scamper, the mare ran out freshly with 0. END
BEGIN NOW Madden END
BEGIN NOW up. END
BEGIN NOW She was leading the field. END
BEGIN NOW All hearts were beating. END
BEGIN NOW Even Phyllis END
BEGIN NOW could not contain herself. END
BEGIN NOW She waved her scarf and cried: Huzzah! END
BEGIN NOW Sceptre wins! END
BEGIN NOW But in the straight on the run home when all were in close END
BEGIN NOW order the dark horse Throwaway drew level, reached, outstripped her. END
BEGIN NOW All END
BEGIN NOW was lost now. END
BEGIN NOW Phyllis was silent: her eyes were sad anemones. END
BEGIN NOW Juno, she END
BEGIN NOW cried, I am undone. END
BEGIN NOW But her lover consoled her and brought her a bright END
BEGIN NOW casket of gold in which lay some oval sugarplums which she partook. END
BEGIN NOW A END
BEGIN NOW tear fell: one only. END
BEGIN NOW A whacking fine whip, said Lenehan, is W. END
BEGIN NOW Lane. END
BEGIN NOW Four winners yesterday and three today. END
BEGIN NOW What rider is like him? END
BEGIN NOW Mount END
BEGIN NOW him on the camel or the boisterous buffalo the victory in a hack canter END
BEGIN NOW is still his. END
BEGIN NOW But let us bear it as was the ancient wont. END
BEGIN NOW Mercy on the END
BEGIN NOW luckless! END
BEGIN NOW Poor Sceptre! END
BEGIN NOW he said with a light sigh. END
BEGIN NOW She is not the filly END
BEGIN NOW that she was. END
BEGIN NOW Never, by this hand, shall we behold such another. END
BEGIN NOW By gad, END
BEGIN NOW sir, a queen of them. END
BEGIN NOW Do you remember her, Vincent? END
BEGIN NOW I wish you could END
BEGIN NOW have seen my queen today, Vincent said. END
BEGIN NOW How young she was and radiant END
BEGIN NOW (Lalage were scarce fair beside her) in her yellow shoes and frock of END
BEGIN NOW muslin, I do not know the right name of it. END
BEGIN NOW The chestnuts that shaded us END
BEGIN NOW were in bloom: the air drooped with their persuasive odour and with END
BEGIN NOW pollen floating by us. END
BEGIN NOW In the sunny patches one might easily have cooked END
BEGIN NOW on a stone a batch of those buns with Corinth fruit in them that END
BEGIN NOW Periplipomenes sells in his booth near the bridge. END
BEGIN NOW But she had nought END
BEGIN NOW for her teeth but the arm with which I held her and in that she nibbled END
BEGIN NOW mischievously when I pressed too close. END
BEGIN NOW A week ago she lay ill, four END
BEGIN NOW days on the couch, but today she was free, blithe, mocked at peril. END
BEGIN NOW She END
BEGIN NOW is more taking then. END
BEGIN NOW Her posies tool Mad romp that she is, she had END
BEGIN NOW pulled her fill as we reclined together. END
BEGIN NOW And in your ear, my friend, you END
BEGIN NOW will not think who met us as we left the field. END
BEGIN NOW Conmee himself! END
BEGIN NOW He was END
BEGIN NOW walking by the hedge, reading, I think a brevier book with, I doubt not, END
BEGIN NOW a witty letter in it from Glycera or Chloe to keep the page. END
BEGIN NOW The sweet END
BEGIN NOW creature turned all colours in her confusion, feigning to reprove a END
BEGIN NOW slight disorder in her dress: a slip of underwood clung there for the END
BEGIN NOW very trees adore her. END
BEGIN NOW When Conmee had passed she glanced at her lovely END
BEGIN NOW echo in that little mirror she carries. END
BEGIN NOW But he had been kind. END
BEGIN NOW In going END
BEGIN NOW by he had blessed us. END
BEGIN NOW The gods too are ever kind, Lenehan said. END
BEGIN NOW If I had END
BEGIN NOW poor luck with Bass's mare perhaps this draught of his may serve me more END
BEGIN NOW propensely. END
BEGIN NOW He was laying his hand upon a winejar: Malachi saw it and END
BEGIN NOW withheld his act, pointing to the stranger and to the scarlet label. END
BEGIN NOW Warily, Malachi whispered, preserve a druid silence. END
BEGIN NOW His soul is far END
BEGIN NOW away. END
BEGIN NOW It is as painful perhaps to be awakened from a vision as to be END
BEGIN NOW born. END
BEGIN NOW Any object, intensely regarded, may be a gate of access to the END
BEGIN NOW incorruptible eon of the gods. END
BEGIN NOW Do you not think it, Stephen? END
BEGIN NOW Theosophos END
BEGIN NOW told me so, Stephen answered, whom in a previous existence Egyptian END
BEGIN NOW priests initiated into the mysteries of karmic law. END
BEGIN NOW The lords of the END
BEGIN NOW moon, Theosophos told me, an orangefiery shipload from planet Alpha of END
BEGIN NOW the lunar chain would not assume the etheric doubles and these were END
BEGIN NOW therefore incarnated by the rubycoloured egos from the second END
BEGIN NOW constellation. END
BEGIN NOW However, as a matter of fact though, the preposterous surmise about him END
BEGIN NOW being in some description of a doldrums or other or mesmerised which was END
BEGIN NOW entirely due to a misconception of the shallowest character, was not the END
BEGIN NOW case at all. END
BEGIN NOW The individual whose visual organs while the above was END
BEGIN NOW going on were at this juncture commencing to exhibit symptoms of END
BEGIN NOW animation was as astute if not astuter than any man living and anybody END
BEGIN NOW that conjectured the contrary would have found themselves pretty END
BEGIN NOW speedily in the wrong shop. END
BEGIN NOW During the past four minutes or thereabouts END
BEGIN NOW he had been staring hard at a certain amount of number one Bass bottled END
BEGIN NOW by Messrs Bass and Co at Burton-on-Trent which happened to be situated END
BEGIN NOW amongst a lot of others right opposite to where he was and which was END
BEGIN NOW certainly calculated to attract anyone's remark on account of its END
BEGIN NOW scarlet appearance. END
