BEGIN NOW He was simply and solely, as it subsequently END
BEGIN NOW transpired for reasons best known to himself, which put quite an END
BEGIN NOW altogether different complexion on the proceedings, after the moment END
BEGIN NOW before's observations about boyhood days and the turf, recollecting two END
BEGIN NOW or three private transactions of his own which the other two were as END
BEGIN NOW mutually innocent of as the babe unborn. END
BEGIN NOW Eventually, however, both their END
BEGIN NOW eyes met and as soon as it began to dawn on him that the other was END
BEGIN NOW endeavouring to help himself to the thing he involuntarily determined to END
BEGIN NOW help him himself and so he accordingly took hold of the neck of the END
BEGIN NOW mediumsized glass recipient which contained the fluid sought after and END
BEGIN NOW made a capacious hole in it by pouring a lot of it out with, also at the END
BEGIN NOW same time, however, a considerable degree of attentiveness in order not END
BEGIN NOW to upset any of the beer that was in it about the place. END
BEGIN NOW The debate which ensued was in its scope and progress an epitome of the END
BEGIN NOW course of life. END
BEGIN NOW Neither place nor council was lacking in dignity. END
BEGIN NOW The END
BEGIN NOW debaters were the keenest in the land, the theme they were engaged on END
BEGIN NOW the loftiest and most vital. END
BEGIN NOW The high hall of Horne's house had never END
BEGIN NOW beheld an assembly so representative and so varied nor had the old END
BEGIN NOW rafters of that establishment ever listened to a language so END
BEGIN NOW encyclopaedic. END
BEGIN NOW A gallant scene in truth it made. END
BEGIN NOW Crotthers was there at END
BEGIN NOW the foot of the table in his striking Highland garb, his face glowing END
BEGIN NOW from the briny airs of the Mull of Galloway. END
BEGIN NOW There too, opposite to him, END
BEGIN NOW was Lynch whose countenance bore already the stigmata of early depravity END
BEGIN NOW and premature wisdom. END
BEGIN NOW Next the Scotchman was the place assigned to END
BEGIN NOW Costello, the eccentric, while at his side was seated in stolid repose END
BEGIN NOW the squat form of Madden. END
BEGIN NOW The chair of the resident indeed stood vacant END
BEGIN NOW before the hearth but on either flank of it the figure of Bannon in END
BEGIN NOW explorer's kit of tweed shorts and salted cowhide brogues contrasted END
BEGIN NOW sharply with the primrose elegance and townbred manners of Malachi END
BEGIN NOW Roland St John Mulligan. END
BEGIN NOW Lastly at the head of the board was the young END
BEGIN NOW poet who found a refuge from his labours of pedagogy and metaphysical END
BEGIN NOW inquisition in the convivial atmosphere of Socratic discussion, while to END
BEGIN NOW right and left of him were accommodated the flippant prognosticator, END
BEGIN NOW fresh from the hippodrome, and that vigilant wanderer, soiled by the END
BEGIN NOW dust of travel and combat and stained by the mire of an indelible END
BEGIN NOW dishonour, but from whose steadfast and constant heart no lure or peril END
BEGIN NOW or threat or degradation could ever efface the image of that voluptuous END
BEGIN NOW loveliness which the inspired pencil of Lafayette has limned for ages END
BEGIN NOW yet to come. END
BEGIN NOW It had better be stated here and now at the outset that the perverted END
BEGIN NOW transcendentalism to which Mr S. END
BEGIN NOW Dedalus' (Div. END
BEGIN NOW Scep.) contentions would END
BEGIN NOW appear to prove him pretty badly addicted runs directly counter to END
BEGIN NOW accepted scientific methods. END
BEGIN NOW Science, it cannot be too often repeated, END
BEGIN NOW deals with tangible phenomena. END
BEGIN NOW The man of science like the man in the END
BEGIN NOW street has to face hardheaded facts that cannot be blinked and explain END
BEGIN NOW them as best he can. END
BEGIN NOW There may be, it is true, some questions which END
BEGIN NOW science cannot answer—at present—such as the first problem submitted by END
BEGIN NOW Mr L. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom (Pubb. END
BEGIN NOW Canv.) regarding the future determination of sex. END
BEGIN NOW Must we accept the view of Empedocles of Trinacria that the right ovary END
BEGIN NOW (the postmenstrual period, assert others) is responsible for the birth END
BEGIN NOW of males or are the too long neglected spermatozoa or nemasperms the END
BEGIN NOW differentiating factors or is it, as most embryologists incline to END
BEGIN NOW opine, such as Culpepper, Spallanzani, Blumenbach, Lusk, Hertwig, END
BEGIN NOW Leopold and Valenti, a mixture of both? END
BEGIN NOW This would be tantamount to a END
BEGIN NOW cooperation (one of nature's favourite devices) between the nisus END
BEGIN NOW formativus of the nemasperm on the one hand and on the other a happily END
BEGIN NOW chosen position, succubitus felix of the passive element. END
BEGIN NOW The other END
BEGIN NOW problem raised by the same inquirer is scarcely less vital: infant END
BEGIN NOW mortality. END
BEGIN NOW It is interesting because, as he pertinently remarks, we are END
BEGIN NOW all born in the same way but we all die in different ways. END
BEGIN NOW Mr M. END
BEGIN NOW Mulligan (Hyg. END
BEGIN NOW et Eug. END
BEGIN NOW Doc.) blames the sanitary conditions in which our END
BEGIN NOW greylunged citizens contract adenoids, pulmonary complaints etc. END
BEGIN NOW by END
BEGIN NOW inhaling the bacteria which lurk in dust. END
BEGIN NOW These factors, he alleged, and END
BEGIN NOW the revolting spectacles offered by our streets, hideous publicity END
BEGIN NOW posters, religious ministers of all denominations, mutilated soldiers END
BEGIN NOW and sailors, exposed scorbutic cardrivers, the suspended carcases of END
BEGIN NOW dead animals, paranoic bachelors and unfructified duennas—these, he END
BEGIN NOW said, were accountable for any and every fallingoff in the calibre of END
BEGIN NOW the race. END
BEGIN NOW Kalipedia, he prophesied, would soon be generally adopted and END
BEGIN NOW all the graces of life, genuinely good music, agreeable literature, END
BEGIN NOW light philosophy, instructive pictures, plastercast reproductions of the END
BEGIN NOW classical statues such as Venus and Apollo, artistic coloured END
BEGIN NOW photographs of prize babies, all these little attentions would enable END
BEGIN NOW ladies who were in a particular condition to pass the intervening months END
BEGIN NOW in a most enjoyable manner. END
BEGIN NOW Mr J. END
BEGIN NOW Crotthers (Disc. END
BEGIN NOW Bacc.) attributes END
BEGIN NOW some of these demises to abdominal trauma in the case of women workers END
BEGIN NOW subjected to heavy labours in the workshop and to marital discipline in END
BEGIN NOW the home but by far the vast majority to neglect, private or official, END
BEGIN NOW culminating in the exposure of newborn infants, the practice of criminal END
BEGIN NOW abortion or in the atrocious crime of infanticide. END
BEGIN NOW Although the former END
BEGIN NOW (we are thinking of neglect) is undoubtedly only too true the case he END
BEGIN NOW cites of nurses forgetting to count the sponges in the peritoneal cavity END
BEGIN NOW is too rare to be normative. END
BEGIN NOW In fact when one comes to look into it the END
BEGIN NOW wonder is that so many pregnancies and deliveries go off so well as they END
BEGIN NOW do, all things considered and in spite of our human shortcomings which END
BEGIN NOW often baulk nature in her intentions. END
BEGIN NOW An ingenious suggestion is that END
BEGIN NOW thrown out by Mr V. END
BEGIN NOW Lynch (Bacc. END
BEGIN NOW Arith.) that both natality and END
BEGIN NOW mortality, as well as all other phenomena of evolution, tidal movements, END
BEGIN NOW lunar phases, blood temperatures, diseases in general, everything, in END
BEGIN NOW fine, in nature's vast workshop from the extinction of some remote sun END
BEGIN NOW to the blossoming of one of the countless flowers which beautify our END
BEGIN NOW public parks is subject to a law of numeration as yet unascertained. END
BEGIN NOW Still the plain straightforward question why a child of normally healthy END
BEGIN NOW parents and seemingly a healthy child and properly looked after succumbs END
BEGIN NOW unaccountably in early childhood (though other children of the same END
BEGIN NOW marriage do not) must certainly, in the poet's words, give us pause. END
BEGIN NOW Nature, we may rest assured, has her own good and cogent reasons for END
BEGIN NOW whatever she does and in all probability such deaths are due to some law END
BEGIN NOW of anticipation by which organisms in which morbous germs have taken up END
BEGIN NOW their residence (modern science has conclusively shown that only the END
BEGIN NOW plasmic substance can be said to be immortal) tend to disappear at an END
BEGIN NOW increasingly earlier stage of development, an arrangement which, though END
BEGIN NOW productive of pain to some of our feelings (notably the maternal), is END
BEGIN NOW nevertheless, some of us think, in the long run beneficial to the race END
BEGIN NOW in general in securing thereby the survival of the fittest. END
BEGIN NOW Mr S. END
BEGIN NOW Dedalus' (Div. END
BEGIN NOW Scep.) remark (or should it be called an interruption?) END
BEGIN NOW that an omnivorous being which can masticate, deglute, digest and END
BEGIN NOW apparently pass through the ordinary channel with pluterperfect END
BEGIN NOW imperturbability such multifarious aliments as cancrenous females END
BEGIN NOW emaciated by parturition, corpulent professional gentlemen, not to speak END
BEGIN NOW of jaundiced politicians and chlorotic nuns, might possibly find gastric END
BEGIN NOW relief in an innocent collation of staggering bob, reveals as nought END
BEGIN NOW else could and in a very unsavoury light the tendency above alluded to. END
BEGIN NOW For the enlightenment of those who are not so intimately acquainted with END
BEGIN NOW the minutiae of the municipal abattoir as this morbidminded esthete and END
BEGIN NOW embryo philosopher who for all his overweening bumptiousness in things END
BEGIN NOW scientific can scarcely distinguish an acid from an alkali prides END
BEGIN NOW himself on being, it should perhaps be stated that staggering bob in the END
BEGIN NOW vile parlance of our lowerclass licensed victuallers signifies the END
BEGIN NOW cookable and eatable flesh of a calf newly dropped from its mother. END
BEGIN NOW In a END
BEGIN NOW recent public controversy with Mr L. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom (Pubb. END
BEGIN NOW Canv.) which took END
BEGIN NOW place in the commons' hall of the National Maternity Hospital, 29, 30 END
BEGIN NOW and 31 Holles street, of which, as is well known, Dr A. END
BEGIN NOW Horne (Lic. END
BEGIN NOW in END
BEGIN NOW Midw., F. END
BEGIN NOW K. END
BEGIN NOW Q. END
BEGIN NOW C. END
BEGIN NOW P. END
BEGIN NOW I.) is the able and popular master, he is reported END
BEGIN NOW by eyewitnesses as having stated that once a woman has let the cat into END
BEGIN NOW the bag (an esthete's allusion, presumably, to one of the most END
BEGIN NOW complicated and marvellous of all nature's processes—the act of sexual END
BEGIN NOW congress) she must let it out again or give it life, as he phrased it, END
BEGIN NOW to save her own. END
BEGIN NOW At the risk of her own, was the telling rejoinder of END
BEGIN NOW his interlocutor, none the less effective for the moderate and measured END
BEGIN NOW tone in which it was delivered. END
BEGIN NOW Meanwhile the skill and patience of the physician had brought about a END
BEGIN NOW happy accouchement. END
BEGIN NOW It had been a weary weary while both for patient and END
BEGIN NOW doctor. END
BEGIN NOW All that surgical skill could do was done and the brave woman END
BEGIN NOW had manfully helped. END
BEGIN NOW She had. END
BEGIN NOW She had fought the good fight and now she END
BEGIN NOW was very very happy. END
BEGIN NOW Those who have passed on, who have gone before, are END
BEGIN NOW happy too as they gaze down and smile upon the touching scene. END
BEGIN NOW Reverently look at her as she reclines there with the motherlight in her END
BEGIN NOW eyes, that longing hunger for baby fingers (a pretty sight it is to END
BEGIN NOW see), in the first bloom of her new motherhood, breathing a silent END
BEGIN NOW prayer of thanksgiving to One above, the Universal Husband. END
BEGIN NOW And as her END
BEGIN NOW loving eyes behold her babe she wishes only one blessing more, to have END
BEGIN NOW her dear Doady there with her to share her joy, to lay in his arms that END
BEGIN NOW mite of God's clay, the fruit of their lawful embraces. END
BEGIN NOW He is older now END
BEGIN NOW (you and I may whisper it) and a trifle stooped in the shoulders yet in END
BEGIN NOW the whirligig of years a grave dignity has come to the conscientious END
BEGIN NOW second accountant of the Ulster bank, College Green branch. END
BEGIN NOW O Doady, END
BEGIN NOW loved one of old, faithful lifemate now, it may never be again, that END
BEGIN NOW faroff time of the roses! END
BEGIN NOW With the old shake of her pretty head she END
BEGIN NOW recalls those days. END
BEGIN NOW God! END
BEGIN NOW How beautiful now across the mist of years! END
BEGIN NOW But END
BEGIN NOW their children are grouped in her imagination about the bedside, hers END
BEGIN NOW and his, Charley, Mary Alice, Frederick Albert (if he had lived), Mamy, END
BEGIN NOW Budgy (Victoria Frances), Tom, Violet Constance Louisa, darling little END
BEGIN NOW Bobsy (called after our famous hero of the South African war, lord Bobs END
BEGIN NOW of Waterford and Candahar) and now this last pledge of their union, a END
BEGIN NOW Purefoy if ever there was one, with the true Purefoy nose. END
BEGIN NOW Young hopeful END
BEGIN NOW will be christened Mortimer Edward after the influential third cousin of END
BEGIN NOW Mr Purefoy in the Treasury Remembrancer's office, Dublin Castle. END
BEGIN NOW And so END
BEGIN NOW time wags on: but father Cronion has dealt lightly here. END
BEGIN NOW No, let no sigh END
BEGIN NOW break from that bosom, dear gentle Mina. END
BEGIN NOW And Doady, knock the ashes from END
BEGIN NOW your pipe, the seasoned briar you still fancy when the curfew rings for END
BEGIN NOW you (may it be the distant day!) and dout the light whereby you read in END
BEGIN NOW the Sacred Book for the oil too has run low, and so with a tranquil END
BEGIN NOW heart to bed, to rest. END
BEGIN NOW He knows and will call in His own good time. END
BEGIN NOW You END
BEGIN NOW too have fought the good fight and played loyally your man's part. END
BEGIN NOW Sir, END
BEGIN NOW to you my hand. END
BEGIN NOW Well done, thou good and faithful servant! END
BEGIN NOW There are sins or (let us call them as the world calls them) evil END
BEGIN NOW memories which are hidden away by man in the darkest places of the heart END
BEGIN NOW but they abide there and wait. END
BEGIN NOW He may suffer their memory to grow dim, END
BEGIN NOW let them be as though they had not been and all but persuade himself END
BEGIN NOW that they were not or at least were otherwise. END
BEGIN NOW Yet a chance word will END
BEGIN NOW call them forth suddenly and they will rise up to confront him in the END
BEGIN NOW most various circumstances, a vision or a dream, or while timbrel and END
BEGIN NOW harp soothe his senses or amid the cool silver tranquility of the END
BEGIN NOW evening or at the feast, at midnight, when he is now filled with wine. END
BEGIN NOW Not to insult over him will the vision come as over one that lies under END
BEGIN NOW her wrath, not for vengeance to cut him off from the living but shrouded END
BEGIN NOW in the piteous vesture of the past, silent, remote, reproachful. END
BEGIN NOW The stranger still regarded on the face before him a slow recession of END
BEGIN NOW that false calm there, imposed, as it seemed, by habit or some studied END
BEGIN NOW trick, upon words so embittered as to accuse in their speaker an END
BEGIN NOW unhealthiness, a flair, for the cruder things of life. END
BEGIN NOW A scene END
BEGIN NOW disengages itself in the observer's memory, evoked, it would seem, by a END
BEGIN NOW word of so natural a homeliness as if those days were really present END
BEGIN NOW there (as some thought) with their immediate pleasures. END
BEGIN NOW A shaven space END
BEGIN NOW of lawn one soft May evening, the wellremembered grove of lilacs at END
BEGIN NOW Roundtown, purple and white, fragrant slender spectators of the game but END
BEGIN NOW with much real interest in the pellets as they run slowly forward over END
BEGIN NOW the sward or collide and stop, one by its fellow, with a brief alert END
BEGIN NOW shock. END
BEGIN NOW And yonder about that grey urn where the water moves at times in END
BEGIN NOW thoughtful irrigation you saw another as fragrant sisterhood, Floey, END
BEGIN NOW Atty, Tiny and their darker friend with I know not what of arresting in END
BEGIN NOW her pose then, Our Lady of the Cherries, a comely brace of them pendent END
BEGIN NOW from an ear, bringing out the foreign warmth of the skin so daintily END
BEGIN NOW against the cool ardent fruit. END
BEGIN NOW A lad of four or five in linseywoolsey END
BEGIN NOW (blossomtime but there will be cheer in the kindly hearth when ere long END
BEGIN NOW the bowls are gathered and hutched) is standing on the urn secured by END
BEGIN NOW that circle of girlish fond hands. END
BEGIN NOW He frowns a little just as this young END
BEGIN NOW man does now with a perhaps too conscious enjoyment of the danger but END
BEGIN NOW must needs glance at whiles towards where his mother watches from the END
BEGIN NOW PIAZZETTA giving upon the flowerclose with a faint shadow of remoteness END
BEGIN NOW or of reproach (alles VergÃ¤ngliche) in her glad look. END
BEGIN NOW Mark this farther and remember. END
BEGIN NOW The end comes suddenly. END
BEGIN NOW Enter that END
BEGIN NOW antechamber of birth where the studious are assembled and note their END
BEGIN NOW faces. END
BEGIN NOW Nothing, as it seems, there of rash or violent. END
BEGIN NOW Quietude of END
BEGIN NOW custody, rather, befitting their station in that house, the vigilant END
BEGIN NOW watch of shepherds and of angels about a crib in Bethlehem of Juda long END
BEGIN NOW ago. END
BEGIN NOW But as before the lightning the serried stormclouds, heavy with END
BEGIN NOW preponderant excess of moisture, in swollen masses turgidly distended, END
BEGIN NOW compass earth and sky in one vast slumber, impending above parched field END
BEGIN NOW and drowsy oxen and blighted growth of shrub and verdure till in an END
BEGIN NOW instant a flash rives their centres and with the reverberation of the END
BEGIN NOW thunder the cloudburst pours its torrent, so and not otherwise was the END
BEGIN NOW transformation, violent and instantaneous, upon the utterance of the END
BEGIN NOW word. END
BEGIN NOW Burke's! END
BEGIN NOW outflings my lord Stephen, giving the cry, and a tag and END
BEGIN NOW bobtail of all them after, cockerel, jackanapes, welsher, pilldoctor, END
BEGIN NOW punctual Bloom at heels with a universal grabbing at headgear, END
BEGIN NOW ashplants, bilbos, Panama hats and scabbards, Zermatt alpenstocks and END
BEGIN NOW what not. END
BEGIN NOW A dedale of lusty youth, noble every student there. END
BEGIN NOW Nurse END
BEGIN NOW Callan taken aback in the hallway cannot stay them nor smiling surgeon END
BEGIN NOW coming downstairs with news of placentation ended, a full pound if a END
BEGIN NOW milligramme. END
BEGIN NOW They hark him on. END
BEGIN NOW The door! END
BEGIN NOW It is open? END
BEGIN NOW Ha! END
BEGIN NOW They are out, END
BEGIN NOW tumultuously, off for a minute's race, all bravely legging it, Burke's END
BEGIN NOW of Denzille and Holles their ulterior goal. END
BEGIN NOW Dixon follows giving them END
BEGIN NOW sharp language but raps out an oath, he too, and on. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom stays with END
BEGIN NOW nurse a thought to send a kind word to happy mother and nurseling up END
BEGIN NOW there. END
BEGIN NOW Doctor Diet and Doctor Quiet. END
BEGIN NOW Looks she too not other now? END
BEGIN NOW Ward END
BEGIN NOW of watching in Horne's house has told its tale in that washedout pallor. END
BEGIN NOW Then all being gone, a glance of motherwit helping, he whispers close in END
BEGIN NOW going: Madam, when comes the storkbird for thee? END
BEGIN NOW The air without is impregnated with raindew moisture, life essence END
BEGIN NOW celestial, glistening on Dublin stone there under starshiny coelum. END
BEGIN NOW God's air, the Allfather's air, scintillant circumambient cessile air. END
BEGIN NOW Breathe it deep into thee. END
BEGIN NOW By heaven, Theodore Purefoy, thou hast done a END
BEGIN NOW doughty deed and no botch! END
BEGIN NOW Thou art, I vow, the remarkablest progenitor END
BEGIN NOW barring none in this chaffering allincluding most farraginous chronicle. END
BEGIN NOW Astounding! END

BEGIN NOW Cleave to her! END

BEGIN NOW Toil on, labour like a very bandog and let scholarment and all END
BEGIN NOW Malthusiasts go hang. END
BEGIN NOW Thou art all their daddies, Theodore. END
BEGIN NOW Art drooping END

BEGIN NOW Head up! END
BEGIN NOW For every newbegotten thou shalt END
BEGIN NOW gather thy homer of ripe wheat. END

BEGIN NOW Darby Dullman there with his Joan? END

BEGIN NOW is all their progeny. END

BEGIN NOW Vegetables, forsooth, and sterile END
BEGIN NOW cohabitation! END

BEGIN NOW He was down and out but, though END

BEGIN NOW nature as a purely domestic animal. END
BEGIN NOW A sevenmonths' child, he had been END
BEGIN NOW carefully brought up and nurtured by an aged bedridden parent. END
BEGIN NOW There END
BEGIN NOW might have been lapses of an erring father but he wanted to turn over a END

BEGIN NOW affectionate surroundings of the heaving bosom of the family. END

BEGIN NOW acclimatised Britisher, he had seen that summer eve from the footplate END

BEGIN NOW We are not in a END
BEGIN NOW beargarden nor at an Oxford rag nor is this a travesty of justice. END
BEGIN NOW My END
BEGIN NOW client is an infant, a poor foreign immigrant who started scratch as a END
BEGIN NOW stowaway and is now trying to turn an honest penny. END
BEGIN NOW The trumped up END
BEGIN NOW misdemeanour was due to a momentary aberration of heredity, brought on END
BEGIN NOW by hallucination, such familiarities as the alleged guilty occurrence END
BEGIN NOW being quite permitted in my client's native place, the land of the END
BEGIN NOW Pharaoh. END

BEGIN NOW carnally knowing. END

BEGIN NOW If the accused could speak he could END

BEGIN NOW the covers of a book. END

BEGIN NOW cobbler's weak chest. END

BEGIN NOW extraction and irresponsible for his actions. END

BEGIN NOW J. END
BEGIN NOW O'MOLLOY: (Hotly to the populace) This is a lonehand fight. END
BEGIN NOW By END

BEGIN NOW superseded the law of the jungle. END

BEGIN NOW with. END

BEGIN NOW Sir Bob, I said... END
BEGIN NOW MRS YELVERTON BARRY: (In lowcorsaged opal balldress and elbowlength END

BEGIN NOW He made improper overtures to me END
BEGIN NOW to misconduct myself at half past four p.m. END
BEGIN NOW on the following Thursday, END
BEGIN NOW Dunsink time. END
BEGIN NOW He offered to send me through the post a work of fiction END
BEGIN NOW by Monsieur Paul de Kock, entitled The Girl with the Three Pairs of END
BEGIN NOW Stays. END
BEGIN NOW MRS BELLINGHAM: (In cap and seal coney mantle, wrapped up to the nose, END
BEGIN NOW steps out of her brougham and scans through tortoiseshell quizzing- END
BEGIN NOW glasses which she takes from inside her huge opossum muff) Also to me. END
BEGIN NOW Yes, I believe it is the same objectionable person. END
BEGIN NOW Because he closed my END
BEGIN NOW carriage door outside sir Thornley Stoker's one sleety day during the END
BEGIN NOW cold snap of February ninetythree when even the grid of the wastepipe END
BEGIN NOW and the ballstop in my bath cistern were frozen. END
BEGIN NOW Subsequently he END
BEGIN NOW enclosed a bloom of edelweiss culled on the heights, as he said, in my END
BEGIN NOW honour. END
BEGIN NOW I had it examined by a botanical expert and elicited the END
BEGIN NOW information that it was ablossom of the homegrown potato plant purloined END
BEGIN NOW from a forcingcase of the model farm. END
BEGIN NOW MRS YELVERTON BARRY: Shame on him! END
BEGIN NOW (A crowd of sluts and ragamuffins surges forward) END
BEGIN NOW THE SLUTS AND RAGAMUFFINS: (Screaming) Stop thief! END
BEGIN NOW Hurrah there, END
BEGIN NOW Bluebeard! END
BEGIN NOW Three cheers for Ikey Mo! END
BEGIN NOW SECOND WATCH: (Produces handcuffs) Here are the darbies. END
BEGIN NOW MRS BELLINGHAM: He addressed me in several handwritings with fulsome END
BEGIN NOW compliments as a Venus in furs and alleged profound pity for my END
BEGIN NOW frostbound coachman Palmer while in the same breath he expressed himself END
BEGIN NOW as envious of his earflaps and fleecy sheepskins and of his fortunate END
BEGIN NOW proximity to my person, when standing behind my chair wearing my livery END
BEGIN NOW and the armorial bearings of the Bellingham escutcheon garnished sable, END
BEGIN NOW a buck's head couped or. END
BEGIN NOW He lauded almost extravagantly my nether END
BEGIN NOW extremities, my swelling calves in silk hose drawn up to the limit, and END
BEGIN NOW eulogised glowingly my other hidden treasures in priceless lace which, END
BEGIN NOW he said, he could conjure up. END
BEGIN NOW He urged me (stating that he felt it his END
BEGIN NOW mission in life to urge me) to defile the marriage bed, to commit END
BEGIN NOW adultery at the earliest possible opportunity. END
BEGIN NOW THE HONOURABLE MRS MERVYN TALBOYS: (In amazon costume, hard hat, END

BEGIN NOW ground of the Phoenix park at the match All Ireland versus the Rest of END
BEGIN NOW Ireland. END
BEGIN NOW My eyes, I know, shone divinely as I watched Captain Slogger END
BEGIN NOW Dennehy of the Inniskillings win the final chukkar on his darling cob END
BEGIN NOW Centaur. END
BEGIN NOW This plebeian Don Juan observed me from behind a hackney car END
BEGIN NOW and sent me in double envelopes an obscene photograph, such as are sold END
BEGIN NOW after dark on Paris boulevards, insulting to any lady. END
BEGIN NOW I have it still. END
BEGIN NOW It represents a partially nude seÃ±orita, frail and lovely (his wife, as END
BEGIN NOW he solemnly assured me, taken by him from nature), practising illicit END
BEGIN NOW intercourse with a muscular torero, evidently a blackguard. END
BEGIN NOW He urged me END
BEGIN NOW to do likewise, to misbehave, to sin with officers of the garrison. END
BEGIN NOW He END
BEGIN NOW implored me to soil his letter in an unspeakable manner, to chastise him END

BEGIN NOW vicious horsewhipping. END

BEGIN NOW sudden paroxysm of fury) I will, by the God above me. END
BEGIN NOW I'll scourge the END
BEGIN NOW pigeonlivered cur as long as I can stand over him. END
BEGIN NOW I'll flay him alive. END
BEGIN NOW BLOOM: (His eyes closing, quails expectantly) Here? END
BEGIN NOW (He squirms) Again! END
BEGIN NOW (He pants cringing) I love the danger. END
BEGIN NOW THE HONOURABLE MRS MERVYN TALBOYS: Very much so! END
BEGIN NOW I'll make it hot for END
BEGIN NOW you. END
BEGIN NOW I'll make you dance Jack Latten for that. END
BEGIN NOW MRS BELLINGHAM: Tan his breech well, the upstart! END
BEGIN NOW Write the stars and END
BEGIN NOW stripes on it! END
BEGIN NOW MRS YELVERTON BARRY: Disgraceful! END
BEGIN NOW There's no excuse for him! END
BEGIN NOW A married END
BEGIN NOW man! END
BEGIN NOW BLOOM: All these people. END
BEGIN NOW I meant only the spanking idea. END
BEGIN NOW A warm tingling END
BEGIN NOW glow without effusion. END
BEGIN NOW Refined birching to stimulate the circulation. END
BEGIN NOW THE HONOURABLE MRS MERVYN TALBOYS: (Laughs derisively) O, did you, my END
BEGIN NOW fine fellow? END
BEGIN NOW Well, by the living God, you'll get the surprise of your END
BEGIN NOW life now, believe me, the most unmerciful hiding a man ever bargained END
BEGIN NOW for. END
BEGIN NOW You have lashed the dormant tigress in my nature into fury. END

BEGIN NOW him smart, Hanna dear. END
BEGIN NOW Give him ginger. END
BEGIN NOW Thrash the mongrel within an END
BEGIN NOW inch of his life. END
BEGIN NOW The cat-o'-nine-tails. END
BEGIN NOW Geld him. END
BEGIN NOW Vivisect him. END

BEGIN NOW cold! END
BEGIN NOW O shivery! END
BEGIN NOW It was your ambrosial beauty. END
BEGIN NOW Forget, forgive. END
BEGIN NOW Kismet. END
BEGIN NOW Let me off this once. END
BEGIN NOW (He offers the other cheek) END
BEGIN NOW MRS YELVERTON BARRY: (Severely) Don't do so on any account, Mrs Talboys! END
BEGIN NOW He should be soundly trounced! END
BEGIN NOW THE HONOURABLE MRS MERVYN TALBOYS: (Unbuttoning her gauntlet violently) END
BEGIN NOW I'll do no such thing. END
BEGIN NOW Pigdog and always was ever since he was pupped! END
BEGIN NOW To dare address me! END
BEGIN NOW I'll flog him black and blue in the public streets. END
BEGIN NOW I'll dig my spurs in him up to the rowel. END
BEGIN NOW He is a wellknown cuckold. END
BEGIN NOW (She swishes her huntingcrop savagely in the air) Take down his trousers END
BEGIN NOW without loss of time. END
BEGIN NOW Come here, sir! END
BEGIN NOW Quick! END
BEGIN NOW Ready? END
BEGIN NOW BLOOM: (Trembling, beginning to obey) The weather has been so warm. END

BEGIN NOW Saint Patrick's Day supplement. END

BEGIN NOW Gob, he organised END
BEGIN NOW her. END

BEGIN NOW Hundred shillings to five. END

BEGIN NOW FIRST WATCH: He is a marked man. END
BEGIN NOW Another girl's plait cut. END

BEGIN NOW the Ripper. END

BEGIN NOW Dignam. END
BEGIN NOW He has gnawed all. END

BEGIN NOW grows to human size and shape. END

BEGIN NOW Doctor END

BEGIN NOW poor wife was awfully cut up. END

BEGIN NOW bottle of sherry. END

BEGIN NOW need. END

BEGIN NOW Sad music. END
BEGIN NOW Church music. END

BEGIN NOW He's inside with his friend. END

BEGIN NOW Mrs Cohen's. END
BEGIN NOW You might go farther and fare worse. END
BEGIN NOW Mother Slipperslapper. END

BEGIN NOW with the vet her tipster that gives her all the winners and pays for her END
BEGIN NOW son in Oxford. END
BEGIN NOW Working overtime but her luck's turned today. END

BEGIN NOW BLOOM: Not I! END
BEGIN NOW ZOE: You both in black. END
BEGIN NOW Has little mousey any tickles tonight? END

BEGIN NOW A hand glides over his END
BEGIN NOW left thigh.) END
BEGIN NOW ZOE: How's the nuts? END
BEGIN NOW BLOOM: Off side. END
BEGIN NOW Curiously they are on the right. END
BEGIN NOW Heavier, I suppose. END
BEGIN NOW One in a million my tailor, Mesias, says. END
BEGIN NOW ZOE: (In sudden alarm) You've a hard chancre. END
BEGIN NOW BLOOM: Not likely. END
BEGIN NOW ZOE: I feel it. END

BEGIN NOW oriental music is played. END

BEGIN NOW ZOE: You'll know me the next time. END

BEGIN NOW Near are lakes. END
BEGIN NOW Round END

BEGIN NOW hairgrowth of resin. END

BEGIN NOW Childish END
BEGIN NOW device. END

BEGIN NOW Sir Walter Ralegh brought END
BEGIN NOW from the new world that potato and that weed, the one a killer of END

BEGIN NOW hundred years before another person whose name I forget brought the END

BEGIN NOW programme. END

BEGIN NOW was born be ornamented with a commemorative tablet and that the END

BEGIN NOW COUNCILLOR LORCAN SHERLOCK: Carried unanimously. END
BEGIN NOW BLOOM: (Impassionedly) These flying Dutchmen or lying Dutchmen as they END
BEGIN NOW recline in their upholstered poop, casting dice, what reck they? END
BEGIN NOW Machines is their cry, their chimera, their panacea. END
BEGIN NOW Laboursaving END
BEGIN NOW apparatuses, supplanters, bugbears, manufactured monsters for mutual END
BEGIN NOW murder, hideous hobgoblins produced by a horde of capitalistic lusts END
BEGIN NOW upon our prostituted labour. END

BEGIN NOW grassing their royal mountain stags or shooting peasants and phartridges END
BEGIN NOW in their purblind pomp of pelf and power. END
BEGIN NOW But their reign is rover for END
BEGIN NOW rever and ever and ev... END
BEGIN NOW (Prolonged applause. END
BEGIN NOW Venetian masts, maypoles and festal arches spring END
BEGIN NOW up. END

BEGIN NOW chiefly ladies. END

BEGIN NOW from High school are perched on the lampposts, telegraph poles, END

BEGIN NOW Bloom appears, bareheaded, in a crimson velvet mantle trimmed with END

BEGIN NOW the curtana. END

BEGIN NOW Wild excitement. END
BEGIN NOW The END
BEGIN NOW ladies from their balconies throw down rosepetals. END
BEGIN NOW The air is perfumed END
BEGIN NOW with essences. END
BEGIN NOW The men cheer. END

BEGIN NOW branches of hawthorn and wrenbushes.) END

BEGIN NOW The wren, the wren, The king of all birds, Saint Stephen's his day Was END
BEGIN NOW caught in the furze. END

BEGIN NOW He END
BEGIN NOW scarcely looks thirtyone. END
BEGIN NOW A PAVIOR AND FLAGGER: That's the famous Bloom now, the world's greatest END
BEGIN NOW reformer. END
BEGIN NOW Hats off! END
BEGIN NOW (All uncover their heads. END
BEGIN NOW Women whisper eagerly.) END
BEGIN NOW A MILLIONAIRESS: (Richly) Isn't he simply wonderful? END
BEGIN NOW A NOBLEWOMAN: (Nobly) All that man has seen! END
BEGIN NOW A FEMINIST: (Masculinely) And done! END
BEGIN NOW A BELLHANGER: A classic face! END
BEGIN NOW He has the forehead of a thinker. END
BEGIN NOW (Bloom's weather. END
BEGIN NOW A sunburst appears in the northwest.) END
BEGIN NOW THE BISHOP OF DOWN AND CONNOR: I here present your undoubted emperor- END

BEGIN NOW BLOOM: (Placing his right hand on his testicles, swears) So may the END

BEGIN NOW interplanetary transmitters are set for reception of message.) END
BEGIN NOW BLOOM: My subjects! END
BEGIN NOW We hereby nominate our faithful charger Copula Felix END
BEGIN NOW hereditary Grand Vizier and announce that we have this day repudiated END
BEGIN NOW our former spouse and have bestowed our royal hand upon the princess END
BEGIN NOW Selene, the splendour of night. END
BEGIN NOW (The former morganatic spouse of Bloom is hastily removed in the Black END
BEGIN NOW Maria. END

BEGIN NOW head, descends from a Sedan chair, borne by two giants. END
BEGIN NOW An outburst of END
BEGIN NOW cheering.) END

BEGIN NOW DR MULLIGAN: (In motor jerkin, green motorgoggles on his brow) Dr Bloom END
BEGIN NOW is bisexually abnormal. END
BEGIN NOW He has recently escaped from Dr Eustace's END
BEGIN NOW private asylum for demented gentlemen. END
BEGIN NOW Born out of bedlock hereditary END
BEGIN NOW epilepsy is present, the consequence of unbridled lust. END
BEGIN NOW Traces of END
BEGIN NOW elephantiasis have been discovered among his ascendants. END
BEGIN NOW There are END
BEGIN NOW marked symptoms of chronic exhibitionism. END
BEGIN NOW Ambidexterity is also latent. END
BEGIN NOW He is prematurely bald from selfabuse, perversely idealistic in END
BEGIN NOW consequence, a reformed rake, and has metal teeth. END
BEGIN NOW In consequence of a END
BEGIN NOW family complex he has temporarily lost his memory and I believe him to END
BEGIN NOW be more sinned against than sinning. END
BEGIN NOW I have made a pervaginal END
BEGIN NOW examination and, after application of the acid test to 5427 anal, END
BEGIN NOW axillary, pectoral and pubic hairs, I declare him to be virgo intacta. END
BEGIN NOW (Bloom holds his high grade hat over his genital organs.) END
BEGIN NOW DR MADDEN: Hypsospadia is also marked. END
BEGIN NOW In the interest of coming END
BEGIN NOW generations I suggest that the parts affected should be preserved in END
BEGIN NOW spirits of wine in the national teratological museum. END
BEGIN NOW DR CROTTHERS: I have examined the patient's urine. END
BEGIN NOW It is albuminoid. END
BEGIN NOW Salivation is insufficient, the patellar reflex intermittent. END
BEGIN NOW DR PUNCH COSTELLO: The fetor judaicus is most perceptible. END
BEGIN NOW DR DIXON: (Reads a bill of health) Professor Bloom is a finished example END
BEGIN NOW of the new womanly man. END
BEGIN NOW His moral nature is simple and lovable. END
BEGIN NOW Many END
BEGIN NOW have found him a dear man, a dear person. END
BEGIN NOW He is a rather quaint fellow END
BEGIN NOW on the whole, coy though not feebleminded in the medical sense. END
BEGIN NOW He has END
BEGIN NOW written a really beautiful letter, a poem in itself, to the court END
BEGIN NOW missionary of the Reformed Priests' Protection Society which clears up END
BEGIN NOW everything. END
BEGIN NOW He is practically a total abstainer and I can affirm that he END
BEGIN NOW sleeps on a straw litter and eats the most Spartan food, cold dried END
BEGIN NOW grocer's peas. END
BEGIN NOW He wears a hairshirt of pure Irish manufacture winter and END
BEGIN NOW summer and scourges himself every Saturday. END
BEGIN NOW He was, I understand, at one END
BEGIN NOW time a firstclass misdemeanant in Glencree reformatory. END

BEGIN NOW states that he was a very posthumous child. END

BEGIN NOW is no answer) The name if you call. END
BEGIN NOW Somnambulist. END
BEGIN NOW (He bends again and END
BEGIN NOW hesitating, brings his mouth near the face of the prostrate form) END
BEGIN NOW Stephen! END
BEGIN NOW (There is no answer. END
BEGIN NOW He calls again.) Stephen! END
BEGIN NOW STEPHEN: (Groans) Who? END
BEGIN NOW Black panther. END
BEGIN NOW Vampire. END
BEGIN NOW (He sighs and stretches END
BEGIN NOW himself, then murmurs thickly with prolonged vowels) END
BEGIN NOW Who... END
BEGIN NOW drive... END
BEGIN NOW Fergus now And pierce... END
BEGIN NOW wood's woven shade?... END
BEGIN NOW (He turns on his left side, sighing, doubling himself together.) END
BEGIN NOW BLOOM: Poetry. END
BEGIN NOW Well educated. END
BEGIN NOW Pity. END
BEGIN NOW (He bends again and undoes the END
BEGIN NOW buttons of Stephen's waistcoat) To breathe. END
BEGIN NOW (He brushes the woodshavings END
BEGIN NOW from Stephen's clothes with light hand and fingers) One pound seven. END
BEGIN NOW Not END
BEGIN NOW hurt anyhow. END
BEGIN NOW (He listens) What? END
BEGIN NOW STEPHEN: (Murmurs) END
BEGIN NOW ... END
BEGIN NOW shadows... END
BEGIN NOW the woods ... END
BEGIN NOW white breast... END
BEGIN NOW dim sea. END
BEGIN NOW (He stretches out his arms, sighs again and curls his body. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom, END
BEGIN NOW holding the hat and ashplant, stands erect. END
BEGIN NOW A dog barks in the distance. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom tightens and loosens his grip on the ashplant. END
BEGIN NOW He looks down on END
BEGIN NOW Stephen's face and form.) END
BEGIN NOW BLOOM: (Communes with the night) Face reminds me of his poor mother. END
BEGIN NOW In END
BEGIN NOW the shady wood. END
BEGIN NOW The deep white breast. END
BEGIN NOW Ferguson, I think I caught. END
BEGIN NOW A END
BEGIN NOW girl. END
BEGIN NOW Some girl. END
BEGIN NOW Best thing could happen him. END
BEGIN NOW (He murmurs)... END
BEGIN NOW swear that END
BEGIN NOW I will always hail, ever conceal, never reveal, any part or parts, art END
BEGIN NOW or arts... END
BEGIN NOW (He murmurs)... END
BEGIN NOW in the rough sands of the sea... END
BEGIN NOW a cabletow's END
BEGIN NOW length from the shore... END
BEGIN NOW where the tide ebbs... END
BEGIN NOW and flows ... END
BEGIN NOW (Silent, thoughtful, alert he stands on guard, his fingers at his lips END
BEGIN NOW in the attitude of secret master. END
BEGIN NOW Against the dark wall a figure appears END
BEGIN NOW slowly, a fairy boy of eleven, a changeling, kidnapped, dressed in an END
BEGIN NOW eton suit with glass shoes and a little bronze helmet, holding a book in END
BEGIN NOW his hand. END
BEGIN NOW He reads from right to left inaudibly, smiling, kissing the END
BEGIN NOW page.) END
BEGIN NOW BLOOM: (Wonderstruck, calls inaudibly) Rudy! END
BEGIN NOW RUDY: (Gazes, unseeing, into Bloom's eyes and goes on reading, kissing, END
BEGIN NOW smiling. END
BEGIN NOW He has a delicate mauve face. END
BEGIN NOW On his suit he has diamond and END
BEGIN NOW ruby buttons. END
BEGIN NOW In his free left hand he holds a slim ivory cane with a END
BEGIN NOW violet bowknot. END
BEGIN NOW A white lambkin peeps out of his waistcoat pocket.) END
BEGIN NOW — III — END
BEGIN NOW [ 16 ] END
BEGIN NOW Preparatory to anything else Mr Bloom brushed off the greater bulk of END
BEGIN NOW the shavings and handed Stephen the hat and ashplant and bucked him up END
BEGIN NOW generally in orthodox Samaritan fashion which he very badly needed. END
BEGIN NOW His END
BEGIN NOW (Stephen's) mind was not exactly what you would call wandering but a bit END
BEGIN NOW unsteady and on his expressed desire for some beverage to drink Mr Bloom END
BEGIN NOW in view of the hour it was and there being no pump of Vartry water END
BEGIN NOW available for their ablutions let alone drinking purposes hit upon an END
BEGIN NOW expedient by suggesting, off the reel, the propriety of the cabman's END
BEGIN NOW shelter, as it was called, hardly a stonesthrow away near Butt bridge END
BEGIN NOW where they might hit upon some drinkables in the shape of a milk and END
BEGIN NOW soda or a mineral. END
BEGIN NOW But how to get there was the rub. END
BEGIN NOW For the nonce he END
BEGIN NOW was rather nonplussed but inasmuch as the duty plainly devolved upon him END
BEGIN NOW to take some measures on the subject he pondered suitable ways and means END
BEGIN NOW during which Stephen repeatedly yawned. END
BEGIN NOW So far as he could see he was END
BEGIN NOW rather pale in the face so that it occurred to him as highly advisable END
BEGIN NOW to get a conveyance of some description which would answer in their then END
BEGIN NOW condition, both of them being e.d.ed, particularly Stephen, always END
BEGIN NOW assuming that there was such a thing to be found. END
BEGIN NOW Accordingly after a END
BEGIN NOW few such preliminaries as brushing, in spite of his having forgotten to END
BEGIN NOW take up his rather soapsuddy handkerchief after it had done yeoman END
BEGIN NOW service in the shaving line, they both walked together along Beaver END
BEGIN NOW street or, more properly, lane as far as the farrier's and the END
BEGIN NOW distinctly fetid atmosphere of the livery stables at the corner of END
BEGIN NOW Montgomery street where they made tracks to the left from thence END
BEGIN NOW debouching into Amiens street round by the corner of Dan Bergin's. END
BEGIN NOW But END
BEGIN NOW as he confidently anticipated there was not a sign of a Jehu plying for END
BEGIN NOW hire anywhere to be seen except a fourwheeler, probably engaged by some END
BEGIN NOW fellows inside on the spree, outside the North Star hotel and there was END
BEGIN NOW no symptom of its budging a quarter of an inch when Mr Bloom, who was END
BEGIN NOW anything but a professional whistler, endeavoured to hail it by emitting END
BEGIN NOW a kind of a whistle, holding his arms arched over his head, twice. END
BEGIN NOW This was a quandary but, bringing common sense to bear on it, evidently END
BEGIN NOW there was nothing for it but put a good face on the matter and foot it END
BEGIN NOW which they accordingly did. END
BEGIN NOW So, bevelling around by Mullett's and the END
BEGIN NOW Signal House which they shortly reached, they proceeded perforce in the END
BEGIN NOW direction of Amiens street railway terminus, Mr Bloom being handicapped END
BEGIN NOW by the circumstance that one of the back buttons of his trousers had, to END
BEGIN NOW vary the timehonoured adage, gone the way of all buttons though, END
BEGIN NOW entering thoroughly into the spirit of the thing, he heroically made END
BEGIN NOW light of the mischance. END
BEGIN NOW So as neither of them were particularly pressed END
BEGIN NOW for time, as it happened, and the temperature refreshing since it END
BEGIN NOW cleared up after the recent visitation of Jupiter Pluvius, they dandered END
BEGIN NOW along past by where the empty vehicle was waiting without a fare or a END
BEGIN NOW jarvey. END
BEGIN NOW As it so happened a Dublin United Tramways Company's sandstrewer END
BEGIN NOW happened to be returning and the elder man recounted to his companion Ã END
BEGIN NOW propos of the incident his own truly miraculous escape of some little END
BEGIN NOW while back. END
BEGIN NOW They passed the main entrance of the Great Northern railway END
BEGIN NOW station, the starting point for Belfast, where of course all traffic was END
BEGIN NOW suspended at that late hour and passing the backdoor of the morgue (a END
BEGIN NOW not very enticing locality, not to say gruesome to a degree, more END
BEGIN NOW especially at night) ultimately gained the Dock Tavern and in due course END
BEGIN NOW turned into Store street, famous for its C division police station. END
BEGIN NOW Between this point and the high at present unlit warehouses of Beresford END
BEGIN NOW place Stephen thought to think of Ibsen, associated with Baird's the END
BEGIN NOW stonecutter's in his mind somehow in Talbot place, first turning on the END
BEGIN NOW right, while the other who was acting as his fidus Achates inhaled with END
BEGIN NOW internal satisfaction the smell of James Rourke's city bakery, situated END
BEGIN NOW quite close to where they were, the very palatable odour indeed of our END
BEGIN NOW daily bread, of all commodities of the public the primary and most END
BEGIN NOW indispensable. END
BEGIN NOW Bread, the staff of life, earn your bread, O tell me END
BEGIN NOW where is fancy bread, at Rourke's the baker's it is said. END
BEGIN NOW En route to his taciturn and, not to put too fine a point on it, not yet END
BEGIN NOW perfectly sober companion Mr Bloom who at all events was in complete END
BEGIN NOW possession of his faculties, never more so, in fact disgustingly sober, END
BEGIN NOW spoke a word of caution re the dangers of nighttown, women of ill fame END
BEGIN NOW and swell mobsmen, which, barely permissible once in a while though not END
BEGIN NOW as a habitual practice, was of the nature of a regular deathtrap for END
BEGIN NOW young fellows of his age particularly if they had acquired drinking END
BEGIN NOW habits under the influence of liquor unless you knew a little jiujitsu END
BEGIN NOW for every contingency as even a fellow on the broad of his back could END
BEGIN NOW administer a nasty kick if you didn't look out. END
BEGIN NOW Highly providential was END
BEGIN NOW the appearance on the scene of Corny Kelleher when Stephen was END
BEGIN NOW blissfully unconscious but for that man in the gap turning up at the END
BEGIN NOW eleventh hour the finis might have been that he might have been a END
BEGIN NOW candidate for the accident ward or, failing that, the bridewell and an END
BEGIN NOW appearance in the court next day before Mr Tobias or, he being the END
BEGIN NOW solicitor rather, old Wall, he meant to say, or Mahony which simply END
BEGIN NOW spelt ruin for a chap when it got bruited about. END
BEGIN NOW The reason he mentioned END
BEGIN NOW the fact was that a lot of those policemen, whom he cordially disliked, END
BEGIN NOW were admittedly unscrupulous in the service of the Crown and, as Mr END
BEGIN NOW Bloom put it, recalling a case or two in the A division in Clanbrassil END
BEGIN NOW street, prepared to swear a hole through a ten gallon pot. END
BEGIN NOW Never on the END
BEGIN NOW spot when wanted but in quiet parts of the city, Pembroke road for END
BEGIN NOW example, the END
BEGIN NOW guardians of the law were well in evidence, the obvious reason being END
BEGIN NOW they were paid to protect the upper classes. END
BEGIN NOW Another thing he commented END
BEGIN NOW on was equipping soldiers with firearms or sidearms of any description END
BEGIN NOW liable to go off at any time which was tantamount to inciting them END
BEGIN NOW against civilians should by any chance they fall out over anything. END
BEGIN NOW You END
BEGIN NOW frittered away your time, he very sensibly maintained, and health and END
BEGIN NOW also character besides which, the squandermania of the thing, fast women END
BEGIN NOW of the demimonde ran away with a lot of Â£. END
BEGIN NOW s. END
BEGIN NOW d. END
BEGIN NOW into the bargain and END
BEGIN NOW the greatest danger of all was who you got drunk with though, touching END
BEGIN NOW the much vexed question of stimulants, he relished a glass of choice old END
BEGIN NOW wine in season as both END
BEGIN NOW nourishing and bloodmaking and possessing aperient virtues (notably a END
BEGIN NOW good burgundy which he was a staunch believer in) still never beyond a END
BEGIN NOW certain point where he invariably drew the line as it simply led to END
BEGIN NOW trouble all round to say nothing of your being at the tender mercy of END
BEGIN NOW others practically. END
BEGIN NOW Most of all he commented adversely on the desertion END
BEGIN NOW of Stephen by all his pubhunting confrÃ¨res but one, a most glaring END
BEGIN NOW piece of ratting on the part of his brother medicos under all the circs. END
BEGIN NOW —And that one was Judas, Stephen said, who up to then had said nothing END
BEGIN NOW whatsoever of any kind. END
BEGIN NOW Discussing these and kindred topics they made a beeline across the back END
BEGIN NOW of the Customhouse and passed under the Loop Line bridge where a brazier END
BEGIN NOW of coke burning in front of a sentrybox or something like one attracted END
BEGIN NOW their rather lagging footsteps. END
BEGIN NOW Stephen of his own accord stopped for no END
BEGIN NOW special reason to look at the heap of barren cobblestones and by the END
BEGIN NOW light emanating from the brazier he could just make out the darker END
BEGIN NOW figure of the corporation watchman inside the gloom of the sentrybox. END
BEGIN NOW He END
BEGIN NOW began to remember that this had happened or had been mentioned as having END
BEGIN NOW happened before but it cost him no small effort before he remembered END
BEGIN NOW that he recognised in the sentry a quondam friend of his father's, END
BEGIN NOW Gumley. END
BEGIN NOW To avoid a meeting he drew nearer to the pillars of the railway END
BEGIN NOW bridge. END
BEGIN NOW —Someone saluted you, Mr Bloom said. END
BEGIN NOW A figure of middle height on the prowl evidently under the arches END
BEGIN NOW saluted again, calling: END
BEGIN NOW —Night! END
BEGIN NOW Stephen of course started rather dizzily and stopped to return the END
BEGIN NOW compliment. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Bloom actuated by motives of inherent delicacy inasmuch END
BEGIN NOW as he always believed in minding his own business moved off but END
BEGIN NOW nevertheless remained on the qui vive with just a shade of anxiety END
BEGIN NOW though not funkyish in the least. END
BEGIN NOW Though unusual in the Dublin area he END
BEGIN NOW knew that it was not by any means unknown for desperadoes who had next END
BEGIN NOW to nothing to live on to be abroad waylaying and generally terrorising END
BEGIN NOW peaceable pedestrians by placing a pistol at their head in some secluded END
BEGIN NOW spot outside the city proper, famished loiterers of the Thames END
BEGIN NOW embankment category they might be hanging about there or simply END
BEGIN NOW marauders ready to decamp with whatever boodle they could in one fell END
BEGIN NOW swoop at a moment's notice, your money or your life, leaving you there END
BEGIN NOW to point a moral, gagged and garrotted. END
BEGIN NOW Stephen, that is when the accosting figure came to close quarters, END
BEGIN NOW though he was not in an over sober state himself recognised Corley's END
BEGIN NOW breath redolent of rotten cornjuice. END
BEGIN NOW Lord John Corley some called him END
BEGIN NOW and his genealogy came about in this wise. END
BEGIN NOW He was the eldest son of END
BEGIN NOW inspector Corley of the G division, lately deceased, who had married a END
BEGIN NOW certain Katherine Brophy, the daughter of a Louth farmer. END
BEGIN NOW His END
BEGIN NOW grandfather Patrick Michael Corley of New Ross had married the widow of END
BEGIN NOW a publican there whose maiden name had been Katherine (also) Talbot. END
BEGIN NOW Rumour had it (though not proved) that she descended from the house of END
BEGIN NOW the lords Talbot de Malahide in whose mansion, really an unquestionably END
BEGIN NOW fine residence of its kind and well worth seeing, her mother or aunt or END
BEGIN NOW some relative, a woman, as the tale went, of extreme beauty, had enjoyed END
BEGIN NOW the distinction of being in service in the washkitchen. END
BEGIN NOW This therefore END
BEGIN NOW was the reason why the still comparatively young though dissolute man END
BEGIN NOW who now addressed Stephen was spoken of by some with facetious END
BEGIN NOW proclivities as Lord John Corley. END
BEGIN NOW Taking Stephen on one side he had the customary doleful ditty to tell. END
BEGIN NOW Not as much as a farthing to purchase a night's lodgings. END
BEGIN NOW His friends END
BEGIN NOW had all deserted him. END
BEGIN NOW Furthermore he had a row with Lenehan and called END
BEGIN NOW him to Stephen a mean bloody swab with a sprinkling of a number of other END
BEGIN NOW uncalledfor expressions. END
BEGIN NOW He was out of a job and implored of Stephen to END
BEGIN NOW tell him where on God's earth he could get something, anything at all, END
BEGIN NOW to do. END
BEGIN NOW No, it was the daughter of the mother in the washkitchen that was END
BEGIN NOW fostersister to the heir of the house or else they were connected END
BEGIN NOW through the mother in some way, both occurrences happening at the same END
BEGIN NOW time if the whole thing wasn't a complete fabrication from start to END
BEGIN NOW finish. END
BEGIN NOW Anyhow he was all in. END
BEGIN NOW —I wouldn't ask you only, pursued he, on my solemn oath and God knows END
BEGIN NOW I'm on the rocks. END
BEGIN NOW —There'll be a job tomorrow or next day, Stephen told him, in a boys' END
BEGIN NOW school at Dalkey for a gentleman usher. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Garrett Deasy. END
BEGIN NOW Try it. END
BEGIN NOW You END
BEGIN NOW may mention my name. END
BEGIN NOW —Ah, God, Corley replied, sure I couldn't teach in a school, man. END
BEGIN NOW I was END
BEGIN NOW never one of your bright ones, he added with a half laugh. END
BEGIN NOW I got stuck END
BEGIN NOW twice in the junior at the christian brothers. END
BEGIN NOW —I have no place to sleep myself, Stephen informed him. END
BEGIN NOW Corley at the first go-off was inclined to suspect it was something to END
BEGIN NOW do with Stephen being fired out of his digs for bringing in a bloody END
BEGIN NOW tart off the street. END
BEGIN NOW There was a dosshouse in Marlborough street, Mrs END
BEGIN NOW Maloney's, but it was only a tanner touch and full of undesirables but END
BEGIN NOW M'Conachie told him you got a decent enough do in the Brazen Head over END
BEGIN NOW in Winetavern street (which was distantly suggestive to the person END
BEGIN NOW addressed of friar Bacon) for a bob. END
BEGIN NOW He was starving too though he END
BEGIN NOW hadn't said a word about it. END
BEGIN NOW Though this sort of thing went on every other night or very near it END
BEGIN NOW still Stephen's feelings got the better of him in a sense though he knew END
BEGIN NOW that Corley's brandnew rigmarole on a par with the others was hardly END
BEGIN NOW deserving of much credence. END
BEGIN NOW However haud ignarus malorum miseris END
BEGIN NOW succurrere disco etcetera as the Latin poet remarks especially as luck END
BEGIN NOW would have it he got paid his screw after every middle of the month on END
BEGIN NOW the sixteenth which was the date of the month as a matter of fact though END
BEGIN NOW a good bit of the wherewithal was demolished. END
BEGIN NOW But the cream of the joke END
BEGIN NOW was nothing would get it out of Corley's head that he was living in END
BEGIN NOW affluence and hadn't a thing to do but hand out the needful. END
BEGIN NOW Whereas. END
BEGIN NOW He END
BEGIN NOW put his hand in a pocket anyhow not with the idea of finding any food END
BEGIN NOW there but thinking he might lend him anything up to a bob or so in lieu END
BEGIN NOW so that he might endeavour at all events and get sufficient to eat but END
BEGIN NOW the result was in the negative for, to his chagrin, he found his cash END
BEGIN NOW missing. END
BEGIN NOW A few broken biscuits were all the result of his investigation. END
BEGIN NOW He tried his hardest to recollect for the moment whether he had lost as END
BEGIN NOW well he might have or left because in that contingency it was not a END
BEGIN NOW pleasant lookout, very much the reverse in fact. END
BEGIN NOW He was altogether too END
BEGIN NOW fagged out to institute a thorough search though he tried to recollect. END
BEGIN NOW About biscuits he dimly remembered. END
BEGIN NOW Who now exactly gave them he END
BEGIN NOW wondered or where was or did he buy. END
BEGIN NOW However in another pocket he came END
BEGIN NOW across what he surmised in the dark were pennies, erroneously however, END
BEGIN NOW as it turned out. END
BEGIN NOW —Those are halfcrowns, man, Corley corrected him. END
BEGIN NOW And so in point of fact they turned out to be. END
BEGIN NOW Stephen anyhow lent him END
BEGIN NOW one of them. END
BEGIN NOW —Thanks, Corley answered, you're a gentleman. END
BEGIN NOW I'll pay you back one END
BEGIN NOW time. END
BEGIN NOW Who's that with you? END
BEGIN NOW I saw him a few times in the Bleeding Horse END
BEGIN NOW in Camden street with Boylan, the billsticker. END
BEGIN NOW You might put in a good END
BEGIN NOW word for us to get me taken on there. END
BEGIN NOW I'd carry a sandwichboard only the END
BEGIN NOW girl in the office told me they're full up for the next three weeks, END
BEGIN NOW man. END
BEGIN NOW God, you've to book ahead, man, you'd think it was for the Carl END
BEGIN NOW Rosa. END
BEGIN NOW I don't give a shite anyway so long as I get a job, even as a END
BEGIN NOW crossing sweeper. END
BEGIN NOW Subsequently being not quite so down in the mouth after the two and six END
BEGIN NOW he got he informed Stephen about a fellow by the name of Bags Comisky END
BEGIN NOW that he said Stephen knew well out of Fullam's, the shipchandler's, END
BEGIN NOW bookkeeper there that used to be often round in Nagle's back with O'Mara END
BEGIN NOW and a little chap with a stutter the name of Tighe. END
BEGIN NOW Anyhow he was lagged END
BEGIN NOW the night before last and fined ten bob for a drunk and disorderly and END
BEGIN NOW refusing to go with the constable. END
BEGIN NOW 210 END
BEGIN NOW Mr Bloom in the meanwhile kept dodging about in the vicinity of the END
BEGIN NOW cobblestones near the brazier of coke in front of the corporation END
BEGIN NOW watchman's sentrybox who evidently a glutton for work, it struck him, END
BEGIN NOW was having a quiet forty winks for all intents and purposes on his own END
BEGIN NOW private account while Dublin slept. END
BEGIN NOW He threw an odd eye at the same time END
BEGIN NOW now and then at Stephen's anything but immaculately attired interlocutor END
BEGIN NOW as if he had seen that nobleman somewhere or other though where he was END
BEGIN NOW not in a position to truthfully state nor had he the remotest idea when. END
BEGIN NOW Being a levelheaded individual who could give points to not a few in END
BEGIN NOW point of shrewd observation he also remarked on his very dilapidated hat END
BEGIN NOW and slouchy wearing apparel generally testifying to a chronic END
BEGIN NOW impecuniosity. END
BEGIN NOW Palpably he was one of his hangerson but for the matter END
BEGIN NOW of that it was merely a question of one preying on his nextdoor END
BEGIN NOW neighbour all round, in every deep, so to put it, a deeper depth and for END
BEGIN NOW the matter of that if the man in the street chanced to be in the dock END
BEGIN NOW himself penal servitude with or without the option of a fine would be a END
BEGIN NOW very rara avis altogether. END
BEGIN NOW In any case he had a consummate amount of END
BEGIN NOW cool assurance intercepting people at that hour of the night or morning. END
BEGIN NOW Pretty thick that was certainly. END
BEGIN NOW The pair parted company and Stephen rejoined Mr Bloom who, with his END
BEGIN NOW practised eye, was not without perceiving that he had succumbed to the END
BEGIN NOW blandiloquence of the other parasite. END
BEGIN NOW Alluding to the encounter he said, END
BEGIN NOW laughingly, Stephen, that is: END
BEGIN NOW —He is down on his luck. END
BEGIN NOW He asked me to ask you to ask somebody named END
BEGIN NOW Boylan, a billsticker, to give him a job as a sandwichman. END
BEGIN NOW At this intelligence, in which he seemingly evinced little interest, Mr END
BEGIN NOW Bloom gazed abstractedly for the space of a half a second or so in the END
BEGIN NOW direction of a bucketdredger, rejoicing in the farfamed name of Eblana, END
BEGIN NOW moored alongside Customhouse quay and quite possibly out of repair, END
BEGIN NOW whereupon he observed evasively: END
BEGIN NOW —Everybody gets their own ration of luck, they say. END
BEGIN NOW Now you mention it END
BEGIN NOW his face was familiar to me. END
BEGIN NOW But, leaving that for the moment, how much END
BEGIN NOW did you part with, he queried, if I am not too inquisitive? END
BEGIN NOW —Half a crown, Stephen responded. END
BEGIN NOW I daresay he needs it to sleep END
BEGIN NOW somewhere. END
BEGIN NOW —Needs! END
BEGIN NOW Mr Bloom ejaculated, professing not the least surprise at the END
BEGIN NOW intelligence, I can quite credit the assertion and I guarantee he END
BEGIN NOW invariably does. END
BEGIN NOW Everyone according to his needs or everyone according END
BEGIN NOW to his deeds. END
BEGIN NOW But, talking about things in general, where, added he with END
BEGIN NOW a smile, will you sleep yourself? END
BEGIN NOW Walking to Sandycove is out of the END
BEGIN NOW question. END
BEGIN NOW And even supposing you did you won't get in after what END
BEGIN NOW occurred at Westland Row station. END
BEGIN NOW Simply fag out there for nothing. END
BEGIN NOW I END
BEGIN NOW don't mean to presume to dictate to you in the slightest degree but why END
BEGIN NOW did you leave your father's house? END
BEGIN NOW —To seek misfortune, was Stephen's answer. END
BEGIN NOW —I met your respected father on a recent occasion, Mr Bloom END
BEGIN NOW diplomatically returned, today in fact, or to be strictly accurate, on END
BEGIN NOW yesterday. END
BEGIN NOW Where does he live at present? END
BEGIN NOW I gathered in the course of END
BEGIN NOW conversation that he had moved. END
BEGIN NOW —I believe he is in Dublin somewhere, Stephen answered unconcernedly. END
BEGIN NOW Why? END
BEGIN NOW —A gifted man, Mr Bloom said of Mr Dedalus senior, in more respects than END
BEGIN NOW one and a born raconteur if ever there was one. END
BEGIN NOW He takes great pride, END
BEGIN NOW quite legitimate, out of you. END
BEGIN NOW You could go back perhaps, he hasarded, END
BEGIN NOW still thinking of the very unpleasant scene at Westland Row terminus END
BEGIN NOW when it was perfectly evident that the other two, Mulligan, that is, and END
BEGIN NOW that English tourist friend of his, who eventually euchred their third END
BEGIN NOW companion, were patently trying as if the whole bally station belonged END
BEGIN NOW to them to give Stephen the slip in the confusion, which they did. END
BEGIN NOW There was no response forthcoming to the suggestion however, such as it END
BEGIN NOW was, Stephen's mind's eye being too busily engaged in repicturing his END
BEGIN NOW family hearth the last time he saw it with his sister Dilly sitting by END
BEGIN NOW the ingle, her hair hanging down, waiting for some weak Trinidad shell END
BEGIN NOW cocoa that was in the sootcoated kettle to be done so that she and he END
BEGIN NOW could drink it with the oatmealwater for milk after the Friday herrings END
BEGIN NOW they had eaten at two a penny with an egg apiece for Maggy, Boody and END
BEGIN NOW Katey, the cat meanwhile under the mangle devouring a mess of eggshells END
BEGIN NOW and charred fish heads and bones on a square of brown paper, in END
BEGIN NOW accordance with the third precept of the church to fast and abstain on END
BEGIN NOW the days commanded, it being quarter tense or if not, ember days or END
BEGIN NOW something like that. END
BEGIN NOW —No, Mr Bloom repeated again, I wouldn't personally repose much trust in END
BEGIN NOW that boon companion of yours who contributes the humorous element, Dr END
BEGIN NOW Mulligan, as a guide, philosopher and friend if I were in your shoes. END
BEGIN NOW He END
BEGIN NOW knows which side his bread is buttered on though in all probability he END
BEGIN NOW never realised what it is to be without regular meals. END
BEGIN NOW Of course you END
BEGIN NOW didn't notice as much as I did. END
BEGIN NOW But it wouldn't occasion me the least END
BEGIN NOW surprise to learn that a pinch of tobacco or some narcotic was put in END
BEGIN NOW your drink for some ulterior object. END
BEGIN NOW He understood however from all he heard that Dr Mulligan was a versatile END
BEGIN NOW allround man, by no means confined to medicine only, who was rapidly END
BEGIN NOW coming to the fore in his line and, if the report was verified, bade END
BEGIN NOW fair to enjoy a flourishing practice in the not too distant future as a END
BEGIN NOW tony medical practitioner drawing a handsome fee for his services in END
BEGIN NOW addition to which professional status his rescue of that man from END
BEGIN NOW certain drowning by artificial respiration and what they call first aid END
BEGIN NOW at Skerries, or Malahide was it?, was, he was bound to admit, an END
BEGIN NOW exceedingly plucky deed which he could not too highly praise, so that END
BEGIN NOW frankly he was utterly at a loss to fathom what earthly reason could be END
BEGIN NOW at the back of it except he put it down to sheer cussedness or jealousy, END
BEGIN NOW pure and simple. END
BEGIN NOW —Except it simply amounts to one thing and he is what they call picking END
BEGIN NOW your brains, he ventured to throw out. END
BEGIN NOW The guarded glance of half solicitude half curiosity augmented by END
BEGIN NOW friendliness which he gave at Stephen's at present morose expression of END
BEGIN NOW features did not throw a flood of light, none at all in fact on the END
BEGIN NOW problem as to whether he had let himself be badly bamboozled to judge by END
BEGIN NOW two or three lowspirited remarks he let drop or the other way about saw END
BEGIN NOW through the affair and for some reason or other best known to himself END
BEGIN NOW allowed matters to more or less. END
BEGIN NOW Grinding poverty did have that effect END
BEGIN NOW and he more than conjectured that, high educational abilities though he END
BEGIN NOW possessed, he experienced no little difficulty in making both ends meet. END
BEGIN NOW Adjacent to the men's public urinal they perceived an icecream car round END
BEGIN NOW which a group of presumably Italians in heated altercation were getting END
BEGIN NOW rid of voluble expressions in their vivacious language in a particularly END
BEGIN NOW animated way, there being some little differences between the parties. END
BEGIN NOW —Puttana madonna, che ci dia i quattrini! END
BEGIN NOW Ho ragione? END
BEGIN NOW Culo rotto! END
BEGIN NOW —Intendiamoci. END
BEGIN NOW Mezzo sovrano piu... END
BEGIN NOW —Dice lui, pero! END
BEGIN NOW —Mezzo. END
BEGIN NOW —Farabutto! END
BEGIN NOW Mortacci sui! END
BEGIN NOW —Ma ascolta! END
BEGIN NOW Cinque la testa piu... END
BEGIN NOW Mr Bloom and Stephen entered the cabman's shelter, an unpretentious END
BEGIN NOW wooden structure, where, prior to then, he had rarely if ever been END
BEGIN NOW before, the former having previously whispered to the latter a few hints END
BEGIN NOW anent the keeper of it said to be the once famous Skin-the-Goat END
BEGIN NOW Fitzharris, the invincible, though he could not vouch for the actual END
BEGIN NOW facts which quite possibly there was not one vestige of truth in. END
BEGIN NOW A few END
BEGIN NOW moments later saw our two noctambules safely seated in a discreet corner END
BEGIN NOW only to be greeted by stares from the decidedly miscellaneous collection END
BEGIN NOW of waifs and strays and other nondescript specimens of the genus homo END
BEGIN NOW already there engaged in eating and drinking diversified by conversation END
BEGIN NOW for whom they seemingly formed an object of marked curiosity. END
BEGIN NOW —Now touching a cup of coffee, Mr Bloom ventured to plausibly suggest to END
BEGIN NOW break the ice, it occurs to me you ought to sample something in the END
BEGIN NOW shape of solid food, say, a roll of some description. END
BEGIN NOW Accordingly his first act was with characteristic sangfroid to order END
BEGIN NOW these commodities quietly. END
BEGIN NOW The hoi polloi of jarvies or stevedores or END
BEGIN NOW whatever they were after a cursory examination turned their eyes END
BEGIN NOW apparently dissatisfied, away though one redbearded bibulous individual END
BEGIN NOW portion of whose hair was greyish, a sailor probably, still stared for END
BEGIN NOW some appreciable time before transferring his rapt attention to the END
BEGIN NOW floor. END

BEGIN NOW just a bowing acquaintance with the language in dispute, though, to be END

BEGIN NOW I mean for singing purposes. END

BEGIN NOW Bella Poetria! END
BEGIN NOW It is so melodious and END
BEGIN NOW full. END
BEGIN NOW Belladonna. END
BEGIN NOW Voglio. END
BEGIN NOW Stephen, who was trying his dead best to yawn if he could, suffering END
BEGIN NOW from lassitude generally, replied: END
BEGIN NOW —To fill the ear of a cow elephant. END
BEGIN NOW They were haggling over money. END
BEGIN NOW —Is that so? END
BEGIN NOW Mr Bloom asked. END
BEGIN NOW Of course, he subjoined pensively, at the END

BEGIN NOW —Sounds are impostures, Stephen said after a pause of some little time, END
BEGIN NOW like names. END
BEGIN NOW Cicero, Podmore. END
BEGIN NOW Napoleon, Mr Goodbody. END
BEGIN NOW Jesus, Mr Doyle. END
BEGIN NOW Shakespeares were as common as Murphies. END
BEGIN NOW What's in a name? END
BEGIN NOW —Yes, to be sure, Mr Bloom unaffectedly concurred. END
BEGIN NOW Of course. END
BEGIN NOW Our name END
BEGIN NOW was changed too, he added, pushing the socalled roll across. END
BEGIN NOW The redbearded sailor who had his weather eye on the newcomers boarded END
BEGIN NOW Stephen, whom he had singled out for attention in particular, squarely END
BEGIN NOW by asking: END
BEGIN NOW —And what might your name be? END
BEGIN NOW Just in the nick of time Mr Bloom touched his companion's boot but END
BEGIN NOW Stephen, apparently disregarding the warm pressure from an unexpected END
BEGIN NOW quarter, answered: END
BEGIN NOW —Dedalus. END
BEGIN NOW The sailor stared at him heavily from a pair of drowsy baggy eyes, END
BEGIN NOW rather bunged up from excessive use of boose, preferably good old END
BEGIN NOW Hollands and water. END
BEGIN NOW —You know Simon Dedalus? END
BEGIN NOW he asked at length. END
BEGIN NOW —I've heard of him, Stephen said. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Bloom was all at sea for a moment, seeing the others evidently END
BEGIN NOW eavesdropping too. END
BEGIN NOW —He's Irish, the seaman bold affirmed, staring still in much the same END
BEGIN NOW way and nodding. END
BEGIN NOW All Irish. END
BEGIN NOW —All too Irish, Stephen rejoined. END
BEGIN NOW As for Mr Bloom he could neither make head or tail of the whole business END
BEGIN NOW and he was just asking himself what possible connection when the sailor END

BEGIN NOW The lefthand dead shot. END

BEGIN NOW Fifty yards measured. END
BEGIN NOW Eggs on the bottles. END
BEGIN NOW Cocks his gun over his shoulder. END
BEGIN NOW Aims. END
BEGIN NOW He turned his body half round, shut up his right eye completely. END

BEGIN NOW he then shouted once. END
BEGIN NOW The entire audience waited, anticipating an additional detonation, there END
BEGIN NOW being still a further egg. END
BEGIN NOW —Pom! END
BEGIN NOW he shouted twice. END
BEGIN NOW Egg two evidently demolished, he nodded and winked, adding END
BEGIN NOW bloodthirstily: END
BEGIN NOW —Buffalo Bill shoots to kill, Never missed nor he never will. END

BEGIN NOW now, sailing about. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Bloom could easily picture his advent on this scene, the homecoming END

BEGIN NOW The sailor, who scarcely seemed to be a Dublin resident, turned to one END

BEGIN NOW I shipped to get over. END

BEGIN NOW breadgraters. END

BEGIN NOW Martin Cunningham frequently said he would work a pass through Egan but END
BEGIN NOW some deuced hitch or other eternally cropped up with the net result that END
BEGIN NOW the scheme fell through. END
BEGIN NOW But even suppose it did come to planking down END
BEGIN NOW the needful and breaking Boyd's heart it was not so dear, purse END
BEGIN NOW permitting, a few guineas at the outside considering the fare to END
BEGIN NOW Mullingar where he figured on going was five and six, there and back. END
BEGIN NOW The trip would benefit health on account of the bracing ozone and be in END
BEGIN NOW every way thoroughly pleasurable, especially for a chap whose liver was END
BEGIN NOW out of order, seeing the different places along the route, Plymouth, END
BEGIN NOW Falmouth, Southampton and so on culminating in an instructive tour of END

BEGIN NOW where doubtless he would see the greatest improvement, tower, abbey, END
BEGIN NOW wealth of Park lane to renew acquaintance with. END
BEGIN NOW Another thing just END
BEGIN NOW struck him as a by no means bad notion was he might have a gaze around END
BEGIN NOW on the spot to see about trying to make arrangements about a concert END
BEGIN NOW tour of summer music embracing the most prominent pleasure resorts, END
BEGIN NOW Margate with mixed bathing and firstrate hydros and spas, Eastbourne, END

BEGIN NOW perfectly simple matter and he was quite sanguine of success, providing END
BEGIN NOW puffs in the local papers could be managed by some fellow with a bit of END

BEGIN NOW with pleasure. END
BEGIN NOW But who? END
BEGIN NOW That was the rub. END
BEGIN NOW Also, without being actually END
BEGIN NOW positive, it struck him a great field was to be opened up in the line of END
BEGIN NOW opening up new routes to keep pace with the times apropos of the END
BEGIN NOW Fishguard-Rosslare route which, it was mooted, was once more on the END
BEGIN NOW tapis in the circumlocution departments with the usual quantity of red END

BEGIN NOW A END
BEGIN NOW great opportunity there certainly was for push and enterprise to meet END
BEGIN NOW the travelling needs of the public at large, the average man, i.e. END
BEGIN NOW Brown, Robinson and Co. END
BEGIN NOW It was a subject of regret and absurd as well on the face of it and no END
BEGIN NOW small blame to our vaunted society that the man in the street, when the END
BEGIN NOW system really needed toning up, for the matter of a couple of paltry END
BEGIN NOW pounds was debarred from seeing more of the world they lived in instead END
BEGIN NOW of being always and ever cooped up since my old stick-in-the-mud took me END
BEGIN NOW for a wife. END
BEGIN NOW After all, hang it, they had their eleven and more humdrum END
BEGIN NOW months of it and merited a radical change of venue after the grind of END

BEGIN NOW spectacular best constituting nothing short of a new lease of life. END

BEGIN NOW pillar. END

BEGIN NOW other side of the card, picture, and passed it along to Stephen. END
BEGIN NOW —I seen a Chinese one time, related the doughty narrator, that had END

BEGIN NOW One was a ship, another was a house, END
BEGIN NOW another was a flower. END

BEGIN NOW the chinks does. END

BEGIN NOW Knife in his END
BEGIN NOW back. END
BEGIN NOW Knife like that. END

BEGIN NOW Fellow END
BEGIN NOW hid behind a door, come up behind him. END
BEGIN NOW Like that. END
BEGIN NOW Prepare to meet your END
BEGIN NOW God, says he. END
BEGIN NOW Chuk! END

BEGIN NOW Funny, very! END

BEGIN NOW He vividly END
