BEGIN NOW land troubles, when it took the civilised world by storm, figuratively END
BEGIN NOW speaking, early in the eighties, eightyone to be correct, when he was END
BEGIN NOW just turned fifteen. END
BEGIN NOW —Ay, boss, the sailor broke in. END
BEGIN NOW Give us back them papers. END
BEGIN NOW The request being complied with he clawed them up with a scrape. END
BEGIN NOW —Have you seen the rock of Gibraltar? END
BEGIN NOW Mr Bloom inquired. END
BEGIN NOW The sailor grimaced, chewing, in a way that might be read as yes, ay or END
BEGIN NOW no. END
BEGIN NOW —Ah, you've touched there too, Mr Bloom said, Europa point, thinking he END
BEGIN NOW had, in the hope that the rover might possibly by some reminiscences but END
BEGIN NOW he failed to do so, simply letting spirt a jet of spew into the sawdust, END
BEGIN NOW and shook his head with a sort of lazy scorn. END
BEGIN NOW —What year would that be about? END
BEGIN NOW Mr B interrogated. END
BEGIN NOW Can you recall the END
BEGIN NOW boats? END
BEGIN NOW Our soi-disant sailor munched heavily awhile hungrily before answering: END
BEGIN NOW —I'm tired of all them rocks in the sea, he said, and boats and ships. END
BEGIN NOW Salt junk all the time. END
BEGIN NOW Tired seemingly, he ceased. END
BEGIN NOW His questioner perceiving that he was not END
BEGIN NOW likely to get a great deal of change out of such a wily old customer, END
BEGIN NOW fell to woolgathering on the enormous dimensions of the water about the END
BEGIN NOW globe, suffice it to say that, as a casual glance at the map revealed, END
BEGIN NOW it covered fully three fourths of it and he fully realised accordingly END
BEGIN NOW what it meant to rule the waves. END
BEGIN NOW On more than one occasion, a dozen at END
BEGIN NOW the lowest, near the North Bull at Dollymount he had remarked a END
BEGIN NOW superannuated old salt, evidently derelict, seated habitually near the END
BEGIN NOW not particularly redolent sea on the wall, staring quite obliviously at END
BEGIN NOW it and it at him, dreaming of fresh woods and pastures new as someone END
BEGIN NOW somewhere sings. END
BEGIN NOW And it left him wondering why. END
BEGIN NOW Possibly he had tried to END
BEGIN NOW find out the secret for himself, floundering up and down the antipodes END
BEGIN NOW and all that sort of thing and over and under, well, not exactly under, END
BEGIN NOW tempting the fates. END
BEGIN NOW And the odds were twenty to nil there was really no END
BEGIN NOW secret about it at all. END
BEGIN NOW Nevertheless, without going into the minutiae of END
BEGIN NOW the business, the eloquent fact remained that the sea was there in all END
BEGIN NOW its glory and in the natural course of things somebody or other had to END
BEGIN NOW sail on it and fly in the face of providence though it merely went to END
BEGIN NOW show how people usually contrived to load that sort of onus on to the END
BEGIN NOW other fellow like the hell idea and the lottery and insurance which were END
BEGIN NOW run on identically the same lines so that for that very reason if no END
BEGIN NOW other lifeboat Sunday was a highly laudable institution to which the END
BEGIN NOW public at large, no matter where living inland or seaside, as the case END
BEGIN NOW might be, having it brought home to them like that should extend its END
BEGIN NOW gratitude also to the harbourmasters and coastguard service who had to END
BEGIN NOW man the rigging and push off and out amid the elements whatever the END
BEGIN NOW season when duty called Ireland expects that every man and so on and END
BEGIN NOW sometimes had a terrible time of it in the wintertime not forgetting the END
BEGIN NOW Irish lights, Kish and others, liable to capsize at any moment, rounding END
BEGIN NOW which he once with his daughter had experienced some remarkably choppy, END
BEGIN NOW not to say stormy, weather. END
BEGIN NOW —There was a fellow sailed with me in the Rover, the old seadog, himself END
BEGIN NOW a rover, proceeded, went ashore and took up a soft job as gentleman's END
BEGIN NOW valet at six quid a month. END
BEGIN NOW Them are his trousers I've on me and he gave END
BEGIN NOW me an oilskin and that jackknife. END
BEGIN NOW I'm game for that job, shaving and END
BEGIN NOW brushup. END
BEGIN NOW I hate roaming about. END
BEGIN NOW There's my son now, Danny, run off to sea END
BEGIN NOW and his mother got him took in a draper's in Cork where he could be END
BEGIN NOW drawing easy money. END
BEGIN NOW —What age is he? END
BEGIN NOW queried one hearer who, by the way, seen from the side, END
BEGIN NOW bore a distant resemblance to Henry Campbell, the townclerk, away from END
BEGIN NOW the carking cares of office, unwashed of course and in a seedy getup and END
BEGIN NOW a strong suspicion of nosepaint about the nasal appendage. END
BEGIN NOW —Why, the sailor answered with a slow puzzled utterance, my son, Danny? END
BEGIN NOW He'd be about eighteen now, way I figure it. END
BEGIN NOW The Skibbereen father hereupon tore open his grey or unclean anyhow END
BEGIN NOW shirt with his two hands and scratched away at his chest on which was to END
BEGIN NOW be seen an image tattooed in blue Chinese ink intended to represent an END
BEGIN NOW anchor. END
BEGIN NOW —There was lice in that bunk in Bridgwater, he remarked, sure as nuts. END
BEGIN NOW I END
BEGIN NOW must get a wash tomorrow or next day. END
BEGIN NOW It's them black lads I objects to. END
BEGIN NOW I hate those buggers. END
BEGIN NOW Suck your blood dry, they does. END
BEGIN NOW Seeing they were all looking at his chest he accommodatingly dragged his END
BEGIN NOW shirt more open so that on top of the timehonoured symbol of the END
BEGIN NOW mariner's hope and rest they had a full view of the figure 16 and a END
BEGIN NOW young man's sideface looking frowningly rather. END
BEGIN NOW —Tattoo, the exhibitor explained. END
BEGIN NOW That was done when we were Iying END
BEGIN NOW becalmed off Odessa in the Black Sea under Captain Dalton. END
BEGIN NOW Fellow, the END
BEGIN NOW name of Antonio, done that. END
BEGIN NOW There he is himself, a Greek. END
BEGIN NOW —Did it hurt much doing it? END
BEGIN NOW one asked the sailor. END
BEGIN NOW That worthy, however, was busily engaged in collecting round the. END
BEGIN NOW Someway in his. END
BEGIN NOW Squeezing or. END
BEGIN NOW —See here, he said, showing Antonio. END
BEGIN NOW There he is cursing the mate. END
BEGIN NOW And END
BEGIN NOW there he is now, he added, the same fellow, pulling the skin with his END
BEGIN NOW fingers, some special knack evidently, and he laughing at a yarn. END
BEGIN NOW And in point of fact the young man named Antonio's livid face did END
BEGIN NOW actually look like forced smiling and the curious effect excited the END
BEGIN NOW unreserved admiration of everybody including Skin-the-Goat, who this END
BEGIN NOW time stretched over. END
BEGIN NOW —Ay, ay, sighed the sailor, looking down on his manly chest. END
BEGIN NOW He's gone END
BEGIN NOW too. END
BEGIN NOW Ate by sharks after. END
BEGIN NOW Ay, ay. END
BEGIN NOW He let go of the skin so that the profile resumed the normal expression END
BEGIN NOW of before. END
BEGIN NOW —Neat bit of work, one longshoreman said. END
BEGIN NOW —And what's the number for? END
BEGIN NOW loafer number two queried. END
BEGIN NOW —Eaten alive? END
BEGIN NOW a third asked the sailor. END
BEGIN NOW —Ay, ay, sighed again the latter personage, more cheerily this time with END
BEGIN NOW some sort of a half smile for a brief duration only in the direction of END
BEGIN NOW the questioner about the number. END
BEGIN NOW Ate. END
BEGIN NOW A Greek he was. END
BEGIN NOW And then he added with rather gallowsbird humour considering his alleged END
BEGIN NOW end: END
BEGIN NOW —As bad as old Antonio, For he left me on my ownio. END
BEGIN NOW The face of a streetwalker glazed and haggard under a black straw hat END
BEGIN NOW peered askew round the door of the shelter palpably reconnoitring on her END
BEGIN NOW own with the object of bringing more grist to her mill. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Bloom, END
BEGIN NOW scarcely knowing which way to look, turned away on the moment END
BEGIN NOW flusterfied but outwardly calm, and, picking up from the table the pink END
BEGIN NOW sheet of the Abbey street organ which the jarvey, if such he was, had END
BEGIN NOW laid aside, he picked it up and looked at the pink of the paper though END
BEGIN NOW why pink. END
BEGIN NOW His reason for so doing was he recognised on the moment round END

BEGIN NOW lane who knew the lady in the brown costume does be with you (Mrs B.) END

BEGIN NOW Also why washing which seemed END
BEGIN NOW rather vague than not, your washing. END
BEGIN NOW Still candour compelled him to END
BEGIN NOW admit he had washed his wife's undergarments when soiled in Holles END
BEGIN NOW street and women would and did too a man's similar garments initialled END

BEGIN NOW loved him, that is to say, love me, love my dirty shirt. END
BEGIN NOW Still just END

BEGIN NOW sign to take herself off. END
BEGIN NOW Round the side of the Evening Telegraph he END

BEGIN NOW —The gunboat, the keeper said. END
BEGIN NOW —It beats me, Mr Bloom confided to Stephen, medically I am speaking, how END
BEGIN NOW a wretched creature like that from the Lock hospital reeking with END
BEGIN NOW disease can be barefaced enough to solicit or how any man in his sober END
BEGIN NOW senses, if he values his health in the least. END
BEGIN NOW Unfortunate creature! END
BEGIN NOW Of END
BEGIN NOW course I suppose some man is ultimately responsible for her condition. END
BEGIN NOW Still no matter what the cause is from... END
BEGIN NOW Stephen had not noticed her and shrugged his shoulders, merely END
BEGIN NOW remarking: END
BEGIN NOW —In this country people sell much more than she ever had and do a END
BEGIN NOW roaring trade. END
BEGIN NOW Fear not them that sell the body but have not power to END
BEGIN NOW buy the soul. END
BEGIN NOW She is a bad merchant. END
BEGIN NOW She buys dear and sells cheap. END
BEGIN NOW The elder man, though not by any manner of means an old maid or a prude, END
BEGIN NOW said it was nothing short of a crying scandal that ought to be put a END
BEGIN NOW stop to instanter to say that women of that stamp (quite apart from any END
BEGIN NOW oldmaidish squeamishness on the subject), a necessary evil, w ere not END
BEGIN NOW licensed and medically inspected by the proper authorities, a thing, he END
BEGIN NOW could truthfully state, he, as a paterfamilias, was a stalwart advocate END
BEGIN NOW of from the very first start. END
BEGIN NOW Whoever embarked on a policy of the sort, END
BEGIN NOW he said, and ventilated the matter thoroughly would confer a lasting END
BEGIN NOW boon on everybody concerned. END
BEGIN NOW —You as a good catholic, he observed, talking of body and soul, believe END
BEGIN NOW in the soul. END
BEGIN NOW Or do you mean the intelligence, the brainpower as such, as END
BEGIN NOW distinct from any outside object, the table, let us say, that cup. END
BEGIN NOW I END
BEGIN NOW believe in that myself because it has been explained by competent men as END
BEGIN NOW the convolutions of the grey matter. END
BEGIN NOW Otherwise we would never have such END
BEGIN NOW inventions as X rays, for instance. END
BEGIN NOW Do you? END
BEGIN NOW Thus cornered, Stephen had to make a superhuman effort of memory to try END
BEGIN NOW and concentrate and remember before he could say: END
BEGIN NOW —They tell me on the best authority it is a simple substance and END
BEGIN NOW therefore incorruptible. END
BEGIN NOW It would be immortal, I understand, but for the END
BEGIN NOW possibility of its annihilation by its First Cause Who, from all I can END
BEGIN NOW hear, is quite capable of adding that to the number of His other END
BEGIN NOW practical jokes, corruptio per se and corruptio per accidens both being END
BEGIN NOW excluded by court etiquette. END
BEGIN NOW Mr Bloom thoroughly acquiesced in the general gist of this though the END
BEGIN NOW mystical finesse involved was a bit out of his sublunary depth still he END
BEGIN NOW felt bound to enter a demurrer on the head of simple, promptly END
BEGIN NOW rejoining: END
BEGIN NOW —Simple? END
BEGIN NOW I shouldn't think that is the proper word. END
BEGIN NOW Of course, I grant END
BEGIN NOW you, to concede a point, you do knock across a simple soul once in a END
BEGIN NOW blue moon. END
BEGIN NOW But what I am anxious to arrive at is it is one thing for END

BEGIN NOW Faultfinding being a proverbially bad hat Mr Bloom thought well to stir END
BEGIN NOW or try to the clotted sugar from the bottom and reflected with something END

BEGIN NOW lucrative) work. END
BEGIN NOW To be sure it was a legitimate object and beyond yea or END

BEGIN NOW and useful lectures (admittance free) by qualified men for the lower END

BEGIN NOW The idea, he was strongly inclined to believe, was to END

BEGIN NOW took a sip of the offending beverage. END
BEGIN NOW —Still it's solid food, his good genius urged, I'm a stickler for solid END

BEGIN NOW manual. END
BEGIN NOW You ought to eat more solid food. END

BEGIN NOW man. END

BEGIN NOW knife. END

BEGIN NOW It reminds me of Roman history. END

BEGIN NOW —Our mutual friend's stories are like himself, Mr Bloom apropos of END
BEGIN NOW knives remarked to his confidante sotto voce. END
BEGIN NOW Do you think they are END
BEGIN NOW genuine? END
BEGIN NOW He could spin those yarns for hours on end all night long and END
BEGIN NOW lie like old boots. END
BEGIN NOW Look at him. END
BEGIN NOW Yet still though his eyes were thick with sleep and sea air life was END
BEGIN NOW full of a host of things and coincidences of a terrible nature and it END
BEGIN NOW was quite within the bounds of possibility that it was not an entire END
BEGIN NOW fabrication though at first blush there was not much inherent END
BEGIN NOW probability in all the spoof he got off his chest being strictly END

BEGIN NOW He had been meantime taking stock of the individual in front of him and END
BEGIN NOW Sherlockholmesing him up ever since he clapped eyes on him. END
BEGIN NOW Though a END
BEGIN NOW wellpreserved man of no little stamina, if a trifle prone to baldness, END
BEGIN NOW there was something spurious in the cut of his jib that suggested a jail END

BEGIN NOW such a weirdlooking specimen with the oakum and treadmill fraternity. END
BEGIN NOW He END
BEGIN NOW might even have done for his man supposing it was his own case he told, END

BEGIN NOW had served his four or five goodlooking years in durance vile to say END
BEGIN NOW nothing of the Antonio personage (no relation to the dramatic personage END

BEGIN NOW —Mind you, I'm not saying that it's all a pure invention, he resumed. END
BEGIN NOW Analogous scenes are occasionally, if not often, met with. END

BEGIN NOW midget queen. END

BEGIN NOW There's an example again of simple souls. END

BEGIN NOW —Spaniards, for instance, he continued, passionate temperaments like END

BEGIN NOW carry in the abdomen. END
BEGIN NOW It comes from the great heat, climate generally. END

BEGIN NOW Quite END
BEGIN NOW dark, regular brunette, black. END

BEGIN NOW accounts for character. END

BEGIN NOW Roberto ruba roba sua. END

BEGIN NOW It having become necessary for him END

BEGIN NOW A hoof scooped anyway for END
BEGIN NOW new foothold after sleep and harness jingled. END

BEGIN NOW having often painted the town tolerably pink without a beggarly stiver. END

BEGIN NOW After which effusion the redoubtable specimen duly arrived on the scene END
BEGIN NOW and regaining his seat he sank rather than sat heavily on the form END
BEGIN NOW provided. END
BEGIN NOW Skin-the-Goat, assuming he was he, evidently with an axe to END
BEGIN NOW grind, was airing his grievances in a forcible-feeble philippic anent END
BEGIN NOW the natural resources of Ireland or something of that sort which he END
BEGIN NOW described in his lengthy dissertation as the richest country bar none on END
BEGIN NOW the face of God's earth, far and away superior to England, with coal in END
BEGIN NOW large quantities, six million pounds worth of pork exported every year, END
BEGIN NOW ten millions between butter and eggs and all the riches drained out of END
BEGIN NOW it by England levying taxes on the poor people that paid through the END
BEGIN NOW nose always and gobbling up the best meat in the market and a lot more END
BEGIN NOW surplus steam in the same vein. END
BEGIN NOW Their conversation accordingly became END
BEGIN NOW general and all agreed that that was a fact. END
BEGIN NOW You could grow any mortal END
BEGIN NOW thing in Irish soil, he stated, and there was that colonel Everard down END
BEGIN NOW there in Navan growing tobacco. END
BEGIN NOW Where would you find anywhere the like END
BEGIN NOW of Irish bacon? END
BEGIN NOW But a day of reckoning, he stated crescendo with no END
BEGIN NOW uncertain voice, thoroughly monopolising all the conversation, was in END
BEGIN NOW store for mighty England, despite her power of pelf on account of her END
BEGIN NOW crimes. END
BEGIN NOW There would be a fall and the greatest fall in history. END
BEGIN NOW The END
BEGIN NOW Germans and the Japs were going to have their little lookin, he END
BEGIN NOW affirmed. END
BEGIN NOW The Boers were the beginning of the end. END
BEGIN NOW Brummagem England was END
BEGIN NOW toppling already and her downfall would be Ireland, her Achilles heel, END
BEGIN NOW which he explained to them about the vulnerable point of Achilles, the END
BEGIN NOW Greek hero, a point his auditors at once seized as he completely gripped END
BEGIN NOW their attention by showing the tendon referred to on his boot. END
BEGIN NOW His END
BEGIN NOW advice to every Irishman was: stay in the land of your birth and work END
BEGIN NOW for Ireland and live for Ireland. END
BEGIN NOW Ireland, Parnell said, could not spare END
BEGIN NOW a single one of her sons. END
BEGIN NOW Silence all round marked the termination of his finale. END
BEGIN NOW The impervious END
BEGIN NOW navigator heard these lurid tidings, undismayed. END
BEGIN NOW —Take a bit of doing, boss, retaliated that rough diamond palpably a bit END
BEGIN NOW peeved in response to the foregoing truism. END
BEGIN NOW To which cold douche referring to downfall and so on the keeper END
BEGIN NOW concurred but nevertheless held to his main view. END
BEGIN NOW —Who's the best troops in the army? END
BEGIN NOW the grizzled old veteran irately END
BEGIN NOW interrogated. END
BEGIN NOW And the best jumpers and racers? END
BEGIN NOW And the best admirals and END
BEGIN NOW generals we've got? END
BEGIN NOW Tell me that. END
BEGIN NOW —The Irish, for choice, retorted the cabby like Campbell, facial END
BEGIN NOW blemishes apart. END
BEGIN NOW —That's right, the old tarpaulin corroborated. END
BEGIN NOW The Irish catholic END
BEGIN NOW peasant. END
BEGIN NOW He's the backbone of our empire. END
BEGIN NOW You know Jem Mullins? END
BEGIN NOW While allowing him his individual opinions as everyman the keeper added END
BEGIN NOW he cared nothing for any empire, ours or his, and considered no Irishman END
BEGIN NOW worthy of his salt that served it. END
BEGIN NOW Then they began to have a few END
BEGIN NOW irascible words when it waxed hotter, both, needless to say, appealing END
BEGIN NOW to the listeners who followed the passage of arms with interest so long END
BEGIN NOW as they didn't indulge in recriminations and come to blows. END
BEGIN NOW From inside information extending over a series of years Mr Bloom was END
BEGIN NOW rather inclined to poohpooh the suggestion as egregious balderdash for, END
BEGIN NOW pending that consummation devoutly to be or not to be wished for, he was END
BEGIN NOW fully cognisant of the fact that their neighbours across the channel, END
BEGIN NOW unless they were much bigger fools than he took them for, rather END
BEGIN NOW concealed their strength than the opposite. END
BEGIN NOW It was quite on a par with END
BEGIN NOW the quixotic idea in certain quarters that in a hundred million years END
BEGIN NOW the coal seam of the sister island would be played out and if, as time END
BEGIN NOW went on, that turned out to be how the cat jumped all he could END
BEGIN NOW personally say on the matter was that as a host of contingencies, END
BEGIN NOW equally relevant to the issue, might occur ere then it was highly END
BEGIN NOW advisable in the interim to try to make the most of both countries even END
BEGIN NOW though poles apart. END
BEGIN NOW Another little interesting point, the amours of END
BEGIN NOW whores and chummies, to put it in common parlance, reminded him Irish END
BEGIN NOW soldiers had as often fought for England as against her, more so, in END
BEGIN NOW fact. END
BEGIN NOW And now, why? END
BEGIN NOW So the scene between the pair of them, the licensee END
BEGIN NOW of the place rumoured to be or have been Fitzharris, the famous END
BEGIN NOW invincible, and the other, obviously bogus, reminded him forcibly as END
BEGIN NOW being on all fours with the confidence trick, supposing, that is, it was END
BEGIN NOW prearranged as the lookeron, a student of the human soul if anything, END
BEGIN NOW the others seeing least of the game. END
BEGIN NOW And as for the lessee or keeper, END
BEGIN NOW who probably wasn't the other person at all, he (B.) couldn't help END
BEGIN NOW feeling and most properly it was better to give people like that the END
BEGIN NOW goby unless you were a blithering idiot altogether and refuse to have END
BEGIN NOW anything to do with them as a golden rule in private life and their END
BEGIN NOW felonsetting, there always being the offchance of a Dannyman coming END
BEGIN NOW forward and turning queen's evidence or king's now like Denis or Peter END
BEGIN NOW Carey, an idea he utterly repudiated. END
BEGIN NOW Quite apart from that he disliked END
BEGIN NOW those careers of wrongdoing and crime on principle. END
BEGIN NOW Yet, though such END
BEGIN NOW criminal propensities had never been an inmate of his bosom in any shape END
BEGIN NOW or form, he certainly did feel and no denying it (while inwardly END
BEGIN NOW remaining what he was) a certain kind of admiration for a man who had END
BEGIN NOW actually brandished a knife, cold steel, with the courage of his END
BEGIN NOW political convictions (though, personally, he would never be a party to END
BEGIN NOW any such thing), off the same bat as those love vendettas of the south, END
BEGIN NOW have her or swing for her, when the husband frequently, after some words END
BEGIN NOW passed between the two concerning her relations with the other lucky END
BEGIN NOW mortal (he having had the pair watched), inflicted fatal injuries on his END
BEGIN NOW adored one as a result of an alternative postnuptial liaison by plunging END
BEGIN NOW his knife into her, until it just struck him that Fitz, nicknamed Skin- END
BEGIN NOW the-Goat, merely drove the car for the actual perpetrators of the END
BEGIN NOW outrage and so was not, if he was reliably informed, actually party to END
BEGIN NOW the ambush which, in point of fact, was the plea some legal luminary END
BEGIN NOW saved his skin on. END
BEGIN NOW In any case that was very ancient history by now and END
BEGIN NOW as for our friend, the pseudo Skin-the-etcetera, he had transparently END
BEGIN NOW outlived his welcome. END
BEGIN NOW He ought to have either died naturally or on the END
BEGIN NOW scaffold high. END
BEGIN NOW Like actresses, always farewell positively last END
BEGIN NOW performance then come up smiling again. END
BEGIN NOW Generous to a fault of course, END
BEGIN NOW temperamental, no economising or any idea of the sort, always snapping END
BEGIN NOW at the bone for the shadow. END
BEGIN NOW So similarly he had a very shrewd suspicion END
BEGIN NOW that Mr Johnny Lever got rid of some l s d. END
BEGIN NOW in the course of his END
BEGIN NOW perambulations round the docks in the congenial atmosphere of the Old END
BEGIN NOW Ireland tavern, come back to Erin and so on. END
BEGIN NOW Then as for the other he END
BEGIN NOW had heard not so long before the same identical lingo as he told Stephen END
BEGIN NOW how he simply but effectually silenced the offender. END
BEGIN NOW —He took umbrage at something or other, that muchinjured but on the END
BEGIN NOW whole eventempered person declared, I let slip. END
BEGIN NOW He called me a jew and END
BEGIN NOW in a heated fashion offensively. END
BEGIN NOW So I without deviating from plain facts END
BEGIN NOW in the least told him his God, I mean Christ, was a jew too and all his END
BEGIN NOW family like me though in reality I'm not. END
BEGIN NOW That was one for him. END
BEGIN NOW A soft END
BEGIN NOW answer turns away wrath. END
BEGIN NOW He hadn't a word to say for himself as everyone END
BEGIN NOW saw. END
BEGIN NOW Am I not right? END
BEGIN NOW He turned a long you are wrong gaze on Stephen of timorous dark pride at END
BEGIN NOW the soft impeachment with a glance also of entreaty for he seemed to END
BEGIN NOW glean in a kind of a way that it wasn't all exactly. END
BEGIN NOW —Ex quibus, Stephen mumbled in a noncommittal accent, their two or four END
BEGIN NOW eyes conversing, Christus or Bloom his name is or after all any other, END
BEGIN NOW secundum carnem. END
BEGIN NOW —Of course, Mr B. END
BEGIN NOW proceeded to stipulate, you must look at both sides of END
BEGIN NOW the question. END
BEGIN NOW It is hard to lay down any hard and fast rules as to right END
BEGIN NOW and wrong but room for improvement all round there certainly is though END
BEGIN NOW every country, they say, our own distressful included, has the END
BEGIN NOW government it deserves. END
BEGIN NOW But with a little goodwill all round. END
BEGIN NOW It's all END
BEGIN NOW very fine to boast of mutual superiority but what about mutual equality. END
BEGIN NOW I resent violence and intolerance in any shape or form. END
BEGIN NOW It never reaches END
BEGIN NOW anything or stops anything. END
BEGIN NOW A revolution must come on the due END
BEGIN NOW instalments plan. END
BEGIN NOW It's a patent absurdity on the face of it to hate END
BEGIN NOW people because they live round the corner and speak another vernacular, END
BEGIN NOW in the next house so to speak. END
BEGIN NOW —Memorable bloody bridge battle and seven minutes' war, Stephen END
BEGIN NOW assented, between Skinner's alley and Ormond market. END
BEGIN NOW Yes, Mr Bloom thoroughly agreed, entirely endorsing the remark, that was END
BEGIN NOW overwhelmingly right. END
BEGIN NOW And the whole world was full of that sort of END
BEGIN NOW thing. END
BEGIN NOW —You just took the words out of my mouth, he said. END
BEGIN NOW A hocuspocus of END
BEGIN NOW conflicting evidence that candidly you couldn't remotely... END
BEGIN NOW All those wretched quarrels, in his humble opinion, stirring up bad END
BEGIN NOW blood, from some bump of combativeness or gland of some kind, END
BEGIN NOW erroneously supposed to be about a punctilio of honour and a flag, were END
BEGIN NOW very largely a question of the money question which was at the back of END
BEGIN NOW everything greed and jealousy, people never knowing when to stop. END
BEGIN NOW —They accuse, remarked he audibly. END
BEGIN NOW He turned away from the others who probably and spoke nearer to, so as END
BEGIN NOW the others in case they. END
BEGIN NOW —Jews, he softly imparted in an aside in Stephen's ear, are accused of END
BEGIN NOW ruining. END
BEGIN NOW Not a vestige of truth in it, I can safely say. END
BEGIN NOW History, would END
BEGIN NOW you be surprised to learn, proves up to the hilt Spain decayed when the END
BEGIN NOW inquisition hounded the jews out and England prospered when Cromwell, an END
BEGIN NOW uncommonly able ruffian who in other respects has much to answer for, END
BEGIN NOW imported them. END
BEGIN NOW Why? END
BEGIN NOW Because they are imbued with the proper spirit. END
BEGIN NOW They END
BEGIN NOW are practical and are proved to be so. END
BEGIN NOW I don't want to indulge in any END
BEGIN NOW because you know the standard works on the subject and then orthodox as END
BEGIN NOW you are. END
BEGIN NOW But in the economic, not touching religion, domain the priest END
BEGIN NOW spells poverty. END
BEGIN NOW Spain again, you saw in the war, compared with goahead END
BEGIN NOW America. END
BEGIN NOW Turks. END
BEGIN NOW It's in the dogma. END
BEGIN NOW Because if they didn't believe they'd END
BEGIN NOW go straight to heaven when they die they'd try to live better, at least END
BEGIN NOW so I think. END
BEGIN NOW That's the juggle on which the p.p's raise the wind on false END
BEGIN NOW pretences. END
BEGIN NOW I'm, he resumed with dramatic force, as good an Irishman as END
BEGIN NOW that rude person I told you about at the outset and I want to see END
BEGIN NOW everyone, concluded he, all creeds and classes pro rata having a END
BEGIN NOW comfortable tidysized income, in no niggard fashion either, something in END
BEGIN NOW the neighbourhood of Â£ 300 per annum. END
BEGIN NOW That's the vital issue at stake END
BEGIN NOW and it's feasible and would be provocative of friendlier intercourse END
BEGIN NOW between man and man. END
BEGIN NOW At least that's my idea for what it's worth. END
BEGIN NOW I call END
BEGIN NOW that patriotism. END
BEGIN NOW Ubi patria, as we learned a smattering of in our END
BEGIN NOW classical days in Alma Mater, vita bene. END
BEGIN NOW Where you can live well, the END
BEGIN NOW sense is, if you work. END
BEGIN NOW Over his untastable apology for a cup of coffee, listening to this END
BEGIN NOW synopsis of things in general, Stephen stared at nothing in particular. END
BEGIN NOW He could hear, of course, all kinds of words changing colour like those END
BEGIN NOW crabs about Ringsend in the morning burrowing quickly into all colours END
BEGIN NOW of different sorts of the same sand where they had a home somewhere END
BEGIN NOW beneath or seemed to. END
BEGIN NOW Then he looked up and saw the eyes that said or END
BEGIN NOW didn't say the words the voice he heard said, if you work. END
BEGIN NOW —Count me out, he managed to remark, meaning work. END
BEGIN NOW The eyes were surprised at this observation because as he, the person END
BEGIN NOW who owned them pro tem. END
BEGIN NOW observed or rather his voice speaking did, all END
BEGIN NOW must work, have to, together. END
BEGIN NOW —I mean, of course, the other hastened to affirm, work in the widest END
BEGIN NOW possible sense. END
BEGIN NOW Also literary labour not merely for the kudos of the END
BEGIN NOW thing. END
BEGIN NOW Writing for the newspapers which is the readiest channel END
BEGIN NOW nowadays. END
BEGIN NOW That's work too. END
BEGIN NOW Important work. END
BEGIN NOW After all, from the little I END
BEGIN NOW know of you, after all the money expended on your education you are END
BEGIN NOW entitled to recoup yourself and command your price. END
BEGIN NOW You have every bit END
BEGIN NOW as much right to live by your pen in pursuit of your philosophy as the END
BEGIN NOW peasant has. END
BEGIN NOW What? END
BEGIN NOW You both belong to Ireland, the brain and the brawn. END
BEGIN NOW Each is equally important. END
BEGIN NOW —You suspect, Stephen retorted with a sort of a half laugh, that I may END
BEGIN NOW be important because I belong to the faubourg Saint Patrice called END
BEGIN NOW Ireland for short. END
BEGIN NOW —I would go a step farther, Mr Bloom insinuated. END
BEGIN NOW —But I suspect, Stephen interrupted, that Ireland must be important END
BEGIN NOW because it belongs to me. END
BEGIN NOW —What belongs, queried Mr Bloom bending, fancying he was perhaps under END
BEGIN NOW some misapprehension. END
BEGIN NOW Excuse me. END
BEGIN NOW Unfortunately, I didn't catch the END
BEGIN NOW latter portion. END
BEGIN NOW What was it you...? END
BEGIN NOW Stephen, patently crosstempered, repeated and shoved aside his mug of END
BEGIN NOW coffee or whatever you like to call it none too politely, adding: 1170 END
BEGIN NOW —We can't change the country. END

BEGIN NOW down but in a quandary, as he couldn't tell exactly what construction to END

BEGIN NOW The rebuke of some END
BEGIN NOW kind was clearer than the other part. END

BEGIN NOW recent orgy spoke then with some asperity in a curious bitter way END

BEGIN NOW the utmost importance had not been all that was needful or he hadn't END

BEGIN NOW eyes more especially reminding him forcibly of father and sister, END

BEGIN NOW For instance END
BEGIN NOW there was the case of O'Callaghan, for one, the halfcrazy faddist, END

BEGIN NOW of lords because early in life the occupant of the throne, then heir END

BEGIN NOW veneer in a way scarcely intended by nature, a thing good Mrs Grundy, as END
BEGIN NOW the law stands, was terribly down on though not for the reason they END
BEGIN NOW thought they were probably whatever it was except women chiefly who were END
BEGIN NOW always fiddling more or less at one another it being largely a matter of END
BEGIN NOW dress and all the rest of it. END
BEGIN NOW Ladies who like distinctive underclothing END
BEGIN NOW should, and every welltailored man must, trying to make the gap wider END

BEGIN NOW his death. END

BEGIN NOW —That bitch, that English whore, did for him, the shebeen proprietor END
BEGIN NOW commented. END
BEGIN NOW She put the first nail in his coffin. END
BEGIN NOW —Fine lump of a woman all the same, the soi-disant townclerk Henry END
BEGIN NOW Campbell remarked, and plenty of her. END
BEGIN NOW She loosened many a man's thighs. END
BEGIN NOW I seen her picture in a barber's. END
BEGIN NOW The husband was a captain or an END
BEGIN NOW officer. END
BEGIN NOW —Ay, Skin-the-Goat amusingly added, he was and a cottonball one. END
BEGIN NOW This gratuitous contribution of a humorous character occasioned a fair END
BEGIN NOW amount of laughter among his entourage. END
BEGIN NOW As regards Bloom he, without the END
BEGIN NOW faintest suspicion of a smile, merely gazed in the direction of the door END
BEGIN NOW and reflected upon the historic story which had aroused extraordinary END
BEGIN NOW interest at the time when the facts, to make matters worse, were made END
BEGIN NOW public with the usual affectionate letters that passed between them full END
BEGIN NOW of sweet nothings. END
BEGIN NOW First it was strictly Platonic till nature intervened END
BEGIN NOW and an attachment sprang up between them till bit by bit matters came to END
BEGIN NOW a climax and the matter became the talk of the town till the staggering END
BEGIN NOW blow came as a welcome intelligence to not a few evildisposed, however, END
BEGIN NOW who were resolved upon encompassing his downfall though the thing was END
BEGIN NOW public property all along though not to anything like the sensational END
BEGIN NOW extent that it subsequently blossomed into. END
BEGIN NOW Since their names were END
BEGIN NOW coupled, though, since he was her declared favourite, where was the END
BEGIN NOW particular necessity to proclaim it to the rank and file from the END
BEGIN NOW housetops, the fact, namely, that he had shared her bedroom which came END
BEGIN NOW out in the witnessbox on oath when a thrill went through the packed END
BEGIN NOW court literally electrifying everybody in the shape of witnesses END
BEGIN NOW swearing to having witnessed him on such and such a particular date in END
BEGIN NOW the act of scrambling out of an upstairs apartment with the assistance END
BEGIN NOW of a ladder in night apparel, having gained admittance in the same END
BEGIN NOW fashion, a fact the weeklies, addicted to the lubric a little, simply END
BEGIN NOW coined shoals of money out of. END
BEGIN NOW Whereas the simple fact of the case was END
BEGIN NOW it was simply a case of the husband not being up to the scratch, with END
BEGIN NOW nothing in common between them beyond the name, and then a real man END
BEGIN NOW arriving on the scene, strong to the verge of weakness, falling a victim END
BEGIN NOW to her siren charms and forgetting home ties, the usual sequel, to bask END
BEGIN NOW in the loved one's smiles. END
BEGIN NOW The eternal question of the life connubial, END
BEGIN NOW needless to say, cropped up. END
BEGIN NOW Can real love, supposing there happens to END
BEGIN NOW be another chap in the case, exist between married folk? END
BEGIN NOW Poser. END
BEGIN NOW Though END
BEGIN NOW it was no concern of theirs absolutely if he regarded her with END
BEGIN NOW affection, carried away by a wave of folly. END
BEGIN NOW A magnificent specimen of END
BEGIN NOW manhood he was truly augmented obviously by gifts of a high order, as END
BEGIN NOW compared with the other military supernumerary that is (who was just the END
BEGIN NOW usual everyday farewell, my gallant captain kind of an individual in the END
BEGIN NOW light dragoons, the 18th hussars to be accurate) and inflammable END
BEGIN NOW doubtless (the fallen leader, that is, not the other) in his own END
BEGIN NOW peculiar way which she of course, woman, quickly perceived as highly END
BEGIN NOW likely to carve his way to fame which he almost bid fair to do till the END
BEGIN NOW priests and ministers of the gospel as a whole, his erstwhile staunch END
BEGIN NOW adherents, and his beloved evicted tenants for whom he had done yeoman END
BEGIN NOW service in the rural parts of the country by taking up the cudgels on END
BEGIN NOW their behalf in a way that exceeded their most sanguine expectations, END
BEGIN NOW very effectually cooked his matrimonial goose, thereby heaping coals of END
BEGIN NOW fire on his head much in the same way as the fabled ass's kick. END
BEGIN NOW Looking END
BEGIN NOW back now in a retrospective kind of arrangement all seemed a kind of END
BEGIN NOW dream. END
BEGIN NOW And then coming back was the worst thing you ever did because it END
BEGIN NOW went without saying you would feel out of place as things always moved END
BEGIN NOW with the times. END
BEGIN NOW Why, as he reflected, Irishtown strand, a locality he END
BEGIN NOW had not been in for quite a number of years looked different somehow END
BEGIN NOW since, as it happened, he went to reside on the north side. END
BEGIN NOW North or END
BEGIN NOW south, however, it was just the wellknown case of hot passion, pure and END
BEGIN NOW simple, upsetting the applecart with a vengeance and just bore out the END
BEGIN NOW very thing he was saying as she also was Spanish or half so, types that END
BEGIN NOW wouldn't do things by halves, passionate abandon of the south, casting END
BEGIN NOW every shred of decency to the winds. END
BEGIN NOW —Just bears out what I was saying, he, with glowing bosom said to END
BEGIN NOW Stephen, about blood and the sun. END
BEGIN NOW And, if I don't greatly mistake she END
BEGIN NOW was Spanish too. END
BEGIN NOW —The king of Spain's daughter, Stephen answered, adding something or END
BEGIN NOW other rather muddled about farewell and adieu to you Spanish onions and END

BEGIN NOW An awful lot of END

BEGIN NOW How they were fated to meet and an attachment sprang up END
BEGIN NOW between the two so that their names were coupled in the public eye was END
BEGIN NOW told in court with letters containing the habitual mushy and END
BEGIN NOW compromising expressions leaving no loophole to show that they openly END

BEGIN NOW He, B, enjoyed the distinction of being END
BEGIN NOW close to Erin's uncrowned king in the flesh when the thing occurred on END

BEGIN NOW As those were END
BEGIN NOW particularly hot times in the general hullaballoo Bloom sustained a END

BEGIN NOW course congregated lodging some place about the pit of the stomach, END
BEGIN NOW fortunately not of a grave character. END
BEGIN NOW His hat (Parnell's) a silk one was END
BEGIN NOW inadvertently knocked off and, as a matter of strict history, Bloom was END
BEGIN NOW the man who picked it up in the crush after witnessing the occurrence END

BEGIN NOW from his hat at the time all the same being a gentleman born with a END
BEGIN NOW stake in the country he, as a matter of fact, having gone into it more END
BEGIN NOW for the kudos of the thing than anything else, what's bred in the bone END
BEGIN NOW instilled into him in infancy at his mother's knee in the shape of END
BEGIN NOW knowing what good form was came out at once because he turned round to END
BEGIN NOW the donor and thanked him with perfect aplomb, saying: Thank you, sir, END

BEGIN NOW profession whose headgear Bloom also set to rights earlier in the course END
BEGIN NOW of the day, history repeating itself with a difference, after the burial END
BEGIN NOW of a mutual friend when they had left him alone in his glory after the END
BEGIN NOW grim task of having committed his remains to the grave. END
BEGIN NOW On the other hand what incensed him more inwardly was the blatant jokes END
BEGIN NOW of the cabman and so on who passed it all off as a jest, laughing 1530 END
BEGIN NOW immoderately, pretending to understand everything, the why and the END
BEGIN NOW wherefore, and in reality not knowing their own minds, it being a case END
BEGIN NOW for the two parties themselves unless it ensued that the legitimate END
BEGIN NOW husband happened to be a party to it owing to some anonymous letter from END
BEGIN NOW the usual boy Jones, who happened to come across them at the crucial END
BEGIN NOW moment in a loving position locked in one another's arms, drawing END
BEGIN NOW attention to their illicit proceedings and leading up to a domestic END
BEGIN NOW rumpus and the erring fair one begging forgiveness of her lord and END
BEGIN NOW master upon her knees and promising to sever the connection and not END
BEGIN NOW receive his visits any more if only the aggrieved husband would overlook END
BEGIN NOW the matter and let bygones be bygones with tears in her eyes though END
BEGIN NOW possibly with her tongue in her fair cheek at the same time as quite END
BEGIN NOW possibly there were several others. END
BEGIN NOW He personally, being of a sceptical END
BEGIN NOW bias, believed and didn't make the smallest bones about saying so either END
BEGIN NOW that man or men in the plural were always hanging around on the waiting END
BEGIN NOW list about a lady, even supposing she was the best wife in the world and END
BEGIN NOW they got on fairly well together for the sake of argument, when, END
BEGIN NOW neglecting her duties, she chose to be tired of wedded life and was on END
BEGIN NOW for a little flutter in polite debauchery to press their attentions on END
BEGIN NOW her with improper intent, the upshot being that her affections centred END
BEGIN NOW on another, the cause of many liaisons between still attractive married END
BEGIN NOW women getting on for fair and forty and younger men, no doubt as several END
BEGIN NOW famous cases of feminine infatuation proved up to the hilt. END
BEGIN NOW It was a thousand pities a young fellow, blessed with an allowance of END
BEGIN NOW brains as his neighbour obviously was, should waste his valuable time END
BEGIN NOW with profligate women who might present him with a nice dose to last him END
BEGIN NOW his lifetime. END
BEGIN NOW In the nature of single blessedness he would one day take END
BEGIN NOW unto himself a wife when Miss Right came on the scene but in the interim END
BEGIN NOW ladies' society was a conditio sine qua non though he had the gravest END
BEGIN NOW possible doubts, not that he wanted in the smallest to pump Stephen END
BEGIN NOW about Miss Ferguson (who was very possibly the particular lodestar who END

BEGIN NOW and the company of smirking misses without a penny to their names bi or END
BEGIN NOW triweekly with the orthodox preliminary canter of complimentplaying and END
BEGIN NOW walking out leading up to fond lovers' ways and flowers and chocs. END
BEGIN NOW To END
BEGIN NOW think of him house and homeless, rooked by some landlady worse than any END
BEGIN NOW stepmother, was really too bad at his age. END

BEGIN NOW popped out with attracted the elder man who was several years the END

BEGIN NOW —At what o'clock did you dine? END
BEGIN NOW he questioned of the slim form and tired END
BEGIN NOW though unwrinkled face. END
BEGIN NOW —Some time yesterday, Stephen said. END
BEGIN NOW —Yesterday! END
BEGIN NOW exclaimed Bloom till he remembered it was already tomorrow END
BEGIN NOW Friday. END
BEGIN NOW Ah, you mean it's after twelve! END
BEGIN NOW —The day before yesterday, Stephen said, improving on himself. END
BEGIN NOW Literally astounded at this piece of intelligence Bloom reflected. END
BEGIN NOW Though they didn't see eye to eye in everything a certain analogy there END
BEGIN NOW somehow was as if both their minds were travelling, so to speak, in the END
BEGIN NOW one train of thought. END
BEGIN NOW At his age when dabbling in politics roughly some END
BEGIN NOW score of years previously when he had been a quasi aspirant to END

BEGIN NOW For instance when the END
BEGIN NOW evicted tenants question, then at its first inception, bulked largely in END

BEGIN NOW farther than Michael Davitt in the striking views he at one time END
BEGIN NOW inculcated as a backtothelander, which was one reason he strongly END

BEGIN NOW themselves were concerned, he was only too conscious of the casualties END
BEGIN NOW invariably resulting from propaganda and displays of mutual animosity END

BEGIN NOW fine young fellows, chiefly, destruction of the fittest, in a word. END
BEGIN NOW Anyhow upon weighing up the pros and cons, getting on for one, as it END
BEGIN NOW was, it was high time to be retiring for the night. END
BEGIN NOW The crux was it was END
BEGIN NOW a bit risky to bring him home as eventualities might possibly ensue END
BEGIN NOW (somebody having a temper of her own sometimes) and spoil the hash END
BEGIN NOW altogether as on the night he misguidedly brought home a dog (breed END
BEGIN NOW unknown) with a lame paw (not that the cases were either identical or END

BEGIN NOW very distinctly remembered, having been there, so to speak. END
BEGIN NOW On the other END
BEGIN NOW hand it was altogether far and away too late for the Sandymount or END

BEGIN NOW Everything pointed to the fact that it behoved him END
BEGIN NOW to avail himself to the full of the opportunity, all things considered. END
BEGIN NOW His initial impression was he was a shade standoffish or not over END
BEGIN NOW effusive but it grew on him someway. END
BEGIN NOW For one thing he mightn't what you END
BEGIN NOW call jump at the idea, if approached, and what mostly worried him was he END

BEGIN NOW At all events he wound up by concluding, END
BEGIN NOW eschewing for the nonce hidebound precedent, a cup of Epps's cocoa and a END

BEGIN NOW doubled into a pillow at least he would be in safe hands and as warm as END
BEGIN NOW a toast on a trivet he failed to perceive any very vast amount of harm END

BEGIN NOW move had to be made because that merry old soul, the grasswidower in END

BEGIN NOW remarks passim. END

BEGIN NOW Achilles. END
BEGIN NOW Your god was a jew. END
BEGIN NOW Because mostly they appeared to imagine he END

BEGIN NOW vicinity. END
BEGIN NOW You can't drink that stuff. END
BEGIN NOW Do you like cocoa? END

BEGIN NOW of the shanty who didn't seem to. END
BEGIN NOW —Yes, that's the best, he assured Stephen to whom for the matter of that END

BEGIN NOW All kinds of Utopian plans were flashing through his (B's) busy brain, END

BEGIN NOW The sailor lugged out from a case he had a pair of greenish goggles END

BEGIN NOW the sympathetic personage like the townclerk END
BEGIN NOW queried. END

BEGIN NOW manner of speaking. END

BEGIN NOW and Red as a Rose is She. END

BEGIN NOW remark. END
BEGIN NOW To cut a long story short Bloom, grasping the situation, was the first END

BEGIN NOW not looking to the effect that the amount due was forthcoming, making a END

BEGIN NOW night air was certainly now a treat to breathe though Stephen was a bit END

BEGIN NOW The only thing is to walk then you'll feel a different man. END
BEGIN NOW Come. END
BEGIN NOW It's not far. END
BEGIN NOW Lean on me. END
BEGIN NOW Accordingly he passed his left arm in Stephen's right and led him on END
BEGIN NOW accordingly. END
BEGIN NOW —Yes, Stephen said uncertainly because he thought he felt a strange kind END
BEGIN NOW of flesh of a different man approach him, sinewless and wobbly and all END
BEGIN NOW that. END
BEGIN NOW Anyhow they passed the sentrybox with stones, brazier etc. END
BEGIN NOW where the END
BEGIN NOW municipal supernumerary, ex Gumley, was still to all intents and END

BEGIN NOW fresh fields and pastures new. END
BEGIN NOW And apropos of coffin of stones the END
BEGIN NOW analogy was not at all bad as it was in fact a stoning to death on the END
BEGIN NOW part of seventytwo out of eighty odd constituencies that ratted at the END
BEGIN NOW time of the split and chiefly the belauded peasant class, probably the END
BEGIN NOW selfsame evicted tenants he had put in their holdings. END
BEGIN NOW So they turned on to chatting about music, a form of art for which END
BEGIN NOW Bloom, as a pure amateur, possessed the greatest love, as they made END
BEGIN NOW tracks arm in arm across Beresford place. END
BEGIN NOW Wagnerian music, though END
BEGIN NOW confessedly grand in its way, was a bit too heavy for Bloom and hard to END
BEGIN NOW follow at the first go-off but the music of Mercadante's Huguenots, END
BEGIN NOW Meyerbeer's Seven Last Words on the Cross and Mozart's Twelfth Mass he END
BEGIN NOW simply revelled in, the Gloria in that being, to his mind, the acme of END
BEGIN NOW first class music as such, literally knocking everything else into a END
BEGIN NOW cocked hat. END
BEGIN NOW He infinitely preferred the sacred music of the catholic END
BEGIN NOW church to anything the opposite shop could offer in that line such as END
BEGIN NOW those Moody and Sankey hymns or Bid me to live and i will live thy END
BEGIN NOW protestant to be. END
BEGIN NOW He also yielded to none in his admiration of Rossini's END
BEGIN NOW Stabat Mater, a work simply abounding in immortal numbers, in which his END
BEGIN NOW wife, Madam Marion Tweedy, made a hit, a veritable sensation, he might END
BEGIN NOW safely say, greatly adding to her other laureis and putting the others END
BEGIN NOW totally in the shade, in the jesuit fathers' church in upper Gardiner END
BEGIN NOW street, the sacred edifice being thronged to the doors to hear her with END
BEGIN NOW virtuosos, or virtuosi rather. END
BEGIN NOW There was the unanimous opinion that END
BEGIN NOW there was none to come up to her and suffice it to say in a place of END
BEGIN NOW worship for music of a sacred character there was a generally voiced END
BEGIN NOW desire for an encore. END
BEGIN NOW On the whole though favouring preferably light END
BEGIN NOW opera of the Don Giovanni description and Martha, a gem in its line, he END
BEGIN NOW had a penchant, though with only a surface knowledge, for the severe END
BEGIN NOW classical school such as Mendelssohn. END
BEGIN NOW And talking of that, taking it for END
BEGIN NOW granted he knew all about the old favourites, he mentioned par END
BEGIN NOW excellence Lionel's air in Martha, M'appari, which, curiously enough, he END
BEGIN NOW had heard or overheard, to be more accurate, on yesterday, a privilege END
BEGIN NOW he keenly appreciated, from the lips of Stephen's respected father, sung END
BEGIN NOW to perfection, a study of the number, in fact, which made all the others END
BEGIN NOW take a back seat. END
BEGIN NOW Stephen, in reply to a politely put query, said he END
BEGIN NOW didn't sing it but launched out into praises of Shakespeare's songs, at END
BEGIN NOW least of in or about that period, the lutenist Dowland who lived in END
BEGIN NOW Fetter lane near Gerard the herbalist, who anno ludendo hausi, END
BEGIN NOW Doulandus, an instrument he was contemplating purchasing from Mr Arnold END
BEGIN NOW Dolmetsch, whom B. END
BEGIN NOW did not quite recall though the name certainly END
BEGIN NOW sounded familiar, for sixtyfive guineas and Farnaby and son with their END
BEGIN NOW dux and comes conceits and Byrd (William) who played the virginals, he END
BEGIN NOW said, in the Queen's chapel or anywhere else he found them and one END
BEGIN NOW Tomkins who made toys or airs and John Bull. END
BEGIN NOW On the roadway which they were approaching whilst still speaking beyond END
BEGIN NOW the swingchains a horse, dragging a sweeper, paced on the paven ground, END
BEGIN NOW brushing a long swathe of mire up so that with the noise Bloom was not END
BEGIN NOW perfectly certain whether he had caught aright the allusion to sixtyfive END
BEGIN NOW guineas and John Bull. END
BEGIN NOW He inquired if it was John Bull the political END
BEGIN NOW celebrity of that ilk, as it struck him, the two identical names, as a END
BEGIN NOW striking coincidence. END
BEGIN NOW By the chains the horse slowly swerved to turn, which perceiving, Bloom, END
BEGIN NOW who was keeping a sharp lookout as usual, plucked the other's sleeve END
BEGIN NOW gently, jocosely remarking: END
BEGIN NOW —Our lives are in peril tonight. END
BEGIN NOW Beware of the steamroller. END
BEGIN NOW They thereupon stopped. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom looked at the head of a horse not worth END
BEGIN NOW anything like sixtyfive guineas, suddenly in evidence in the dark quite END
BEGIN NOW near so that it seemed new, a different grouping of bones and even flesh END
BEGIN NOW because palpably it was a fourwalker, a hipshaker, a blackbuttocker, a END
BEGIN NOW taildangler, a headhanger putting his hind foot foremost the while the END
BEGIN NOW lord of his creation sat on the perch, busy with his thoughts. END
BEGIN NOW But such END
BEGIN NOW a good poor brute he was sorry he hadn't a lump of sugar but, as he END
BEGIN NOW wisely reflected, you could scarcely be prepared for every emergency END
BEGIN NOW that might crop up. END
BEGIN NOW He was just a big nervous foolish noodly kind of a END
BEGIN NOW horse, without a second care in the world. END
BEGIN NOW But even a dog, he reflected, END
BEGIN NOW take that mongrel in Barney Kiernan's, of the same size, would be a holy END
BEGIN NOW horror to face. END
BEGIN NOW But it was no animal's fault in particular if he was END
BEGIN NOW built that way like the camel, ship of the desert, distilling grapes END
BEGIN NOW into potheen in his hump. END
BEGIN NOW Nine tenths of them all could be caged or END
BEGIN NOW trained, nothing beyond the art of man barring the bees. END
BEGIN NOW Whale with a END
BEGIN NOW harpoon hairpin, alligator tickle the small of his back and he sees the END
BEGIN NOW joke, chalk a circle for a rooster, tiger my eagle eye. END
BEGIN NOW These timely END
BEGIN NOW reflections anent the brutes of the field occupied his mind somewhat END
BEGIN NOW distracted from Stephen's words while the ship of the street was END
BEGIN NOW manoeuvring and Stephen went on about the highly interesting old. END
BEGIN NOW —What's this I was saying? END
BEGIN NOW Ah, yes! END
BEGIN NOW My wife, he intimated, plunging in END
BEGIN NOW medias res, would have the greatest of pleasure in making your END
BEGIN NOW acquaintance as she is passionately attached to music of any kind. END
BEGIN NOW He looked sideways in a friendly fashion at the sideface of Stephen, END
BEGIN NOW image of his mother, which was not quite the same as the usual handsome END
BEGIN NOW blackguard type they unquestionably had an insatiable hankering after as END
BEGIN NOW he was perhaps not that way built. END
BEGIN NOW Still, supposing he had his father's gift as he more than suspected, it END
BEGIN NOW opened up new vistas in his mind such as Lady Fingall's Irish END
BEGIN NOW industries, concert on the preceding Monday, and aristocracy in general. END
BEGIN NOW Exquisite variations he was now describing on an air Youth here has End END
BEGIN NOW by Jans Pieter Sweelinck, a Dutchman of Amsterdam where the frows come END
BEGIN NOW from. END
BEGIN NOW Even more he liked an old German song of Johannes Jeep about the END
BEGIN NOW clear sea and the voices of sirens, sweet murderers of men, which END
BEGIN NOW boggled Bloom a bit: END
BEGIN NOW Von der Sirenen Listigkeit Tun die Poeten dichten. END
BEGIN NOW These opening bars he sang and translated extempore. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom, nodding, END
BEGIN NOW said he perfectly understood and begged him to go on by all means which END
BEGIN NOW he did. END
BEGIN NOW A phenomenally beautiful tenor voice like that, the rarest of boons, END
BEGIN NOW which Bloom appreciated at the very first note he got out, could easily, END
BEGIN NOW if properly handled by some recognised authority on voice production END
BEGIN NOW such as Barraclough and being able to read music into the bargain, END
BEGIN NOW command its own price where baritones were ten a penny and procure for END
BEGIN NOW its fortunate possessor in the near future an entrÃ©e into fashionable END
BEGIN NOW houses in the best residential quarters of financial magnates in a large END
BEGIN NOW way of business and titled people where with his university degree of B. END
BEGIN NOW A. END
BEGIN NOW (a huge ad in its way) and gentlemanly bearing to all the more END
BEGIN NOW influence the good impression he would infallibly score a distinct END
BEGIN NOW success, being blessed with brains which also could be utilised for the END
BEGIN NOW purpose and other requisites, if his clothes were properly attended to END
BEGIN NOW so as to the better worm his way into their good graces as he, a END
BEGIN NOW youthful tyro in—society's sartorial niceties, hardly understood how a END
BEGIN NOW little thing like that could militate against you. END
BEGIN NOW It was in fact only a END
BEGIN NOW matter of months and he could easily foresee him participating in their END
BEGIN NOW musical and artistic conversaziones during the festivities of the END
BEGIN NOW Christmas season, for choice, causing a slight flutter in the dovecotes END
BEGIN NOW of the fair sex and being made a lot of by ladies out for sensation, END
BEGIN NOW cases of which, as he happened to know, were on record—in fact, without END
BEGIN NOW giving the show away, he himself once upon a time, if he cared to, could END
BEGIN NOW easily have. END
BEGIN NOW Added to which of course would be the pecuniary emolument END
BEGIN NOW by no means to be sneezed at, going hand in hand with his tuition fees. END
BEGIN NOW Not, he parenthesised, that for the sake of filthy lucre he need END
BEGIN NOW necessarily embrace the lyric platform as a walk in life for any lengthy END
BEGIN NOW space of time. END
BEGIN NOW But a step in the required direction it was beyond yea or END
BEGIN NOW nay and both monetarily and mentally it contained no reflection on his END
BEGIN NOW dignity in the smallest and it often turned in uncommonly handy to be END
BEGIN NOW handed a cheque at a muchneeded moment when every little helped. END
BEGIN NOW Besides, though taste latterly had deteriorated to a degree, original END
BEGIN NOW music like that, different from the conventional rut, would rapidly have END
BEGIN NOW a great vogue as it would be a decided novelty for Dublin's musical END
BEGIN NOW world after the usual hackneyed run of catchy tenor solos foisted on a END
BEGIN NOW confiding public by Ivan St Austell and Hilton St Just and their genus END
BEGIN NOW omne. END
BEGIN NOW Yes, beyond a shadow of a doubt he could with all the cards in his END
BEGIN NOW hand and he had a capital opening to make a name for himself and win a END
BEGIN NOW high place in the city's esteem where he could command a stiff figure END
BEGIN NOW and, booking ahead, give a grand concert for the patrons of the King END
BEGIN NOW street house, given a backerup, if one were forthcoming to kick him END
BEGIN NOW upstairs, so to speak, a big if, however, with some impetus of the END
BEGIN NOW goahead sort to obviate the inevitable procrastination which often END
BEGIN NOW tripped-up a too much fÃªted prince of good fellows. END
BEGIN NOW And it need not END
BEGIN NOW detract from the other by one iota as, being his own master, he would END
BEGIN NOW have heaps of time to practise literature in his spare moments when END
BEGIN NOW desirous of so doing without its clashing with his vocal career or END
BEGIN NOW containing anything derogatory whatsoever as it was a matter for himself END
BEGIN NOW alone. END
BEGIN NOW In fact, he had the ball at his feet and that was the very reason END
BEGIN NOW why the other, possessed of a remarkably sharp nose for smelling a rat END
BEGIN NOW of any sort, hung on to him at all. END
BEGIN NOW The horse was just then. END
BEGIN NOW And later on at a propitious opportunity he END
BEGIN NOW purposed (Bloom did), without anyway prying into his private affairs on END
BEGIN NOW the fools step in where angels principle, advising him to sever his END
BEGIN NOW connection with a certain budding practitioner who, he noticed, was END
BEGIN NOW prone to disparage and even to a slight extent with some hilarious END
BEGIN NOW pretext when not present, deprecate him, or whatever you like to call it END
BEGIN NOW which in Bloom's humble opinion threw a nasty sidelight on that side of END
BEGIN NOW a person's character, no pun intended. END
BEGIN NOW The horse having reached the end of his tether, so to speak, halted and, END
BEGIN NOW rearing high a proud feathering tail, added his quota by letting fall on END
BEGIN NOW the floor which the brush would soon brush up and polish, three smoking END
BEGIN NOW globes of turds. END
BEGIN NOW Slowly three times, one after another, from a full END
BEGIN NOW crupper he mired. END
BEGIN NOW And humanely his driver waited till he (or she) had END
BEGIN NOW ended, patient in his scythed car. END
BEGIN NOW Side by side Bloom, profiting by the contretemps, with Stephen passed END
BEGIN NOW through the gap of the chains, divided by the upright, and, stepping END
BEGIN NOW over a strand of mire, went across towards Gardiner street lower, END
BEGIN NOW Stephen singing more boldly, but not loudly, the end of the ballad. END
BEGIN NOW Und alle Schiffe brÃ¼cken. END
BEGIN NOW The driver never said a word, good, bad or indifferent, but merely END
BEGIN NOW watched the two figures, as he sat on his lowbacked car, both black, one END
BEGIN NOW full, one lean, walk towards the railway bridge, to be married by Father END
BEGIN NOW Maher. END
BEGIN NOW As they walked they at times stopped and walked again continuing END
BEGIN NOW their tÃªte-Ã -tÃªte (which, of course, he was utterly out of) about END
BEGIN NOW sirens enemies of man's reason, mingled with a number of other topics of END
BEGIN NOW the same category, usurpers, historical cases of the kind while the man END
BEGIN NOW in the sweeper car or you might as well call it in the sleeper car who END
BEGIN NOW in any case couldn't possibly hear because they were too far simply sat END
BEGIN NOW in his seat near the end of lower Gardiner street and looked after their END
BEGIN NOW lowbacked car. END
BEGIN NOW [ 17 ] END
BEGIN NOW What parallel courses did Bloom and Stephen follow returning? END
BEGIN NOW Starting united both at normal walking pace from Beresford place they END
BEGIN NOW followed in the order named Lower and Middle Gardiner streets and END
BEGIN NOW Mountjoy square, west: then, at reduced pace, each bearing left, END
BEGIN NOW Gardiner's place by an inadvertence as far as the farther corner of END
BEGIN NOW Temple street: then, at reduced pace with interruptions of halt, bearing END
BEGIN NOW right, Temple street, north, as far as Hardwicke place. END
BEGIN NOW Approaching, END
BEGIN NOW disparate, at relaxed walking pace they crossed both the circus before END
BEGIN NOW George's church diametrically, the chord in any circle being less than END
BEGIN NOW the arc which it subtends. END
BEGIN NOW Of what did the duumvirate deliberate during their itinerary? END
BEGIN NOW Music, literature, Ireland, Dublin, Paris, friendship, woman, END
BEGIN NOW prostitution, diet, the influence of gaslight or the light of arc and END
BEGIN NOW glowlamps on the growth of adjoining paraheliotropic trees, exposed END
BEGIN NOW corporation emergency dustbuckets, the Roman catholic church, END
BEGIN NOW ecclesiastical celibacy, the Irish nation, jesuit education, careers, END
BEGIN NOW the study of medicine, the past day, the maleficent influence of the END
BEGIN NOW presabbath, Stephen's collapse. END
BEGIN NOW Did Bloom discover common factors of similarity between their respective END
BEGIN NOW like and unlike reactions to experience? END
BEGIN NOW Both were sensitive to artistic impressions, musical in preference to END
BEGIN NOW plastic or pictorial. END
BEGIN NOW Both preferred a continental to an insular manner END
BEGIN NOW of life, a cisatlantic to a transatlantic place of residence. END
BEGIN NOW Both END
BEGIN NOW indurated by early domestic training and an inherited tenacity of END
BEGIN NOW heterodox resistance professed their disbelief in many orthodox END
BEGIN NOW religious, national, social and ethical doctrines. END
BEGIN NOW Both admitted the END
BEGIN NOW alternately stimulating and obtunding influence of heterosexual END
BEGIN NOW magnetism. END
BEGIN NOW Were their views on some points divergent? END
BEGIN NOW Stephen dissented openly from Bloom's views on the importance of dietary END
BEGIN NOW and civic selfhelp while Bloom dissented tacitly from Stephen's views on END
BEGIN NOW the eternal affirmation of the spirit of man in literature. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom END
BEGIN NOW assented covertly to Stephen's rectification of the anachronism involved END
BEGIN NOW in assigning the date of the conversion of the Irish nation to END
BEGIN NOW christianity from druidism by Patrick son of Calpornus, son of Potitus, END
BEGIN NOW son of Odyssus, sent by pope Celestine I in the year 432 in the reign of END
BEGIN NOW Leary to the year 260 or thereabouts in the reign of Cormac MacArt (â€ END
BEGIN NOW 266 A.D.), suffocated by imperfect deglutition of aliment at Sletty and END
BEGIN NOW interred at Rossnaree. END
BEGIN NOW The collapse which Bloom ascribed to gastric END
BEGIN NOW inanition and certain chemical compounds of varying degrees of END
BEGIN NOW adulteration and alcoholic strength, accelerated by mental exertion and END
BEGIN NOW the velocity of rapid circular motion in a relaxing atmosphere, Stephen END
BEGIN NOW attributed to the reapparition of a matutinal cloud (perceived by both END
BEGIN NOW from two different points of observation Sandycove and Dublin) at first END
BEGIN NOW no bigger than a woman's hand. END
BEGIN NOW Was there one point on which their views were equal and negative? END
BEGIN NOW The influence of gaslight or electric light on the growth of adjoining END
BEGIN NOW paraheliotropic trees. END
BEGIN NOW Had Bloom discussed similar subjects during nocturnal perambulations in END
BEGIN NOW the past? END
BEGIN NOW In 1884 with Owen Goldberg and Cecil Turnbull at night on public END
BEGIN NOW thoroughfares between Longwood avenue and Leonard's corner and Leonard's END
BEGIN NOW corner and Synge street and Synge street and Bloomfield avenue. END
BEGIN NOW In 1885 with Percy Apjohn in the evenings, reclined against the wall END
BEGIN NOW between Gibraltar villa and Bloomfield house in Crumlin, barony of END
BEGIN NOW Uppercross. END
BEGIN NOW In 1886 occasionally with casual acquaintances and END
BEGIN NOW prospective purchasers on doorsteps, in front parlours, in third class END
BEGIN NOW railway carriages of suburban lines. END
BEGIN NOW In 1888 frequently with major Brian END
BEGIN NOW Tweedy and his daughter Miss Marion Tweedy, together and separately on END
BEGIN NOW the lounge in Matthew Dillon's house in Roundtown. END
BEGIN NOW Once in 1892 and once END
BEGIN NOW in 1893 with Julius (Juda) Mastiansky, on both occasions in the parlour END
BEGIN NOW of his (Bloom's) house in Lombard street, west. END
BEGIN NOW What reflection concerning the irregular sequence of dates 1884, 1885, END
BEGIN NOW 1886, 1888, 1892, 1893, 1904 did Bloom make before their arrival at END
BEGIN NOW their destination? END
BEGIN NOW He reflected that the progressive extension of the field of individual END
BEGIN NOW development and experience was regressively accompanied by a restriction END
BEGIN NOW of the converse domain of interindividual relations. END
BEGIN NOW As in what ways? END
BEGIN NOW From inexistence to existence he came to many and was as one received: END
BEGIN NOW existence with existence he was with any as any with any: from existence END
BEGIN NOW to nonexistence gone he would be by all as none perceived. END
BEGIN NOW What act did Bloom make on their arrival at their destination? END
BEGIN NOW At the housesteps of the 4th Of the equidifferent uneven numbers, number END
BEGIN NOW 7 Eccles street, he inserted his hand mechanically into the back pocket END
BEGIN NOW of his trousers to obtain his latchkey. END
BEGIN NOW Was it there? END
BEGIN NOW It was in the corresponding pocket of the trousers which he had worn on END
BEGIN NOW the day but one preceding. END
BEGIN NOW Why was he doubly irritated? END
BEGIN NOW Because he had forgotten and because he remembered that he had reminded END
BEGIN NOW himself twice not to forget. END
BEGIN NOW What were then the alternatives before the, premeditatedly END
BEGIN NOW (respectively) and inadvertently, keyless couple? END
BEGIN NOW To enter or not to enter. END
BEGIN NOW To knock or not to knock. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom's decision? END
BEGIN NOW A stratagem. END
BEGIN NOW Resting his feet on the dwarf wall, he climbed over the END
BEGIN NOW area railings, compressed his hat on his head, grasped two points at the END
BEGIN NOW lower union of rails and stiles, lowered his body gradually by its END
BEGIN NOW length of five feet nine inches and a half to within two feet ten inches END
BEGIN NOW of the area pavement and allowed his body to move freely in space by END
BEGIN NOW separating himself from the railings and crouching in preparation for END
BEGIN NOW the impact of the fall. END
BEGIN NOW Did he fall? END
BEGIN NOW By his body's known weight of eleven stone and four pounds in END
BEGIN NOW avoirdupois measure, as certified by the graduated machine for END
BEGIN NOW periodical selfweighing in the premises of Francis Froedman, END
BEGIN NOW pharmaceutical chemist of 19 Frederick street, north, on the last feast END
BEGIN NOW of the Ascension, to wit, the twelfth day of May of the bissextile year END
BEGIN NOW one thousand nine hundred and four of the christian era (jewish era five END
BEGIN NOW thousand six hundred and sixtyfour, mohammadan era one thousand three END
BEGIN NOW hundred and twentytwo), golden number 5, epact 13, solar cycle 9, END
BEGIN NOW dominical letters C B, Roman indiction 2, Julian period 6617, MCMIV. END
BEGIN NOW Did he rise uninjured by concussion? END
BEGIN NOW Regaining new stable equilibrium he rose uninjured though concussed by END
BEGIN NOW the impact, raised the latch of the area door by the exertion of force END
BEGIN NOW at its freely moving flange and by leverage of the first kind applied at END
BEGIN NOW its fulcrum, gained retarded access to the kitchen through the END
BEGIN NOW subadjacent scullery, ignited a lucifer match by friction, set free END
BEGIN NOW inflammable coal gas by turningon the ventcock, lit a high flame which, END
BEGIN NOW by regulating, he reduced to quiescent candescence and lit finally a END
BEGIN NOW portable candle. END
BEGIN NOW What discrete succession of images did Stephen meanwhile perceive? END
BEGIN NOW Reclined against the area railings he perceived through the transparent END
BEGIN NOW kitchen panes a man regulating a gasflame of 14 CP, a man lighting a END
BEGIN NOW candle of 1 CP, a man removing in turn each of his two boots, a man END
BEGIN NOW leaving the kitchen holding a candle. END
BEGIN NOW Did the man reappear elsewhere? END
BEGIN NOW After a lapse of four minutes the glimmer of his candle was discernible END
BEGIN NOW through the semitransparent semicircular glass fanlight over the END
BEGIN NOW halldoor. END
BEGIN NOW The halldoor turned gradually on its hinges. END
BEGIN NOW In the open space END
BEGIN NOW of the doorway the man reappeared without his hat, with his candle. END
BEGIN NOW Did Stephen obey his sign? END
BEGIN NOW Yes, entering softly, he helped to close and chain the door and followed END
BEGIN NOW softly along the hallway the man's back and listed feet and lighted END
BEGIN NOW candle past a lighted crevice of doorway on the left and carefully down END
BEGIN NOW a turning staircase of more than five steps into the kitchen of Bloom's END
BEGIN NOW house. END
BEGIN NOW What did Bloom do? END
BEGIN NOW He extinguished the candle by a sharp expiration of breath upon its END
BEGIN NOW flame, drew two spoonseat deal chairs to the hearthstone, one for END
BEGIN NOW Stephen with its back to the area window, the other for himself when END
BEGIN NOW necessary, knelt on one knee, composed in the grate a pyre of crosslaid END
BEGIN NOW resintipped sticks and various coloured papers and irregular polygons of END
BEGIN NOW best Abram coal at twentyone shillings a ton from the yard of Messrs END
BEGIN NOW Flower and M'Donald of 14 D'Olier street, kindled it at three projecting END
BEGIN NOW points of paper with one ignited lucifer match, thereby releasing the END
BEGIN NOW potential energy contained in the fuel by allowing its carbon and END
BEGIN NOW hydrogen elements to enter into free union with the oxygen of the air. END
BEGIN NOW Of what similar apparitions did Stephen think? END
BEGIN NOW Of others elsewhere in other times who, kneeling on one knee or on two, END
BEGIN NOW had kindled fires for him, of Brother Michael in the infirmary of the END
BEGIN NOW college of the Society of Jesus at Clongowes Wood, Sallins, in the END
BEGIN NOW county of Kildare: of his father, Simon Dedalus, in an unfurnished room END
BEGIN NOW of his first residence in Dublin, number thirteen Fitzgibbon street: of END
BEGIN NOW his godmother Miss Kate Morkan in the house of her dying sister Miss END
BEGIN NOW Julia Morkan at 15 Usher's Island: of his aunt Sara, wife of Richie END
BEGIN NOW (Richard) Goulding, in the kitchen of their lodgings at 62 Clanbrassil END
BEGIN NOW street: of his mother Mary, wife of Simon Dedalus, in the kitchen of END
BEGIN NOW number twelve North Richmond street on the morning of the feast of Saint END
BEGIN NOW Francis Xavier 1898: of the dean of studies, Father Butt, in the END
BEGIN NOW physics' theatre of university College, 16 Stephen's Green, north: of END
BEGIN NOW his sister Dilly (Delia) in his father's house in Cabra. END
BEGIN NOW What did Stephen see on raising his gaze to the height of a yard from END
BEGIN NOW the fire towards the opposite wall? END
BEGIN NOW Under a row of five coiled spring housebells a curvilinear rope, END
BEGIN NOW stretched between two holdfasts athwart across the recess beside the END
BEGIN NOW chimney pier, from which hung four smallsized square handkerchiefs END
BEGIN NOW folded unattached consecutively in adjacent rectangles and one pair of END
BEGIN NOW ladies' grey hose with Lisle suspender tops and feet in their habitual END
BEGIN NOW position clamped by three erect wooden pegs two at their outer END
BEGIN NOW extremities and the third at their point of junction. END
BEGIN NOW What did Bloom see on the range? END
BEGIN NOW On the right (smaller) hob a blue enamelled saucepan: on the left END
BEGIN NOW (larger) hob a black iron kettle. END
BEGIN NOW What did Bloom do at the range? END
BEGIN NOW He removed the saucepan to the left hob, rose and carried the iron END
BEGIN NOW kettle to the sink in order to tap the current by turning the faucet to END
BEGIN NOW let it flow. END
BEGIN NOW Did it flow? END
BEGIN NOW Yes. END
BEGIN NOW From Roundwood reservoir in county Wicklow of a cubic capacity of END
BEGIN NOW 2400 million gallons, percolating through a subterranean aqueduct of END
BEGIN NOW filter mains of single and double pipeage constructed at an initial END
BEGIN NOW plant cost of Â£ 5 per linear yard by way of the Dargle, Rathdown, Glen END
BEGIN NOW of the Downs and Callowhill to the 26 acre reservoir at Stillorgan, a END
BEGIN NOW distance of 22 statute miles, and thence, through a system of relieving END
BEGIN NOW tanks, by a gradient of 250 feet to the city boundary at Eustace bridge, END
BEGIN NOW upper Leeson street, though from prolonged summer drouth and daily END
BEGIN NOW supply of 12 1/2 million gallons the water had fallen below the sill of END
BEGIN NOW the overflow weir for which reason the borough surveyor and waterworks END
BEGIN NOW engineer, Mr Spencer Harty, C. END
BEGIN NOW E., on the instructions of the waterworks END
BEGIN NOW committee had prohibited the use of municipal water for purposes other END
BEGIN NOW than those of consumption (envisaging the possibility of recourse being END
BEGIN NOW had to the impotable water of the Grand and Royal canals as in 1893) END
BEGIN NOW particularly as the South Dublin Guardians, notwithstanding their ration END
BEGIN NOW of 15 gallons per day per pauper supplied through a 6 inch meter, had END
BEGIN NOW been convicted of a wastage of 20,000 gallons per night by a reading of END
BEGIN NOW their meter on the affirmation of the law agent of the corporation, Mr END
BEGIN NOW Ignatius Rice, solicitor, thereby acting to the detriment of another END
BEGIN NOW section of the public, selfsupporting taxpayers, solvent, sound. END
BEGIN NOW What in water did Bloom, waterlover, drawer of water, watercarrier, END
BEGIN NOW returning to the range, admire? END
BEGIN NOW Its universality: its democratic equality and constancy to its nature in END
BEGIN NOW seeking its own level: its vastness in the ocean of Mercator's END
BEGIN NOW projection: its unplumbed profundity in the Sundam trench of the Pacific END
BEGIN NOW exceeding 8000 fathoms: the restlessness of its waves and surface END
BEGIN NOW particles visiting in turn all points of its seaboard: the independence END
BEGIN NOW of its units: the variability of states of sea: its hydrostatic END
BEGIN NOW quiescence in calm: its hydrokinetic turgidity in neap and spring tides: END
BEGIN NOW its subsidence after devastation: its sterility in the circumpolar END
BEGIN NOW icecaps, arctic and antarctic: its climatic and commercial significance: END
BEGIN NOW its preponderance of 3 to 1 over the dry land of the globe: its END
BEGIN NOW indisputable hegemony extending in square leagues over all the region END
BEGIN NOW below the subequatorial tropic of Capricorn: the multisecular stability END
BEGIN NOW of its primeval basin: its luteofulvous bed: its capacity to dissolve END
BEGIN NOW and hold in solution all soluble substances including millions of tons END
BEGIN NOW of the most precious metals: its slow erosions of peninsulas and END
BEGIN NOW islands, its persistent formation of homothetic islands, peninsulas and END
BEGIN NOW downwardtending promontories: its alluvial deposits: its weight and END
BEGIN NOW volume and density: its imperturbability in lagoons and highland tarns: END
BEGIN NOW its gradation of colours in the torrid and temperate and frigid zones: END
BEGIN NOW its vehicular ramifications in continental lakecontained streams and END
BEGIN NOW confluent oceanflowing rivers with their tributaries and transoceanic END
BEGIN NOW currents, gulfstream, north and south equatorial courses: its violence END
BEGIN NOW in seaquakes, waterspouts, Artesian wells, eruptions, torrents, eddies, END
BEGIN NOW freshets, spates, groundswells, watersheds, waterpartings, geysers, END
BEGIN NOW cataracts, whirlpools, maelstroms, inundations, deluges, cloudbursts: END
