BEGIN NOW its vast circumterrestrial ahorizontal curve: its secrecy in springs and END
BEGIN NOW latent humidity, revealed by rhabdomantic or hygrometric instruments and END
BEGIN NOW exemplified by the well by the hole in the wall at Ashtown gate, END
BEGIN NOW saturation of air, distillation of dew: the simplicity of its END
BEGIN NOW composition, two constituent parts of hydrogen with one constituent part END
BEGIN NOW of oxygen: its healing virtues: its buoyancy in the waters of the Dead END
BEGIN NOW Sea: its persevering penetrativeness in runnels, gullies, inadequate END
BEGIN NOW dams, leaks on shipboard: its properties for cleansing, quenching thirst END
BEGIN NOW and fire, nourishing vegetation: its infallibility as paradigm and END
BEGIN NOW paragon: its metamorphoses as vapour, mist, cloud, rain, sleet, snow, END
BEGIN NOW hail: its strength in rigid hydrants: its variety of forms in loughs and END
BEGIN NOW bays and gulfs and bights and guts and lagoons and atolls and END
BEGIN NOW archipelagos and sounds and fjords and minches and tidal estuaries and END
BEGIN NOW arms of sea: its solidity in glaciers, icebergs, icefloes: its docility END
BEGIN NOW in working hydraulic millwheels, turbines, dynamos, electric power END
BEGIN NOW stations, bleachworks, tanneries, scutchmills: its utility in canals, END
BEGIN NOW rivers, if navigable, floating and graving docks: its potentiality END
BEGIN NOW derivable from harnessed tides or watercourses falling from level to END
BEGIN NOW level: its submarine fauna and flora (anacoustic, photophobe), END
BEGIN NOW numerically, if not literally, the inhabitants of the globe: its END
BEGIN NOW ubiquity as constituting 90 percent of the human body: the noxiousness END
BEGIN NOW of its effluvia in lacustrine marshes, pestilential fens, faded END
BEGIN NOW flowerwater, stagnant pools in the waning moon. END
BEGIN NOW Having set the halffilled kettle on the now burning coals, why did he END
BEGIN NOW return to the stillflowing tap? END
BEGIN NOW To wash his soiled hands with a partially consumed tablet of END
BEGIN NOW Barrington's lemonflavoured soap, to which paper still adhered, (bought END
BEGIN NOW thirteen hours previously for fourpence and still unpaid for), in fresh END
BEGIN NOW cold neverchanging everchanging water and dry them, face and hands, in a END
BEGIN NOW long redbordered holland cloth passed over a wooden revolving roller. END
BEGIN NOW What reason did Stephen give for declining Bloom's offer? END
BEGIN NOW That he was hydrophobe, hating partial contact by immersion or total by END
BEGIN NOW submersion in cold water, (his last bath having taken place in the month END
BEGIN NOW of October of the preceding year), disliking the aqueous substances of END
BEGIN NOW glass and crystal, distrusting aquacities of thought and language. END
BEGIN NOW What impeded Bloom from giving Stephen counsels of hygiene and END
BEGIN NOW prophylactic to which should be added suggestions concerning a END
BEGIN NOW preliminary wetting of the head and contraction of the muscles with END
BEGIN NOW rapid splashing of the face and neck and thoracic and epigastric region END
BEGIN NOW in case of sea or river bathing, the parts of the human anatomy most END
BEGIN NOW sensitive to cold being the nape, stomach and thenar or sole of foot? END
BEGIN NOW The incompatibility of aquacity with the erratic originality of genius. END
BEGIN NOW What additional didactic counsels did he similarly repress? END
BEGIN NOW Dietary: concerning the respective percentage of protein and caloric END
BEGIN NOW energy in bacon, salt ling and butter, the absence of the former in the END
BEGIN NOW lastnamed and the abundance of the latter in the firstnamed. END
BEGIN NOW Which seemed to the host to be the predominant qualities of his guest? END
BEGIN NOW Confidence in himself, an equal and opposite power of abandonment and END
BEGIN NOW recuperation. END
BEGIN NOW What concomitant phenomenon took place in the vessel of liquid by the END
BEGIN NOW agency of fire? END
BEGIN NOW The phenomenon of ebullition. END
BEGIN NOW Fanned by a constant updraught of END
BEGIN NOW ventilation between the kitchen and the chimneyflue, ignition was END
BEGIN NOW communicated from the faggots of precombustible fuel to polyhedral END
BEGIN NOW masses of bituminous coal, containing in compressed mineral form the END
BEGIN NOW foliated fossilised decidua of primeval forests which had in turn END
BEGIN NOW derived their vegetative existence from the sun, primal source of heat END
BEGIN NOW (radiant), transmitted through omnipresent luminiferous diathermanous END
BEGIN NOW ether. END
BEGIN NOW Heat (convected), a mode of motion developed by such combustion, END
BEGIN NOW was constantly and increasingly conveyed from the source of END
BEGIN NOW calorification to the liquid contained in the vessel, being radiated END
BEGIN NOW through the uneven unpolished dark surface of the metal iron, in part END
BEGIN NOW reflected, in part absorbed, in part transmitted, gradually raising the END
BEGIN NOW temperature of the water from normal to boiling point, a rise in END
BEGIN NOW temperature expressible as the result of an expenditure of 72 thermal END
BEGIN NOW units needed to raise 1 pound of water from 50 degrees to 212 degrees END
BEGIN NOW Fahrenheit. END
BEGIN NOW What announced the accomplishment of this rise in temperature? END
BEGIN NOW A double falciform ejection of water vapour from under the kettlelid at END
BEGIN NOW both sides simultaneously. END
BEGIN NOW For what personal purpose could Bloom have applied the water so boiled? END
BEGIN NOW To shave himself. END
BEGIN NOW What advantages attended shaving by night? END
BEGIN NOW A softer beard: a softer brush if intentionally allowed to remain from END
BEGIN NOW shave to shave in its agglutinated lather: a softer skin if unexpectedly END
BEGIN NOW encountering female acquaintances in remote places at incustomary hours: END
BEGIN NOW quiet reflections upon the course of the day: a cleaner sensation when END
BEGIN NOW awaking after a fresher sleep since matutinal noises, premonitions and END
BEGIN NOW perturbations, a clattered milkcan, a postman's double knock, a paper END
BEGIN NOW read, reread while lathering, relathering the same spot, a shock, a END
BEGIN NOW shoot, with thought of aught he sought though fraught with nought might END
BEGIN NOW cause a faster rate of shaving and a nick on which incision plaster with END
BEGIN NOW precision cut and humected and applied adhered: which was to be done. END
BEGIN NOW Why did absence of light disturb him less than presence of noise? END
BEGIN NOW Because of the surety of the sense of touch in his firm full masculine END
BEGIN NOW feminine passive active hand. END
BEGIN NOW What quality did it (his hand) possess but with what counteracting END
BEGIN NOW influence? END
BEGIN NOW The operative surgical quality but that he was reluctant to shed human END
BEGIN NOW blood even when the end justified the means, preferring, in their END
BEGIN NOW natural order, heliotherapy, psychophysicotherapeutics, osteopathic END
BEGIN NOW surgery. END
BEGIN NOW What lay under exposure on the lower, middle and upper shelves of the END
BEGIN NOW kitchen dresser, opened by Bloom? END
BEGIN NOW On the lower shelf five vertical breakfast plates, six horizontal END
BEGIN NOW breakfast saucers on which rested inverted breakfast cups, a END
BEGIN NOW moustachecup, uninverted, and saucer of Crown Derby, four white END
BEGIN NOW goldrimmed eggcups, an open shammy purse displaying coins, mostly END
BEGIN NOW copper, and a phial of aromatic (violet) comfits. END
BEGIN NOW On the middle shelf a END
BEGIN NOW chipped eggcup containing pepper, a drum of table salt, four END
BEGIN NOW conglomerated black olives in oleaginous paper, an empty pot of END
BEGIN NOW Plumtree's potted meat, an oval wicker basket bedded with fibre and END
BEGIN NOW containing one Jersey pear, a halfempty bottle of William Gilbey and END
BEGIN NOW Co's white invalid port, half disrobed of its swathe of coralpink tissue END
BEGIN NOW paper, a packet of Epps's soluble cocoa, five ounces of Anne Lynch's END
BEGIN NOW choice tea at 2/- per lb in a crinkled leadpaper bag, a cylindrical END
BEGIN NOW canister containing the best crystallised lump sugar, two onions, one, END
BEGIN NOW the larger, Spanish, entire, the other, smaller, Irish, bisected with END
BEGIN NOW augmented surface and more redolent, a jar of Irish Model Dairy's cream, END
BEGIN NOW a jug of brown crockery containing a naggin and a quarter of soured END
BEGIN NOW adulterated milk, converted by heat into water, acidulous serum and END
BEGIN NOW semisolidified curds, which added to the quantity subtracted for Mr END
BEGIN NOW Bloom's and Mrs Fleming's breakfasts, made one imperial pint, the total END
BEGIN NOW quantity originally delivered, two cloves, a halfpenny and a small dish END
BEGIN NOW containing a slice of fresh ribsteak. END
BEGIN NOW On the upper shelf a battery of END
BEGIN NOW jamjars (empty) of various sizes and proveniences. END
BEGIN NOW What attracted his attention lying on the apron of the dresser? END
BEGIN NOW Four polygonal fragments of two lacerated scarlet betting tickets, END
BEGIN NOW numbered 8 87, 88 6. END
BEGIN NOW What reminiscences temporarily corrugated his brow? END
BEGIN NOW Reminiscences of coincidences, truth stranger than fiction, END
BEGIN NOW preindicative of the result of the Gold Cup flat handicap, the official END
BEGIN NOW and definitive result of which he had read in the Evening Telegraph, END
BEGIN NOW late pink edition, in the cabman's shelter, at Butt bridge. END
BEGIN NOW Where had previous intimations of the result, effected or projected, END
BEGIN NOW been received by him? END
BEGIN NOW In Bernard Kiernan's licensed premises 8, 9 and 10 little Britain END
BEGIN NOW street: in David Byrne's licensed premises, 14 Duke street: in O'Connell END
BEGIN NOW street lower, outside Graham Lemon's when a dark man had placed in his END
BEGIN NOW hand a throwaway (subsequently thrown away), advertising Elijah, END
BEGIN NOW restorer of the church in Zion: in Lincoln place outside the premises of END
BEGIN NOW F. END
BEGIN NOW W. END
BEGIN NOW Sweny and Co (Limited), dispensing chemists, when, when Frederick END
BEGIN NOW M. END
BEGIN NOW (Bantam) Lyons had rapidly and successively requested, perused and END
BEGIN NOW restituted the copy of the current issue of the Freeman's Journal and END
BEGIN NOW National Press which he had been about to throw away (subsequently END
BEGIN NOW thrown away), he had proceeded towards the oriental edifice of the END
BEGIN NOW Turkish and Warm Baths, 11 Leinster street, with the light of END
BEGIN NOW inspiration shining in his countenance and bearing in his arms the END
BEGIN NOW secret of the race, graven in the language of prediction. END
BEGIN NOW What qualifying considerations allayed his perturbations? END
BEGIN NOW The difficulties of interpretation since the significance of any event END
BEGIN NOW followed its occurrence as variably as the acoustic report followed the END
BEGIN NOW electrical discharge and of counterestimating against an actual loss by END
BEGIN NOW failure to interpret the total sum of possible losses proceeding END
BEGIN NOW originally from a successful interpretation. END
BEGIN NOW His mood? END
BEGIN NOW He had not risked, he did not expect, he had not been disappointed, he END
BEGIN NOW was satisfied. END
BEGIN NOW What satisfied him? END
BEGIN NOW To have sustained no positive loss. END
BEGIN NOW To have brought a positive gain to END
BEGIN NOW others. END
BEGIN NOW Light to the gentiles. END
BEGIN NOW How did Bloom prepare a collation for a gentile? END
BEGIN NOW He poured into two teacups two level spoonfuls, four in all, of Epps's END
BEGIN NOW soluble cocoa and proceeded according to the directions for use printed END
BEGIN NOW on the label, to each adding after sufficient time for infusion the END
BEGIN NOW prescribed ingredients for diffusion in the manner and in the quantity END
BEGIN NOW prescribed. END
BEGIN NOW What supererogatory marks of special hospitality did the host show his END
BEGIN NOW guest? END
BEGIN NOW Relinquishing his symposiarchal right to the moustache cup of imitation END
BEGIN NOW Crown Derby presented to him by his only daughter, Millicent (Milly), he END
BEGIN NOW substituted a cup identical with that of his guest and served END
BEGIN NOW extraordinarily to his guest and, in reduced measure, to himself the END
BEGIN NOW viscous cream ordinarily reserved for the breakfast of his wife Marion END
BEGIN NOW (Molly). END
BEGIN NOW Was the guest conscious of and did he acknowledge these marks of END
BEGIN NOW hospitality? END
BEGIN NOW His attention was directed to them by his host jocosely, and he accepted END
BEGIN NOW them seriously as they drank in jocoserious silence Epps's massproduct, END
BEGIN NOW the creature cocoa. END
BEGIN NOW Were there marks of hospitality which he contemplated but suppressed, END
BEGIN NOW reserving them for another and for himself on future occasions to END
BEGIN NOW complete the act begun? END
BEGIN NOW The reparation of a fissure of the length of 1 1/2 inches in the right END
BEGIN NOW side of his guest's jacket. END
BEGIN NOW A gift to his guest of one of the four END
BEGIN NOW lady's handkerchiefs, if and when ascertained to be in a presentable END
BEGIN NOW condition. END
BEGIN NOW Who drank more quickly? END
BEGIN NOW Bloom, having the advantage of ten seconds at the initiation and taking, END
BEGIN NOW from the concave surface of a spoon along the handle of which a steady END
BEGIN NOW flow of heat was conducted, three sips to his opponent's one, six to END
BEGIN NOW two, nine to three. END
BEGIN NOW What cerebration accompanied his frequentative act? END
BEGIN NOW Concluding by inspection but erroneously that his silent companion was END
BEGIN NOW engaged in mental composition he reflected on the pleasures derived from END
BEGIN NOW literature of instruction rather than of amusement as he himself had END
BEGIN NOW applied to the works of William Shakespeare more than once for the END
BEGIN NOW solution of difficult problems in imaginary or real life. END
BEGIN NOW Had he found their solution? END
BEGIN NOW In spite of careful and repeated reading of certain classical passages, END
BEGIN NOW aided by a glossary, he had derived imperfect conviction from the text, END
BEGIN NOW the answers not bearing in all points. END
BEGIN NOW What lines concluded his first piece of original verse written by him, END
BEGIN NOW potential poet, at the age of 11 in 1877 on the occasion of the offering END
BEGIN NOW of three prizes of 10/-, 5/- and 2/6 respectively for competition by the END
BEGIN NOW Shamrock, a weekly newspaper? END
BEGIN NOW An ambition to squint At my verses in print Makes me hope that for these END
BEGIN NOW you'll find room?. END
BEGIN NOW If you so condescend Then please place at the end The END
BEGIN NOW name of yours truly, L. END
BEGIN NOW Bloom. END
BEGIN NOW Did he find four separating forces between his temporary guest and him? END
BEGIN NOW Name, age, race, creed. END
BEGIN NOW What anagrams had he made on his name in youth? END
BEGIN NOW Leopold Bloom Ellpodbomool Molldopeloob Bollopedoom Old Ollebo, M. END
BEGIN NOW P. END
BEGIN NOW What acrostic upon the abbreviation of his first name had he (kinetic END
BEGIN NOW poet) sent to Miss Marion (Molly) Tweedy on the 14 February 1888? END
BEGIN NOW Poets oft have sung in rhyme Of music sweet their praise divine. END
BEGIN NOW Let END
BEGIN NOW them hymn it nine times nine. END
BEGIN NOW Dearer far than song or wine. END
BEGIN NOW You are END
BEGIN NOW mine. END
BEGIN NOW The world is mine. END
BEGIN NOW What had prevented him from completing a topical song (music by R. END
BEGIN NOW G. END
BEGIN NOW Johnston) on the events of the past, or fixtures for the actual, years, END
BEGIN NOW entitled If Brian Boru could but come back and see old Dublin now, END
BEGIN NOW commissioned by Michael Gunn, lessee of the Gaiety Theatre, 46, 47, 48, END
BEGIN NOW 49 South King street, and to be introduced into the sixth scene, the END
BEGIN NOW valley of diamonds, of the second edition (30 January 1893) of the grand END
BEGIN NOW annual Christmas pantomime Sinbad the Sailor (produced by R Shelton 26 END
BEGIN NOW December 1892, written by Greenleaf Whittier, scenery by George A. END
BEGIN NOW Jackson and Cecil Hicks, costumes by Mrs and Miss Whelan under the END
BEGIN NOW personal supervision of Mrs Michael Gunn, ballets by Jessie Noir, END
BEGIN NOW harlequinade by Thomas Otto) and sung by Nelly Bouverist, principal END
BEGIN NOW girl? END
BEGIN NOW Firstly, oscillation between events of imperial and of local interest, END
BEGIN NOW the anticipated diamond jubilee of Queen Victoria (born 1820, acceded END
BEGIN NOW 1837) and the posticipated opening of the new municipal fish market: END
BEGIN NOW secondly, apprehension of opposition from extreme circles on the END
BEGIN NOW questions of the respective visits of Their Royal Highnesses the duke END
BEGIN NOW and duchess of York (real) and of His Majesty King Brian Boru END
BEGIN NOW (imaginary): thirdly, a conflict between professional etiquette and END
BEGIN NOW professional emulation concerning the recent erections of the Grand END
BEGIN NOW Lyric Hall on Burgh Quay and the Theatre Royal in Hawkins street: END
BEGIN NOW fourthly, distraction resultant from compassion for Nelly Bouverist's END
BEGIN NOW non-intellectual, non-political, non-topical expression of countenance END
BEGIN NOW and concupiscence caused by Nelly Bouverist's revelations of white END
BEGIN NOW articles of non-intellectual, non-political, non-topical underclothing END
BEGIN NOW while she (Nelly Bouverist) was in the articles: fifthly, the END
BEGIN NOW difficulties of the selection of appropriate music and humorous END
BEGIN NOW allusions from Everybody's Book of Jokes (1000 pages and a laugh in END
BEGIN NOW every one): sixthly, the rhymes, homophonous and cacophonous, associated END
BEGIN NOW with the names of the new lord mayor, Daniel Tallon, the new high END
BEGIN NOW sheriff, Thomas Pile and the new solicitorgeneral, Dunbar Plunket END
BEGIN NOW Barton. END
BEGIN NOW What relation existed between their ages? END
BEGIN NOW 16 years before in 1888 when Bloom was of Stephen's present age Stephen END
BEGIN NOW was 6. END
BEGIN NOW 16 years after in 1920 when Stephen would be of Bloom's present END
BEGIN NOW age Bloom would be 54. END
BEGIN NOW In 1936 when Bloom would be 70 and Stephen 54 END
BEGIN NOW their ages initially in the ratio of 16 to 0 would be as 17 1/2 to 13 END
BEGIN NOW 1/2, the proportion increasing and the disparity diminishing according END
BEGIN NOW as arbitrary future years were added, for if the proportion existing in END
BEGIN NOW 1883 had continued immutable, conceiving that to be possible, till then END
BEGIN NOW 1904 when Stephen was 22 Bloom would be 374 and in 1920 when Stephen END
BEGIN NOW would be 38, as Bloom then was, Bloom would be 646 while in 1952 when END
BEGIN NOW Stephen would have attained the maximum postdiluvian age of 70 Bloom, END
BEGIN NOW being 1190 years alive having been born in the year 714, would have END
BEGIN NOW surpassed by 221 years the maximum antediluvian age, that of Methusalah, END
BEGIN NOW 969 years, while, if Stephen would continue to live until he would END
BEGIN NOW attain that age in the year 3072 A.D., Bloom would have been obliged to END
BEGIN NOW have been alive 83,300 years, having been obliged to have been born in END
BEGIN NOW the year 81,396 B.C. END
BEGIN NOW What events might nullify these calculations? END
BEGIN NOW The cessation of existence of both or either, the inauguration of a new END
BEGIN NOW era or calendar, the annihilation of the world and consequent END
BEGIN NOW extermination of the human species, inevitable but impredictable. END
BEGIN NOW How many previous encounters proved their preexisting acquaintance? END
BEGIN NOW Two. END
BEGIN NOW The first in the lilacgarden of Matthew Dillon's house, Medina END
BEGIN NOW Villa, Kimmage road, Roundtown, in 1887, in the company of Stephen's END
BEGIN NOW mother, Stephen being then of the age of 5 and reluctant to give his END
BEGIN NOW hand in salutation. END
BEGIN NOW The second in the coffeeroom of Breslin's hotel on a END
BEGIN NOW rainy Sunday in the January of 1892, in the company of Stephen's father END
BEGIN NOW and Stephen's granduncle, Stephen being then 5 years older. END
BEGIN NOW Did Bloom accept the invitation to dinner given then by the son and END
BEGIN NOW afterwards seconded by the father? END
BEGIN NOW Very gratefully, with grateful appreciation, with sincere appreciative END
BEGIN NOW gratitude, in appreciatively grateful sincerity of regret, he declined. END
BEGIN NOW Did their conversation on the subject of these reminiscences reveal a END
BEGIN NOW third connecting link between them? END
BEGIN NOW Mrs Riordan (Dante), a widow of independent means, had resided in the END
BEGIN NOW house of Stephen's parents from 1 September 1888 to 29 December 1891 and END
BEGIN NOW had also resided during the years 1892, 1893 and 1894 in the City Arms END
BEGIN NOW Hotel owned by Elizabeth O'Dowd of 54 Prussia street where, during parts END
BEGIN NOW of the years 1893 and 1894, she had been a constant informant of Bloom END
BEGIN NOW who resided also in the same hotel, being at that time a clerk in the END
BEGIN NOW employment of Joseph Cuffe of 5 Smithfield for the superintendence of END
BEGIN NOW sales in the adjacent Dublin Cattle market on the North Circular road. END
BEGIN NOW Had he performed any special corporal work of mercy for her? END
BEGIN NOW He had sometimes propelled her on warm summer evenings, an infirm widow END
BEGIN NOW of independent, if limited, means, in her convalescent bathchair with END
BEGIN NOW slow revolutions of its wheels as far as the corner of the North END
BEGIN NOW Circular road opposite Mr Gavin Low's place of business where she had END
BEGIN NOW remained for a certain time scanning through his onelensed binocular END
BEGIN NOW fieldglasses unrecognisable citizens on tramcars, roadster bicycles END
BEGIN NOW equipped with inflated pneumatic tyres, hackney carriages, tandems, END
BEGIN NOW private and hired landaus, dogcarts, ponytraps and brakes passing from END
BEGIN NOW the city to the Phoenix Park and vice versa. END
BEGIN NOW Why could he then support that his vigil with the greater equanimity? END
BEGIN NOW Because in middle youth he had often sat observing through a rondel of END
BEGIN NOW bossed glass of a multicoloured pane the spectacle offered with END
BEGIN NOW continual changes of the thoroughfare without, pedestrians, quadrupeds, END
BEGIN NOW velocipedes, vehicles, passing slowly, quickly, evenly, round and round END
BEGIN NOW and round the rim of a round and round precipitous globe. END
BEGIN NOW What distinct different memories had each of her now eight years END
BEGIN NOW deceased? END
BEGIN NOW The older, her bezique cards and counters, her Skye terrier, her END
BEGIN NOW suppositious wealth, her lapses of responsiveness and incipient END
BEGIN NOW catarrhal deafness: the younger, her lamp of colza oil before the statue END
BEGIN NOW of the Immaculate Conception, her green and maroon brushes for Charles END
BEGIN NOW Stewart Parnell and for Michael Davitt, her tissue papers. END
BEGIN NOW Were there no means still remaining to him to achieve the rejuvenation END
BEGIN NOW which these reminiscences divulged to a younger companion rendered the END
BEGIN NOW more desirable? END
BEGIN NOW The indoor exercises, formerly intermittently practised, subsequently END
BEGIN NOW abandoned, prescribed in Eugen Sandow's Physical Strength and How to END
BEGIN NOW Obtain It which, designed particularly for commercial men engaged in END
BEGIN NOW sedentary occupations, were to be made with mental concentration in END
BEGIN NOW front of a mirror so as to bring into play the various families of END
BEGIN NOW muscles and produce successively a pleasant rigidity, a more pleasant END
BEGIN NOW relaxation and the most pleasant repristination of juvenile agility. END
BEGIN NOW Had any special agility been his in earlier youth? END
BEGIN NOW Though ringweight lifting had been beyond his strength and the full END
BEGIN NOW circle gyration beyond his courage yet as a High school scholar he had END
BEGIN NOW excelled in his stable and protracted execution of the half lever END
BEGIN NOW movement on the parallel bars in consequence of his abnormally developed END
BEGIN NOW abdominal muscles. END
BEGIN NOW Did either openly allude to their racial difference? END
BEGIN NOW Neither. END
BEGIN NOW What, reduced to their simplest reciprocal form, were Bloom's thoughts END
BEGIN NOW about Stephen's thoughts about Bloom and about Stephen's thoughts about END
BEGIN NOW Bloom's thoughts about Stephen? END
BEGIN NOW He thought that he thought that he was a jew whereas he knew that he END
BEGIN NOW knew that he knew that he was not. END
BEGIN NOW What, the enclosures of reticence removed, were their respective END
BEGIN NOW parentages? END
BEGIN NOW Bloom, only born male transubstantial heir of Rudolf Virag (subsequently END
BEGIN NOW Rudolph Bloom) of Szombathely, Vienna, Budapest, Milan, London and END
BEGIN NOW Dublin and of Ellen Higgins, second daughter of Julius Higgins (born END
BEGIN NOW Karoly) and Fanny Higgins (born Hegarty). END
BEGIN NOW Stephen, eldest surviving male END
BEGIN NOW consubstantial heir of Simon Dedalus of Cork and Dublin and of Mary, END
BEGIN NOW daughter of Richard and Christina Goulding (born Grier). END
BEGIN NOW Had Bloom and Stephen been baptised, and where and by whom, cleric or END
BEGIN NOW layman? END
BEGIN NOW Bloom (three times), by the reverend Mr Gilmer Johnston M. END
BEGIN NOW A., alone, in END
BEGIN NOW the protestant church of Saint Nicholas Without, Coombe, by James END
BEGIN NOW O'Connor, Philip Gilligan and James Fitzpatrick, together, under a pump END
BEGIN NOW in the village of Swords, and by the reverend Charles Malone C. END
BEGIN NOW C., in END
BEGIN NOW the church of the Three Patrons, Rathgar. END
BEGIN NOW Stephen (once) by the reverend END
BEGIN NOW Charles Malone C. END
BEGIN NOW C., alone, in the church of the Three Patrons, END
BEGIN NOW Rathgar. END
BEGIN NOW Did they find their educational careers similar? END
BEGIN NOW Substituting Stephen for Bloom Stoom would have passed successively END
BEGIN NOW through a dame's school and the high school. END
BEGIN NOW Substituting Bloom for END
BEGIN NOW Stephen Blephen would have passed successively through the preparatory, END
BEGIN NOW junior, middle and senior grades of the intermediate and through the END
BEGIN NOW matriculation, first arts, second arts and arts degree courses of the END
BEGIN NOW royal university. END
BEGIN NOW Why did Bloom refrain from stating that he had frequented the university END
BEGIN NOW of life? END
BEGIN NOW Because of his fluctuating incertitude as to whether this observation END
BEGIN NOW had or had not been already made by him to Stephen or by Stephen to him. END
BEGIN NOW What two temperaments did they individually represent? END
BEGIN NOW The scientific. END
BEGIN NOW The artistic. END
BEGIN NOW What proofs did Bloom adduce to prove that his tendency was towards END
BEGIN NOW applied, rather than towards pure, science? END
BEGIN NOW Certain possible inventions of which he had cogitated when reclining in END
BEGIN NOW a state of supine repletion to aid digestion, stimulated by his END
BEGIN NOW appreciation of the importance of inventions now common but once END
BEGIN NOW revolutionary, for example, the aeronautic parachute, the reflecting END
BEGIN NOW telescope, the spiral corkscrew, the safety pin, the mineral water END
BEGIN NOW siphon, the canal lock with winch and sluice, the suction pump. END
BEGIN NOW Were these inventions principally intended for an improved scheme of END
BEGIN NOW kindergarten? END
BEGIN NOW Yes, rendering obsolete popguns, elastic airbladders, games of hazard, END
BEGIN NOW catapults. END
BEGIN NOW They comprised astronomical kaleidoscopes exhibiting the END
BEGIN NOW twelve constellations of the zodiac from Aries to Pisces, miniature END
BEGIN NOW mechanical orreries, arithmetical gelatine lozenges, geometrical to END
BEGIN NOW correspond with zoological biscuits, globemap playing balls, END
BEGIN NOW historically costumed dolls. END
BEGIN NOW What also stimulated him in his cogitations? END
BEGIN NOW The financial success achieved by Ephraim Marks and Charles A. END
BEGIN NOW James, END
BEGIN NOW the former by his 1d bazaar at 42 George's street, south, the latter at END
BEGIN NOW his 6 1/2d shop and world's fancy fair and waxwork exhibition at 30 END
BEGIN NOW Henry street, admission 2d, children 1d: and the infinite possibilities END
BEGIN NOW hitherto unexploited of the modern art of advertisement if condensed in END
BEGIN NOW triliteral monoideal symbols, vertically of maximum visibility END
BEGIN NOW (divined), horizontally of maximum legibility (deciphered) and of END
BEGIN NOW magnetising efficacy to arrest involuntary attention, to interest, to END
BEGIN NOW convince, to decide. END
BEGIN NOW Such as? END
BEGIN NOW K. END
BEGIN NOW II. END
BEGIN NOW Kino's 11/- Trousers. END
BEGIN NOW House of Keys. END
BEGIN NOW Alexander J. END
BEGIN NOW Keyes. END
BEGIN NOW Such as not? END
BEGIN NOW Look at this long candle. END
BEGIN NOW Calculate when it burns out and you receive END
BEGIN NOW gratis 1 pair of our special non-compo boots, guaranteed 1 candle power. END
BEGIN NOW Address: Barclay and Cook, 18 Talbot street. END
BEGIN NOW Bacilikil (Insect Powder). END
BEGIN NOW Veribest (Boot Blacking). END
BEGIN NOW Uwantit (Combined END
BEGIN NOW pocket twoblade penknife with corkscrew, nailfile and pipecleaner). END
BEGIN NOW Such as never? END
BEGIN NOW What is home without Plumtree's Potted Meat? END
BEGIN NOW Incomplete. END
BEGIN NOW With it an abode of bliss. END
BEGIN NOW Manufactured by George Plumtree, 23 Merchants' quay, Dublin, put up in 4 END
BEGIN NOW oz pots, and inserted by Councillor Joseph P. END
BEGIN NOW Nannetti, M. END
BEGIN NOW P., Rotunda END
BEGIN NOW Ward, 19 Hardwicke street, under the obituary notices and anniversaries END
BEGIN NOW of deceases. END
BEGIN NOW The name on the label is Plumtree. END
BEGIN NOW A plumtree in a meatpot, END
BEGIN NOW registered trade mark. END
BEGIN NOW Beware of imitations. END
BEGIN NOW Peatmot. END
BEGIN NOW Trumplee. END
BEGIN NOW Moutpat. END
BEGIN NOW Plamtroo. END
BEGIN NOW Which example did he adduce to induce Stephen to deduce that END
BEGIN NOW originality, though producing its own reward, does not invariably END
BEGIN NOW conduce to success? END
BEGIN NOW His own ideated and rejected project of an illuminated showcart, drawn END
BEGIN NOW by a beast of burden, in which two smartly dressed girls were to be END
BEGIN NOW seated engaged in writing. END
BEGIN NOW What suggested scene was then constructed by Stephen? END
BEGIN NOW Solitary hotel in mountain pass. END
BEGIN NOW Autumn. END
BEGIN NOW Twilight. END
BEGIN NOW Fire lit. END
BEGIN NOW In dark END
BEGIN NOW corner young man seated. END
BEGIN NOW Young woman enters. END
BEGIN NOW Restless. END
BEGIN NOW Solitary. END
BEGIN NOW She END
BEGIN NOW sits. END
BEGIN NOW She goes to window. END
BEGIN NOW She stands. END
BEGIN NOW She sits. END
BEGIN NOW Twilight. END
BEGIN NOW She thinks. END
BEGIN NOW On END
BEGIN NOW solitary hotel paper she writes. END
BEGIN NOW She thinks. END
BEGIN NOW She writes. END
BEGIN NOW She sighs. END
BEGIN NOW Wheels and hoofs. END
BEGIN NOW She hurries out. END
BEGIN NOW He comes from his dark corner. END
BEGIN NOW He END
BEGIN NOW seizes solitary paper. END
BEGIN NOW He holds it towards fire. END
BEGIN NOW Twilight. END
BEGIN NOW He reads. END
BEGIN NOW Solitary. END
BEGIN NOW What? END
BEGIN NOW In sloping, upright and backhands: Queen's Hotel, Queen's Hotel, Queen's END
BEGIN NOW Hotel. END
BEGIN NOW Queen's Ho... END
BEGIN NOW What suggested scene was then reconstructed by Bloom? END
BEGIN NOW The Queen's Hotel, Ennis, county Clare, where Rudolph Bloom (Rudolf END
BEGIN NOW Virag) died on the evening of the 27 June 1886, at some hour unstated, END
BEGIN NOW in consequence of an overdose of monkshood (aconite) selfadministered in END
BEGIN NOW the form of a neuralgic liniment composed of 2 parts of aconite liniment END
BEGIN NOW to I of chloroform liniment (purchased by him at 10.20 a.m. END
BEGIN NOW on the END
BEGIN NOW morning of 27 June 1886 at the medical hall of Francis Dennehy, 17 END
BEGIN NOW Church street, Ennis) after having, though not in consequence of having, END
BEGIN NOW purchased at 3.15 p.m. END
BEGIN NOW on the afternoon of 27 June 1886 a new boater END
BEGIN NOW straw hat, extra smart (after having, though not in consequence of END
BEGIN NOW having, purchased at the hour and in the place aforesaid, the toxin END
BEGIN NOW aforesaid), at the general drapery store of James Cullen, 4 Main street, END
BEGIN NOW Ennis. END
BEGIN NOW Did he attribute this homonymity to information or coincidence or END
BEGIN NOW intuition? END
BEGIN NOW Coincidence. END
BEGIN NOW Did he depict the scene verbally for his guest to see? END
BEGIN NOW He preferred himself to see another's face and listen to another's words END
BEGIN NOW by which potential narration was realised and kinetic temperament END
BEGIN NOW relieved. END
BEGIN NOW Did he see only a second coincidence in the second scene narrated to END
BEGIN NOW him, described by the narrator as A Pisgah Sight of Palestine or The END
BEGIN NOW Parable of the Plums? END
BEGIN NOW It, with the preceding scene and with others unnarrated but existent by END
BEGIN NOW implication, to which add essays on various subjects or moral apothegms END
BEGIN NOW (e.g. END
BEGIN NOW My Favourite Hero or Procrastination is the Thief of Time) END
BEGIN NOW composed during schoolyears, seemed to him to contain in itself and in END
BEGIN NOW conjunction with the personal equation certain possibilities of END
BEGIN NOW financial, social, personal and sexual success, whether specially END
BEGIN NOW collected and selected as model pedagogic themes (of cent per cent END
BEGIN NOW merit) for the use of preparatory and junior grade students or END
BEGIN NOW contributed in printed form, following the precedent of Philip Beaufoy END
BEGIN NOW or Doctor Dick or Heblon's Studies in Blue, to a publication of END
BEGIN NOW certified circulation and solvency or employed verbally as intellectual END
BEGIN NOW stimulation for sympathetic auditors, tacitly appreciative of successful END
BEGIN NOW narrative and confidently augurative of successful achievement, during END
BEGIN NOW the increasingly longer nights gradually following the summer solstice END
BEGIN NOW on the day but three following, videlicet, Tuesday, 21 June (S. END
BEGIN NOW Aloysius END
BEGIN NOW Gonzaga), sunrise 3.33 a.m., sunset 8.29 p.m. END
BEGIN NOW Which domestic problem as much as, if not more than, any other END
BEGIN NOW frequently engaged his mind? END
BEGIN NOW What to do with our wives. END
BEGIN NOW What had been his hypothetical singular solutions? END
BEGIN NOW Parlour games (dominos, halma, tiddledywinks, spilikins, cup and ball, END
BEGIN NOW nap, spoil five, bezique, twentyfive, beggar my neighbour, draughts, END
BEGIN NOW chess or backgammon): embroidery, darning or knitting for the END
BEGIN NOW policeaided clothing society: musical duets, mandoline and guitar, piano END
BEGIN NOW and flute, guitar and piano: legal scrivenery or envelope addressing: END
BEGIN NOW biweekly visits to variety entertainments: commercial activity as END
BEGIN NOW pleasantly commanding and pleasingly obeyed mistress proprietress in a END
BEGIN NOW cool dairy shop or warm cigar divan: the clandestine satisfaction of END
BEGIN NOW erotic irritation in masculine brothels, state inspected and medically END
BEGIN NOW controlled: social visits, at regular infrequent prevented intervals and END
BEGIN NOW with regular frequent preventive superintendence, to and from female END
BEGIN NOW acquaintances of recognised respectability in the vicinity: courses of END
BEGIN NOW evening instruction specially designed to render liberal instruction END
BEGIN NOW agreeable. END
BEGIN NOW What instances of deficient mental development in his wife inclined him END
BEGIN NOW in favour of the lastmentioned (ninth) solution? END
BEGIN NOW In disoccupied moments she had more than once covered a sheet of paper END
BEGIN NOW with signs and hieroglyphics which she stated were Greek and Irish and END
BEGIN NOW Hebrew characters. END
BEGIN NOW She had interrogated constantly at varying intervals END
BEGIN NOW as to the correct method of writing the capital initial of the name of a END
BEGIN NOW city in Canada, Quebec. END
BEGIN NOW She understood little of political END
BEGIN NOW complications, internal, or balance of power, external. END
BEGIN NOW In calculating END
BEGIN NOW the addenda of bills she frequently had recourse to digital aid. END
BEGIN NOW After END
BEGIN NOW completion of laconic epistolary compositions she abandoned the END
BEGIN NOW implement of calligraphy in the encaustic pigment, exposed to the END
BEGIN NOW corrosive action of copperas, green vitriol and nutgall. END
BEGIN NOW Unusual END
BEGIN NOW polysyllables of foreign origin she interpreted phonetically or by false END
BEGIN NOW analogy or by both: metempsychosis (met him pike hoses), alias (a END
BEGIN NOW mendacious person mentioned in sacred scripture). END
BEGIN NOW What compensated in the false balance of her intelligence for these and END
BEGIN NOW such deficiencies of judgment regarding persons, places and things? END
BEGIN NOW The false apparent parallelism of all perpendicular arms of all END
BEGIN NOW balances, proved true by construction. END
BEGIN NOW The counterbalance of her END
BEGIN NOW proficiency of judgment regarding one person, proved true by experiment. END
BEGIN NOW How had he attempted to remedy this state of comparative ignorance? END
BEGIN NOW Variously. END
BEGIN NOW By leaving in a conspicuous place a certain book open at a END
BEGIN NOW certain page: by assuming in her, when alluding explanatorily, latent END
BEGIN NOW knowledge: by open ridicule in her presence of some absent other's END
BEGIN NOW ignorant lapse. END
BEGIN NOW With what success had he attempted direct instruction? END
BEGIN NOW She followed not all, a part of the whole, gave attention with interest END
BEGIN NOW comprehended with surprise, with care repeated, with greater difficulty END
BEGIN NOW remembered, forgot with ease, with misgiving reremembered, rerepeated END
BEGIN NOW with error. END
BEGIN NOW What system had proved more effective? END
BEGIN NOW Indirect suggestion implicating selfinterest. END
BEGIN NOW Example? END
BEGIN NOW She disliked umbrella with rain, he liked woman with umbrella, she END
BEGIN NOW disliked new hat with rain, he liked woman with new hat, he bought new END
BEGIN NOW hat with rain, she carried umbrella with new hat. END
BEGIN NOW Accepting the analogy implied in his guest's parable which examples of END
BEGIN NOW postexilic eminence did he adduce? END
BEGIN NOW Three seekers of the pure truth, Moses of Egypt, Moses Maimonides, END
BEGIN NOW author of More Nebukim (Guide of the Perplexed) and Moses Mendelssohn of END
BEGIN NOW such eminence that from Moses (of Egypt) to Moses (Mendelssohn) there END
BEGIN NOW arose none like Moses (Maimonides). END
BEGIN NOW What statement was made, under correction, by Bloom concerning a fourth END
BEGIN NOW seeker of pure truth, by name Aristotle, mentioned, with permission, by END
BEGIN NOW Stephen? END
BEGIN NOW That the seeker mentioned had been a pupil of a rabbinical philosopher, END
BEGIN NOW name uncertain. END
BEGIN NOW Were other anapocryphal illustrious sons of the law and children of a END
BEGIN NOW selected or rejected race mentioned? END
BEGIN NOW Felix Bartholdy Mendelssohn (composer), Baruch Spinoza (philosopher), END
BEGIN NOW Mendoza (pugilist), Ferdinand Lassalle (reformer, duellist). END
BEGIN NOW What fragments of verse from the ancient Hebrew and ancient Irish END
BEGIN NOW languages were cited with modulations of voice and translation of texts END
BEGIN NOW by guest to host and by host to guest? END
BEGIN NOW By Stephen: suil, suil, suil arun, suil go siocair agus suil go cuin END
BEGIN NOW (walk, walk, walk your way, walk in safety, walk with care). END
BEGIN NOW By Bloom: Kkifeloch, harimon rakatejch m'baad l'zamatejch (thy temple END
BEGIN NOW amid thy hair is as a slice of pomegranate). END
BEGIN NOW How was a glyphic comparison of the phonic symbols of both languages END
BEGIN NOW made in substantiation of the oral comparison? END
BEGIN NOW By juxtaposition. END
BEGIN NOW On the penultimate blank page of a book of inferior END
BEGIN NOW literary style, entituled Sweets of Sin (produced by Bloom and so END
BEGIN NOW manipulated that its front cover came in contact with the surface of the END
BEGIN NOW table) with a pencil (supplied by Stephen) Stephen wrote the Irish END
BEGIN NOW characters for gee, eh, dee, em, simple and modified, and Bloom in turn END
BEGIN NOW wrote the Hebrew characters ghimel, aleph, daleth and (in the absence of END
BEGIN NOW mem) a substituted qoph, explaining their arithmetical values as ordinal END
BEGIN NOW and cardinal numbers, videlicet 3, 1, 4, and 100. END
BEGIN NOW Was the knowledge possessed by both of each of these languages, the END
BEGIN NOW extinct and the revived, theoretical or practical? END
BEGIN NOW Theoretical, being confined to certain grammatical rules of accidence END
BEGIN NOW and syntax and practically excluding vocabulary. END
BEGIN NOW What points of contact existed between these languages and between the END
BEGIN NOW peoples who spoke them? END
BEGIN NOW The presence of guttural sounds, diacritic aspirations, epenthetic and END
BEGIN NOW servile letters in both languages: their antiquity, both having been END
BEGIN NOW taught on the plain of Shinar 242 years after the deluge in the seminary END
BEGIN NOW instituted by Fenius Farsaigh, descendant of Noah, progenitor of Israel, END
BEGIN NOW and ascendant of Heber and Heremon, progenitors of Ireland: their END
BEGIN NOW archaeological, genealogical, hagiographical, exegetical, homiletic, END
BEGIN NOW toponomastic, historical and religious literatures comprising the works END
BEGIN NOW of rabbis and culdees, Torah, Talmud (Mischna and Ghemara), Massor, END
BEGIN NOW Pentateuch, Book of the Dun Cow, Book of Ballymote, Garland of Howth, END
BEGIN NOW Book of Kells: their dispersal, persecution, survival and revival: the END
BEGIN NOW isolation of their synagogical and ecclesiastical rites in ghetto (S. END
BEGIN NOW Mary's Abbey) and masshouse (Adam and Eve's tavern): the proscription of END
BEGIN NOW their national costumes in penal laws and jewish dress acts: the END
BEGIN NOW restoration in Chanah David of Zion and the possibility of Irish END
BEGIN NOW political autonomy or devolution. END
BEGIN NOW What anthem did Bloom chant partially in anticipation of that multiple, END
BEGIN NOW ethnically irreducible consummation? END
BEGIN NOW Kolod balejwaw pnimah Nefesch, jehudi, homijah. END
BEGIN NOW Why was the chant arrested at the conclusion of this first distich? END
BEGIN NOW In consequence of defective mnemotechnic. END
BEGIN NOW How did the chanter compensate for this deficiency? END
BEGIN NOW By a periphrastic version of the general text. END
BEGIN NOW In what common study did their mutual reflections merge? END
BEGIN NOW The increasing simplification traceable from the Egyptian epigraphic END
BEGIN NOW hieroglyphs to the Greek and Roman alphabets and the anticipation of END
BEGIN NOW modern stenography and telegraphic code in the cuneiform inscriptions END
BEGIN NOW (Semitic) and the virgular quinquecostate ogham writing (Celtic). END
BEGIN NOW Did END
BEGIN NOW the guest comply with his host's request? END
BEGIN NOW Doubly, by appending his signature in Irish and Roman characters. END
BEGIN NOW What was Stephen's auditive sensation? END
BEGIN NOW He heard in a profound ancient male unfamiliar melody the accumulation END
BEGIN NOW of the past. END
BEGIN NOW What was Bloom's visual sensation? END
BEGIN NOW He saw in a quick young male familiar form the predestination of a END
BEGIN NOW future. END
BEGIN NOW What were Stephen's and Bloom's quasisimultaneous volitional END
BEGIN NOW quasisensations of concealed identities? END
BEGIN NOW Visually, Stephen's: The traditional figure of hypostasis, depicted by END
BEGIN NOW Johannes Damascenus, Lentulus Romanus and Epiphanius Monachus as END
BEGIN NOW leucodermic, sesquipedalian with winedark hair. END
BEGIN NOW Auditively, Bloom's: The END
BEGIN NOW traditional accent of the ecstasy of catastrophe. END
BEGIN NOW What future careers had been possible for Bloom in the past and with END
BEGIN NOW what exemplars? END
BEGIN NOW In the church, Roman, Anglican or Nonconformist: exemplars, the very END
BEGIN NOW reverend John Conmee S. END
BEGIN NOW J., the reverend T. END
BEGIN NOW Salmon, D. END
BEGIN NOW D., provost of END
BEGIN NOW Trinity college, Dr Alexander J. END
BEGIN NOW Dowie. END
BEGIN NOW At the bar, English or Irish: END
BEGIN NOW exemplars, Seymour Bushe, K. END
BEGIN NOW C., Rufus Isaacs, K. END
BEGIN NOW C. END
BEGIN NOW On the stage modern END
BEGIN NOW or Shakespearean: exemplars, Charles Wyndham, high comedian Osmond END
BEGIN NOW Tearle (died 1901), exponent of Shakespeare. END
BEGIN NOW Did the host encourage his guest to chant in a modulated voice a strange END
BEGIN NOW legend on an allied theme? END
BEGIN NOW Reassuringly, their place, where none could hear them talk, being END
BEGIN NOW secluded, reassured, the decocted beverages, allowing for subsolid END
BEGIN NOW residual sediment of a mechanical mixture, water plus sugar plus cream END
BEGIN NOW plus cocoa, having been consumed. END
BEGIN NOW Recite the first (major) part of this chanted legend. END
BEGIN NOW Little Harry Hughes and his schoolfellows all Went out for to play ball. END
BEGIN NOW And the very first ball little Harry Hughes played He drove it o'er the END
BEGIN NOW jew's garden wall. END
BEGIN NOW And the very second ball little Harry Hughes played END
BEGIN NOW He broke the jew's windows all. END
BEGIN NOW How did the son of Rudolph receive this first part? END
BEGIN NOW With unmixed feeling. END
BEGIN NOW Smiling, a jew he heard with pleasure and saw the END
BEGIN NOW unbroken kitchen window. END
BEGIN NOW Recite the second part (minor) of the legend. END
BEGIN NOW Then out there came the jew's daughter And she all dressed in green. END
BEGIN NOW "Come back, come back, you pretty little boy, And play your ball again." END
BEGIN NOW "I can't come back and I won't come back Without my schoolfellows all. END
BEGIN NOW For if my master he did hear He'd make it a sorry ball." END
BEGIN NOW She took him by the lilywhite hand And led him along the hall Until she END
BEGIN NOW led him to a room Where none could hear him call. END
BEGIN NOW She took a penknife out of her pocket And cut off his little head. END
BEGIN NOW And END
BEGIN NOW now he'll play his ball no more For he lies among the dead. END
BEGIN NOW How did the father of Millicent receive this second part? END
BEGIN NOW With mixed feelings. END
BEGIN NOW Unsmiling, he heard and saw with wonder a jew's END
BEGIN NOW daughter, all dressed in green. END
BEGIN NOW Condense Stephen's commentary. END
BEGIN NOW One of all, the least of all, is the victim predestined. END
BEGIN NOW Once by END
BEGIN NOW inadvertence twice by design he challenges his destiny. END
BEGIN NOW It comes when he END
BEGIN NOW is abandoned and challenges him reluctant and, as an apparition of hope END
BEGIN NOW and youth, holds him unresisting. END
BEGIN NOW It leads him to a strange habitation, END
BEGIN NOW to a secret infidel apartment, and there, implacable, immolates him, END
BEGIN NOW consenting. END
BEGIN NOW Why was the host (victim predestined) sad? END
BEGIN NOW He wished that a tale of a deed should be told of a deed not by him END
BEGIN NOW should by him not be told. END
BEGIN NOW Why was the host (reluctant, unresisting) still? END
BEGIN NOW In accordance with the law of the conservation of energy. END
BEGIN NOW Why was the host (secret infidel) silent? END
BEGIN NOW He weighed the possible evidences for and against ritual murder: the END
BEGIN NOW incitations of the hierarchy, the superstition of the populace, the END
BEGIN NOW propagation of rumour in continued fraction of veridicity, the envy of END
BEGIN NOW opulence, the influence of retaliation, the sporadic reappearance of END
BEGIN NOW atavistic delinquency, the mitigating circumstances of fanaticism, END
BEGIN NOW hypnotic suggestion and somnambulism. END
BEGIN NOW From which (if any) of these mental or physical disorders was he not END
BEGIN NOW totally immune? END
BEGIN NOW From hypnotic suggestion: once, waking, he had not recognised his END
BEGIN NOW sleeping apartment: more than once, waking, he had been for an END
BEGIN NOW indefinite time incapable of moving or uttering sounds. END
BEGIN NOW From END
BEGIN NOW somnambulism: once, sleeping, his body had risen, crouched and crawled END
BEGIN NOW in the direction of a heatless fire and, having attained its END
BEGIN NOW destination, there, curled, unheated, in night attire had lain, END
BEGIN NOW sleeping. END
BEGIN NOW Had this latter or any cognate phenomenon declared itself in any member END
BEGIN NOW of his family? END
BEGIN NOW Twice, in Holles street and in Ontario terrace, his daughter Millicent END
BEGIN NOW (Milly) at the ages of 6 and 8 years had uttered in sleep an exclamation END
BEGIN NOW of terror and had replied to the interrogations of two figures in night END
BEGIN NOW attire with a vacant mute expression. END
BEGIN NOW What other infantile memories had he of her? END
BEGIN NOW 15 June 1889. END
BEGIN NOW A querulous newborn female infant crying to cause and END
BEGIN NOW lessen congestion. END
BEGIN NOW A child renamed Padney Socks she shook with shocks END
BEGIN NOW her moneybox: counted his three free moneypenny buttons, one, tloo, END
BEGIN NOW tlee: a doll, a boy, a sailor she cast away: blond, born of two dark, END
BEGIN NOW she had blond ancestry, remote, a violation, Herr Hauptmann Hainau, END
BEGIN NOW Austrian army, proximate, a hallucination, lieutenant Mulvey, British END
BEGIN NOW navy. END
BEGIN NOW What endemic characteristics were present? END
BEGIN NOW Conversely the nasal and frontal formation was derived in a direct line END
BEGIN NOW of lineage which, though interrupted, would continue at distant END
BEGIN NOW intervals to more distant intervals to its most distant intervals. END
BEGIN NOW What memories had he of her adolescence? END
BEGIN NOW She relegated her hoop and skippingrope to a recess. END
BEGIN NOW On the duke's lawn, END
BEGIN NOW entreated by an English visitor, she declined to permit him to make and END
BEGIN NOW take away her photographic image (objection not stated). END
BEGIN NOW On the South END
BEGIN NOW Circular road in the company of Elsa Potter, followed by an individual END
BEGIN NOW of sinister aspect, she went half way down Stamer street and turned END
BEGIN NOW abruptly back (reason of change not stated). END
BEGIN NOW On the vigil of the 15th END
BEGIN NOW anniversary of her birth she wrote a letter from Mullingar, county END
BEGIN NOW Westmeath, making a brief allusion to a local student (faculty and year END
BEGIN NOW not stated). END
BEGIN NOW Did that first division, portending a second division, afflict him? END
BEGIN NOW Less than he had imagined, more than he had hoped. END
BEGIN NOW What second departure was contemporaneously perceived by him similarly, END
BEGIN NOW if differently? END
BEGIN NOW A temporary departure of his cat. END
BEGIN NOW Why similarly, why differently? END
BEGIN NOW Similarly, because actuated by a secret purpose the quest of a new male END
BEGIN NOW (Mullingar student) or of a healing herb (valerian). END
BEGIN NOW Differently, END
BEGIN NOW because of different possible returns to the inhabitants or to the END
BEGIN NOW habitation. END
BEGIN NOW In other respects were their differences similar? END
BEGIN NOW In passivity, in economy, in the instinct of tradition, in END
BEGIN NOW unexpectedness. END
BEGIN NOW As? END
BEGIN NOW Inasmuch as leaning she sustained her blond hair for him to ribbon it END
BEGIN NOW for her (cf neckarching cat). END
BEGIN NOW Moreover, on the free surface of the lake END
BEGIN NOW in Stephen's green amid inverted reflections of trees her uncommented END
BEGIN NOW spit, describing concentric circles of waterrings, indicated by the END
BEGIN NOW constancy of its permanence the locus of a somnolent prostrate fish (cf END
BEGIN NOW mousewatching cat). END
BEGIN NOW Again, in order to remember the date, combatants, issue and consequences END
BEGIN NOW of a famous military engagement she pulled a plait of her hair (cf END
BEGIN NOW earwashing cat). END
BEGIN NOW Furthermore, silly Milly, she dreamed of having had an END
BEGIN NOW unspoken unremembered conversation with a horse whose name had been END
BEGIN NOW Joseph to whom (which) she had offered a tumblerful of lemonade which it END
BEGIN NOW (he) had appeared to have accepted (cf hearthdreaming cat). END
BEGIN NOW Hence, in END
BEGIN NOW passivity, in economy, in the instinct of tradition, in unexpectedness, END
BEGIN NOW their differences were similar. END
BEGIN NOW In what way had he utilised gifts (1) an owl, (2) a clock, given as END
BEGIN NOW matrimonial auguries, to interest and to instruct her? END
BEGIN NOW As object lessons to explain: 1) the nature and habits of oviparous END
BEGIN NOW animals, the possibility of aerial flight, certain abnormalities of END
BEGIN NOW vision, the secular process of imbalsamation: 2) the principle of the END
BEGIN NOW pendulum, exemplified in bob, wheelgear and regulator, the translation END
BEGIN NOW in terms of human or social regulation of the various positions of END
BEGIN NOW clockwise moveable indicators on an unmoving dial, the exactitude of the END
BEGIN NOW recurrence per hour of an instant in each hour when the longer and the END
BEGIN NOW shorter indicator were at the same angle of inclination, videlicet, 5 END
BEGIN NOW 5/11 minutes past each hour per hour in arithmetical progression. END
BEGIN NOW In what manners did she reciprocate? END
BEGIN NOW She remembered: on the 27th anniversary of his birth she presented to END
BEGIN NOW him a breakfast moustachecup of imitation Crown Derby porcelain ware. END
BEGIN NOW She provided: at quarter day or thereabouts if or when purchases had END
BEGIN NOW been made by him not for her she showed herself attentive to his END
BEGIN NOW necessities, anticipating his desires. END
BEGIN NOW She admired: a natural phenomenon END
BEGIN NOW having been explained by him to her she expressed the immediate desire END
BEGIN NOW to possess without gradual acquisition a fraction of his science, the END
BEGIN NOW moiety, the quarter, a thousandth part. END
BEGIN NOW What proposal did Bloom, diambulist, father of Milly, somnambulist, make END
BEGIN NOW to Stephen, noctambulist? END
BEGIN NOW To pass in repose the hours intervening between Thursday (proper) and END
BEGIN NOW Friday (normal) on an extemporised cubicle in the apartment immediately END
BEGIN NOW above the kitchen and immediately adjacent to the sleeping apartment of END
BEGIN NOW his host and hostess. END
BEGIN NOW What various advantages would or might have resulted from a prolongation END
BEGIN NOW of such an extemporisation? END
BEGIN NOW For the guest: security of domicile and seclusion of study. END
BEGIN NOW For the END
BEGIN NOW host: rejuvenation of intelligence, vicarious satisfaction. END
BEGIN NOW For the END
BEGIN NOW hostess: disintegration of obsession, acquisition of correct Italian END
BEGIN NOW pronunciation. END
BEGIN NOW Why might these several provisional contingencies between a guest and a END
BEGIN NOW hostess not necessarily preclude or be precluded by a permanent END
BEGIN NOW eventuality of reconciliatory union between a schoolfellow and a jew's END
BEGIN NOW daughter? END
BEGIN NOW Because the way to daughter led through mother, the way to mother END
BEGIN NOW through daughter. END
BEGIN NOW To what inconsequent polysyllabic question of his host did the guest END
BEGIN NOW return a monosyllabic negative answer? END
BEGIN NOW If he had known the late Mrs Emily Sinico, accidentally killed at Sydney END
BEGIN NOW Parade railway station, 14 October 1903. END
BEGIN NOW What inchoate corollary statement was consequently suppressed by the END
BEGIN NOW host? END
BEGIN NOW A statement explanatory of his absence on the occasion of the interment END
BEGIN NOW of Mrs Mary Dedalus (born Goulding), 26 June 1903, vigil of the END
BEGIN NOW anniversary of the decease of Rudolph Bloom (born Virag). END
BEGIN NOW Was the proposal of asylum accepted? END
BEGIN NOW Promptly, inexplicably, with amicability, gratefully it was declined. END
BEGIN NOW What exchange of money took place between host and guest? END
BEGIN NOW The former returned to the latter, without interest, a sum of money (1- END
BEGIN NOW 7-0), one pound seven shillings sterling, advanced by the latter to the END
BEGIN NOW former. END
BEGIN NOW What counterproposals were alternately advanced, accepted, modified, END
BEGIN NOW declined, restated in other terms, reaccepted, ratified, reconfirmed? END
BEGIN NOW To inaugurate a prearranged course of Italian instruction, place the END
BEGIN NOW residence of the instructed. END
BEGIN NOW To inaugurate a course of vocal END
BEGIN NOW instruction, place the residence of the instructress. END
BEGIN NOW To inaugurate a END
BEGIN NOW series of static semistatic and peripatetic intellectual dialogues, END
BEGIN NOW places the residence of both speakers (if both speakers were resident in END
BEGIN NOW the same place), the Ship hotel and tavern, 6 Lower Abbey street (W. END
BEGIN NOW and END
BEGIN NOW E. END
BEGIN NOW Connery, proprietors), the National Library of Ireland, 10 Kildare END
BEGIN NOW street, the National Maternity Hospital, 29, 30 and 31 Holles street, a END
BEGIN NOW public garden, the vicinity of a place of worship, a conjunction of two END
BEGIN NOW or more public thoroughfares, the point of bisection of a right line END
BEGIN NOW drawn between their residences (if both speakers were resident in END
BEGIN NOW different places). END
BEGIN NOW What rendered problematic for Bloom the realisation of these mutually END
BEGIN NOW selfexcluding propositions? END
BEGIN NOW The irreparability of the past: once at a performance of Albert END
BEGIN NOW Hengler's circus in the Rotunda, Rutland square, Dublin, an intuitive END
BEGIN NOW particoloured clown in quest of paternity had penetrated from the ring END
BEGIN NOW to a place in the auditorium where Bloom, solitary, was seated and had END
BEGIN NOW publicly declared to an exhilarated audience that he (Bloom) was his END
BEGIN NOW (the clown's) papa. END
BEGIN NOW The imprevidibility of the future: once in the END
BEGIN NOW summer of 1898 he (Bloom) had marked a florin (2/-) with three notches END
BEGIN NOW on the milled edge and tendered it m payment of an account due to and END
BEGIN NOW received by J. END
BEGIN NOW and T. END
BEGIN NOW Davy, family grocers, 1 Charlemont Mall, Grand END
BEGIN NOW Canal, for circulation on the waters of civic finance, for possible, END
BEGIN NOW circuitous or direct, return. END
BEGIN NOW Was the clown Bloom's son? END
BEGIN NOW No. END
BEGIN NOW Had Bloom's coin returned? END
BEGIN NOW Never. END
BEGIN NOW Why would a recurrent frustration the more depress him? END
BEGIN NOW Because at the critical turningpoint of human existence he desired to END
BEGIN NOW amend many social conditions, the product of inequality and avarice and END
BEGIN NOW international animosity. END
BEGIN NOW He believed then that human life was infinitely END
BEGIN NOW perfectible, eliminating these conditions? END
BEGIN NOW There remained the generic conditions imposed by natural, as distinct END
BEGIN NOW from human law, as integral parts of the human whole: the necessity of END
BEGIN NOW destruction to procure alimentary sustenance: the painful character of END
BEGIN NOW the ultimate functions of separate existence, the agonies of birth and END
BEGIN NOW death: the monotonous menstruation of simian and (particularly) human END
BEGIN NOW females extending from the age of puberty to the menopause: inevitable END
BEGIN NOW accidents at sea, in mines and factories: certain very painful maladies END
BEGIN NOW and their resultant surgical operations, innate lunacy and congenital END
BEGIN NOW criminality, decimating epidemics: catastrophic cataclysms which make END
BEGIN NOW terror the basis of human mentality: seismic upheavals the epicentres of END
BEGIN NOW which are located in densely populated regions: the fact of vital END
BEGIN NOW growth, through convulsions of metamorphosis, from infancy through END
BEGIN NOW maturity to decay. END
BEGIN NOW Why did he desist from speculation? END
BEGIN NOW Because it was a task for a superior intelligence to substitute other END
BEGIN NOW more acceptable phenomena in the place of the less acceptable phenomena END
BEGIN NOW to be removed. END
BEGIN NOW Did Stephen participate in his dejection? END
BEGIN NOW He affirmed his significance as a conscious rational animal proceeding END
BEGIN NOW syllogistically from the known to the unknown and a conscious rational END
BEGIN NOW reagent between a micro and a macrocosm ineluctably constructed upon the END
BEGIN NOW incertitude of the void. END
BEGIN NOW Was this affirmation apprehended by Bloom? END
BEGIN NOW Not verbally. END
BEGIN NOW Substantially. END
BEGIN NOW What comforted his misapprehension? END
BEGIN NOW That as a competent keyless citizen he had proceeded energetically from END
BEGIN NOW the unknown to the known through the incertitude of the void. END
BEGIN NOW In what order of precedence, with what attendant ceremony was the exodus END
BEGIN NOW from the house of bondage to the wilderness of inhabitation effected? END
BEGIN NOW Lighted Candle in Stick borne by END
BEGIN NOW BLOOM END
BEGIN NOW Diaconal Hat on Ashplant borne by END
BEGIN NOW STEPHEN: END
BEGIN NOW With what intonation secreto of what commemorative psalm? END
BEGIN NOW The 113th, modus peregrinus: In exitu Israel de Egypto: domus Jacob de END
BEGIN NOW populo barbaro. END
BEGIN NOW What did each do at the door of egress? END
BEGIN NOW Bloom set the candlestick on the floor. END
BEGIN NOW Stephen put the hat on his head. END
BEGIN NOW For what creature was the door of egress a door of ingress? END
BEGIN NOW For a cat. END
BEGIN NOW What spectacle confronted them when they, first the host, then the END
BEGIN NOW guest, emerged silently, doubly dark, from obscurity by a passage from END
BEGIN NOW the rere of the house into the penumbra of the garden? END
BEGIN NOW The heaventree of stars hung with humid nightblue fruit. END
BEGIN NOW With what meditations did Bloom accompany his demonstration to his END
BEGIN NOW companion of various constellations? END
BEGIN NOW Meditations of evolution increasingly vaster: of the moon invisible in END
BEGIN NOW incipient lunation, approaching perigee: of the infinite lattiginous END
BEGIN NOW scintillating uncondensed milky way, discernible by daylight by an END
BEGIN NOW observer placed at the lower end of a cylindrical vertical shaft 5000 ft END
BEGIN NOW deep sunk from the surface towards the centre of the earth: of Sirius END
BEGIN NOW (alpha in Canis Maior) 10 lightyears (57,000,000,000,000 miles) distant END
BEGIN NOW and in volume 900 times the dimension of our planet: of Arcturus: of the END
BEGIN NOW precession of equinoxes: of Orion with belt and sextuple sun theta and END
BEGIN NOW nebula in which 100 of our solar systems could be contained: of moribund END
BEGIN NOW and of nascent new stars such as Nova in 1901: of our system plunging END
BEGIN NOW towards the constellation of Hercules: of the parallax or parallactic END
BEGIN NOW drift of socalled fixed stars, in reality evermoving wanderers from END
BEGIN NOW immeasurably remote eons to infinitely remote futures in comparison with END
BEGIN NOW which the years, threescore and ten, of allotted human life formed a END
BEGIN NOW parenthesis of infinitesimal brevity. END
BEGIN NOW Were there obverse meditations of involution increasingly less vast? END
BEGIN NOW Of the eons of geological periods recorded in the stratifications of the END
BEGIN NOW earth: of the myriad minute entomological organic existences concealed END
BEGIN NOW in cavities of the earth, beneath removable stones, in hives and mounds, END
BEGIN NOW of microbes, germs, bacteria, bacilli, spermatozoa: of the incalculable END
BEGIN NOW trillions of billions of millions of imperceptible molecules contained END
BEGIN NOW by cohesion of molecular affinity in a single pinhead: of the universe END
BEGIN NOW of human serum constellated with red and white bodies, themselves END
BEGIN NOW universes of void space constellated with other bodies, each, in END
BEGIN NOW continuity, its universe of divisible component bodies of which each was END
BEGIN NOW again divisible in divisions of redivisible component bodies, dividends END
BEGIN NOW and divisors ever diminishing without actual division till, if the END
BEGIN NOW progress were carried far enough, nought nowhere was never reached. END
BEGIN NOW Why did he not elaborate these calculations to a more precise result? END
BEGIN NOW Because some years previously in 1886 when occupied with the problem of END
BEGIN NOW the quadrature of the circle he had learned of the existence of a number END
BEGIN NOW computed to a relative degree of accuracy to be of such magnitude and of END
BEGIN NOW so many places, e.g., the 9th power of the 9th power of 9, that, the END
BEGIN NOW result having been obtained, 33 closely printed volumes of 1000 pages END
BEGIN NOW each of innumerable quires and reams of India paper would have to be END
BEGIN NOW requisitioned in order to contain the complete tale of its printed END
BEGIN NOW integers of units, tens, hundreds, thousands, tens of thousands, END
BEGIN NOW hundreds of thousands, millions, tens of millions, hundreds of millions, END
BEGIN NOW billions, the nucleus of the nebula of every digit of every series END
BEGIN NOW containing succinctly the potentiality of being raised to the utmost END
BEGIN NOW kinetic elaboration of any power of any of its powers. END
BEGIN NOW Did he find the problems of the inhabitability of the planets and their END
BEGIN NOW satellites by a race, given in species, and of the possible social and END
BEGIN NOW moral redemption of said race by a redeemer, easier of solution? END
BEGIN NOW Of a different order of difficulty. END
BEGIN NOW Conscious that the human organism, END
BEGIN NOW normally capable of sustaining an atmospheric pressure of 19 tons, when END
BEGIN NOW elevated to a considerable altitude in the terrestrial atmosphere END
BEGIN NOW suffered with arithmetical progression of intensity, according as the END
BEGIN NOW line of demarcation between troposphere and stratosphere was END
BEGIN NOW approximated from nasal hemorrhage, impeded respiration and vertigo, END
BEGIN NOW when proposing this problem for solution, he had conjectured as a END
BEGIN NOW working hypothesis which could not be proved impossible that a more END
BEGIN NOW adaptable and differently anatomically constructed race of beings might END
BEGIN NOW subsist otherwise under Martian, Mercurial, Veneral, Jovian, Saturnian, END
BEGIN NOW Neptunian or Uranian sufficient and equivalent conditions, though an END
BEGIN NOW apogean humanity of beings created in varying forms with finite END
BEGIN NOW differences resulting similar to the whole and to one another would END
BEGIN NOW probably there as here remain inalterably and inalienably attached to END
BEGIN NOW vanities, to vanities of vanities and to all that is vanity. END
BEGIN NOW And the problem of possible redemption? END
BEGIN NOW The minor was proved by the END
BEGIN NOW major. END
BEGIN NOW Which various features of the constellations were in turn considered? END
BEGIN NOW The various colours significant of various degrees of vitality (white, END
BEGIN NOW yellow, crimson, vermilion, cinnabar): their degrees of brilliancy: END
BEGIN NOW their magnitudes revealed up to and including the 7th: their positions: END
BEGIN NOW the waggoner's star: Walsingham way: the chariot of David: the annular END
BEGIN NOW cinctures of Saturn: the condensation of spiral nebulae into suns: the END
BEGIN NOW interdependent gyrations of double suns: the independent synchronous END
BEGIN NOW discoveries of Galileo, Simon Marius, Piazzi, Le Verrier, Herschel, END
BEGIN NOW Galle: the systematisations attempted by Bode and Kepler of cubes of END
BEGIN NOW distances and squares of times of revolution: the almost infinite END
BEGIN NOW compressibility of hirsute comets and their vast elliptical egressive END
BEGIN NOW and reentrant orbits from perihelion to aphelion: the sidereal origin of END
BEGIN NOW meteoric stones: the Libyan floods on Mars about the period of the birth END
BEGIN NOW of the younger astroscopist: the annual recurrence of meteoric showers END
BEGIN NOW about the period of the feast of S. END
BEGIN NOW Lawrence (martyr, lo August): the END
BEGIN NOW monthly recurrence known as the new moon with the old moon in her arms: END
BEGIN NOW the posited influence of celestial on human bodies: the appearance of a END
BEGIN NOW star (1st magnitude) of exceeding brilliancy dominating by night and day END
BEGIN NOW (a new luminous sun generated by the collision and amalgamation in END
BEGIN NOW incandescence of two nonluminous exsuns) about the period of the birth END
BEGIN NOW of William Shakespeare over delta in the recumbent neversetting END
BEGIN NOW constellation of Cassiopeia and of a star (2nd magnitude) of similar END
BEGIN NOW origin but of lesser brilliancy which had appeared in and disappeared END
BEGIN NOW from the constellation of the Corona Septentrionalis about the period of END
BEGIN NOW the birth of Leopold Bloom and of other stars of (presumably) similar END
BEGIN NOW origin which had (effectively or presumably) appeared in and disappeared END
BEGIN NOW from the constellation of Andromeda about the period of the birth of END
BEGIN NOW Stephen Dedalus, and in and from the constellation of Auriga some years END
BEGIN NOW after the birth and death of Rudolph Bloom, junior, and in and from END
BEGIN NOW other constellations some years before or after the birth or death of END
BEGIN NOW other persons: the attendant phenomena of eclipses, solar and lunar, END
BEGIN NOW from immersion to emersion, abatement of wind, transit of shadow, END
BEGIN NOW taciturnity of winged creatures, emergence of nocturnal or crepuscular END
BEGIN NOW animals, persistence of infernal light, obscurity of terrestrial waters, END
BEGIN NOW pallor of human beings. END
BEGIN NOW His (Bloom's) logical conclusion, having weighed the matter and allowing END
BEGIN NOW for possible error? END
BEGIN NOW That it was not a heaventree, not a heavengrot, not a heavenbeast, not a END
BEGIN NOW heavenman. END
BEGIN NOW That it was a Utopia, there being no known method from the END
BEGIN NOW known to the unknown: an infinity renderable equally finite by the END
BEGIN NOW suppositious apposition of one or more bodies equally of the same and of END
BEGIN NOW different magnitudes: a mobility of illusory forms immobilised in space, END
BEGIN NOW remobilised in air: a past which possibly had ceased to exist as a END
BEGIN NOW present before its probable spectators had entered actual present END
BEGIN NOW existence. END
BEGIN NOW Was he more convinced of the esthetic value of the spectacle? END
BEGIN NOW Indubitably in consequence of the reiterated examples of poets in the END
BEGIN NOW delirium of the frenzy of attachment or in the abasement of rejection END
BEGIN NOW invoking ardent sympathetic constellations or the frigidity of the END
BEGIN NOW satellite of their planet. END
BEGIN NOW Did he then accept as an article of belief the theory of astrological END
BEGIN NOW influences upon sublunary disasters? END
BEGIN NOW It seemed to him as possible of proof as of confutation and the END
BEGIN NOW nomenclature employed in its selenographical charts as attributable to END
BEGIN NOW verifiable intuition as to fallacious analogy: the lake of dreams, the END
BEGIN NOW sea of rains, the gulf of dews, the ocean of fecundity. END
BEGIN NOW What special affinities appeared to him to exist between the moon and END
BEGIN NOW woman? END
BEGIN NOW Her antiquity in preceding and surviving successive tellurian END
BEGIN NOW generations: her nocturnal predominance: her satellitic dependence: her END
BEGIN NOW luminary reflection: her constancy under all her phases, rising and END
BEGIN NOW setting by her appointed times, waxing and waning: the forced END
BEGIN NOW invariability of her aspect: her indeterminate response to inaffirmative END
BEGIN NOW interrogation: her potency over effluent and refluent waters: her power END
BEGIN NOW to enamour, to mortify, to invest with beauty, to render insane, to END
BEGIN NOW incite to and aid delinquency: the tranquil inscrutability of her END
BEGIN NOW visage: the terribility of her isolated dominant implacable resplendent END
BEGIN NOW propinquity: her omens of tempest and of calm: the stimulation of her END
BEGIN NOW light, her motion and her presence: the admonition of her craters, her END
BEGIN NOW arid seas, her silence: her splendour, when visible: her attraction, END
BEGIN NOW when invisible. END
BEGIN NOW What visible luminous sign attracted Bloom's, who attracted Stephen's, END
BEGIN NOW gaze? END
BEGIN NOW In the second storey (rere) of his (Bloom's) house the light of a END
BEGIN NOW paraffin oil lamp with oblique shade projected on a screen of roller END
BEGIN NOW blind supplied by Frank O'Hara, window blind, curtain pole and revolving END
BEGIN NOW shutter manufacturer, 16 Aungier street. END
BEGIN NOW How did he elucidate the mystery of an invisible attractive person, his END
BEGIN NOW wife Marion (Molly) Bloom, denoted by a visible splendid sign, a lamp? END
BEGIN NOW With indirect and direct verbal allusions or affirmations: with subdued END
BEGIN NOW affection and admiration: with description: with impediment: with END
BEGIN NOW suggestion. END
BEGIN NOW Both then were silent? END
BEGIN NOW Silent, each contemplating the other in both mirrors of the reciprocal END
BEGIN NOW flesh of theirhisnothis fellowfaces. END
BEGIN NOW Were they indefinitely inactive? END
BEGIN NOW At Stephen's suggestion, at Bloom's instigation both, first Stephen, END
BEGIN NOW then Bloom, in penumbra urinated, their sides contiguous, their organs END
BEGIN NOW of micturition reciprocally rendered invisible by manual circumposition, END
BEGIN NOW their gazes, first Bloom's, then Stephen's, elevated to the projected END
BEGIN NOW luminous and semiluminous shadow. END
BEGIN NOW Similarly? END
BEGIN NOW The trajectories of their, first sequent, then simultaneous, urinations END
BEGIN NOW were dissimilar: Bloom's longer, less irruent, in the incomplete form of END
BEGIN NOW the bifurcated penultimate alphabetical letter, who in his ultimate year END
BEGIN NOW at High School (1880) had been capable of attaining the point of END
BEGIN NOW greatest altitude against the whole concurrent strength of the END
BEGIN NOW institution, 210 scholars: Stephen's higher, more sibilant, who in the END
BEGIN NOW ultimate hours of the previous day had augmented by diuretic consumption END
BEGIN NOW an insistent vesical pressure. END
BEGIN NOW What different problems presented themselves to each concerning the END
BEGIN NOW invisible audible collateral organ of the other? END
BEGIN NOW To Bloom: the problems of irritability, tumescence, rigidity, END
BEGIN NOW reactivity, dimension, sanitariness, pilosity. END
BEGIN NOW To Stephen: the problem of the sacerdotal integrity of Jesus circumcised END
BEGIN NOW (I January, holiday of obligation to hear mass and abstain from END
BEGIN NOW unnecessary servile work) and the problem as to whether the divine END
BEGIN NOW prepuce, the carnal bridal ring of the holy Roman catholic apostolic END
BEGIN NOW church, conserved in Calcata, were deserving of simple hyperduly or of END
BEGIN NOW the fourth degree of latria accorded to the abscission of such divine END
BEGIN NOW excrescences as hair and toenails. END
BEGIN NOW What celestial sign was by both simultaneously observed? END
BEGIN NOW A star precipitated with great apparent velocity across the firmament END
BEGIN NOW from Vega in the Lyre above the zenith beyond the stargroup of the Tress END
BEGIN NOW of Berenice towards the zodiacal sign of Leo. END
BEGIN NOW How did the centripetal remainer afford egress to the centrifugal END
BEGIN NOW departer? END
BEGIN NOW By inserting the barrel of an arruginated male key in the hole of an END
BEGIN NOW unstable female lock, obtaining a purchase on the bow of the key and END
BEGIN NOW turning its wards from right to left, withdrawing a bolt from its END
BEGIN NOW staple, pulling inward spasmodically an obsolescent unhinged door and END
BEGIN NOW revealing an aperture for free egress and free ingress. END
BEGIN NOW How did they take leave, one of the other, in separation? END
BEGIN NOW Standing perpendicular at the same door and on different sides of its END
BEGIN NOW base, the lines of their valedictory arms, meeting at any point and END
BEGIN NOW forming any angle less than the sum of two right angles. END
BEGIN NOW What sound accompanied the union of their tangent, the disunion of their END
BEGIN NOW (respectively) centrifugal and centripetal hands? END
BEGIN NOW The sound of the peal of the hour of the night by the chime of the bells END
BEGIN NOW in the church of Saint George. END
BEGIN NOW What echoes of that sound were by both and each heard? END
BEGIN NOW By Stephen: END
BEGIN NOW Liliata rutilantium. END
BEGIN NOW Turma circumdet. END
BEGIN NOW Iubilantium te virginum. END
BEGIN NOW Chorus END
BEGIN NOW excipiat. END
BEGIN NOW By Bloom: END
BEGIN NOW Heigho, heigho, Heigho, heigho. END
BEGIN NOW Where were the several members of the company which with Bloom that day END
BEGIN NOW at the bidding of that peal had travelled from Sandymount in the south END
BEGIN NOW to Glasnevin in the north? END
BEGIN NOW Martin Cunningham (in bed), Jack Power (in bed), Simon Dedalus (in bed), END
BEGIN NOW Ned Lambert (in bed), Tom Kernan (in bed), Joe Hynes (in bed), John END
BEGIN NOW Henry Menton (in bed), Bernard Corrigan (in bed), Patsy Dignam (in bed), END
BEGIN NOW Paddy Dignam (in the grave). END
BEGIN NOW Alone, what did Bloom hear? END
BEGIN NOW The double reverberation of retreating feet on the heavenborn earth, the END
BEGIN NOW double vibration of a jew's harp in the resonant lane. END
BEGIN NOW Alone, what did Bloom feel? END
BEGIN NOW The cold of interstellar space, thousands of degrees below freezing END
BEGIN NOW point or the absolute zero of Fahrenheit, Centigrade or RÃ©aumur: the END
BEGIN NOW incipient intimations of proximate dawn. END
BEGIN NOW Of what did bellchime and handtouch and footstep and lonechill remind END
BEGIN NOW him? END
BEGIN NOW Of companions now in various manners in different places defunct: Percy END
