BEGIN NOW Apjohn (killed in action, Modder River), Philip Gilligan (phthisis, END
BEGIN NOW Jervis Street hospital), Matthew F. END
BEGIN NOW Kane (accidental drowning, Dublin END
BEGIN NOW Bay), Philip Moisel (pyemia, Heytesbury street), Michael Hart (phthisis, END
BEGIN NOW Mater Misericordiae hospital), Patrick Dignam (apoplexy, Sandymount). END
BEGIN NOW What prospect of what phenomena inclined him to remain? END
BEGIN NOW The disparition of three final stars, the diffusion of daybreak, the END
BEGIN NOW apparition of a new solar disk. END
BEGIN NOW Had he ever been a spectator of those phenomena? END
BEGIN NOW Once, in 1887, after a protracted performance of charades in the house END
BEGIN NOW of Luke Doyle, Kimmage, he had awaited with patience the apparition of END
BEGIN NOW the diurnal phenomenon, seated on a wall, his gaze turned in the END
BEGIN NOW direction of Mizrach, the east. END
BEGIN NOW He remembered the initial paraphenomena? END
BEGIN NOW More active air, a matutinal distant cock, ecclesiastical clocks at END
BEGIN NOW various points, avine music, the isolated tread of an early wayfarer, END
BEGIN NOW the visible diffusion of the light of an invisible luminous body, the END
BEGIN NOW first golden limb of the resurgent sun perceptible low on the horizon. END
BEGIN NOW Did he remain? END
BEGIN NOW With deep inspiration he returned, retraversing the garden, reentering END
BEGIN NOW the passage, reclosing the door. END
BEGIN NOW With brief suspiration he reassumed the END
BEGIN NOW candle, reascended the stairs, reapproached the door of the front room, END
BEGIN NOW hallfloor, and reentered. END
BEGIN NOW What suddenly arrested his ingress? END
BEGIN NOW The right temporal lobe of the hollow sphere of his cranium came into END
BEGIN NOW contact with a solid timber angle where, an infinitesimal but sensible END
BEGIN NOW fraction of a second later, a painful sensation was located in END
BEGIN NOW consequence of antecedent sensations transmitted and registered. END
BEGIN NOW Describe the alterations effected in the disposition of the articles of END
BEGIN NOW furniture. END
BEGIN NOW A sofa upholstered in prune plush had been translocated from opposite END
BEGIN NOW the door to the ingleside near the compactly furled Union Jack (an END
BEGIN NOW alteration which he had frequently intended to execute): the blue and END
BEGIN NOW white checker inlaid majolicatopped table had been placed opposite the END
BEGIN NOW door in the place vacated by the prune plush sofa: the walnut sideboard END
BEGIN NOW (a projecting angle of which had momentarily arrested his ingress) had END
BEGIN NOW been moved from its position beside the door to a more advantageous but END
BEGIN NOW more perilous position in front of the door: two chairs had been moved END
BEGIN NOW from right and left of the ingleside to the position originally occupied END
BEGIN NOW by the blue and white checker inlaid majolicatopped table. END
BEGIN NOW Describe them. END
BEGIN NOW One: a squat stuffed easychair, with stout arms extended and back END
BEGIN NOW slanted to the rere, which, repelled in recoil, had then upturned an END
BEGIN NOW irregular fringe of a rectangular rug and now displayed on its amply END
BEGIN NOW upholstered seat a centralised diffusing and diminishing discolouration. END
BEGIN NOW The other: a slender splayfoot chair of glossy cane curves, placed END
BEGIN NOW directly opposite the former, its frame from top to seat and from seat END
BEGIN NOW to base being varnished dark brown, its seat being a bright circle of END
BEGIN NOW white plaited rush. END
BEGIN NOW What significances attached to these two chairs? END
BEGIN NOW Significances of similitude, of posture, of symbolism, of circumstantial END
BEGIN NOW evidence, of testimonial supermanence. END
BEGIN NOW What occupied the position originally occupied by the sideboard? END
BEGIN NOW A vertical piano (Cadby) with exposed keyboard, its closed coffin END
BEGIN NOW supporting a pair of long yellow ladies' gloves and an emerald ashtray END
BEGIN NOW containing four consumed matches, a partly consumed cigarette and two END
BEGIN NOW discoloured ends of cigarettes, its musicrest supporting the music in END
BEGIN NOW the key of G natural for voice and piano of Love's Old Sweet Song (words END
BEGIN NOW by G. END
BEGIN NOW Clifton Bingham, composed by J. END
BEGIN NOW L. END
BEGIN NOW Molloy, sung by Madam END
BEGIN NOW Antoinette Sterling) open at the last page with the final indications ad END
BEGIN NOW libitum, forte, pedal, animato, sustained pedal, ritirando, close. END
BEGIN NOW With what sensations did Bloom contemplate in rotation these objects? END
BEGIN NOW With strain, elevating a candlestick: with pain, feeling on his right END
BEGIN NOW temple a contused tumescence: with attention, focussing his gaze on a END
BEGIN NOW large dull passive and a slender bright active: with solicitation, END
BEGIN NOW bending and downturning the upturned rugfringe: with amusement, END
BEGIN NOW remembering Dr Malachi Mulligan's scheme of colour containing the END
BEGIN NOW gradation of green: with pleasure, repeating the words and antecedent END
BEGIN NOW act and perceiving through various channels of internal sensibility the END
BEGIN NOW consequent and concomitant tepid pleasant diffusion of gradual END
BEGIN NOW discolouration. END
BEGIN NOW His next proceeding? END
BEGIN NOW From an open box on the majolicatopped table he extracted a black END
BEGIN NOW diminutive cone, one inch in height, placed it on its circular base on a END
BEGIN NOW small tin plate, placed his candlestick on the right corner of the END
BEGIN NOW mantelpiece, produced from his waistcoat a folded page of prospectus END
BEGIN NOW (illustrated) entitled Agendath Netaim, unfolded the same, examined it END
BEGIN NOW superficially, rolled it into a thin cylinder, ignited it in the END
BEGIN NOW candleflame, applied it when ignited to the apex of the cone till the END
BEGIN NOW latter reached the stage of rutilance, placed the cylinder in the basin END
BEGIN NOW of the candlestick disposing its unconsumed part in such a manner as to END
BEGIN NOW facilitate total combustion. END
BEGIN NOW What followed this operation? END
BEGIN NOW The truncated conical crater summit of the diminutive volcano emitted a END
BEGIN NOW vertical and serpentine fume redolent of aromatic oriental incense. END
BEGIN NOW What homothetic objects, other than the candlestick, stood on the END
BEGIN NOW mantelpiece? END
BEGIN NOW A timepiece of striated Connemara marble, stopped at the hour of 4.46 END
BEGIN NOW a.m. END
BEGIN NOW on the 21 March 1896, matrimonial gift of Matthew Dillon: a dwarf END
BEGIN NOW tree of glacial arborescence under a transparent bellshade, matrimonial END
BEGIN NOW gift of Luke and Caroline Doyle: an embalmed owl, matrimonial gift of END
BEGIN NOW Alderman John Hooper. END
BEGIN NOW What interchanges of looks took place between these three objects and END
BEGIN NOW Bloom? END
BEGIN NOW In the mirror of the giltbordered pierglass the undecorated back of the END
BEGIN NOW dwarf tree regarded the upright back of the embalmed owl. END
BEGIN NOW Before the END
BEGIN NOW mirror the matrimonial gift of Alderman John Hooper with a clear END
BEGIN NOW melancholy wise bright motionless compassionate gaze regarded Bloom END
BEGIN NOW while Bloom with obscure tranquil profound motionless compassionated END
BEGIN NOW gaze regarded the matrimonial gift of Luke and Caroline Doyle. END
BEGIN NOW What composite asymmetrical image in the mirror then attracted his END
BEGIN NOW attention? END
BEGIN NOW The image of a solitary (ipsorelative) mutable (aliorelative) man. END
BEGIN NOW Why solitary (ipsorelative)? END
BEGIN NOW Brothers and sisters had he none. END
BEGIN NOW Yet that man's father was his END
BEGIN NOW grandfather's son. END
BEGIN NOW Why mutable (aliorelative)? END
BEGIN NOW From infancy to maturity he had resembled his maternal procreatrix. END
BEGIN NOW From END
BEGIN NOW maturity to senility he would increasingly resemble his paternal END
BEGIN NOW procreator. END
BEGIN NOW What final visual impression was communicated to him by the mirror? END
BEGIN NOW The optical reflection of several inverted volumes improperly arranged END
BEGIN NOW and not in the order of their common letters with scintillating titles END
BEGIN NOW on the two bookshelves opposite. END
BEGIN NOW Catalogue these books. END
BEGIN NOW Thom's Dublin Post Office Directory, 1886. END
BEGIN NOW Denis Florence M'Carthy's END
BEGIN NOW Poetical Works (copper beechleaf bookmark at p. END
BEGIN NOW 5). END
BEGIN NOW Shakespeare's Works END
BEGIN NOW (dark crimson morocco, goldtooled). END
BEGIN NOW The Useful Ready Reckoner (brown cloth). END
BEGIN NOW The Secret History of the Court of Charles II (red cloth, tooled END
BEGIN NOW binding). END
BEGIN NOW The Child's Guide (blue cloth). END
BEGIN NOW The Beauties of Killarney (wrappers). END
BEGIN NOW When We Were Boys by William O'Brien M. END
BEGIN NOW P. END
BEGIN NOW (green cloth, slightly faded, END
BEGIN NOW envelope bookmark at p. END
BEGIN NOW 217). END
BEGIN NOW Thoughts from Spinoza (maroon leather). END
BEGIN NOW The Story of the Heavens by Sir Robert Ball (blue cloth). END
BEGIN NOW Ellis's Three END
BEGIN NOW Trips to Madagascar (brown cloth, title obliterated). END
BEGIN NOW The Stark-Munro Letters by A. END
BEGIN NOW Conan Doyle, property of the City of END
BEGIN NOW Dublin Public Library, 106 Capel street, lent 21 May (Whitsun Eve) 1904, END
BEGIN NOW due 4 June 1904, 13 days overdue (black cloth binding, bearing white END
BEGIN NOW letternumber ticket). END
BEGIN NOW Voyages in China by "Viator" (recovered with brown paper, red ink END
BEGIN NOW title). END
BEGIN NOW Philosophy of the Talmud (sewn pamphlet). END
BEGIN NOW Lockhart's Life of Napoleon END
BEGIN NOW (cover wanting, marginal annotations, minimising victories, aggrandising END
BEGIN NOW defeats of the protagonist). END
BEGIN NOW Soll und Haben by Gustav Freytag (black boards, Gothic characters, END
BEGIN NOW cigarette coupon bookmark at p. END
BEGIN NOW 24). END
BEGIN NOW Hozier's History of the Russo- END
BEGIN NOW Turkish War (brown cloth, a volumes, with gummed label, Garrison END
BEGIN NOW Library, Governor's Parade, Gibraltar, on verso of cover). END
BEGIN NOW Laurence Bloomfield in Ireland by William Allingham (second edition, END
BEGIN NOW green cloth, gilt trefoil design, previous owner's name on recto of END
BEGIN NOW flyleaf erased). END
BEGIN NOW A Handbook of Astronomy (cover, brown leather, detached, S plates, END
BEGIN NOW antique letterpress long primer, author's footnotes nonpareil, marginal END
BEGIN NOW clues brevier, captions small pica). END
BEGIN NOW The Hidden Life of Christ (black boards). END
BEGIN NOW In the Track of the Sun (yellow cloth, titlepage missing, recurrent END
BEGIN NOW title intestation). END
BEGIN NOW Physical Strength and How to Obtain It by Eugen Sandow (red cloth). END
BEGIN NOW Short but yet Plain Elements of Geometry written in French by F. END
BEGIN NOW Ignat. END
BEGIN NOW Pardies and rendered into English by John Harris D. END
BEGIN NOW D. END
BEGIN NOW London, printed END
BEGIN NOW for R. END
BEGIN NOW Knaplock at the Bifhop's Head, MDCCXI, with dedicatory epiftle to END
BEGIN NOW his worthy friend Charles Cox, efquire, Member of Parliament for the END
BEGIN NOW burgh of Southwark and having ink calligraphed statement on the flyleaf END
BEGIN NOW certifying that the book was the property of Michael Gallagher, dated END
BEGIN NOW this 10th day of May 1822 and requefting the perfon who should find it, END
BEGIN NOW if the book should be loft or go aftray, to reftore it to Michael END
BEGIN NOW Gallagher, carpenter, Dufery Gate, Ennifcorthy, county Wicklow, the END
BEGIN NOW fineft place in the world. END
BEGIN NOW What reflections occupied his mind during the process of reversion of END
BEGIN NOW the inverted volumes? END
BEGIN NOW The necessity of order, a place for everything and everything in its END
BEGIN NOW place: the deficient appreciation of literature possessed by females: END
BEGIN NOW the incongruity of an apple incuneated in a tumbler and of an umbrella END
BEGIN NOW inclined in a closestool: the insecurity of hiding any secret document END
BEGIN NOW behind, beneath or between the pages of a book. END
BEGIN NOW Which volume was the largest in bulk? END
BEGIN NOW Hozier's History of the Russo-Turkish war. END
BEGIN NOW What among other data did the second volume of the work in question END
BEGIN NOW contain? END
BEGIN NOW The name of a decisive battle (forgotten), frequently remembered by a END
BEGIN NOW decisive officer, major Brian Cooper Tweedy (remembered). END
BEGIN NOW Why, firstly and secondly, did he not consult the work in question? END
BEGIN NOW Firstly, in order to exercise mnemotechnic: secondly, because after an END
BEGIN NOW interval of amnesia, when, seated at the central table, about to consult END
BEGIN NOW the work in question, he remembered by mnemotechnic the name of the END
BEGIN NOW military engagement, Plevna. END
BEGIN NOW What caused him consolation in his sitting posture? END
BEGIN NOW The candour, nudity, pose, tranquility, youth, grace, sex, counsel of a END
BEGIN NOW statue erect in the centre of the table, an image of Narcissus purchased END
BEGIN NOW by auction from P. END
BEGIN NOW A. END
BEGIN NOW Wren, 9 Bachelor's Walk. END
BEGIN NOW What caused him irritation in his sitting posture? END
BEGIN NOW Inhibitory pressure END
BEGIN NOW of collar (size 17) and waistcoat (5 buttons), two articles of clothing END
BEGIN NOW superfluous in the costume of mature males and inelastic to alterations END
BEGIN NOW of mass by expansion. END
BEGIN NOW How was the irritation allayed? END
BEGIN NOW He removed his collar, with contained black necktie and collapsible END
BEGIN NOW stud, from his neck to a position on the left of the table. END
BEGIN NOW He END
BEGIN NOW unbuttoned successively in reversed direction waistcoat, trousers, shirt END
BEGIN NOW and vest along the medial line of irregular incrispated black hairs END
BEGIN NOW extending in triangular convergence from the pelvic basin over the END
BEGIN NOW circumference of the abdomen and umbilicular fossicle along the medial END
BEGIN NOW line of nodes to the intersection of the sixth pectoral vertebrae, END
BEGIN NOW thence produced both ways at right angles and terminating in circles END
BEGIN NOW described about two equidistant points, right and left, on the summits END
BEGIN NOW of the mammary prominences. END
BEGIN NOW He unbraced successively each of six minus END
BEGIN NOW one braced trouser buttons, arranged in pairs, of which one incomplete. END
BEGIN NOW What involuntary actions followed? END
BEGIN NOW He compressed between 2 fingers the flesh circumjacent to a cicatrice in END
BEGIN NOW the left infracostal region below the diaphragm resulting from a sting END
BEGIN NOW inflicted 2 weeks and 3 days previously (23 May 1904) by a bee. END
BEGIN NOW He END
BEGIN NOW scratched imprecisely with his right hand, though insensible of END
BEGIN NOW prurition, various points and surfaces of his partly exposed, wholly END
BEGIN NOW abluted skin. END
BEGIN NOW He inserted his left hand into the left lower pocket of END
BEGIN NOW his waistcoat and extracted and replaced a silver coin (I shilling), END
BEGIN NOW placed there (presumably) on the occasion (17 October 1903) of the END
BEGIN NOW interment of Mrs Emily Sinico, Sydney Parade. END
BEGIN NOW Compile the budget for 16 June 1904. END

BEGIN NOW Did the process of divestiture continue? END
BEGIN NOW Sensible of a benignant persistent ache in his footsoles he extended his END
BEGIN NOW foot to one side and observed the creases, protuberances and salient END
BEGIN NOW points caused by foot pressure in the course of walking repeatedly in END
BEGIN NOW several different directions, then, inclined, he disnoded the laceknots, END
BEGIN NOW unhooked and loosened the laces, took off each of his two boots for the END
BEGIN NOW second time, detached the partially moistened right sock through the END
BEGIN NOW fore part of which the nail of his great toe had again effracted, raised END
BEGIN NOW his right foot and, having unhooked a purple elastic sock suspender, END
BEGIN NOW took off his right sock, placed his unclothed right foot on the margin END
BEGIN NOW of the seat of his chair, picked at and gently lacerated the protruding END
BEGIN NOW part of the great toenail, raised the part lacerated to his nostrils and END
BEGIN NOW inhaled the odour of the quick, then, with satisfaction, threw away the END
BEGIN NOW lacerated ungual fragment. END
BEGIN NOW Why with satisfaction? END
BEGIN NOW Because the odour inhaled corresponded to other odours inhaled of other END
BEGIN NOW ungual fragments, picked and lacerated by Master Bloom, pupil of Mrs END
BEGIN NOW Ellis's juvenile school, patiently each night in the act of brief END
BEGIN NOW genuflection and nocturnal prayer and ambitious meditation. END
BEGIN NOW In what ultimate ambition had all concurrent and consecutive ambitions END
BEGIN NOW now coalesced? END
BEGIN NOW Not to inherit by right of primogeniture, gavelkind or borough English, END
BEGIN NOW or possess in perpetuity an extensive demesne of a sufficient number of END
BEGIN NOW acres, roods and perches, statute land measure (valuation Â£ 42), of END
BEGIN NOW grazing turbary surrounding a baronial hall with gatelodge and carriage END
BEGIN NOW drive nor, on the other hand, a terracehouse or semidetached villa, END
BEGIN NOW described as Rus in Urbe or Qui si sana, but to purchase by private END
BEGIN NOW treaty in fee simple a thatched bungalowshaped 2 storey dwellinghouse of END
BEGIN NOW southerly aspect, surmounted by vane and lightning conductor, connected END
BEGIN NOW with the earth, with porch covered by parasitic plants (ivy or Virginia END
BEGIN NOW creeper), halldoor, olive green, with smart carriage finish and neat END
BEGIN NOW doorbrasses, stucco front with gilt tracery at eaves and gable, rising, END
BEGIN NOW if possible, upon a gentle eminence with agreeable prospect from balcony END
BEGIN NOW with stone pillar parapet over unoccupied and unoccupyable interjacent END
BEGIN NOW pastures and standing in 5 or 6 acres of its own ground, at such a END
BEGIN NOW distance from the nearest public thoroughfare as to render its END
BEGIN NOW houselights visible at night above and through a quickset hornbeam hedge END
BEGIN NOW of topiary cutting, situate at a given point not less than 1 statute END
BEGIN NOW mile from the periphery of the metropolis, within a time limit of not END
BEGIN NOW more than 15 minutes from tram or train line (e.g., Dundrum, south, or END
BEGIN NOW Sutton, north, both localities equally reported by trial to resemble the END
BEGIN NOW terrestrial poles in being favourable climates for phthisical subjects), END
BEGIN NOW the premises to be held under feefarm grant, lease 999 years, the END
BEGIN NOW messuage to consist of 1 drawingroom with baywindow (2 lancets), END
BEGIN NOW thermometer affixed, 1 sittingroom, 4 bedrooms, 2 servants' rooms, tiled END
BEGIN NOW kitchen with close range and scullery, lounge hall fitted with linen END
BEGIN NOW wallpresses, fumed oak sectional bookcase containing the Encyclopaedia END
BEGIN NOW Britannica and New Century Dictionary, transverse obsolete medieval and END
BEGIN NOW oriental weapons, dinner gong, alabaster lamp, bowl pendant, vulcanite END
BEGIN NOW automatic telephone receiver with adjacent directory, handtufted END
BEGIN NOW Axminster carpet with cream ground and trellis border, loo table with END
BEGIN NOW pillar and claw legs, hearth with massive firebrasses and ormolu mantel END
BEGIN NOW chronometer clock, guaranteed timekeeper with cathedral chime, barometer END
BEGIN NOW with hygrographic chart, comfortable lounge settees and corner fitments, END
BEGIN NOW upholstered in ruby plush with good springing and sunk centre, three END
BEGIN NOW banner Japanese screen and cuspidors (club style, rich winecoloured END
BEGIN NOW leather, gloss renewable with a minimum of labour by use of linseed oil END
BEGIN NOW and vinegar) and pyramidically prismatic central chandelier lustre, END
BEGIN NOW bentwood perch with fingertame parrot (expurgated language), embossed END
BEGIN NOW mural paper at 10/- per dozen with transverse swags of carmine floral END
BEGIN NOW design and top crown frieze, staircase, three continuous flights at END
BEGIN NOW successive right angles, of varnished cleargrained oak, treads and END
BEGIN NOW risers, newel, balusters and handrail, with steppedup panel dado, END
BEGIN NOW dressed with camphorated wax: bathroom, hot and cold supply, reclining END
BEGIN NOW and shower: water closet on mezzanine provided with opaque singlepane END
BEGIN NOW oblong window, tipup seat, bracket lamp, brass tierod and brace, END
BEGIN NOW armrests, footstool and artistic oleograph on inner face of door: ditto, END
BEGIN NOW plain: servants' apartments with separate sanitary and hygienic END
BEGIN NOW necessaries for cook, general and betweenmaid (salary, rising by END
BEGIN NOW biennial unearned increments of Â£ 2, with comprehensive fidelity END
BEGIN NOW insurance, annual bonus (Â£ 1) and retiring allowance (based on the 65 END
BEGIN NOW system) after 30 years' service), pantry, buttery, larder, refrigerator, END
BEGIN NOW outoffices, coal and wood cellarage with winebin (still and sparkling END
BEGIN NOW vintages) for distinguished guests, if entertained to dinner (evening END
BEGIN NOW dress), carbon monoxide gas supply throughout. END
BEGIN NOW What additional attractions might the grounds contain? END
BEGIN NOW As addenda, a tennis and fives court, a shrubbery, a glass summerhouse END
BEGIN NOW with tropical palms, equipped in the best botanical manner, a rockery END
BEGIN NOW with waterspray, a beehive arranged on humane principles, oval END
BEGIN NOW flowerbeds in rectangular grassplots set with eccentric ellipses of END
BEGIN NOW scarlet and chrome tulips, blue scillas, crocuses, polyanthus, sweet END
BEGIN NOW William, sweet pea, lily of the valley (bulbs obtainable from sir James END
BEGIN NOW W. END
BEGIN NOW Mackey (Limited) wholesale and retail seed and bulb merchants and END
BEGIN NOW nurserymen, agents for chemical manures, 23 Sackville street, upper), an END
BEGIN NOW orchard, kitchen garden and vinery protected against illegal trespassers END
BEGIN NOW by glasstopped mural enclosures, a lumbershed with padlock for various END
BEGIN NOW inventoried implements. END
BEGIN NOW As? END
BEGIN NOW Eeltraps, lobsterpots, fishingrods, hatchet, steelyard, grindstone, END
BEGIN NOW clodcrusher, swatheturner, carriagesack, telescope ladder, 10 tooth END
BEGIN NOW rake, washing clogs, haytedder, tumbling rake, billhook, paintpot, END
BEGIN NOW brush, hoe and so on. END
BEGIN NOW What improvements might be subsequently introduced? END
BEGIN NOW A rabbitry and fowlrun, a dovecote, a botanical conservatory, 2 hammocks END
BEGIN NOW (lady's and gentleman's), a sundial shaded and sheltered by laburnum or END
BEGIN NOW lilac trees, an exotically harmonically accorded Japanese tinkle END
BEGIN NOW gatebell affixed to left lateral gatepost, a capacious waterbutt, a END
BEGIN NOW lawnmower with side delivery and grassbox, a lawnsprinkler with END
BEGIN NOW hydraulic hose. END
BEGIN NOW What facilities of transit were desirable? END
BEGIN NOW When citybound frequent connection by train or tram from their END
BEGIN NOW respective intermediate station or terminal. END
BEGIN NOW When countrybound END
BEGIN NOW velocipedes, a chainless freewheel roadster cycle with side basketcar END
BEGIN NOW attached, or draught conveyance, a donkey with wicker trap or smart END
BEGIN NOW phaeton with good working solidungular cob (roan gelding, 14 h). END
BEGIN NOW What might be the name of this erigible or erected residence? END
BEGIN NOW Bloom Cottage. END
BEGIN NOW Saint Leopold's. END
BEGIN NOW Flowerville. END
BEGIN NOW Could Bloom of 7 Eccles street foresee Bloom of Flowerville? END
BEGIN NOW In loose allwool garments with Harris tweed cap, price 8/6, and useful END
BEGIN NOW garden boots with elastic gussets and wateringcan, planting aligned END
BEGIN NOW young firtrees, syringing, pruning, staking, sowing hayseed, trundling a END
BEGIN NOW weedladen wheelbarrow without excessive fatigue at sunset amid the scent END
BEGIN NOW of newmown hay, ameliorating the soil, multiplying wisdom, achieving END
BEGIN NOW longevity. END
BEGIN NOW What syllabus of intellectual pursuits was simultaneously possible? END
BEGIN NOW Snapshot photography, comparative study of religions, folklore relative END
BEGIN NOW to various amatory and superstitious practices, contemplation of the END
BEGIN NOW celestial constellations. END
BEGIN NOW What lighter recreations? END
BEGIN NOW Outdoor: garden and fieldwork, cycling on level macadamised causeways END
BEGIN NOW ascents of moderately high hills, natation in secluded fresh water and END
BEGIN NOW unmolested river boating in secure wherry or light curricle with kedge END
BEGIN NOW anchor on reaches free from weirs and rapids (period of estivation), END
BEGIN NOW vespertinal perambulation or equestrian circumprocession with inspection END
BEGIN NOW of sterile landscape and contrastingly agreeable cottagers' fires of END
BEGIN NOW smoking peat turves (period of hibernation). END
BEGIN NOW Indoor: discussion in tepid END
BEGIN NOW security of unsolved historical and criminal problems: lecture of END
BEGIN NOW unexpurgated exotic erotic masterpieces: house carpentry with toolbox END
BEGIN NOW containing hammer, awl nails, screws, tintacks, gimlet, tweezers, END
BEGIN NOW bullnose plane and turnscrew. END
BEGIN NOW Might he become a gentleman farmer of END
BEGIN NOW field produce and live stock? END
BEGIN NOW Not impossibly, with 1 or 2 stripper cows, 1 pike of upland hay and END
BEGIN NOW requisite farming implements, e.g., an end-to-end churn, a turnip pulper END
BEGIN NOW etc. END
BEGIN NOW What would be his civic functions and social status among the county END
BEGIN NOW families and landed gentry? END
BEGIN NOW Arranged successively in ascending powers of hierarchical order, that of END
BEGIN NOW gardener, groundsman, cultivator, breeder, and at the zenith of his END
BEGIN NOW career, resident magistrate or justice of the peace with a family crest END
BEGIN NOW and coat of arms and appropriate classical motto (Semper paratus), duly END
BEGIN NOW recorded in the court directory (Bloom, Leopold P., M. END
BEGIN NOW P., P. END
BEGIN NOW C., K. END
BEGIN NOW P., END
BEGIN NOW L. END
BEGIN NOW L. END
BEGIN NOW D. END
BEGIN NOW (honoris causa), Bloomville, Dundrum) and mentioned in court END
BEGIN NOW and fashionable intelligence (Mr and Mrs Leopold Bloom have left END
BEGIN NOW Kingstown for England). END
BEGIN NOW What course of action did he outline for himself in such capacity? END
BEGIN NOW A course that lay between undue clemency and excessive rigour: the END
BEGIN NOW dispensation in a heterogeneous society of arbitrary classes, END
BEGIN NOW incessantly rearranged in terms of greater and lesser social inequality, END
BEGIN NOW of unbiassed homogeneous indisputable justice, tempered with mitigants END
BEGIN NOW of the widest possible latitude but exactable to the uttermost farthing END
BEGIN NOW with confiscation of estate, real and personal, to the crown. END
BEGIN NOW Loyal to END
BEGIN NOW the highest constituted power in the land, actuated by an innate love of END
BEGIN NOW rectitude his aims would be the strict maintenance of public order, the END
BEGIN NOW repression of many abuses though not of all simultaneously (every END
BEGIN NOW measure of reform or retrenchment being a preliminary solution to be END
BEGIN NOW contained by fluxion in the final solution), the upholding of the letter END
BEGIN NOW of the law (common, statute and law merchant) against all traversers in END
BEGIN NOW covin and trespassers acting in contravention of bylaws and regulations, END
BEGIN NOW all resuscitators (by trespass and petty larceny of kindlings) of END
BEGIN NOW venville rights, obsolete by desuetude, all orotund instigators of END
BEGIN NOW international persecution, all perpetuators of international END
BEGIN NOW animosities, all menial molestors of domestic conviviality, all END
BEGIN NOW recalcitrant violators of domestic connubiality. END
BEGIN NOW Prove that he had loved rectitude from his earliest youth. END
BEGIN NOW To Master Percy Apjohn at High School in 1880 he had divulged his END
BEGIN NOW disbelief in the tenets of the Irish (protestant) church (to which his END
BEGIN NOW father Rudolf Virag (later Rudolph Bloom) had been converted from the END
BEGIN NOW Israelitic faith and communion in 1865 by the Society for promoting END
BEGIN NOW Christianity among the jews) subsequently abjured by him in favour of END
BEGIN NOW Roman catholicism at the epoch of and with a view to his matrimony in END
BEGIN NOW 1888. END
BEGIN NOW To Daniel Magrane and Francis Wade in 1882 during a juvenile END
BEGIN NOW friendship (terminated by the premature emigration of the former) he had END
BEGIN NOW advocated during nocturnal perambulations the political theory of END
BEGIN NOW colonial (e.g. END
BEGIN NOW Canadian) expansion and the evolutionary theories of END
BEGIN NOW Charles Darwin, expounded in The Descent of Man and The Origin of END
BEGIN NOW Species. END
BEGIN NOW In 1885 he had publicly expressed his adherence to the END
BEGIN NOW collective and national economic programme advocated by James Fintan END
BEGIN NOW Lalor, John Fisher Murray, John Mitchel, J. END
BEGIN NOW F. END
BEGIN NOW X. END
BEGIN NOW O'Brien and others, END

BEGIN NOW P. END

BEGIN NOW Midlothian, N. END
BEGIN NOW B.) and, in support of his political convictions, had END
BEGIN NOW climbed up into a secure position amid the ramifications of a tree on END
BEGIN NOW Northumberland road to see the entrance (2 February 1888) into the END
BEGIN NOW capital of a demonstrative torchlight procession of 20,000 torchbearers, END
BEGIN NOW divided into 120 trade corporations, bearing 2000 torches in escort of END
BEGIN NOW the marquess of Ripon and (honest) John Morley. END

BEGIN NOW stipulated. END

BEGIN NOW Positing what protasis would the contraction for such several schemes END

BEGIN NOW Given a guarantee equal to the sum sought, the support, by deed of gift END
BEGIN NOW and transfer vouchers during donor's lifetime or by bequest after END
BEGIN NOW donor's painless extinction, of eminent financiers (Blum Pasha, END
BEGIN NOW Rothschild Guggenheim, Hirsch, Montefiore, Morgan, Rockefeller) END
BEGIN NOW possessing fortunes in 6 figures, amassed during a successful life, and END
BEGIN NOW joining capital with opportunity the thing required was done. END
BEGIN NOW What eventuality would render him independent of such wealth? END
BEGIN NOW The independent discovery of a goldseam of inexhaustible ore. END
BEGIN NOW For what reason did he meditate on schemes so difficult of realisation? END
BEGIN NOW It was one of his axioms that similar meditations or the automatic END
BEGIN NOW relation to himself of a narrative concerning himself or tranquil END
BEGIN NOW recollection of the past when practised habitually before retiring for END
BEGIN NOW the night alleviated fatigue and produced as a result sound repose and END
BEGIN NOW renovated vitality. END
BEGIN NOW His justifications? END
BEGIN NOW As a physicist he had learned that of the 70 years of complete human END
BEGIN NOW life at least 2/7, viz. END
BEGIN NOW 20 years are passed in sleep. END
BEGIN NOW As a philosopher END
BEGIN NOW he knew that at the termination of any allotted life only an END
BEGIN NOW infinitesimal part of any person's desires has been realised. END
BEGIN NOW As a END
BEGIN NOW physiologist he believed in the artificial placation of malignant END
BEGIN NOW agencies chiefly operative during somnolence. END
BEGIN NOW What did he fear? END
BEGIN NOW The committal of homicide or suicide during sleep by an aberration of END
BEGIN NOW the light of reason, the incommensurable categorical intelligence END
BEGIN NOW situated in the cerebral convolutions. END
BEGIN NOW What were habitually his final meditations? END
BEGIN NOW Of some one sole unique advertisement to cause passers to stop in END
BEGIN NOW wonder, a poster novelty, with all extraneous accretions excluded, END
BEGIN NOW reduced to its simplest and most efficient terms not exceeding the span END
BEGIN NOW of casual vision and congruous with the velocity of modern life. END
BEGIN NOW What did the first drawer unlocked contain? END

BEGIN NOW Bloom, certain pages of which bore diagram drawings, marked Papli, which END

BEGIN NOW Quote the textual terms in which the prospectus claimed advantages for END
BEGIN NOW this thaumaturgic remedy. END
BEGIN NOW It heals and soothes while you sleep, in case of trouble in breaking END
BEGIN NOW wind, assists nature in the most formidable way, insuring instant relief END
BEGIN NOW in discharge of gases, keeping parts clean and free natural action, an END
BEGIN NOW initial outlay of 7/6 making a new man of you and life worth living. END
BEGIN NOW Ladies find Wonderworker especially useful, a pleasant surprise when END
BEGIN NOW they note delightful result like a cool drink of fresh spring water on a END
BEGIN NOW sultry summer's day. END
BEGIN NOW Recommend it to your lady and gentlemen friends, END
BEGIN NOW lasts a lifetime. END
BEGIN NOW Insert long round end. END
BEGIN NOW Wonderworker. END
BEGIN NOW Were there testimonials? END
BEGIN NOW Numerous. END
BEGIN NOW From clergyman, British naval officer, wellknown author, city END
BEGIN NOW man, hospital nurse, lady, mother of five, absentminded beggar. END

BEGIN NOW What a pity the government did not supply our men with wonderworkers END
BEGIN NOW during the South African campaign! END
BEGIN NOW What a relief it would have been! END

BEGIN NOW F. END

BEGIN NOW mercenary, variously instructed, a lady by origin. END

BEGIN NOW Quote the textual terms of this notice. END
BEGIN NOW I, Rudolph Virag, now resident at no 52 Clanbrassil street, Dublin, END
BEGIN NOW formerly of Szombathely in the kingdom of Hungary, hereby give notice END
BEGIN NOW that I have assumed and intend henceforth upon all occasions and at all END
BEGIN NOW times to be known by the name of Rudolph Bloom. END
BEGIN NOW What other objects relative to Rudolph Bloom (born Virag) were in the END
BEGIN NOW 2nd drawer? END
BEGIN NOW An indistinct daguerreotype of Rudolf Virag and his father Leopold Virag END
BEGIN NOW executed in the year 1852 in the portrait atelier of their END
BEGIN NOW (respectively) 1st and 2nd cousin, Stefan Virag of Szesfehervar, END
BEGIN NOW Hungary. END

BEGIN NOW prayers for Pessach (Passover): a photocard of the Queen's Hotel, Ennis, END
BEGIN NOW proprietor, Rudolph Bloom: an envelope addressed: To My Dear Son END
BEGIN NOW Leopold. END

BEGIN NOW evoke? END
BEGIN NOW Tomorrow will be a week that I received... END
BEGIN NOW it is no use Leopold to be END
BEGIN NOW ... END

BEGIN NOW What reminiscences of a human subject suffering from progressive END
BEGIN NOW melancholia did these objects evoke in Bloom? END
BEGIN NOW An old man, widower, unkempt of hair, in bed, with head covered, END
BEGIN NOW sighing: an infirm dog, Athos: aconite, resorted to by increasing doses END
BEGIN NOW of grains and scruples as a palliative of recrudescent neuralgia: the END
BEGIN NOW face in death of a septuagenarian, suicide by poison. END
BEGIN NOW Why did Bloom experience a sentiment of remorse? END
BEGIN NOW Because in immature impatience he had treated with disrespect certain END
BEGIN NOW beliefs and practices. END
BEGIN NOW As? END
BEGIN NOW The prohibition of the use of fleshmeat and milk at one meal: the END
BEGIN NOW hebdomadary symposium of incoordinately abstract, perfervidly concrete END
BEGIN NOW mercantile coexreligionist excompatriots: the circumcision of male END
BEGIN NOW infants: the supernatural character of Judaic scripture: the END
BEGIN NOW ineffability of the tetragrammaton: the sanctity of the sabbath. END
BEGIN NOW How did these beliefs and practices now appear to him? END
BEGIN NOW Not more rational than they had then appeared, not less rational than END
BEGIN NOW other beliefs and practices now appeared. END
BEGIN NOW What first reminiscence had he of Rudolph Bloom (deceased)? END
BEGIN NOW Rudolph Bloom (deceased) narrated to his son Leopold Bloom (aged 6) a END
BEGIN NOW retrospective arrangement of migrations and settlements in and between END
BEGIN NOW Dublin, London, Florence, Milan, Vienna, Budapest, Szombathely with END
BEGIN NOW statements of satisfaction (his grandfather having seen Maria Theresia, END
BEGIN NOW empress of Austria, queen of Hungary), with commercial advice (having END
BEGIN NOW taken care of pence, the pounds having taken care of themselves). END
BEGIN NOW Leopold Bloom (aged 6) had accompanied these narrations by constant END
BEGIN NOW consultation of a geographical map of Europe (political) and by END
BEGIN NOW suggestions for the establishment of affiliated business premises in the END
BEGIN NOW various centres mentioned. END
BEGIN NOW Had time equally but differently obliterated the memory of these END
BEGIN NOW migrations in narrator and listener? END
BEGIN NOW In narrator by the access of years and in consequence of the use of END
BEGIN NOW narcotic toxin: in listener by the access of years and in consequence of END
BEGIN NOW the action of distraction upon vicarious experiences. END
BEGIN NOW What idiosyncracies of the narrator were concomitant products of END
BEGIN NOW amnesia? END
BEGIN NOW Occasionally he ate without having previously removed his hat. END
BEGIN NOW Occasionally he drank voraciously the juice of gooseberry fool from an END
BEGIN NOW inclined plate. END
BEGIN NOW Occasionally he removed from his lips the traces of food END
BEGIN NOW by means of a lacerated envelope or other accessible fragment of paper. END
BEGIN NOW What two phenomena of senescence were more frequent? END
BEGIN NOW The myopic digital calculation of coins, eructation consequent upon END
BEGIN NOW repletion. END
BEGIN NOW What object offered partial consolation for these reminiscences? END
BEGIN NOW The endowment policy, the bank passbook, the certificate of the END
BEGIN NOW possession of scrip. END
BEGIN NOW Reduce Bloom by cross multiplication of reverses of fortune, from which END
BEGIN NOW these supports protected him, and by elimination of all positive values END
BEGIN NOW to a negligible negative irrational unreal quantity. END
BEGIN NOW Successively, in descending helotic order: Poverty: that of the outdoor END
BEGIN NOW hawker of imitation jewellery, the dun for the recovery of bad and END
BEGIN NOW doubtful debts, the poor rate and deputy cess collector. END
BEGIN NOW Mendicancy: END
BEGIN NOW that of the fraudulent bankrupt with negligible assets paying 1s. END
BEGIN NOW 4d. END
BEGIN NOW in END
BEGIN NOW the Â£, sandwichman, distributor of throwaways, nocturnal vagrant, END
BEGIN NOW insinuating sycophant, maimed sailor, blind stripling, superannuated END
BEGIN NOW bailiffs man, marfeast, lickplate, spoilsport, pickthank, eccentric END
BEGIN NOW public laughingstock seated on bench of public park under discarded END
BEGIN NOW perforated umbrella. END
BEGIN NOW Destitution: the inmate of Old Man's House (Royal END
BEGIN NOW Hospital) Kilmainham, the inmate of Simpson's Hospital for reduced but END
BEGIN NOW respectable men permanently disabled by gout or want of sight. END
BEGIN NOW Nadir of END
BEGIN NOW misery: the aged impotent disfranchised ratesupported moribund lunatic END
BEGIN NOW pauper. END
BEGIN NOW With which attendant indignities? END
BEGIN NOW The unsympathetic indifference of previously amiable females, the END
BEGIN NOW contempt of muscular males, the acceptance of fragments of bread, the END
BEGIN NOW simulated ignorance of casual acquaintances, the latration of END
BEGIN NOW illegitimate unlicensed vagabond dogs, the infantile discharge of END
BEGIN NOW decomposed vegetable missiles, worth little or nothing, nothing or less END
BEGIN NOW than nothing. END
BEGIN NOW By what could such a situation be precluded? END
BEGIN NOW By decease (change of state): by departure (change of place). END
BEGIN NOW Which preferably? END
BEGIN NOW The latter, by the line of least resistance. END
BEGIN NOW What considerations rendered departure not entirely undesirable? END
BEGIN NOW Constant cohabitation impeding mutual toleration of personal defects. END
BEGIN NOW The habit of independent purchase increasingly cultivated. END
BEGIN NOW The necessity END
BEGIN NOW to counteract by impermanent sojourn the permanence of arrest. END
BEGIN NOW What considerations rendered departure not irrational? END
BEGIN NOW The parties concerned, uniting, had increased and multiplied, which END
BEGIN NOW being done, offspring produced and educed to maturity, the parties, if END
BEGIN NOW not disunited were obliged to reunite for increase and multiplication, END
BEGIN NOW which was absurd, to form by reunion the original couple of uniting END
BEGIN NOW parties, which was impossible. END
BEGIN NOW What considerations rendered departure desirable? END
BEGIN NOW The attractive character of certain localities in Ireland and abroad, as END
BEGIN NOW represented in general geographical maps of polychrome design or in END
BEGIN NOW special ordnance survey charts by employment of scale numerals and END
BEGIN NOW hachures. END
BEGIN NOW In Ireland? END
BEGIN NOW The cliffs of Moher, the windy wilds of Connemara, lough Neagh with END
BEGIN NOW submerged petrified city, the Giant's Causeway, Fort Camden and Fort END
BEGIN NOW Carlisle, the Golden Vale of Tipperary, the islands of Aran, the END
BEGIN NOW pastures of royal Meath, Brigid's elm in Kildare, the Queen's Island END
BEGIN NOW shipyard in Belfast, the Salmon Leap, the lakes of Killarney. END
BEGIN NOW Abroad? END
BEGIN NOW Ceylon (with spicegardens supplying tea to Thomas Kernan, agent for END
BEGIN NOW Pulbrook, Robertson and Co, 2 Mincing Lane, London, E. END
BEGIN NOW C., 5 Dame END
BEGIN NOW street, Dublin), Jerusalem, the holy city (with mosque of Omar and gate END
BEGIN NOW of Damascus, goal of aspiration), the straits of Gibraltar (the unique END
BEGIN NOW birthplace of Marion Tweedy), the Parthenon (containing statues of nude END
BEGIN NOW Grecian divinities), the Wall street money market (which controlled END
BEGIN NOW international finance), the Plaza de Toros at La Linea, Spain (where END
BEGIN NOW O'Hara of the Camerons had slain the bull), Niagara (over which no human END
BEGIN NOW being had passed with impunity), the land of the Eskimos (eaters of END
BEGIN NOW soap), the forbidden country of Thibet (from which no traveller END
BEGIN NOW returns), the bay of Naples (to see which was to die), the Dead Sea. END
BEGIN NOW Under what guidance, following what signs? END
BEGIN NOW At sea, septentrional, by night the polestar, located at the point of END
BEGIN NOW intersection of the right line from beta to alpha in Ursa Maior produced END
BEGIN NOW and divided externally at omega and the hypotenuse of the rightangled END
BEGIN NOW triangle formed by the line alpha omega so produced and the line alpha END
BEGIN NOW delta of Ursa Maior. END
BEGIN NOW On land, meridional, a bispherical moon, revealed END
BEGIN NOW in imperfect varying phases of lunation through the posterior interstice END
BEGIN NOW of the imperfectly occluded skirt of a carnose negligent perambulating END
BEGIN NOW female, a pillar of the cloud by day. END
BEGIN NOW What public advertisement would divulge the occultation of the departed? END
BEGIN NOW Â£ 5 reward, lost, stolen or strayed from his residence 7 Eccles street, END
BEGIN NOW missing gent about 40, answering to the name of Bloom, Leopold (Poldy), END
BEGIN NOW height 5 ft 9 1/2 inches, full build, olive complexion, may have since END
BEGIN NOW grown a beard, when last seen was wearing a black suit. END
BEGIN NOW Above sum will END
BEGIN NOW be paid for information leading to his discovery. END
BEGIN NOW What universal binomial denominations would be his as entity and END
BEGIN NOW nonentity? END
BEGIN NOW Assumed by any or known to none. END
BEGIN NOW Everyman or Noman. END
BEGIN NOW What tributes his? END
BEGIN NOW Honour and gifts of strangers, the friends of Everyman. END
BEGIN NOW A nymph END
BEGIN NOW immortal, beauty, the bride of Noman. END
BEGIN NOW Would the departed never nowhere nohow reappear? END
BEGIN NOW Ever he would wander, selfcompelled, to the extreme limit of his END
BEGIN NOW cometary orbit, beyond the fixed stars and variable suns and telescopic END
BEGIN NOW planets, astronomical waifs and strays, to the extreme boundary of END
BEGIN NOW space, passing from land to land, among peoples, amid events. END
BEGIN NOW Somewhere END
BEGIN NOW imperceptibly he would hear and somehow reluctantly, suncompelled, obey END
BEGIN NOW the summons of recall. END
BEGIN NOW Whence, disappearing from the constellation of END
BEGIN NOW the Northern Crown he would somehow reappear reborn above delta in the END
BEGIN NOW constellation of Cassiopeia and after incalculable eons of peregrination END
BEGIN NOW return an estranged avenger, a wreaker of justice on malefactors, a dark END
BEGIN NOW crusader, a sleeper awakened, with financial resources (by supposition) END
BEGIN NOW surpassing those of Rothschild or the silver king. END
BEGIN NOW What would render such return irrational? END
BEGIN NOW An unsatisfactory equation between an exodus and return in time through END
BEGIN NOW reversible space and an exodus and return in space through irreversible END
BEGIN NOW time. END
BEGIN NOW What play of forces, inducing inertia, rendered departure undesirable? END
BEGIN NOW The lateness of the hour, rendering procrastinatory: the obscurity of END
BEGIN NOW the night, rendering invisible: the uncertainty of thoroughfares, END
BEGIN NOW rendering perilous: the necessity for repose, obviating movement: the END
BEGIN NOW proximity of an occupied bed, obviating research: the anticipation of END
BEGIN NOW warmth (human) tempered with coolness (linen), obviating desire and END
BEGIN NOW rendering desirable: the statue of Narcissus, sound without echo, END
BEGIN NOW desired desire. END
BEGIN NOW What advantages were possessed by an occupied, as distinct from an END
BEGIN NOW unoccupied bed? END
BEGIN NOW The removal of nocturnal solitude, the superior quality of human (mature END
BEGIN NOW female) to inhuman (hotwaterjar) calefaction, the stimulation of END
BEGIN NOW matutinal contact, the economy of mangling done on the premises in the END
BEGIN NOW case of trousers accurately folded and placed lengthwise between the END
BEGIN NOW spring mattress (striped) and the woollen mattress (biscuit section). END
BEGIN NOW What past consecutive causes, before rising preapprehended, of END
BEGIN NOW accumulated fatigue did Bloom, before rising, silently recapitulate? END
BEGIN NOW The preparation of breakfast (burnt offering): intestinal congestion and END
BEGIN NOW premeditative defecation (holy of holies): the bath (rite of John): the END
BEGIN NOW funeral (rite of Samuel): the advertisement of Alexander Keyes (Urim and END
BEGIN NOW Thummim): the unsubstantial lunch (rite of Melchisedek): the visit to END
BEGIN NOW museum and national library (holy place): the bookhunt along Bedford END
BEGIN NOW row, Merchants' Arch, Wellington Quay (Simchath Torah): the music in the END
BEGIN NOW Ormond Hotel (Shira Shirim): the altercation with a truculent troglodyte END
BEGIN NOW in Bernard Kiernan's premises (holocaust): a blank period of time END
BEGIN NOW including a cardrive, a visit to a house of mourning, a leavetaking END
BEGIN NOW (wilderness): the eroticism produced by feminine exhibitionism (rite of END
BEGIN NOW Onan): the prolonged delivery of Mrs Mina Purefoy (heave offering): the END
BEGIN NOW visit to the disorderly house of Mrs Bella Cohen, 82 Tyrone street, END
BEGIN NOW lower and subsequent brawl and chance medley in Beaver street END
BEGIN NOW (Armageddon)—nocturnal perambulation to and from the cabman's shelter, END
BEGIN NOW Butt Bridge (atonement). END
BEGIN NOW What selfimposed enigma did Bloom about to rise in order to go so as to END
BEGIN NOW conclude lest he should not conclude involuntarily apprehend? END
BEGIN NOW The cause of a brief sharp unforeseen heard loud lone crack emitted by END
BEGIN NOW the insentient material of a strainveined timber table. END
BEGIN NOW What selfinvolved enigma did Bloom risen, going, gathering multicoloured END
BEGIN NOW multiform multitudinous garments, voluntarily apprehending, not END
BEGIN NOW comprehend? END
BEGIN NOW Who was M'Intosh? END
BEGIN NOW What selfevident enigma pondered with desultory constancy during 30 END
BEGIN NOW years did Bloom now, having effected natural obscurity by the extinction END
BEGIN NOW of artificial light, silently suddenly comprehend? END
BEGIN NOW Where was Moses when the candle went out? END
BEGIN NOW What imperfections in a perfect day did Bloom, walking, charged with END
BEGIN NOW collected articles of recently disvested male wearing apparel, silently, END
BEGIN NOW successively, enumerate? END
BEGIN NOW A provisional failure to obtain renewal of an advertisement: to obtain a END
BEGIN NOW certain quantity of tea from Thomas Kernan (agent for Pulbrook, END
BEGIN NOW Robertson and Co, 5 Dame Street, Dublin, and 2 Mincing Lane, London E. END
BEGIN NOW C.): to certify the presence or absence of posterior rectal orifice in END
BEGIN NOW the case of Hellenic female divinities: to obtain admission (gratuitous END
BEGIN NOW or paid) to the performance of Leah by Mrs Bandmann Palmer at the Gaiety END
BEGIN NOW Theatre, 46, 47, 48, 49 South King street. END
BEGIN NOW What impression of an absent face did Bloom, arrested, silently recall? END
BEGIN NOW The face of her father, the late Major Brian Cooper Tweedy, Royal Dublin END
BEGIN NOW Fusiliers, of Gibraltar and Rehoboth, Dolphin's Barn. END
BEGIN NOW What recurrent impressions of the same were possible by hypothesis? END
BEGIN NOW Retreating, at the terminus of the Great Northern Railway, Amiens END
BEGIN NOW street, with constant uniform acceleration, along parallel lines meeting END
BEGIN NOW at infinity, if produced: along parallel lines, reproduced from END
BEGIN NOW infinity, with constant uniform retardation, at the terminus of the END
BEGIN NOW Great Northern Railway, Amiens street, returning. END
BEGIN NOW What miscellaneous effects of female personal wearing apparel were END
BEGIN NOW perceived by him? END
BEGIN NOW A pair of new inodorous halfsilk black ladies' hose, a pair of new END
BEGIN NOW violet garters, a pair of outsize ladies' drawers of India mull, cut on END
BEGIN NOW generous lines, redolent of opoponax, jessamine and Muratti's Turkish END
BEGIN NOW cigarettes and containing a long bright steel safety pin, folded END
BEGIN NOW curvilinear, a camisole of batiste with thin lace border, an accordion END
BEGIN NOW underskirt of blue silk moirette, all these objects being disposed END
BEGIN NOW irregularly on the top of a rectangular trunk, quadruple battened, END
BEGIN NOW having capped corners, with multicoloured labels, initialled on its fore END
BEGIN NOW side in white lettering B. END
BEGIN NOW C. END
BEGIN NOW T. END
BEGIN NOW (Brian Cooper Tweedy). END
BEGIN NOW What impersonal objects were perceived? END
BEGIN NOW A commode, one leg fractured, totally covered by square cretonne END
BEGIN NOW cutting, apple design, on which rested a lady's black straw hat. END
BEGIN NOW Orangekeyed ware, bought of Henry Price, basket, fancy goods, chinaware END
BEGIN NOW and ironmongery manufacturer, 21, 22, 23 Moore street, disposed END
BEGIN NOW irregularly on the washstand and floor and consisting of basin, soapdish END
BEGIN NOW and brushtray (on the washstand, together), pitcher and night article END
BEGIN NOW (on the floor, separate). END
BEGIN NOW Bloom's acts? END
BEGIN NOW He deposited the articles of clothing on a chair, removed his remaining END
BEGIN NOW articles of clothing, took from beneath the bolster at the head of the END
BEGIN NOW bed a folded long white nightshirt, inserted his head and arms into the END
BEGIN NOW proper apertures of the nightshirt, removed a pillow from the head to END
BEGIN NOW the foot of the bed, prepared the bedlinen accordingly and entered the END
BEGIN NOW bed. END
BEGIN NOW How? END
BEGIN NOW With circumspection, as invariably when entering an abode (his own or END
BEGIN NOW not his own): with solicitude, the snakespiral springs of the mattress END
BEGIN NOW being old, the brass quoits and pendent viper radii loose and tremulous END
BEGIN NOW under stress and strain: prudently, as entering a lair or ambush of lust END
BEGIN NOW or adders: lightly, the less to disturb: reverently, the bed of END
BEGIN NOW conception and of birth, of consummation of marriage and of breach of END
BEGIN NOW marriage, of sleep and of death. END
BEGIN NOW What did his limbs, when gradually extended, encounter? END
BEGIN NOW New clean bedlinen, additional odours, the presence of a human form, END
BEGIN NOW female, hers, the imprint of a human form, male, not his, some crumbs, END
BEGIN NOW some flakes of potted meat, recooked, which he removed. END
BEGIN NOW If he had smiled why would he have smiled? END
BEGIN NOW To reflect that each one who enters imagines himself to be the first to END
BEGIN NOW enter whereas he is always the last term of a preceding series even if END
BEGIN NOW the first term of a succeeding one, each imagining himself to be first, END
BEGIN NOW last, only and alone whereas he is neither first nor last nor only nor END
BEGIN NOW alone in a series originating in and repeated to infinity. END
BEGIN NOW What preceding series? END
BEGIN NOW Assuming Mulvey to be the first term of his series, Penrose, Bartell END
BEGIN NOW d'Arcy, professor Goodwin, Julius Mastiansky, John Henry Menton, Father END
BEGIN NOW Bernard Corrigan, a farmer at the Royal Dublin Society's Horse Show, END
BEGIN NOW Maggot O'Reilly, Matthew Dillon, Valentine Blake Dillon (Lord Mayor of END
BEGIN NOW Dublin), Christopher Callinan, Lenehan, an Italian organgrinder, an END
BEGIN NOW unknown gentleman in the Gaiety Theatre, Benjamin Dollard, Simon END
BEGIN NOW Dedalus, Andrew (Pisser) Burke, Joseph Cuffe, Wisdom Hely, Alderman John END
BEGIN NOW Hooper, Dr Francis Brady, Father Sebastian of Mount Argus, a bootblack END
BEGIN NOW at the General Post Office, Hugh E. END
BEGIN NOW (Blazes) Boylan and so each and so END
BEGIN NOW on to no last term. END
BEGIN NOW What were his reflections concerning the last member of this series and END
BEGIN NOW late occupant of the bed? END
BEGIN NOW Reflections on his vigour (a bounder), corporal proportion (a END
BEGIN NOW billsticker), commercial ability (a bester), impressionability (a END
BEGIN NOW boaster). END
BEGIN NOW Why for the observer impressionability in addition to vigour, corporal END
BEGIN NOW proportion and commercial ability? END
BEGIN NOW Because he had observed with augmenting frequency in the preceding END
BEGIN NOW members of the same series the same concupiscence, inflammably END
BEGIN NOW transmitted, first with alarm, then with understanding, then with END
BEGIN NOW desire, finally with fatigue, with alternating symptoms of epicene END
BEGIN NOW comprehension and apprehension. END
BEGIN NOW With what antagonistic sentiments were his subsequent reflections END
BEGIN NOW affected? END
BEGIN NOW Envy, jealousy, abnegation, equanimity. END
BEGIN NOW Envy? END
BEGIN NOW Of a bodily and mental male organism specially adapted for the END
BEGIN NOW superincumbent posture of energetic human copulation and energetic END
BEGIN NOW piston and cylinder movement necessary for the complete satisfaction of END
BEGIN NOW a constant but not acute concupiscence resident in a bodily and mental END
BEGIN NOW female organism, passive but not obtuse. END
BEGIN NOW Jealousy? END
BEGIN NOW Because a nature full and volatile in its free state, was alternately END
BEGIN NOW the agent and reagent of attraction. END
BEGIN NOW Because attraction between agent(s) END
BEGIN NOW and reagent(s) at all instants varied, with inverse proportion of END
BEGIN NOW increase and decrease, with incessant circular extension and radial END
BEGIN NOW reentrance. END
BEGIN NOW Because the controlled contemplation of the fluctuation of END
BEGIN NOW attraction produced, if desired, a fluctuation of pleasure. END
BEGIN NOW Abnegation? END
BEGIN NOW In virtue of a) acquaintance initiated in September 1903 in the END
BEGIN NOW establishment of George Mesias, merchant tailor and outfitter, 5 Eden END
BEGIN NOW Quay, b) hospitality extended and received in kind, reciprocated and END
BEGIN NOW reappropriated in person, c) comparative youth subject to impulses of END
BEGIN NOW ambition and magnanimity, colleagual altruism and amorous egoism, d) END
BEGIN NOW extraracial attraction, intraracial inhibition, supraracial prerogative, END
BEGIN NOW e) an imminent provincial musical tour, common current expenses, net END
BEGIN NOW proceeds divided. END
BEGIN NOW Equanimity? END
BEGIN NOW As as natural as any and every natural act of a nature expressed or END
BEGIN NOW understood executed in natured nature by natural creatures in accordance END
BEGIN NOW with his, her and their natured natures, of dissimilar similarity. END
BEGIN NOW As END
BEGIN NOW not so calamitous as a cataclysmic annihilation of the planet in END
BEGIN NOW consequence of a collision with a dark sun. END
BEGIN NOW As less reprehensible than END
BEGIN NOW theft, highway robbery, cruelty to children and animals, obtaining money END
BEGIN NOW under false pretences, forgery, embezzlement, misappropriation of public END
BEGIN NOW money, betrayal of public trust, malingering, mayhem, corruption of END
BEGIN NOW minors, criminal libel, blackmail, contempt of court, arson, treason, END
BEGIN NOW felony, mutiny on the high seas, trespass, burglary, jailbreaking, END
BEGIN NOW practice of unnatural vice, desertion from armed forces in the field, END
BEGIN NOW perjury, poaching, usury, intelligence with the king's enemies, END
BEGIN NOW impersonation, criminal assault, manslaughter, wilful and premeditated END
BEGIN NOW murder. END
BEGIN NOW As not more abnormal than all other parallel processes of END
BEGIN NOW adaptation to altered conditions of existence, resulting in a reciprocal END
BEGIN NOW equilibrium between the bodily organism and its attendant circumstances, END
BEGIN NOW foods, beverages, acquired habits, indulged inclinations, significant END
BEGIN NOW disease. END
BEGIN NOW As more than inevitable, irreparable. END
BEGIN NOW Why more abnegation than jealousy, less envy than equanimity? END
BEGIN NOW From outrage (matrimony) to outrage (adultery) there arose nought but END
BEGIN NOW outrage (copulation) yet the matrimonial violator of the matrimonially END
BEGIN NOW violated had not been outraged by the adulterous violator of the END
BEGIN NOW adulterously violated. END
BEGIN NOW What retribution, if any? END
BEGIN NOW Assassination, never, as two wrongs did not make one right. END
BEGIN NOW Duel by END
BEGIN NOW combat, no. END
BEGIN NOW Divorce, not now. END
BEGIN NOW Exposure by mechanical artifice (automatic END
BEGIN NOW bed) or individual testimony (concealed ocular witnesses), not yet. END
BEGIN NOW Suit END
BEGIN NOW for damages by legal influence or simulation of assault with evidence of END
BEGIN NOW injuries sustained (selfinflicted), not impossibly. END
BEGIN NOW Hushmoney by moral END
BEGIN NOW influence possibly. END
BEGIN NOW If any, positively, connivance, introduction of END
BEGIN NOW emulation (material, a prosperous rival agency of publicity: moral, a END
BEGIN NOW successful rival agent of intimacy), depreciation, alienation, END
BEGIN NOW humiliation, separation protecting the one separated from the other, END
BEGIN NOW protecting the separator from both. END
BEGIN NOW By what reflections did he, a conscious reactor against the void of END
BEGIN NOW incertitude, justify to himself his sentiments? END
BEGIN NOW The preordained frangibility of the hymen: the presupposed intangibility END
BEGIN NOW of the thing in itself: the incongruity and disproportion between the END
BEGIN NOW selfprolonging tension of the thing proposed to be done and the END
BEGIN NOW selfabbreviating relaxation of the thing done; the fallaciously inferred END
BEGIN NOW debility of the female: the muscularity of the male: the variations of END
BEGIN NOW ethical codes: the natural grammatical transition by inversion involving END
BEGIN NOW no alteration of sense of an aorist preterite proposition (parsed as END
BEGIN NOW masculine subject, monosyllabic onomatopoeic transitive verb with direct END
BEGIN NOW feminine object) from the active voice into its correlative aorist END
BEGIN NOW preterite proposition (parsed as feminine subject, auxiliary verb and END
BEGIN NOW quasimonosyllabic onomatopoeic past participle with complementary END
BEGIN NOW masculine agent) in the passive voice: the continued product of END
BEGIN NOW seminators by generation: the continual production of semen by END
BEGIN NOW distillation: the futility of triumph or protest or vindication: the END
BEGIN NOW inanity of extolled virtue: the lethargy of nescient matter: the apathy END
BEGIN NOW of the stars. END
BEGIN NOW In what final satisfaction did these antagonistic sentiments and END
BEGIN NOW reflections, reduced to their simplest forms, converge? END
BEGIN NOW Satisfaction at the ubiquity in eastern and western terrestrial END
BEGIN NOW hemispheres, in all habitable lands and islands explored or unexplored END
BEGIN NOW (the land of the midnight sun, the islands of the blessed, the isles of END
BEGIN NOW Greece, the land of promise), of adipose anterior and posterior female END
BEGIN NOW hemispheres, redolent of milk and honey and of excretory sanguine and END
BEGIN NOW seminal warmth, reminiscent of secular families of curves of amplitude, END
BEGIN NOW insusceptible of moods of impression or of contrarieties of expression, END
BEGIN NOW expressive of mute immutable mature animality. END
BEGIN NOW The visible signs of antesatisfaction? END
BEGIN NOW An approximate erection: a solicitous adversion: a gradual elevation: a END
BEGIN NOW tentative revelation: a silent contemplation. END
BEGIN NOW Then? END
BEGIN NOW He kissed the plump mellow yellow smellow melons of her rump, on each END
BEGIN NOW plump melonous hemisphere, in their mellow yellow furrow, with obscure END
BEGIN NOW prolonged provocative melonsmellonous osculation. END
BEGIN NOW The visible signs of postsatisfaction? END
BEGIN NOW A silent contemplation: a tentative velation: a gradual abasement: a END
BEGIN NOW solicitous aversion: a proximate erection. END
BEGIN NOW What followed this silent action? END
BEGIN NOW Somnolent invocation, less somnolent recognition, incipient excitation, END
BEGIN NOW catechetical interrogation. END
BEGIN NOW With what modifications did the narrator reply to this interrogation? END
BEGIN NOW Negative: he omitted to mention the clandestine correspondence between END
BEGIN NOW Martha Clifford and Henry Flower, the public altercation at, in and in END
BEGIN NOW the vicinity of the licensed premises of Bernard Kiernan and Co, END
BEGIN NOW Limited, 8, 9 and 10 Little Britain street, the erotic provocation and END
BEGIN NOW response thereto caused by the exhibitionism of Gertrude (Gerty), END
BEGIN NOW surname unknown. END
BEGIN NOW Positive: he included mention of a performance by Mrs END
BEGIN NOW Bandmann Palmer of LEAH at the Gaiety Theatre, 46, 47, 48, 49 South King END
BEGIN NOW street, an invitation to supper at Wynn's (Murphy's) Hotel, 35, 36 and END
BEGIN NOW 37 Lower Abbey street, a volume of peccaminous pornographical tendency END
BEGIN NOW entituled SWEETS OF SIN, anonymous author a gentleman of fashion, a END
BEGIN NOW temporary concussion caused by a falsely calculated movement in the END
BEGIN NOW course of a postcenal gymnastic display, the victim (since completely END
BEGIN NOW recovered) being Stephen Dedalus, professor and author, eldest surviving END
BEGIN NOW son of Simon Dedalus, of no fixed occupation, an aeronautical feat END
BEGIN NOW executed by him (narrator) in the presence of a witness, the professor END
BEGIN NOW and author aforesaid, with promptitude of decision and gymnastic END
BEGIN NOW flexibility. END
BEGIN NOW Was the narration otherwise unaltered by modifications? END
BEGIN NOW Absolutely. END
BEGIN NOW Which event or person emerged as the salient point of his narration? END
BEGIN NOW Stephen Dedalus, professor and author. END
BEGIN NOW What limitations of activity and inhibitions of conjugal rights were END
BEGIN NOW perceived by listener and narrator concerning themselves during the END
BEGIN NOW course of this intermittent and increasingly more laconic narration? END
BEGIN NOW By the listener a limitation of fertility inasmuch as marriage had been END
BEGIN NOW celebrated 1 calendar month after the 18th anniversary of her birth (8 END
BEGIN NOW September 1870), viz. END
BEGIN NOW 8 October, and consummated on the same date with END
BEGIN NOW female issue born 15 June 1889, having been anticipatorily consummated END
BEGIN NOW on the lo September of the same year and complete carnal intercourse, END
BEGIN NOW with ejaculation of semen within the natural female organ, having last END
BEGIN NOW taken place 5 weeks previous, viz. END
BEGIN NOW 27 November 1893, to the birth on 29 END
BEGIN NOW December 1893 of second (and only male) issue, deceased 9 January 1894, END
BEGIN NOW aged 11 days, there remained a period of 10 years, 5 months and 18 days END
BEGIN NOW during which carnal intercourse had been incomplete, without ejaculation END
BEGIN NOW of semen within the natural female organ. END
BEGIN NOW By the narrator a limitation END
BEGIN NOW of activity, mental and corporal, inasmuch as complete mental END
BEGIN NOW intercourse between himself and the listener had not taken place since END
BEGIN NOW the consummation of puberty, indicated by catamenic hemorrhage, of the END
BEGIN NOW female issue of narrator and listener, 15 September 1903, there remained END
BEGIN NOW a period of 9 months and 1 day during which, in consequence of a END
BEGIN NOW preestablished natural comprehension in incomprehension between the END
BEGIN NOW consummated females (listener and issue), complete corporal liberty of END
BEGIN NOW action had been circumscribed. END
BEGIN NOW How? END
BEGIN NOW By various reiterated feminine interrogation concerning the masculine END
BEGIN NOW destination whither, the place where, the time at which, the duration END
BEGIN NOW for which, the object with which in the case of temporary absences, END
BEGIN NOW projected or effected. END
BEGIN NOW What moved visibly above the listener's and the narrator's invisible END
BEGIN NOW thoughts? END
BEGIN NOW The upcast reflection of a lamp and shade, an inconstant series of END
BEGIN NOW concentric circles of varying gradations of light and shadow. END
BEGIN NOW In what directions did listener and narrator lie? END
BEGIN NOW Listener, S. END
BEGIN NOW E. END
BEGIN NOW by E.: Narrator, N. END
BEGIN NOW W. END
BEGIN NOW by W.: on the 53rd parallel of END
BEGIN NOW latitude, N., and 6th meridian of longitude, W.: at an angle of 45 END
BEGIN NOW degrees to the terrestrial equator. END
BEGIN NOW In what state of rest or motion? END
BEGIN NOW At rest relatively to themselves and to each other. END
BEGIN NOW In motion being each END
BEGIN NOW and both carried westward, forward and rereward respectively, by the END
BEGIN NOW proper perpetual motion of the earth through everchanging tracks of END
BEGIN NOW neverchanging space. END
BEGIN NOW In what posture? END
BEGIN NOW Listener: reclined semilaterally, left, left hand under head, right leg END
BEGIN NOW extended in a straight line and resting on left leg, flexed, in the END
BEGIN NOW attitude of Gea-Tellus, fulfilled, recumbent, big with seed. END
BEGIN NOW Narrator: END
BEGIN NOW reclined laterally, left, with right and left legs flexed, the index END
BEGIN NOW finger and thumb of the right hand resting on the bridge of the nose, in END
BEGIN NOW the attitude depicted in a snapshot photograph made by Percy Apjohn, the END
BEGIN NOW childman weary, the manchild in the womb. END
BEGIN NOW Womb? END
BEGIN NOW Weary? END
BEGIN NOW He rests. END
BEGIN NOW He has travelled. END
BEGIN NOW With? END
BEGIN NOW Sinbad the Sailor and Tinbad the Tailor and Jinbad the Jailer and END
BEGIN NOW Whinbad the Whaler and Ninbad the Nailer and Finbad the Failer and END
BEGIN NOW Binbad the Bailer and Pinbad the Pailer and Minbad the Mailer and Hinbad END
BEGIN NOW the Hailer and Rinbad the Railer and Dinbad the Kailer and Vinbad the END
BEGIN NOW Quailer and Linbad the Yailer and Xinbad the Phthailer. END

BEGIN NOW Going to dark bed there was a square round Sinbad the Sailor roc's auk's END
BEGIN NOW egg in the night of the bed of all the auks of the rocs of Darkinbad the END
BEGIN NOW Brightdayler. END
